review.title: Historic hotel near downtown and Union Square.
review.reviewText: The hotel is classic with lots of charm and history. The service was great and we loved the period dressed door men. You can also find a trolley stop just outside the hotel on Powell St. A couple drawbacks to an old hotel included a wait for the elevators on occasion and lots of road noise from sirens, horns, and trolley bells. We even changed rooms because of it, but the staff was very accommodating with this process. I suggest requesting a room on the back of the hotel. If you get above the 12th floor, you have a great view of downtown and the bay.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake is a lovely historical hotel.  It is nicely appointed.  I arrived after mid-night.  There was no hassle at the front desk.  My room was very nice and cozy.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was efficient and polite.  The juice and coffee in the morning was a pleasant touch.  Wine from 5-6 started the evenings off wonderfully.
review.negativeRemarks: A full length mirror in the room would be great in order to check out the last minute details of the outfit before dashing off for the day
review.locationRemarks: Since it is right off Union Square and on the cable car line it is close to everything including great shopping, China Town and North Beach restaurant

review.title: Union Square & Chinatown
review.reviewText: Hotel is right beside Union square and very accessible to downtown and the waterfront.  Staff are very friendly and helpful.  Was able to park my motorcycle in the underground valet parking.  Vincent at the valet desk is fantastic!
review.negativeRemarks: Leave the coffee out a little bit longer in the lobby in the mornings.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping on Powell street within blocks of the hotel.  Very close to Chinatown as well.

managementResponses.response: Thank you sujatha, we really appreciate the feedback as it helps us make the changes needed to be the best we can be. I hope you can give us another chance in the future.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Hotel room was clean, staff was courteous. But no coffee machine in room, they offered to bring up a pot - that never materialized. Tea bags at breakfast bar were missing - took them a long time to replenish stock... Pricey hotel with small touches missing!

managementResponses.response: I am so sorry to hear that you had such a rough visit with us, this is never the goal! We would love for you to give us another to chance to get you into something a bit quieter.

review.title: Old windows..3 stories up and Up all Night
review.reviewText:
The room was very clean and the staff was wonderful. Also the breakfast we had downstairs was fantastic.  
However, the windows are as old as the building.  We were three stories up and could hear every sound on the street.  I have been in many hotels in San francisco and this was the loudest place I have ever stayed.  The bell on the bus or whatever it was went off all the time.  It apparently was the quickest route for the ambulance because that woke us up more than once also.
Very clean and cute. But would ask for the top floor if I had to stay here again.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review, we hope to have you back soon!

review.title: Nice hotel, antique decor, and great architecture!
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel, in a historic building, very close to Union square, in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Rooms are rather small, due to the location (everything tends to be small, by American standards, in San Francisco) but they are comfortable. Coffee is served in the hall in the morning, and wine tasting in the late afternoon, as in the tradition of the Kimpton Hotels. The bathroom was extremely small. Overall, I did like the hotel. The price was acceptable through a secret deal, but would be on the rather pricey level directly from the hotel. But, again, this is the heart of downtown San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Architecture, excellent location near Union Square. The bar/club on the top floor has awesome views of the city!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, very close to Union Square and in the heart of downtown San Francisco.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review, we have larger rooms available and would love to get you into one on your next visit!

review.title: Great location and historic hotel

Disliked: Cramped elevators and only one of the four seemed to be operating. This led to long waits and lines. Also, while our room was lovely, the bathroom was exceedingly small, making use of the toilet awkward.

Parking/Valet could be a problem on busy Powell Street.

review.title: Great hotel, clean, good service, convenient.
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a great city and the Sir Francis Drake only made it better!
review.positiveRemarks: It had character, was clean, and had great service.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to everything!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review, Steven! We really appreciate your feedback and are happy to hear you got to enjoy some of our amenities during your visit. Hope to have you back very soon!

review.title: Excellent hotel for the area and price
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake is located in Union Square and there are hundreds of resturants and bars within a few blocks. The hotel is older but well maintained and they embrace the theme so it doesn't seem like the hotel is as old as it is. The room was large and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was small but very functional. The lobby bar was always busy and seemed like a nice hangout for the area. Also the starlight room is on the 21st floor and the patrons take the same elevators as guests. I found this a little off putting as I was in the elevator with about 10 unsavory characters. I would definitely recommend the Drake as it is probably the most affordable in the area and really doesn't skimp on amenities. I love Kimpton Hotels and stay at one anytime I have a chance. As with all Kimptons there is a free wine social everyday from 5-6 and they are very pet friendly. This was a wonderful stay and experience in SanFran.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much JoJo! It sounds like you got the real SF experience while you were here and I am ecstatic that we could be your home away from home during this trip. Hope to see you soon!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco and we didn't have any idea where to stay.This hotel is in a great location.  You can easily take the F Market line to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 or to any of the tour locations (hop on-hop off bus, wine tour bus, bike riding tour over the Golden Gate Bridge).  The cable car stops right out front of the hotel.  The hotel has coffee and tea in the lobby each morning and a wine happy hour each evening.  The rooms are older but very clean.  The staff is excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: It has a welcoming feeling and we really enjoyed staying here.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are older, but very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, Union Square Park, Lefty O'Doul's, the Irish House just a few of our stops while staying at the Sir Francis Drake.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your comments! Happy to hear you liked our decor, I think it is decadent as well - but that is how I like it!! See you soon!

review.title: Gorgeous and classy, prohibition era hotel.
review.reviewText: Great room, albeit tiny, even though we booked the 'Deluxe' on 20th floor with city views. Views were ok, room was decadent. We were warned about nightclub music from 21st floor, though heard next to nothing. We had been offered lower room with smaller beds upon check-in, plus $60 hotel credit. Took 20th floor anyway and we were glad we did. Front desk threw in $60 hotel credit at last minute regardless. Kids ordered gelato with caramel sauce (gelato - $7, topping - $2  x 2 = $18), came out to nearly $30 with service charge and delivery fee!!! Hubby and I had one cocktail a piece at bar downstairs, came out to $25 with tip. So there went the hotel credit! We did enjoy a couple of glasses of wine each during the complimentary wine hour from 5-6. Overall, nice hotel in nice part of SF. We'd stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor is beautiful, great location, friendly staff, comfy beds, free wine during wine hour.
review.negativeRemarks: Not too many good channels on the tv!
review.locationRemarks: In Union Square with cable car stop right outside lobby! Lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for letting us know about this, Nick. We will be addressing with out team and making sure this is prevented in the future.

review.title: OK hotel but hotel staff failed
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice.  We had reservations at 9am so we called the front desk to schedule a wake up call which is a very common request for hotels.  We never received the wake up call and we missed out reservations and had to rethink our vacation plans for that day.  This was the first hotel we have ever experienced this problems with and it was very disappointing.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your comments Steve!! So happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us, we look forward to spoiling you on your next visit!!!

review.title: Great location at a great price
review.reviewText:
Stayed two nights in San Francisco for a quick getaway. I chose the Sir Francis Drake because of its central location, and because I got a great price from Experia. This is my third time here since it has become a Kimpton hotel. The hotel is a classic hotel, refurbished, but with old San Francisco charm (wooden elevator doors on floors above the lobby, the iconic doormen). 

Room size is more European standard than American suburban standard (i.e. smallish) which suited me fine. All fixtures worked well, and the hotel provided all amenities. If you have a room that fronts Powell Street, you will hear the cable cars running by, which I enjoyed, but if you are sensitive to street sounds you may want a room away from Powell.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, no hassle parking (valet), top notch service. Book in advance to take advantage of any discounts.
review.negativeRemarks: I had a wonderful trip and was not wishing for any improvements in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: It is steps away from Union Square and all the shopping there, and across the street from Sears Fine Foods, the famous SF breakfast establishment.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback. I am very sorry you were not happy with your stay. We will look into your comments and hope you can visit us again in the future.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Very disappointing.  My wife and I have been to San Francisco quite a few times and have never felt as if we were over paying for anything more than the room at The Sir Francis Drake.
review.negativeRemarks: Towels were stored (hung) in the shower, had to be removed every time a shower was taken.Shower and sink were stopped up.Construction @ 6:00 am.

managementResponses.response: Wow, I am so sorry this happened. We are investigating internally and feel this is unacceptable as well. Thank you for giving us your feedback and we hope you can give us another chance in the future.

review.title: Disappointment by the Bay
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Sir Francis Drake for three nights with my mother and daughter for her high school graduation trip.   The bellman was very helpful as was the front desk staff who allowed us to check in early.  That was the extent of our pleasant experience.  That evening, my mother pulled back the linens on her bed to find DIRTY sheets.  We called the front desk.  They said they couldn't help; she would need to call housekeeping.  We did.  It was 11:00 PM.  Thirty minutes later we still didn't have clean linens.  She called again.  Apparently there was a shift change, and the message wasn't relayed.  Ten minutes later a man arrived with clean linens, but he was unable to change the sheets because that was "not his job."  Truly, he said that.  The bartenders were rude and inefficient causing for long waits and small drinks.  The bathroom was very small.  There were no glasses or cups in our room. No coffee pot.  Far from a four star experience.

managementResponses.response: Thank you!!! See you soon!

review.reviewText: I stayed just one night for business trip. Good location and good fitness/workout room.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review! We appreciate the feedback and will be looking into the items you mentioned! Hope to see you soon!

Overall you could stay at a branded property that will ensure you have a pleasurable experience or find a way to take care of you.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for these comments, I really appreciate the feedback. We will look into this issue and make sure this is not an ongoing problem. Thank you again.

review.reviewText: We had booked a city view through Expedia but had to change the room when we got there. They knew we had the city view but they gave us a classic room which was less expensive. When I ask the hotel if I could get credit for this, they said yes but called Expedia which I did. Expedia said the hotel wouldn't give us the credit. The manager said we booked through Expedia and they could not help us. It was a blame game between Expedia and the hotel, we had no problem with our rental car we booked through Expedia, we got credit back. I think this poor communication and should be something they should fix. I'm sure this happens all the time guest needing to change rooms.Sure the hotel said they could give us credit for eating in the hotel but we were there to visit San Francisco this wasn't a business trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was great and it was a pretty hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Yes, improve your communication with booking websites like Expedia.

review.title: Classic vintage hotel in heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Sir Francis Drake hotel in downtown San Francisco. The historic property is beautiful, convenient and well-located as a base for walking out to enjoy the many sites and activities in the Union Square area. A lovely lobby and nice bar area greeted us upon arrival, and parking was conveniently close by. The hotel staff was welcoming, personable and helpful. Our room was comfortable and a good value for the price, with all amenities we needed for our 4-day stay. We love staying in vintage places with some history, so those who prefer a brand new chain-style hotel (which we think lack character and are too sterile) might not enjoy it as much as we did. We would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Full of character, history, and a fun, eclectic vibe. Good location in downtown, prompt service from staff. We especially enjoyed chatting at the bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Well, next time there won't be a Superbowl City in the midst of everything, creating transit complications....
review.locationRemarks: Lots of fun bars and restaurants nearby, and a good walk to the Embarcadero for contstitutionals.

Sincerely,

David von Winckler

review.title: Great location to Union Square
review.reviewText:
I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I went with two of my girlfriends who we hadn't all been together for a couple years. The staff was great. The bellboy was excellent; happy, friendly, and eager to tell us about what the hotel had to offer. (He was also adorable)
There are two bars, one downstairs and one on the 21st floor (the top floor). The bartender was great downstairs, and made a great chocolate martini. We didn't go in to the top bar because it was a $10 cover, and didn't tell us until we got to the front. Not sure if you don't pay a cover if you are staying there, and didn't ask. The bouncer was very pleasant, and also attractive. A $10 cover isn't much, we just didn't go because we wanted to talk and it was more of a night on the town vibe so we headed back downstairs. The drinks at the bar and the food at the restaurant were decently priced for the city so that was nice. All in all, great. But no refrigerator if that's an issue to anyone.

managementResponses.response:
We are in a great location! Thanks for telling everyone about our wonderful staff. So sorry that your room was too small. Next time try out a larger room. Thank you.
Best, 
Erica Peterson
Hotel Manager

review.title: Great Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved staying at the Sir Francis Drake. The staff was amazing. Friendly, helpful, just overall wonderful people who made my husband and I feel comfortable and taken care of. The only complaint I have is the room we were in really needed some updating. In several places, there was paint upon paint, with cracks from the old paint underneathe. With a pro paint job and a couple of other little updates, the room would have been perfect. I'd still stay there again with no hesitations. Scala's Bistro is connected to the hotel-- EAT THERE IT'S SO GOOD. Also go to the Starlight Room on top of the hotel, wonderful ambiance, panoramic views of the city, and the waitresses wear gowns!

managementResponses.response:
Porscha,
Thanks so much for the great comments! What a great spot for the family holiday. Hope to see you again...but don't wait until next year. 
See you soon, 
Erica Peterson
Hotel Manager

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Family holiday to enjoy the break between Christmas and New Year's.
review.positiveRemarks: Customer service was excellent. Hotel staff was always working to please guests. Free coffee in the morning and wine in the evening was gracious.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a touch small with somewhat large and ornate furniture. A little more room would ease movement and stay in historically small quarters.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient access to Union Square, Walgreens and several yummy restaurants for different types of food (Indian, Filipino, Thai, cafe/breakfast grub).

review.reviewText: Not friendly staff except the doorman who is honest ..I left my bags and he took care of it.. But happy bec it's a pet friendly hotel

review.title: Awesome location, 1920's elegance!
review.reviewText: Leif the concierge worked with us in advance to make our family's Christmas holiday stay extra special! Fabulous location with trolly right in front of hotel, walking distance to china Town main gate etc.

review.title: Scary hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: My kids and I Stayed the night in SF for holiday break. The positive about this hotel was it was close to union square. However, when we checked in the staff was friendly but the room was right out of the movie The Shining. The artwork on the wall was of scary clown like people, not relaxing at all. I tried to take the pic down but we couldn't. My daughter felt like she was sleeping in a casket although the beds were comfortable. The dresser was blood red color. The color scheme for the room of black and red was not relaxing. I felt like it was haunted and the shower was hand held which was not great. I was expecting a classic hotel. This was super scary. On the plus side the bell man was awesome!

review.title: Right in Union Square
review.reviewText: It was OK nothing above and beyond or luxurious. The bathroom was tiny and the bed wasn't super comfy. But it was right in Union Square.  Wish it at least had a fridge

managementResponses.response:
Brenda, 
Sounds like you had a great trip! Thank you and come back soon!
Best, 
Erica Peterson, Hotel Manager

review.title: Excellent Union Square location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake was a pleasant surprise. The location was perfect for a holiday shopping trip --- just off Union Square, close to shopping but less noisy/congested than just a block away, on the square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check-in was fast. The room was a nice size, though the bathroom was pretty small. We parked at a garage on Sutter, just around the corner, saving $20 off the valet parking fee.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining, theaters, people-watching are all there.

review.title: Historical Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText:
I am a Kimpton Rewards member.  Kimpton has always been my choice hotel for business and pleasure.  I was not aware that by my booking this stay through Expedia would change the treatment of service.  When I asked if I would be able to use an upgrade reward, I was told no because I booked through Expedia.  I was not greeted with the same level of service when I checked.  When I asked about the Kimpton Rewards I was told they would not apply to me because I booked through Expedia.  I booked two rooms through Expedia.  I would like to be treated as a Kimpton guest regardless of the method used for booking.  The room was quaint for a historical property but certainly not convenient.  The bathroom has zero counter space. The room offered little room for maneuvering.  Closet space is minimal at best.  There are only four elevator cars.  Almost each time we needed elevator we needed to allow for 20 minutes.

We were even treated differently by the concierge.  When asked for a reservation at the Hotel's fine dining restaurant we were told no reservations were available.  When I walked into the restaurant to inquire, we were given the very first reservation available which was 5:15.
review.negativeRemarks: Recognize when you have a Kimpton Rewards member as a guest that you treat them like a Reward.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful dining and shopping.  Christmas in the City is a delightful experience.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you, and hopefully next time we can get you into a larger bathroom! 
Best, 
Erica Peterson, Hotel Manager

review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful, room was clean but bathroom very small.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your feedback. We are looking into multiple options to better utilize the space in the bathrooms- you have some great suggestions. And the street noise, well, our central location in Union Square does produce more than normal noise. It's part of the experience, but I agree can be bothersome. 
Thank you again, 
Erica Peterson, Hotel Manager

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText:
Small bathrooms...no place to hang towels, etc. or to store cosmetics. How about a medicine cabinet or drawer in the vanity and towel bar or hook for used towels and washcloths?
Street noise was bothersome.

managementResponses.response:
Jeff, 
What a disappointment to hear. So sorry about housekeeping-you shouldn't have to fight to get towels or anything else you need for that matter! And I completely agree about the water. We addressed this water problem immediately as we don't want to waste any water. I hate for you to leave Sir Francis Drake with a bad taste. Maybe you can give us another try. Reach out to me if you do want to return. 
All my best, 
Erica Peterson, Hotel Manager

review.title: Expected more from Kimpton
review.reviewText: We Kimpton Hotels, but the Sir Francis Drake did not live up to the high Kimpton quality of places to stay we've experienced in the past. Hotel staff did not make up room one day for some reason. Couldn't get staff to bring new towels until the next day, even though after several calls to the front desk, they said they would. Shower had only cold water for the first 5-10 minutes of running before water was warm enough to get in. Huge waste of water in a state experiencing a multi year drought. Great location but disappointed overall.

managementResponses.response:
Renee, 
I couldn't have said it better myself! Hope to see you again soon. 
Best, 
Erica Peterson, Hotel Manager

review.title: Great hotel at union square
review.reviewText: Excellent value right on Union square. Rooms are small but location is worth it! The wine happy hour is the way to end a shopping day above the lobby and the night time view from the Starlight room is amazing!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the free wine reception!
review.locationRemarks: The location is the best.. Cable car stop in front... Shopping and restaurants steps away. Beautiful views of Union Square

managementResponses.response:
Our historic rooms and bathrooms are cozy. For the rooms that don't have mini fridges, we do have them available for delivery. Thanks again. 
Erica Peterson, Hotel Manager

review.reviewText: The room was tiny and so was the bathroom. No mini fridge in room.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks again for staying. Happy to hear we got you moved into a better room! Hope to see you back at the Sir Francis Drake!
Cheers, 
Erica Peterson, Hotel Manager

review.title: Perfect spot in Union Square
review.reviewText: We spent the Thanksgiving holiday at the Drake. It is located in the perfect spot for all the shopping and holiday activities. After being given a room that smelled very old and musty, the staff moved us to another floor and the room was small but clean with a nice view
My wife and I enjoyed our time at this hotel. The staff was great, the location was great and we would definitely come back again.

review.title: Nice old hotel in the middle of all the action.
review.reviewText:
Nice hustle area for stores and people. Hotel old but not shabby. 
Smell in rooms and hallways of many mixed odors though. And a warning the parking is 67$ a night. 
Otherwise quite comfortable beds and excellent sheets.
Overall a great hotel in a fantastic location. We would stay here again.

review.title: Nice vintage hotel right at Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location and fun vintage hotel. The staff gave excellent service but the doormen in their Beefeater outfits were wonderful. Very helpful and great humor. Made our stay memorable.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms, lobby bar, guest services staff and last but far from least the doormen.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to reach any part of the city and right at Union Square for great shopping and people watching.

review.title: Nice hotel close to all the shops
review.reviewText: Stayed here a few times. Always love it. Close to shops and can go dancing. Would like to be able to open window. And have more room in bathroom
Super tiny rooms with a musty smell.  Comfortable beds and nice staff.  Wine hour was a nice touch and seemed to help make up for the room sizes.

review.title: Nice hotel right at Union Square
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay here.  The locale was great.  The bar and lobby area were decorated very hipster and the vibe was great!  The rooms were nicely decorated and the bed was ultra comfortable.  We would definitely go back and stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance, the locale and the bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.  We really liked our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, nice restaurants and bars.

review.title: Loud and horrible pillows
review.reviewText: Very loud neighbors you could hear through the walls and construction traffic outside at night.  The pillow was so hard it hurt.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, nice staff, rooms need investment
review.reviewText: I don't like to have to ask the front desk why my mini bar fridge has no power.  For the price, there was no basic amenities (wine opener, robe etc)  No space for make-up etc in bathroom. Parking was a rip off.  Otherwise, great location and super staff.

review.title: Disappointing.
review.reviewText: Tiny box of a room, mouldy air conditioning, water running ceaselessly. Insanely overpriced. A shame, because this is a great looking hotel. High marks for the Starlight room up top, however.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the feedback and positive review; we are a historic hotel with many different room types some smaller nd many larger ones available too.

review.title: Union Square...Convenient to shopping & restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco/Union Square

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

We are a 1928 historic building that went through a renovation in 2011.  Our bathroom size is very typical of the 20's era, but hope we can change that soon.

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: Very Nice Hotel in the center of San Francisco at Union Square.  Beautiful architecture.  Sadly, the bathroom was dinky.  Not what I expected from a nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was dinky - barely enough room to turn around.
review.locationRemarks: At Union Square.  Wonderful dining.  A short walk to North Beach.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I am sorry to hear that the trash pickup truck woke you up.  We try our best to keep up with the regular maintenance and hope the sink was fixed if you called.
I appreciate your feedback.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Extremely noisy all night long
review.reviewText: We were in an awkward shape room with excessive noise! Street trash hauling going on all night! Sink backed up when you brushed your teeth.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Amandar,
Thank you for your review.  It sounds like you enjoyed our hotel.  Please know that our rooms facing away from the streets are quieter and also provide some views.  Thank you for joining our Kimpton Karma program - you'll get more than a free WiFi connection!  

Thanks!
Jim Gross

review.title: Very nice hotel, loud from street noises
review.reviewText:
This is a lovely hotel with recent renovations which still capture the time in which it was built.  There is no way to block all the street noise - our room was on Powell St, where the cable cars run, so throughout the day you'd hear the dinging of the cars.  Also, we had rowdy neighbors who came back to their rooms at around 2 on Saturday morning, yelling and having a good time.  They seemed to stay in the hall for about 15 minutes, but at least one of their own shushed them at some point.  
The wine hour is a nice touch, option of red or white, and they have a snack as well.  If you are a Kimpton rewards member (free), you'll get a $10 credit for use in the bar or mini-bar.
Check out the Starlight Room - great views of the city!
review.negativeRemarks: sound-proofing?
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - but what's there to do there, really?  Cable car, which can be taken down to Fisherman's Wharf, tons of bars and restaurants

managementResponses.response:
Dear Nick,

I appreciate your candid comment!  I am sorry to hear that there were few problems, but I am glad that my staff could help you quickly.  We are a 1928 historic building, but try our best to maintain its beautiful quality.

We hope to see you again.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great staff! Okay hotel
review.reviewText: I experienced quite a few problems in my three day stay at Sir Francis Drake - many of which are likely because of its age (The age lends a beautiful quality as well). The staff were excellent! They were on top of any issues I had, immediately helpful, and with a smile. The staff certainly made the place! That said, when next I'm in San Francisco I may choose another bed in which to sleep.

managementResponses.response:
Dear alex,
Thanks for your review.  Our rooms facing the Union Square are quieter and may offer a great view.   Glad you enjoyed our complimentary service.  
We hope to see you again soon.
Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: hotel on powell street
review.reviewText: Hotel overlooks Powell street, which means you may have a noisy room - cable cars, street cleaning, etc. No kettle in room
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasant reception area, free coffee in morning, happy hour in evening
review.negativeRemarks: sound-proofing

managementResponses.response:
Dear Patty,

Oh yes, Ryan is an amazing mixologist and he can create some amazing cocktails!    It's always a pleasure to hear that our guest found our hotel clean, comfortable, and our staff being very helpful.  

I appreciate your feedback and we all look forward to seeing you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: A Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: The Drake is a very clean and comfortable hotel just off Union Square, close to restaurants, shopping and public transportation. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. It has an impressive bar and the bartender, Ryan, is very friendly and knowledgable and mixes great cocktails.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the cleanliness of this hotel, the selection of tv channels, and fact that the bartender can mix real cocktails.
review.locationRemarks: The Drake is a block off Union Square. It is close to shopping and restaurants and is just a short walk from Chinatown and public transportation.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Juliavee,

Wow, thank you so much for your 5-star review.  It sounds like you truly enjoyed our 20's decor to our location and our staff.

We look forward to seeing you again soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: We loved the Drake! The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The hotel has so much charm, absolutely beautiful details from 1928. Perfect location and walking distance to the best shopping and dining. We had cocktails in the Starlight Room and they made us feel so special.  We'll definitely be staying here again!

managementResponses.response:
Dear DL,

I couldn't agree more on what you enjoyed about our hotel - thank you!  As for the amenity display, thank you for your feedback; I'll keep that in mind.

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Wonderful hotel; noisy area.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is great; room was nice; bed was comfortable; staff was very nice: attached restaurant was excellent. 

But even from the fourth floor, subtle street noises were easily heard. We could keep up with conversations down on the sidewalk. 

Also,  when we walked in, one of the first things I saw was a bunch of stuff with price tags on it. I kind of thought I had time warped into some cheap hotel, except the prices were so high ($6 for a self-labeled 1l bottle water).

For a hotel as highly rated and recommended as this one, that kind of cheap display was disappointing.

managementResponses.response:
Dear molly,

Home away from home for 7-nights, I am glad you enjoyed it.  Our location couldn't be better for all the convenience you look for while you are visiting another city.
We hope to see you soon.
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square and BART
review.reviewText: Enjoyed 7 night stay. Close to everything. BART station nearby but a walk uphill. Rooms small but nice. Bathrooms large enough for 1 person only. Would recommend adult stay only without children.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for staying with us.  Aside from our location, I am sorry that you didn't find our room suitable to your stay.  Please know that we have bigger rooms.  

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The room so small no facilities for the price not stay in this hotel again

managementResponses.response:
Dear Rick,

Thanks for coming back to stay with us!  That itself says something and we couldn't be happier that we didn't disappoint!   
We hope to see you again...for the 3rd time!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great hotel great location next to union square
review.reviewText: This is my second time here clean rooms great staff well worth the price

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sanjay,

Please know that we have limited numbers of coffee makers in our housekeeping department and can be brought it to your room upon request.  Hopefully, you enjoyed our daily complimentary coffee/tea service in our lobby area.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: a tea coffee maker in the Room would have been nice.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

First off, I am equally disappointed to learn that you found one of our concierges unfriendly.  All of them often get great reviews and I am surprised and am sorry that you had to experience her uncaring customer service.    As for the door, I am not certain which room you stayed in but I will have my engineering to check on the doors.  

Thank you for your comments.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText:
Very disappointing  -  Room door is old and heavy, and it was very hard to open.
Wi-fi service was spotty, so I asked for Concierge's help -  She was extremely unfriendly and did not care.  The staff should have a proper customer service training.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mercedez,

Glad that you liked our location!  I can certainly appreciate that our style isn't for everyone's liking.   We are a 1928 historic building and some rooms can be much cozier and better suited for a single traveler while we offer much bigger rooms that can accommodate a family.  

We hope that you'll visit us soon.
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location, small rooms, old facility
review.reviewText: Can't complain about the location, but comfort is lacking due to small rooms and old facility
review.negativeRemarks: hotel needs some updating; rooms are small

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

It sounds like you had a nice getaway from So. Cal!  First off, yes, our location speaks for itself and although you may not need to have a car to get around, there are several public parking garages.  Unfortunately, ours is managed and owned by a 3rd party company.    Please also know that we have very limited numbers of mini frige available in our housekeeping department.  It can be brought up upon request.  Hopefully you enjoyed our complimentary coffee/tea service in the morning as well as our nightly complimentary wine hour.

We hope to see you soon!
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Quick get away.
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I stayed here on a 2 night getaway from Los Angeles. The hotel is centrally located right in the middle of Union Square. Plenty of wonderful restaurants and shopping! It's near the metro, and also walking distance to a lot of San Francisco attractions. When we arrived the valet guy dressed in his renaissance outfit offered to park the car right away but did not mention the price of $59 a day. When I asked price I decided not to park there and half a block away I parked for $30 a day. We got checked in right away and when we got to our room it was the very last room on the corner the regular rooms are tiny! We had a rattling noise coming from the bathroom celling that was pretty loud so I called and told them it was going to be impossible for me to sleep there. They upgraded right away to a deluxe which was soo much better and a bigger space. After that our hotel stay was great.
The only thing I wished they had was a refrigerator to keep things cold and continental breakfast. They only serve coffee and tea in the morning and free wine from 5-6 I believe.

managementResponses.response:
Dear frog and gator,

Thank you for a wonderful 5-star review!  I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.

We hope to see you again soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Perfect downtown location
review.reviewText: We spent 5 days in SF and had a great stay at the Drake.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Lisa,

I appreciate your wonderful review!  We are a 1928 historic building that went under a renovation in 2011 to add few modern amenities.  As you mentioned, our rooms are very typical of the 20's era; some cozier but many larger rooms that can comfortably accommodate a family.   Yes, our location is not only safe, but very convenient to the theatre district as well as many world-class shopping and dining.

We hope to see you again soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: This is a very old, but nicely kept current hotel.  The location is great and the staff was first class.  My room was so extremely small, but I knew after reading reviews that is was going to be.  That being said, it had all updated equipment and was very comfortable.  I was on the 11th floor, so there was no noice problem.  I was in town for Phantom of the Ophra and I felt very comfortible and safe at the Sir Frances Drake.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Becca,

Yes, our location speaks for itself and I'm glad that you enjoyed it.  Please know that our hotel is a 1928 historic building that went under a renovation in 2011.  Some of the things were untouched due to few restrictions, but hopefully that'll change in the future.  I'm glad to hear that our housekeeper did a great job.

We hope to see you soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice location but too small.
review.reviewText: The location was great but the room, particularly the bathroom, was too small. There was no place to put  toiletries. The noise level was also very bad. You could hear the people in the next room & the people in the club. Maid service was excellent.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I appreciate your comment.  Yes, our location is very close to everything and you can walk to many places.  We are a 1928 historic building that went under a renovation in 2011.  I'm glad that our staff was able to move you to a quieter room.      

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good location, nice staff, a bit old
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square, but unfortunately the windows are thin and you can hear everything.  The first room I was in had a window in the shower that wouldn't close so you felt like you were at the concert that was going on in Union Square.  Staff was really nice and moved me to another (slightly quieter) room.  The a/c in the room was a joke and it was really hot all night as well.  The lobby, location and staff are great, but the rooms could use some upgrades.

managementResponses.response:
Dear ann,

It sounds like you had a week full of activities!  I'm glad that our location was very convenient to get to all those places you visited!  I'm glad you enjoyed our wine hour.

We hope to see you again soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We stayed a week, taking in all the attractions of SF. The hotel's location made it all easily accessible. We walked to Union Square to pick up a tour bus, to the Bart, to the ballpark, and to Chinatown. The staff was great, especially the young ladies who poured our complimentary wine during happy hour, from 5 to 6!
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location, the old time feel, and the complimentary coffe and tea in the morning, and the wine in the afternoon.
review.negativeRemarks: The coffee and tea ran out some mornings and was not filled up quickly enough.
review.locationRemarks: The location near Union Square was great, making many things to do walkable, like the Bart, and Chinatown.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback. Whilst some guests do enjoy the Cable Car sound, I am sorry that it woke you up. The rooms facing Union Square is a lot quieter than the one facing the street side.

I hope to see you soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel and room
review.reviewText: Only downside was we were on the 3rd floor and it was very noisy. Trolley and traffic woke us every morning at 6am. If you are on a higher floor you most likely will not hear it as much.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Union Square is a hub of all things happening in San Francisco!  World-class shopping and dining as well as most every attractions are within walking distance.

We hope to see you soon.
Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Hotel located in great area everything convenient especially transportation .

managementResponses.response:
Dear BB,

It sounds like you had a wonderful stay with us!   Please come back for another great stay!

Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great hotel by Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a great experience - adults and kids both!  Great location near Union Square although not too noisy. The staff were super friendly and helpful.  The rooms are adequately sized for 4 people.  The tea and coffee in the morning and wine hour in the evening with games for the kids were an added bonus.  We would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff made our stay fun.
review.negativeRemarks: Newer towels and quite of few of the wall sockets were loose.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Square so lots of shopping and restaurants close by.  Trolley stop right outside the hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Wow, thanks for a 5-star review and glad you had an excellent stay.

Hope to see you soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel experience overall and perfect location

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Our location is indeed excellent. Please know that we got bigger rooms! Should you require any information on our room sizes, please feel free to reach out to us!

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Tiny room, excellent location
review.reviewText: The room was really small, very difficult to open your suitcase and standup at the same time

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mandy,

I appreciate your feedback on your recent stay with us. Yikes, I am sorry to hear that our busy staff made you feel ignored. We are a 1928 historic building and I understand that it's not everyone's cup of tea and we maintain this hotel to exceed our standard on a daily basis. It doesn't sound like our housekeeping team failed to meet that standard and I am sorry for that. I can guarantee you that I'll be addressing this with a Housekeeping Director.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Very ordinary
review.reviewText: An old hotel with not much acknowledgment from staff, concierge was on the phone every time we went to the desk and ignored us.  There was a drink bottle under the bedside table and someones large hair clip under the window which meant the floors must not have been vacuumed otherwise these would have been cleaned up.  Bathroom was tiny.  Just felt very old and tired.
review.negativeRemarks: More friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to everything

managementResponses.response:
Dear alex,

It sounds like you had one of our historic rooms which is suitable for a single traveler. Please know that as we speak, we are replacing all of our mattresses in the hotel. It's not an overnight process to replace all the mattresses in 416 rooms, but hopefully it won't be squeaking much on your next visit! I'm glad that you found our staff great.

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: why was it this bad?
review.reviewText: First I check in get a tiny room (which as fine) but it had the most squeaky bed! they moved me to a room whose phone didnt work as well as a hit or miss flushing toilet. staff was great but experience not so much

managementResponses.response:
Dear Wz,

I'm glad that you enjoyed our location! Hope you explored this wonderful city!

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great.  Close to Union Square.  Our room and bathroom were quite small.  We only stayed one night and it was fine for us.
review.negativeRemarks: Room & bathroom size

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I appreciate your feedback! Please know that (as we speak) we are switching out our mattresses to all new ones. Thanks for utilizing our 'Choose to Conserve' program - a 'win-win' situation for both our guests and the hotel.

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good all around hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location
$10 bar credit if you don't want housekeeping
Great staff
Beds/pillows could be updated, not the most comfortable
Overall a good hotel

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

As you know, San Francisco might have surpassed NYC in terms of the space/price!  The space is indeed a commodity here as well.  I'm glad that you found our staff helpful and you liked our food.   Please keep checking on our web site to find a great deal!

Thank you and hope to see you soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel staff and conveniently located, but ...
review.reviewText:
Rooms are cramped. The space between the bed and chest of drawers is 2 Ft. Bath is small with old fixtures. Reminds me of new York City where space is a commodity.
A bit over priced.
Staff were great, pleasant and knowledgeable. Food was great and reasonably priced. The weight room was adequate.
I would stay there again for reduced price.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is located in the heart of union square shopping and tourist vendors.

review.title: 14th floor -Powell Street
review.reviewText: Corner room, facing Powell & Sutter Streets, nice and large, 14th floor, But very noisy. Lots of cable car, street traffic and construction noise made it difficult to fall asleep.

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: Traveled to the hotel in June for a family vacation.  Excellent service all around!  Scott at the bar was wonderful, as was the concierge and the bellmen.  Great location...easy to walk to Union Square and surrounding areas.  This was our children's first trip to the Bay Area and they loved it.  Definitely would stay there again and/or recommend to others.  Only issue we had was their water conservation service.  We placed the sign on the door to not have the sheets or towels changed, but they took that as no maid service at all.  We had to request to have the trash emptied several times.  In addition, we only received on $10 credit, instead of one each night.  Other than that, it was a great vacation!
review.negativeRemarks: Explanation of their water conservation program, specifically that they would at least empty the trash each day.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, great restaurants within walking distance, trolley stop right outside the front doors, Starbucks next door.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review. Our location speaks for itself and I'm glad that you enjoyed our room and its amenities.

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Great location to central SF, nice amenities and room!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Indeed, it is a 1928 historic building that went through a renovation in 2011. We definitely wanted to keep the 'old-world' charm and we couldn't be happier to know that you enjoyed it.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: The hotel has old world charm and a through back to years past.
review.positiveRemarks: Happy hour and good bar service.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a little small but comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to stores and restaurants.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Allie&Carmen,

Aww, it's one of the best things to hear that we could be part of your 'once in a lifetime' experience! As you mentioned, starting from our Beefeater doorman to the employees working behind the scene, we all strive to make everyone's experience a 'once in a lifetime' one! I'm glad you enjoyed our wine-hour; hope you got to meet fellow guests and our staff.

We look forward to seeing here again.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: What a dream
review.reviewText: My friend and I were visiting for the weekend, and found the Sir Francis Drake Hotel to be truly the experience of a lifetime. The room was tastefully designed, extraordinarily comfortable, and above all: clean. The first encounter with the hotel was impressive, from the outside greeter, to the friendly staff, to the free wine and sangria being served on the first floor. We felt taken care of and right at home. On the first night, we realized we had forgotten our hair straighteners, and the front desk delivered one for us to use within 15 minutes. Overall, we had an excellent experience and we didn't want to leave. I am wholeheartedly grateful to the hotel for their wonderful and impressive service.
review.negativeRemarks: Better pillows
review.locationRemarks: Great and safe location in union square, lots of shops, restaurants, and bars nearby.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mike,

Thank you for staying with us. San Francisco is now one of the most expensive places to live and visit. In return, many can enjoy our majestic scenery, worldly renowned bridge and other attractions and hopefully, you enjoyed what this city had to offer.

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Typical S.F. older hotel: overpriced, over sold.
review.reviewText: Staying in San Francisco has become absurdly overpriced. If I didn't have relatives there, I wouldn't visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Booking large groups at cheap prices over the weekend over extends the facility and staff and ruins the experience for others.
review.locationRemarks: It's at Union Square, the center of the city.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Nicole,

Thank you for staying at the Drake for your getaway with your daughter. It sounds like you had a wonderful time especially our signature Drag brunch! It made me smile to know that you could smile about our smaller bathroom. This building is a 1928 historic building and some of the feature are very typical of the 20's era.

We hope to see you again in the near future.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with all the old world styling.  My daughter and I stayed here for a long weekend and it was prefect in location and comfort.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The room was very nice and comfortable, albeit small. We actually had a good laugh over the notch that was cut out of the bathroom door to accommodate the toilet..otherwise you couldn't close the door.  All in all, we had a great time.  Must see "Sunday is a Drag" Brunch. That is worth every penny and the food is pretty good as well.  Two show times so make reservations.
review.positiveRemarks: Old world styling, great staff, good food, close to everything
review.locationRemarks: Trolly is right out front, China Town, great food choices, excellent shopping, Pier 39 is a quick taxi ride away.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for dining at our Scala's Bistro. Hope you enjoyed your dinner. As you mentioned, we were built in 1928 and it is one of the historic buildings in San Francisco.

We look forward to your another visit.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: My visit was for business but had the opportunity to visit family as well.  Had dinner in the restaurant and met family in the bar area.  Historic hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located in Union Square where all the best shopping can be found.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for loving our hotel! I know it's definitely an eclectic hotel only very distinguished could appreciate! That's said, thank YOU. Scala's Bistro's chef uses the freshest local produce as much as possible.

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Hotel was beautiful!
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel.  The breakfast at the restaurant was great too!  Only down side at all was the bathroom was very tiny.  but thats ok.  I loved it!
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom VERY small
review.locationRemarks: GREAT location!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review. I appreciate that you liked our location and our Starlight room on the 21st floor. Please know that the Drake is a 1928 historic building that went through a renovation in 2011. Our rooms vary in so many sizes - some much cozier while others are big enough to accommodate a family.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: mixed bag
review.reviewText:
the good -location ,good bar on 21st floor ,Starbucks downstairs
the bad -shows age in the need of a major face lift . 
rooms are very small and bathroom is even smaller. Closet is a joke if you are traveling as a couple storage will be a big problem .
hotel is ok if you are on the budget
review.positiveRemarks: location cant be beat, starlight is a good bar , Starbucks is downstairs
review.negativeRemarks: needs a major renovation
review.locationRemarks: fantastic location right on Powell street

review.title: Great location in Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel if you are looking to be in the heart of Union Square. The staff is very nice and the rooms are clean. It's an older hotel, but does have comfortable beds and flat screen TV's. The bathroom in the room I was in was quite small and dark, very small shower, and nowhere to put my toiletries. But overall, location made it worth it for me, and I would return if the price was right.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms - small and dark with not a lot of space.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants, theater, shopping nearby. Easy access to tourist attractions.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Yikes, although, we are a pet friendly hotel, I agree that the barking dogs are definitely not what we want to deal with. I'm sorry to hear that you had to deal with that.

Hopefully, you'll give us another opportunity to serve you.

Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: So so this time
review.reviewText: Had barking dogs, and too much noise. Needed to call fron desk to see to the barking dogs.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to review pet friendly policy
review.locationRemarks: Union square, and lot of shops

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Perfectly situated by Union Square
3 mins to BART stop
Cable car runs right outside
Bed v comfy
Have a lot of personal touches

review.title: Great location in Union Square.
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located for your first trip to San Francisco and is great value for money. We kindly had our room upgraded at check-in and had great views of the city. Yes - there is some noise from the city and cable cars but we expected this from a centrally located hotel. The hotel staff were great and the complimentary wine daily was a lovely touch. The hotel is quite dated but this this added to an authentic San Fran experience.

review.title: Comfortable Rooms, Jaw Dropping Lobby
review.reviewText: This hotel is a gem. It is in a convenient location, the rooms are comfortable and the decor is spectacular. I have two complaints, however: our third story room had small, high windows that stared directly at a wall making the room feel claustrophobic, and the bouncer who was the gate keeper at the lounge took his job too seriously. We watched him turn away a group of 60 year olds who didn't have their ID but not before going on a bizarre rhetorical rant about what the purpose of ID was. A real turn off and tainted our otherwise warm fuzzy feelings about the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the hotel. I rated the room a 4 instead of a 5 because it was a little small but over all it was comfortable. Hotel is located in a great location. Would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a place for toiletries in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: It was a great location. Close to retail store and many restaurants.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I'm glad that you liked our service.

We look forward to seeing here soon.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice classic hotel.
review.reviewText:
Was upgraded upon arrical and given a complementary breakfast coupon. Noce touch with the coffee in the lobby.
Very pleasant stay.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sayre,

I appreciate your comment about the furniture arrangement. I am not certain which you room you stayed, but we always welcome any suggestion! I'm happy to hear you liked our room otherwise.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Very nice room and happily an upgrade.
review.reviewText: Nice room, but furniture arrangement was not great--closet was a very tight squeeze (you really had to climb over a bed to access it)!
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to Union Square, dining and shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: Rearrange the furniture and more accessible plug ins (my husband uses a Cpap at night and light had to be unplugged to use it the breathing machine.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square has amazing stores and entertaining performers and artists.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for bringing your experience to my attention. Indeed, it seems like it was our oversight in not placing a pad and a pen. Although, it sounds like a wire hanger was left from the previous guest, it should've been removed by our housekeeping crew. For that I am sorry for the inconvenience.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The room was smell muddy upon walk in to the room. Very small and not much else only basic. No paper pad nor pen available. No light in closet and wire hanging inside.
review.negativeRemarks: Signature hotel paper head and pen would be nice for the price we paid for the room. Should provide some breakfast: fruit, Danish or muffins with cof.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Yikes, I am disappointed to learn that we could not 'wow' you on your recent stay with us. Please know that as part of the Kimpton hotels, we provide daily complimentary coffee/tea service in the lobby every morning. Additionally, there are items that can be brought up on request. However, it is not excusable that our room service staff brought you a wrong item 3 times; for that I am sorry for your incovenience.

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location, poor quality for cost
review.reviewText: Bathrooms are very tiny and have no fans so they feel dirty. Basically zero amenities. Staff are friendly but seem incapable of comprehending things - had to call down three separate times for milk for our coffee (they kept bringing us more coffee instead). Had to ask for things that are normally standard for hotel rooms that are upwards of $300/night - coffee maker in room, robes, etc. Overall it was beautiful on the outside and in the lobby but way too expensive for subpar rooms and service and I wouldn't stay there again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Nancy,

First off, thank you for staying with us. I certainly understand that everyone wants to spend less than more, but please keep in mind that our rate is very very compatible to other similar hotels in the same area. As for our rooms, please know that the Drake is a 1928 historic building that went under a renovation in 2011: some rooms are cozy for a single traveler whilst other rooms are big enough to accommodate a family comfortably. We hope you enjoyed our location and spent time exploring this wonderful city.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Save this one for an expense account
review.reviewText: I am really disappointed in myself that I booked this place --- It was too expensive -- this should be saved for a business trip.  On vacation you are out and about mostly so the room does not matter.  The room was so small -- why do they give you a yoga mat -- ? there is no floor space to put it out !!!!.    Good location but that is about all -- wish I would have booked something more unique.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby was beautiful -- but never used it much.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant was terrible -- overpriced and not good food. Starlight room was nice to visit
review.locationRemarks: Cable car and chinatown close by

managementResponses.response:
Dear Lupi,

Thank you for staying with us. I am not certain as to which type of room you were staying, but we definitely have rooms big enough to accommodate a family of 4. I am glad that you found our staff friendly and liked our lobby.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel perfect location
review.reviewText: room was too small for 2 adults and 2 kids.  terrible view from room.  Nice lobby area friendly people and awesome conceirge
review.negativeRemarks: enhance the view from window
review.locationRemarks: everything is nearby

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thanks for your comment!

We hope that you'll visit us soon.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: room&bathroom small.staff&concierage terrific. fitness center decent.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback! I'm glad that you found our hotel and staff great. Please know that we have several room types! The bathrooms can be very typical of the 20's building, but they seem to be adequate for most travelers. Also, Bar Drake in a lobby closes at 11pm, but you can enjoy your drinks at the Starlight Room until later. We hope you can stop by their on your next visit!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: The hotel itself is charming, in a great location and the staff is superb. However, the rooms (and especially bathrooms) are tiny.  Also, the bar closes every night at 11PM, which is a bit of an inconvenience when you are wanting to hang out without getting outside in the cold, windy weather of San Fran.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

What a nice complement to know that the Drake is your 'Go-To' hotel - Thank YOU! Yes, whatever the occasion may be, our location is perfect spot to start your day!

We'll see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Wedding dress shopping
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake Hotel is our "go to" hotel each time we visit SF.  This time it provided a perfect setting for mom. aunt, and daughters shopping for a wedding dress.  The hotel is steps from Union Square and very safe and friendly.  It is like home to us.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is perfect for shopping and sightseeing.  Scala's restaurant attached to the hotel is one of the best in town!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Roger,

Thank you for your comment! We always love to hear a positive feedback. Our location is convenient to most shopping and dining, not to mention many of the famed San Francisco attractions. I couldn't be happier to learn that you found our staff very professional!

See you soon at the Drake!
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location and wonderful service
review.reviewText: The entire staff was very professional. Room was in great condition.Able to walk to many restaurants. Shopping mecca .  Excellent service.
review.negativeRemarks: They should make a policy, when an item is lost , it should be sent to main desk for guest to claim.  waiting  until 6pm to to access the starlight ng
review.locationRemarks: It is in the center of union square need I say more

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I'm so glad that you loved our hotel! Our location speaks for itself and hope you got to explore this wonderful city!

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great historic hotel in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and our trip was fabulous. So close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms look a little dated as do the corridors

managementResponses.response:
Dear charles,

Thanks for staying with us. The Drake is a 1928 historic building that went through a renovation in 2011. It does present an old-world charm and sounds like you really enjoyed that. I couldn't be happier that you found our staff friendly.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: Very warm staff. The infrastructure is bit old but the people are definitely trying. I like the lobby and this old style looking.

review.title: Great Union Square Location, Beautiful view
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at this Hotel and would recommend it to any of our friends or family.  First of the location was great. It was our anniversary and they were able to accommodate some special requests, the staff were very pleasant, and the concierge was very helpful in helping us get around to our planned excursions, without spending all our money on transportation.  Our room had a beautiful view of Powell street and Union Square Park.  The hotel also offered a coffee tea service in the morning ( very nice to get your day going) and a wine service in the evening ( we were not able to partake in this because we were getting back late from our outings).
review.negativeRemarks: I would of liked more information about the coffee & wine service upon check in,  and also about the room service incentive
review.locationRemarks: The location was very central, We were able to walk to China Town, Trolley Car stopped right by the hotel, there was lots of shopping close by.

review.title: Lack of hot water
review.reviewText: Room was smaller than we are accustomed to, and the shower water is lukewarm at best. Bed was not the most comfortable, either.

managementResponses.response:
Dear shaun,

Our location is definitely a plus. The Drake being a 1928 historic building, what you may expect at more modern hotels may not be present. But we take our guest comments seriously and we are brainstorming as to what we can do.

Thanks for your feedback.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Walls are paper thin.
review.reviewText: Good location but the walls are paper thin. Could hear everything from the rooms next door. And I mean everything.

managementResponses.response:
Dear K,

I'm glad you liked our hotel and location! Please know that our rooms vary in so many sizes - anything from a cozy room fit for a single traveler to a grand suites!

We hope to welcome you back in the near future!
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: It's a well located hotel but rooms are too small!
review.reviewText: I like the hotel but it's difficult to move around in such a small room.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Hugo,

Thanks for a 5-star review! What a nice comment knowing that you stayed in other hotels: our rooms overlooking the city and Union Square sure are one of the best rooms we have. We couldn't be happier that we exceeded your expectations!

We hope to welcome you back at the Drake in the near future.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: I've stayed at half a dozen hotels around the Union Square area and this one (at least for the room I had on this stay) was the best. I had a pleasant room on the 17th floor looking out over the city and Union Square. Lovely atmosphere.
review.positiveRemarks: My room was excellent. Spacious, clean, and a great view. Free wine in the foyer at happy hour, helps with the jetlag ;-)
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning wasn't great, but perfectly tolerable.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Yikes...I'm very disappointed that you left the hotel feeling this way. Please know that our amenity pricing is very similar, if not the same with other hotels and the same goes for our parking fee. Yes, there are cheaper parking spots within the area should you wish to forego the convenience. It sounds like we missed the mark on few things in the room however; I am sorry for that.

Perhaps, you can give us another try on your next visit to San Francisco!
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nickle and dime hotel
review.reviewText: pillows hard as a rock, blinds broken, tub mildew, way overpriced for food, drinks, and they had a bag of cookies in the room with 7 x 2" cookies or 6 oz peanuts for $7 ea.  how about a bud light in a bottle for $8 + tip ea.  What about a latte for $6.50.  We went up to the star light room on the top floor to have dinner.  There were 8 people in the bar/grill on a Saturday afternoon.  I wonder why there were not many people there.   Oh and $60 per day for parking.
review.negativeRemarks: stop trying to nickel and dime your customers.
review.locationRemarks: San Fransisco hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear OC,

Yes, our location speaks for itself! I'm glad that you enjoyed our complimentary coffee/tea service in the morning as well as 'wine hour'. Thanks for your visit and we look forward to your next stay with us!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Great location! Darling hotel, free coffee in the morning and wine at happy hour. Great staff.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mark,

The Drake is as classic as it can get: 1928 historic building that went through a renovation in 2011. Very typical of the 20's, room can be cozier than more modern hotels, but we also have rooms that are large enough to accommodate a family! Oh, no, I'm so disappointed to learn about your interaction with our concierge who often gets the most complements amongst all of us! I will personally talk to him about it.
Well, I'm otherwise happy to know that you enjoyed your stay and our location!

We hope to welcome you again soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Classic Hotel in Perfect Union Square Location
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel. I would put in a classic category. The rooms are smallish, but well appointed. Staff was friendly and helpful for the most part. The one exception was a less than helpful encounter with one of the concierges when we inquired about the Alcatraz tour. His answer to our questions was to direct us to the tour's website. Not much of an effort in my opinion. Other than that, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Also, the hotel is ideally located in the Union Square district. Close to all the shops and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Better concierge service
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfectly situated in the Union Square district. Close to all the amazing shopping and restaurants in the area.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Sounds like you had a great time! I'm glad that you enjoyed our wine hour!
We hope to see you again soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Great location. Small bathroom but really not a deal breaker. Staff was very helpful and we loved the happy hou,  wine tasting was a pleasant surprise.

managementResponses.response:
Dear shannon,

Thank you! I'm so glad that you felt our great vibe! It's a combination of the 1928 historic building (went through a renovation in 2011) and our staff who loves to welcome our guests!
Well, I'm happy that you will come back for another stay!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great atmosphere and character!
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful place to stay. The location of the hotel is ideal and our experience was incredible. We just loved the energy and feel of the place. The room, a corner room, was beautiful; however, the bathroom was TINY! That was the only downside. Definitely will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is beautiful. It has a unique style which lends to a great energy and feel. The staff is very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: This can't really be improved, but the bathrooms are really small. If you are okay with this, then definitely stay here....it is worth it.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping! When I booked this hotel, I had no I idea how great the location would be. We were surrounded by shops and could walk to Chinatown.

managementResponses.response:
Dear guest,

Thanks for a stellar review! You couldn't have said better than this and we really appreciate you!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Great stay - staff was exceptionally friendly. Well appointed rooms and super convenient location

managementResponses.response:
Dear guest,

Thank you very much for your loyalty! We always love to have a guest with an eye for beauty and who can appreciate the old-world classic with a little bit of modern twist! You couldn't have said it better and we really appreciate your return visits!

We will see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText:
I visit San Francisco a few times a year and always stay at "the Drake".
I like the size of the property and the location.
Rooms are clean and stylish, a nice feeling of historic San Francisco and modern style.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Bob,

I'm glad that your check-in/out process went smoothly as well as you liked our staff and ambiance. As for our rooms, please know that we have bigger rooms that are suitable for few adults; our front desk/reservation team are hear to answer all your questions about the room size.

We hope that you'll choose to stay in our bigger rooms on your next visit!
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Too Small
review.reviewText: Our check in and check out was very smooth with no hassles or problems and while the overall ambiance of the hotel was very nice and the personnel were very nice the size of our room was shockingly small. There was just enough room for two people to navigate, but if you had any visitors (and we did) we had to meet them in the lobby because the size of the room would not accommodate them. The bathroom was also very small, you had to close the door to sit down and there was no space to put one's necessities. Overall the room was a major disappointment.
review.positiveRemarks: The overall ambiance of the hotel was very nice and the location was great.
review.locationRemarks: The location right on the trollycar line and close to Union Square; everything from shopping to dining was within walking distance.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Patricia,

Thank you for your feedback! Were you here during the week we hosted the wine hour with different themes every night? It is definitely one of the feature most of our guests love! Hope you enjoyed our location to explore this city!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Ideal location in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Loved the wine 0'clock every evening...bathrooms very small but had everything we needed....

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback! I couldn't be happier that you enjoyed your stay with us as well as Scala's restaurant. Our executive chef creates some wonderful dishes using fresh produce from the local farms.
I am sorry to hear about the frustration you experienced regarding our Cable Car drivers and stations. Although, it is a must to ride our famous cable car on your first visit, this city is fairly walk-able (and get your exercise at the same time!) so bring a pair of sneakers next time!

See you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location, very close to Union Square .
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a perfect location for shopping and easily getting around San Francisco. The restaurant 
Scalia was fabulous. We ate there twice and had late night cocktails in the lobby bar as well. Staff were very friendly and accommodating.
