The trolley car system in San Francisco is definitely broken. It took us an hour to get a trolley from Fisherman's Warf on Sunday afternoon. There were 3 trolleys waiting in the station,  but the workers were unwilling to keep the tourists happy and run the trolleys. They explained that they had to wait for change of shift so no overtime was paid. As a result they left many unhappy guests waiting to take a trolley. The same situation took place in 
Union Square where people lined up for an hour to get on the trolley.
review.negativeRemarks: elevators are slow despite all 4 being operational.
review.locationRemarks: make sure you check out Neiman Marcus in Union Square. Huge shopping mall with movie theatre and some great quick food court options.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thanks for staying at the Drake, a 1928 historic building that went through a renovation in 2011. I can certainly appreciate that the classic style isn't for everyone.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText: There are much better options.. Not a good hotel... rooms are outdated and small..

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

The Drake is a 1928 historic building that went through a renovation in 2011. It's always my pleasure to hear that our guests appreciate the old-world charm of this hotel. Please know that some of the amenities are provided upon request; hopefully you enjoyed our complimentary coffee service in a lobby. Lastly, but not least, I couldn't be happier that you enjoyed our service!

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Old World flavor hotel adjacent to Union Sq.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great deal of charm, particularly enjoyed the Drake Bar and lobby area. The staff was without exception helpful and cheerful, all of them said hi, from maintenance to desk staff. The room was small and lacks many amenities such as coffee maker, but there was free coffee (not too bad) in the lobby in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be upgraded a bit.
review.locationRemarks: Adjacent to Union SQ, trolley car line stop right in front.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Indeed, our location is great, just steps away from world-class shopping and dining, not to mention all the attractions you want to visit! Please know that the Drake is a historic building that was built in 1928, and our bathroom size is very typical of that era. Also, please know that our parking is managed by a 3rd party who also manage other similar hotels in the area and our fee is very compatible. Hopefully, you'll visit us without a car as San Francisco is a very walking-friendly city.

Thanks again for your review and we look forward to your visit soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location and we were near everything! The only negative comments I have are that the bathroom is JUST TOO SMALL and outdated and the hotel parking is ridiculously expensive for guests.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom and I think guests should be offered a better parking price.
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect for shopping and eating. Also, it wasn't too far uphill, so you weren't exhausted when you went out for a walk.

managementResponses.response:
Dear diego,

You are right, there are similar name hotel near by that is a completely different brand. Although, our pricing is very compatible depending on what is going in the city. Some days, we can offer lower, some days higher. Hope you enjoyed our location!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location but too expencive for what you get.
review.reviewText:
You have to be carefull because its not the same "san francis" than "sir francis"

I paid a rate of 500usd per night but i think the right price is 300 just for the perfect location but the hotel is not something wow!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Paul,

Thanks for your candid comment. Our parking fee is very compatible to other hotels as most of them are managed by the same parking company. I can certainly appreciate that our 1928 historic, old-world classic hotel isn't for everyone. I'm glad to hear that you found our location and staff's service good.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: There are better place for the money
review.reviewText: Stayed just one night. The hotel is great located and staff was very polite. But it was small, old fashioned and a bit noisy room. Also overnight parking cost $55 extra for a small car. So can't recommend sorry

managementResponses.response:
Dear Bob,

I appreciate your 5-star review! I couldn't be happier to know that your family had a great time exploring the city. What a treat that you got to see the sunsets!

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great Classic Hotel close to everything!
review.reviewText: The whole family enjoyed the Sir Francis Drake.  The entire staff helped us have a great spring break trip.  Get a bus pass and travel the whole city.  Many moderately priced restaurants one block or less from the hotel.  Sunsets at the top of the Drake in the Starlight Room.  Great experience!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Megan,

I'm very happy that you took a full advantage of what the Drake can offer: Sunday's a Drag, our location and it's proximity to the world-class shopping and dining.

Thank you for your 5-star review! We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Beautiful hotel in an awesome location.
review.reviewText: Great location, close to several stores and restaurants. Went to the Sunday's a Drag brunch located in the Starlight Room and it was AMAZING. Would definitely stay here again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I couldn't be happier to know that you had a wonderful trip to San Francisco with your granddaughters! They are absolutely right; the Drake (as the locals call us), does look like something out of an old classic movie! We are so happy that we made your trip a very special one.

We appreciate your review.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: san Francisco a wonderful trip
review.reviewText: The sir francis drake is an elegant older hotel that has been upgraded to be better than new. I traveled with my granddaughters (20 somethings) on a weeks tour of northern California. They adored the ambience of a hotel they have only seen in movies.. However it is not uptight but is amazingly homelike with great morning coffee and papers, fast valet and even faster elevators. A staff always ready with directions and suggestions for closeby events. The hotel experience definitely made our trip special.
review.positiveRemarks: Room dcor and bedding was lovely. Lots of room for all four of us and our suitcases especially the walk in closet.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was small. Valet parking very expensive.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right in the heart of the city. Easy walk every where and on corner cable car stop.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Ani,

Thanks for your 5-star review! Our location is great, isn't it? Hope you got to enjoy our establishments as well.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel. close to many shopping areas.
review.reviewText: I had a great time at sir Francis drake hotel. It was in the heart of San francisco. A lot of nice shopping areas around you. the hotel itself had many lively options like the bar area, starlight room/club. Starbucks was right next to the hotel which I loved. I would recommend this hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear CLS,

Indeed, our location speaks for itself and our 1928 historic building offers a glimpse into the 20's era. I am glad that you found our room clean and our bed comfortable, but I am sorry that you had to deal with the noise from the outside and the noise from our back of the house. We've been in search for a way to buffer the noise and hopefully everyone will have a good-night sleep regardless of the actions that go on around us.

Thanks for your feedback!
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Too Much of 'Right in the Middle of the Action'
review.reviewText:
This location was convenient to a meeting location and the architecture was inviting so I gave it a try. My room was acceptably clean and the bed was comfortable.  

The challenge was noise from several sources.  Certainly the hotel could not control nearby construction which included jackhammering at 9 pm on a Sunday evening and all night on Monday evening.  But, when they offered to move me to the other side of the hotel, I repacked my suitcase.  Over an hour later, a bellman showed up with new keys.  Not cool.  

The noise that could have been controlled came from the elevator shaft, my room was right next to it, and from the Lounge, my room was right below it.  Late night noise from back of house activities impacted my sleep both nights.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby bar is nice with knowledgable bartenders.
review.negativeRemarks: Responsiveness from the staff.  Accuracy of room service orders.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I appreciate that you gave us a try! I understand that our old-world classic isn't everyone's cup of tea. We are a 1928 historic building and are one of the most recognized hotel in San Francisco.

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Business
review.reviewText:
Old furniture, too old elevators, noisy in the evenings 
Old style concept I did not like
Noisy

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I appreciate your feedback about our room and the employees. I couldn't be more happy to know that you found our staff professional and helpful. Although, yes, some of our rooms are smaller, but please know that we'd be happy to move you to a different room if/when we have any available room.

Please visit us soon in the future!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: the employees were very professional and helpful.   the hotel itself looked very nice but the room we stayed in could of had more area  for getting ready  to clean up in the morning
review.negativeRemarks: the  bathroom and sink area were too small and crampted
review.locationRemarks: were near to restaurants and shopping

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kimberly,

Wow, for the last 20 years? I sincerely appreciate your loyalty! I'm sure you've noticed many things changed (for the better) while some things stay the same. You are absolutely right about our location; very convenient to pretty much everything you want and need when you are visiting this city. I'm happy that you find our staff SUPER helpful and enjoy our hotel.

We hope you'll be met with more pleasant memories and experiences in the future.

Again, thank YOU for being a part of the Drake family!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: My favorite hotel in San F for romance or family
review.reviewText:
First, this hotel is luxury. Beautiful interiors and great comfy beds. Second,  you are in the best location.
There is a Starbucks next door, the cable car to the Wharf and North Beach is in front, and there is a Walgreens where you can get waters, CASH back, and anything you forgot across the street.  You are next to Union Square, and at Thanksgiving (good time to bring kids as there is ice skating and shows for xmas) with great shopping.  You are also walking distance from all the best parts of town...china town, the wharf, north beach, nob hill, Lombard street.  The rooms are kept clean- great maid I had.  The staff is SUPER helpful and sweet from the doorman to the front desk. And, there is a great night club view of the city on top.  I have been staying here for almost 20 years, each year.  I have brought my children, and I have had a romantic get away. You cannot beat this hotel!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I'm glad to hear that you had a nice stay! Indeed, our location is very convenient to all the things you want as a traveler!

We hope to see you soon.

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel close to most attractions.
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel, close to many attractions and transportation. The room was a little small but comfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I'm very pleased to know that you found our staff friendly. Bar Drake is a favorite place for our guests to unwind from a day full of activities that surround the hotel.

We'll see you soon.
Thank you for your comment!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Close proximity to shopping and restaurants
review.reviewText:
Overall good experience nice bar area
Great bar scene
We were pleasantly surprised at the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need upgrading
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and great, restaurants

managementResponses.response:
Dear Deb,

Thank you for staying with us. Our historical room is suitable for a single traveler. It is a room that reflects our by-gone era of the 20's. I'm glad that you liked our staff.

Please visit us soon and hope you'll get to experience our bigger room.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location at Union Square
review.reviewText: Great staff. Had an historical room so very small. Otherwise, was great.
review.locationRemarks: By Union Square, directly on Cable Car route to Fisherman's Wharf, etc.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Liz,

Thank you for your review. I certainly understand your frustration for not having your room ready. Please know that we try our best to meet the request of our guest.
I couldn't be happier to know that you enjoyed everything about the Scala's restaurant. I have already shared your experience with the rest of my team at the Sir Francis Drake!

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Centrally located but a bit dated
review.reviewText: Hotel did not have a room with two beds as requested and paid for with my reservation.  Suggested I take a room with a roll away bed.  I declined, but that meant we had to wait about 15 minutes for a room. Not that big a deal, but when you get in from a flight (at night), you would like your room ready.  La Scala restaurant was fabulous, though.  We did not have dinner reservations and it was Valentine's Day night, so the place was packed.  The hostess not only found us a table, but it was in the lovely Wine Room.  We had a delicious meal that even our 11 year-old loved.  Cocktails were awesome and the staff was super efficient and friendly.  Highly recommend the restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great; centrally located to shops and BART.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom is tiny, tiny.  Not very comfortable at all.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is very close, as well as Union Square shopping.  You can also have a nice walk to the Ferry Building, which is one of our favorite places.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I couldn't be happier to learn that you found our staff helpful and loved the hotel. It is a 1928 historic building that went under a renovation few years ago. It sure offers an eclectic yet old-world charm atmosphere which many can enjoy and appreciate.
We hope that you'll visit soon in the future.
Thanks for your review!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText:
The staff is very helpful and dedicated. The design is historic and beautiful. If you like contemporary, this won't work for you. But if you are looking for Edwardian/London look, it is perfect. My room was a bit small and the view not very nice, but the furniture and paintings on the walls were lovely.
The lobby/bar is amazing.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Greg,

Thank you for staying with us for 3 nights. I'm glad to know that you found our hotel well maintained and professionally run. Indeed, it is a 1928 historic building that went through an extensive renovation few years ago. Please know that our parking rate is very compatible to other hotels in the area as it is managed by a parking management company. But you are right! Our public transportation system is fairly well-run so anyone should be able to get around easily.
We hope to see you soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: 3 nights at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake Hotel in San Francisco is a very well maintained and professionally run older hotel with a lot of style. The staff is top notch and super helpful. The room service menu is basic and reasonably priced.  The hotel parking is over the top expensive for 24 hours with in and out privileges. The public transportation in SF is excellent I will not rent a car next time unless it is absolutely necessary.
review.negativeRemarks: Windows are old wooden single pain that do not block out any of the city sounds. We were on the 9th floor and it sounded like the street was just outs
review.locationRemarks: The cable car picks up in front of the hotel. Eat at Sears Caf across the street.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for your 5-star review. Indeed, our location is very convenient to the world-class shopping and dining; glad you enjoyed our rooms, staff and the service!

We hope you took an advantage of our location and explored this beautiful City by the Bay!

Please visit us soon!
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Very handy to center of town
review.reviewText: Close to center of town. Clean rooms and good service. Staff were very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Tidy and clean. Handy so easy to walk.
review.negativeRemarks: The lifts. A little slow in the morning when all is busy.
review.locationRemarks: On business at Moscone, so good for this and good for shopping at Macys.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Maggie,

Thank you for your review. I'm glad that our check-in process went without a glitch. Also, I appreciate that your mentioning about the coffee service as it should not be empty at 9:15am. I will discuss this with my room service department who oversees the morning coffee service.
As far as our rooms, there are variety of rooms in this 415-room hotel; some are suitable for 1 and some are much bigger to accommodate a group of 3 easily. If you have a question about the room and how many people can be accommodated, please feel free to reach out our front desk or reservation staff.

We hope that you'll give us another opportunity to serve you.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Very small rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very nice.  Check-in was pleasant and quick.  However, our room was extremely small, especially for three people.  There was very little room for a suitcase, let alone three.  The bathroom was even worse.  The smallest ever.  Anyone over 150 pounds would not at all be able to use the toilet.  In the morning we went down to the lobby 9:15 for coffee and the pot was empty.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby area is very nice and pleasant with a nice bar. Staff is friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Our room should not have more than one bed.  It would be helpful it the bath vanity had at least a cabinet to keep toiletries.
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent and trolley stops in front of hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear awesomer,

Thanks for your review! Please know that we have rooms that are more suitable for a family as well as a room with a separate sitting area. Our staff is more than happy to answer any questions about our rooms! The Starlight Room does host variety of nights, including Sunday 'Drag' brunch. Hopefully, you'll be able to enjoy one of our music nights!
See you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: nice city option for downtown
review.reviewText: great but room was tiny... Sky lounge was hip hop central... Guess I am getting old :)

managementResponses.response:
Dear Gretta,

Thank you for not only giving us a 5-star review, but taking advantage of our 'Choose to Conserve' program. It sure is a win-win situation for both of us! It sounds like you really enjoyed our location and we do look forward to seeing you here in the near future!

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location, fabulous hotel at a good price too
review.reviewText:
Central to market district. I liked the option to accrue vouchers in return for no housekeeping and towel change. Suited me well. 
The gym was good too. 
If I return to sanfrancisco I will stay there.

managementResponses.response:
Dear J,

Thanks for posting your review! I couldn't agree more on everything you said! Thank you for noticing that... Our location is very convenient and we hope you took good advantage of it to explore the city.

We hope that you'll visit us soon.

Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Free internet. Very clean. Helpful staff. Very small rooms, but efficiently arranged. Air circulation is hardly noticeable, but it is very effective. Location is relatively quiet, and rooms were quiet.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of major shopping area. Public transportation nearby. Close to many area attractions. Good dining establishments nearby.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kerry,

Thank you for visiting us and writing a feedback on your stay. I couldn't be happier to know that you enjoyed your stay and its convenient location to explore.

We hope to see you soon.
Cheers,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Central location in city. Easy access to shopping, cable car, Fisherman's wharf and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Grand hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Fee coffee/tea/hot chocolate in lobby bar every morning. Happy hour every night at the bar.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review. I couldn't happier to learn that you enjoyed our hotel. Please know that there are other size rooms available depending on your needs and our front desk will be happy to assign you to a different room when we have availability.

Thank you for dining at Scala's for your daily meal! We hope you'll return to the Drake in the near future.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great downtown location
review.reviewText:
Overall, very pleased with the Hotel
 Staff were friendly and helpful in every way. Rooms I thought to be a little small, especially the bathroom.
Scala served up the best meal we had the week we were there.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mym,

The Drake is definitely unique! 1928 Historic building that went under the renovation in 2011, we offer an eclectic vibe to many.

I couldn't be happier to know that you enjoyed our location and staff.

We hope to see you in the near future.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Right there in Union Square
review.reviewText: Kind of unique in a quirky way. Rooms/bathrooms on small side but that's San Francisco! Cable car right outside, precious. Can be rather noisy at night. Staff very obliging. Worth a visit, highly recommend.

managementResponses.response:
Hi John,

I appreciate your review. I'm glad that we were able to move you to a bigger room. By any means, we are trying to cut corners, but rather trying our best to contribute to being the Eco-conscious hotel by choosing to use the refillable bottles for shampoo, etc over wasteful small plastic bottles.

We appreciate your understanding and participation in our effort to be eco-friendly.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Don't accept room 15
review.reviewText:
After we got stuck in room 2015 we found out that that's where they put people who book standard room on Expedia.  It must have been a storage room/closet at some point.  It's about 10 ft wide by 20 ft. and they don't even have a door on the closet because you wouldn't be able to open it (bed is in the way).  I assume the "15" rooms on all floors would be the same but didn't check.
Thankfully a really helpful guy at the front desk moved us to another room the second night.  Much better!  If it wasn't for the room 2015 experience I'd give this place 4 stars. It's nice but for over $400 a night they shouldn't be cutting corners they way they do; basic cable (no HBO, expensive On Demand), soap/shampoo dispensers rather than mini bottles, really cheap toilet paper, no continental breakfast...  I don't care about these things but they detract from the atmosphere I assume they're trying to create with the decor.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, central to all and quick cab ride to the different neighborhoods.

review.title: Good, except the bathroom
review.reviewText:
Like the hotel, its vintage looking yet the upgrade keeps the facilities new and clean. Atmosphere good, staff and service warmth, morning coffee was fantastic with the ranges of options, which made up for the lack of coffee in the room. Location is great. We went to Fisherman's Wharf by bus and took the cable car back that stops right outside the hotel. Its a fun slow and scenaric roller coaster ride - must try! Hotel's Italian restaurant has the best Margarita pizza, food is great!
Bathroom is small, but I'm not overly bothered. My only irritation is the minimal shelf space. We have 3 people living in the room with different sets of toiletries and facial product. The shelf space cannot even accommodate one person's toiletries so we have them all over the places and hence messy.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Amanda,

The Drake as locals call it, definitely offers all sorts of character! 1928 historic building went under a renovation few years ago, many visitors love our eclectic mix of old and new. Our location as you noticed is one of the most convenient to all kind of activities for visitors and locals. I'm glad that you found our staff friendly and helpful.

Please visit us soon on your next trip to San Francisco!
Happy New Year
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Hotel  with Character
review.reviewText: Hotel with lots of charm. Central to all places of interest if walking and close to all modes of transport. Cable car stop right outside front of Hotel taking you to Fisherman's Wharf or Ferries. Staff friendly, helpful and prompt.  Great bar upstairs with views of the city. Reasonable rates. Surrounded by fantastic shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: Its charming furnishings. Staff were very accommodating. Close to the shops. Free coffee and hot chocolate in lounge area in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Roomy comfy but bathroom a little too small with not enough bench space.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car stop right outside the door taking you to fisherman's wharf. Cheesecake shop above Macy's a must do is only down the road.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Lots of charm indeed! The Drake is a 1928 historic building and after going through a renovation in 2011, it added lots of charm!
Lastly, please know that our rooms vary in so many sizes; some are much cozier and others much bigger to accommodate a family of 4 - 6.

We hope to see you soon at the Drake.
Happy New Year
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Overall, a nice hotel with lots of charm! But the rooms are small!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Great to hear that you had a good stay. Yes, our location speaks for itself and I'm glad that you enjoyed it.

Thank you for your review.

Happy New Year
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Comfortable stay.  Location is wonderful.  Older hotel so rooms are small.

managementResponses.response:
Dear james,

Thank you for your review. I am pleased to know that you found our staff and service great. However, I am utterly disappointed to learn that the room wasn't cleaned. I will definitely pass this onto my housekeeping manager. I really appreciate that you pointed out.

Happy New Year.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Well located, faded glory
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent, service was good.  Facility condition is a B-.  Room was very small and cleanliness level was not good.  There was a significant amount of dust on the wallpaper near the heat vent in particular.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and all of the traditional San Francisco locations.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review. I'm disappointed to learn that you didn't feel the relocation situation wasn't handled as you expected. Did you return to our hotel after your relocation? If so, hope you had a much better experience.

We hope to see you soon at the Drake.
Happy New Year!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Its was great, they could handle our hotel relocation a lot better. Have the room booked prior to our arrival
review.negativeRemarks: Room to look more new
review.locationRemarks: Very close to malls and China Town

managementResponses.response:
Dear JCo,

Thank you for choosing to stay at the Drake! I couldn't agree with you more on our location. Our historic building provides a very unique setting - some rooms are smaller and others are much bigger. We get our windows washed after our most foggy/rainy season. I'm sorry to hear that the views were not something you've expected.

Happy New Year.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Okay Night
review.reviewText: Great location but a bit rundown. Very small rooms and dirty stained windows that take from the city views.

review.title: Nice hotel central location
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful inside and out. Staff are friendly and attentive. Wine out was a huge Plus! Room is small but that is to be expected in this area.
Excellent hotel, excellent service and location. Bathroom is a little small but overall excellent experience. Totally recommended.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Good to hear that you had a great time! Thank you for your precise comment!

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Had a great time.  Rooms small but very clean.  Friendly staff and overall a very nice hotel
too much money for such small rooms and poor service

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sophie,

I really appreciate your expressing the experience you had. You are absolutely right about the communication: we are always trying to be mindful about passing on the right and precise information to our guests and I'm sorry that information you were given wasn't so.

We hope that you'll give us another opportunity to make your stay a much better one.

Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good location to Union Square
review.reviewText:
We stayed here over the Christmas break and I was really impressed by the location and the reception area.  The rooms were a good size and clean, although the walls were a little thin and you could hear people in the room next to you.  When we checked in the staff were very helpful - particularly a blonde lady on reception.   

The only disappointment was that we were told on Christmas Day that there would be room service till 10am.  I called up 2 weeks before the stay to confirm this as well as when we checked in.  On Christmas Day they told us at 9.15am that actually there was no room service and that there was a first come, first served plate of pastries in reception which had all gone by the time they called us!  However, the staff were quick to understand the frustration and kindly went out to get us more pastries.  The communication could have been better.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. It was comfortable and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no coffee or tea machine in the room which was fairly unusual.  The walls in the rooms are very thin and so you can hear adjacent rooms
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a great location to stay in San Francisco - it's near shops, a cable car route, China Town, the Financial District and Ferry Terminal.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I'm sorry to hear that the sound from the Starlight Room kept you up until 1:30am. Please know that we are in a process of coming up with better sound proofing to lessen the amount of noise traveling down from the Starlight Room. In the meantime, please know that we'd be more than happy to move you to a different room whenever we have availability and we do have a set of ear plugs upon request from our housekeeping department.

We hope that you'll give us another chance to serve you.
Happy New Year!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: DO NOT ACCEPT A ROOM ON THE 20TH floor!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: 20th floor of this hotel is below the club at this hotel and we were kept up all night to 1:30 a.m. that is, DO NOT EXCEPT A ROOM ON THE 20TH floor PERIOD!
review.locationRemarks: EVERYTHING IS CLOSE great hotel for central S.F.

review.title: Did not deliver what it promised!
review.reviewText: I made this reservation based on a friend's recommendation.  After reading the description of the room, I went for it:  Historic Queen Room with City View in Downtown San Francisco with the glamour of the past but the convenience and the comfort of the present.  Reading further about the hotel, I loved the idea of its group and I even joined the loyalty program.  I was pleasantly surprised with the location and the lobby but not with the check-in process where the person made sure to make me feel that he is in a rush and he did not even have time to enter my loyalty program number in the reservation since I am not getting any perks anyhow (to be fair, it was new year's eve and the hotel was sold out; but then, I did pay $$$$ for a one night stay in a room...a very small room to discover later), I had to wait for no less than 5 minutes for the elevator, and then be shocked that a city view means seeing the Walgreens sign out of my window!  The room was unique in design, clean, and the bed was comfortable.  The day I checked out was much easier where the housekeeping staff made enough noise in the hallway to wake me up (yes, that is sarcasm!) and the gentleman who checked me out was very nice (this is true!).
review.negativeRemarks: description of room (city view s/b removed because it is misleading), more staff when it is busy, quiet time in hallway
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

managementResponses.response:
Dear Bob,

Wow, thanks for letting me know that you had a wonderful stay with us! What a way to start a new year for both of us! Our location, Union Square becomes even more alive with all of the holiday decorations and i couldn't be happier to know that you had a blast!

We hope to see you soon for another great stay!
Happy New Year.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Outstanding service!
review.reviewText: This classic SFO hotel was remodeled in past few years and is very clean, classic, and nostalgic.  What really impressed us, though, was the outstanding personal service and attention to us.  The staff really made an effort to demonstrate appreciation for our visit over Christmas 2014.  The place was alive with guests and staff - we had a blast.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra pillows and improved sound-dampening windows on the Powell ST. side of the building.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location at Union Square.  We took our kids to SFO for Christmas and this hotel was the best part of the trip - we loved it.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Leslie,

It's nice to know that you had a wonderful weekend getaway! The location speaks for itself as you discovered and glad that you ventured out to different places! The Drake is a 1928 historic building that many may appreciate and it sounds you certainly did. Very typical of that era, the bathrooms are smaller than what you find in more modern hotels, but we are always coming up new ideas to make the best use out of our bathroom.
We sincerely hope that you'll visit us soon for another wonderful stay!

Thanks and Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great place to stay in Union Square
review.reviewText: Stayed here for the weekend with a girlfriend. It was close to shopping and restaurants. It's also a short walk to Chinatown and North Beach.  The hotel has a beautiful lobby with an old world feel. The happy hour was great and just what we needed after a long day of shopping. The rooms were nice except the bathroom was small; It had no counter space to put your things. The beds were very soft and comfy.  I'd stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge, Leif, was absolutely fantastic. He went out of his way for us. He even offered to lay down in the street if we couldn't get a cab!
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants, bike rentals, tours, cable cars, Walgreens and Starbucks

managementResponses.response:
Dear Nev,

Thank you for making the Drake your family vacation destination! With a family of 6, I wouldn't doubt the location couldn't be more convenient and much more economical (no cabs to get to places/back to the hotel)! Glad that you noticed our facade which is 1928 historic; Scala's has a great menu which our Exec. Chef tries to use local produce as much as possible. Hope you enjoyed the view from the Starlight Room as well.

We all hope to see you again in the future!
Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel in central San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were a family of 6 in 2 rooms. The hotel is adjacent to Union Square, has a cable car stop outside and is close to all starting points for tours. The staff were very, very helpful. The foyer is exquisite, Scala's restaurant has an excellent menu and is very lively. The Starlight Room on Level 21 is also a lot of fun. The hotel can also handle weddings and conferences with aplomb.
review.positiveRemarks: The proximity to all points in San Francisco is a feature. The restaurant, foyer bar and rooftop bar / dance floor create a fun atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are clean, but the attention to detail on the building aspects (e.g. tiling, paintwork) could be better.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a hive of activity for shopping and dining, and is also easy for accessing the rest of San Francisco.

managementResponses.response:
Dear xx,

Thanks for choosing the Drake! You are right; it is part of our effort to being a energy conscious hotel by installing a light with timer. Also, please know that we have smaller and bigger rooms; depending on your needs and preference.

Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Room was small, bathroom light turned off mid shower, it's on a timer or something. Otherwise, a great stay!

review.title: Nice but small room
review.reviewText: Beautiful place, very nice hotel. Only complaint is that room was TINY.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I can certainly feel your frustration, but I'm glad that we were able to move you to another room. Broken lock is definitely NOT a usual occurrence and if there is ever any problem, our team can usually fix it in no time.
We really hope that you can give us another opportunity and show you a real hospitality on your next stay.

Happy Holidays,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Very bad experience.
review.reviewText: The lock of the door is broken and I couldn't get to my room. They spend couple hours working on it without a fix before they move me to another room. The room is okay with a  tiny restroom and a tiny toilet

managementResponses.response:
Dear mona,

I welcome everyone's opinions and suggestions. Although, it is hard to accommodate every different recommendation, but we are always trying to improve on our guest experiences!
As for the coffee pot, we offer a complimentary morning coffee/tea/hot chocolate service in the lobby; mini refrig is available upon request (first come, first serve) On your next trip, please give the front desk a ring to request both coffee maker and a mini refrig in advance and we'd be more than happy to place them in your room.

I appreciate that you plan to return!

Happy Holidays,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Superb location
review.reviewText:
Generally a nice hotel -- although some amenities could be improved such as providing coffee pot in room, a real wet bar in mini refrig, more
drinking glasses and soap in bathroom.  Other than a tiny bar of soap and tiny body lotion -- nothing else is provided.  However due to its central location I would most likely return.

review.title: crazy xmas
review.reviewText: the help was very nice. the room nice but very noisy one window won,t shut all the way thus the noise. the bath tub seemed dirty but it was so old that might have been a large part of the problem. try to valet was a hassle do to xmas. crowd.
review.positiveRemarks: all the hotel staff was wonderful the bed was very nice
review.negativeRemarks: remodeling the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: location was great close to shops easy to get a cab everything close by couldn,t get any better

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed stay overall. Hotel has nice restaurant and decor. Hard to sleep due to noise from street below (construction, traffic, and people).

review.title: Great hotel for holidays!
review.reviewText:
We had 6 of us, 3 rooms.  Hotel staff nicely accommodated us on same floor, nice rooms even with fully booked hotel. Beautiful hotel decorated for holidays.  Pretty even when not if you like the older style. If you like new and modern, try another place.  This place has TONS of character! 3 doormen are awesome and work hard.  Front desk staff was great, and the cleaning crew was too.  Also valets....basically all who we dealt with were great. 
Very busy time, lots of traffic, people etc.  Best way to get anywhere at this time of year was taxi or walk but that was fine with us.  Cable cars ridiculous and not available unless you waited hours...then they broke down.  
Again, great hotel, great location, (rooms not super roomy but we managed to enjoy our downtime just fine!) Classic King rooms....double occupancy.
review.negativeRemarks: coffee makers in rooms
review.locationRemarks: Union square....every thing is accessible from here.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kristina,

Wow, we really appreciate your loyalty; 2nd visit in 2 months! Of course, our location speaks for itself, surrounded by great shopping venues. I'm glad that you found our staff friendly, our beds comfortable! It sounds like you had a fun time at Starlight! Our signature Wine Hour is a great place to mingle with our staff and other guests to share some travel stories. Please do stop by on your next visit to the Drake!

Thanks and Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Absolutely will stay again!
review.reviewText: This was my second time in 2 months and 3rd time overall staying at the Sir Francis Drake and I will absolutely stay there the next time I travel.  Everyone from the valet to the concierge are warm and friendly and extremely helpful, almost like talking with old friends.  I had a beautiful room that was spotless and the beds and pillows were comfortable.  The counter space in the bathroom is non-existent, but that may be my only complaint.  My party traveled to see a show and they handled our transportation to and from.  The concierge's recommendation for dinner and drinks couldn't have been better!   We even hit the Starlight Room and danced until morning.  I highly recommend it.  Next time I plan on making the wine tasting from 5 to 6.  Also the location couldn't be better.  It's right next to Union Square.  The shopping is fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: It's clean. The staff is friendly and helpful.  It has a bar!  In the morning there is complimentary coffee and hot chocolate bar. LOCATION!
review.negativeRemarks: Counter space in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping, shopping.  Union square.  See a show.  Catch a Giants game!!!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Lee,

Thank YOU for a 5-star review! You said it perfectly and I look forward to your return stay with us!

Happy Holidays!

Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Enjoyed our stat
review.reviewText: Great old hotel. Staff was friendly and very helpful. I'd definitely go back.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

It's no surprise that everyone loves our location as it is in a middle of Union Square for your shopping and dining experience. As this is a 1928 historic building, we try to keep up with our maintenance, but we always welcome our guests comments so that we can make a necessary repairs and improvement.

I'm glad that it was an overall good experience for staying at the Drake.

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Good location...downtown area within walking distance from shops and restaurants. Bathrooms need updating and towel rods or hooks. An overall good experience.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mitra,

I am very disappointed that you felt nickeld and dimed. Our mini-bar items are priced very compatible to other hotels in the same area and we offer a complimentary coffee/tea service in the lobby area as well as evening wine hour. Our shampoo and body wash pumps are supposed to be filled by our housekeeper and it sounds like they needed a refill...and I am sorry for that. We do have a limited number of mini fridge in our housekeeping that can be brought up on request.

I appreciate your review.
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nickled and dimed

No in-room coffee, microwave or mini fridge, but plenty of overpriced purchase options. It was a little insulting. Staff pleasant and helpful.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Center of Downtown San Fran
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel with a lot of charm. We had a major room and credit card mix up. But the staff corrected the issue and upgraded our room.

review.negativeRemarks: The mix up with the rooms was corrected. But it should be noted that this hotel has single bed rooms.

Thank you for your review!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location

When we complained, the staff assured us that it wouldn't happen the next morning. The next morning again we were awakened by hammering one floor above us! I loved the location, they have a complimentary happy hour and free wifi. The rooms and bathrooms are super small, but we didn't spend that much time in our room.
review.positiveRemarks: The old SF feel. It's very ornate and beautiful. It's location is tops!

review.title: Sir francis drake
review.reviewText: It was a lot of fun! Pet friendly, wine hour every night, and the starlite room has a wonderful view !! Would love to stay here again of we make it back to San Francisco!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Einstein,

It's always good to hear that our guests enjoy this 1928 historic building. No doubt, our location couldn't be beat either. Please know that it is unacceptable to me as well when I hear that a guest felt our service was not up-to-par.

Please know that our aim is to providing the best and the most comfortable experience and it is very disappointing that the situation wasn't met with your agreement. Although, while some guests love our beds, I understand, some don't. However, I am sorry that you had to take a cold shower.

Happy Holidays.

Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Stunning historic hotel lacking comfort
review.reviewText:
Don't get me wrong -- this is a GORGEOUS hotel! Beautiful high ceilings, ornate chandeliers, giant mirrors everywhere...it's definitely worth seeing. Also, the location was terrific -- right next to a cable car stop, right by Union Square, etc. But as we all know, looks can be deceiving! When it came to service and comfort, this hotel was just not up to par.

The $62/night valet completely ignored us upon arrival. Then, when we got to our small room by the elevator, I took a shower that turned ice cold about 5 minutes in (you know, just in time to get my hair full of shampoo so I was trapped in this deep freeze until I could get the shampoo out). When I told the front desk about it, they simply said they had been having trouble with the hot water and were trying to get it fixed. First, WHY ON EARTH wouldn't you say something when we checked in?? Just a little "We're very sorry, but we're having some trouble with the hot water. Would you like to maybe have a drink at the bar while we fix it?" I guess they were just hoping no one would take a shower right then? I don't know. It was weird. And after I froze my butt off, they weren't particularly apologetic and didn't offer anything to correct it. I find this pretty unforgivable for a hotel of this quality and price. And the bed was like sleeping on plywood -- just so so so hard. WHY?! 

So for rather a lot of money, I got ignored by valet, an ice cold shower, and an uncomfortable bed. BUT the bar and bartender (Dan) were nice!
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the overall look and feel of the hotel, and the bartender - Dan.
review.negativeRemarks: SERVICE SERVICE SERVICE!! Don't ignore your guests upon arrival and don't "forget" to tell them there's no hot water.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Marieke,

Thank you for staying with us! We are a 1928 historic building and have gone through a renovation few years ago. Our location is indeed excellent close to everything you want to explore; our staff whom many guests find them friendly. Please know that we'll be switching out some of the older mattresses to new one as well as pillows in 2015. In addition, a different type of pillow can be requested through our housekeeping department.

Please visit us soon!

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great staff but lousy pillows and thin walls
review.reviewText: Authentic building in the heart of San Francisco; great staff working the reception. Major disadvantages: Very thin walls (can hear other guests speak through the wall), old beds and paper thin pillows. All in all great ambience but little comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: New beds. New pillows. Isolate the walls.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is just around the corner.

managementResponses.response:
Dear James,

Wow, thank YOU for a wonderful review! The Drake as locals call us is a 1928 historic building and has gone through a major renovation to add some modern amenities. Although, there were several limitation as to what we could do, we tried to keep the old-world charm.
I'm also glad that you found our staff friendly and helpful.

New Zealand is quite away, but hopefully you'll visit us soon.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nicely presented hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
Hotels are a mixed bag in the Union Square area, and pleasingly this hotel is certainly amongst the best in terms of value for money and quality. Being an older building, my room was small, but well fitted out. The bed was comfortable, the room clean. The WiFi was free and performed well. Noise between rooms was a bit poorer than you'd hoped for in a hotel - but based on the age of the building not a big surprise. Certainly better than other nearby hotels!
Staff were friendly and helpful - my request to use the business centre after I'd checked out was gladly met, and service at the hotel bar was good.
The hotel is really well presented - a classic building, nicely restored. It's a place where you feel you've gone back in time (but in a good way!)
I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.
review.positiveRemarks: nicely appointed clean rooms; free wifi; helpful staff; great location
review.negativeRemarks: A bit more sound proofing would be nice, but not a big deal.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Square, so excellent position. Great craft beer bar over the road.

review.reviewText: Great location and great atmosphere.  I would recommend to all travelers.

The hotel is in an excellent location, but that's about the only good thing I can say. Our room was incredibly small, smelled horrible, and had an extremely uncomfortable bed. I have never had a bad experience with a Kimpton hotel, but will definitely not stay here again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I appreciate your review. The Drake, as you know is a 1928 historic building and as you noticed we've gone through a renovation to add few modern amenities yet keeping the old-world charm. The bathroom will go through a resurfacing project in 2015.

As for the room, we would've been happy to upgrade you to a room whenever there is an availability, and I'm sorry that there was not an applicable room available at the time of your check-in.

We hope that you'll visit us soon.
Thank you.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Location trumps
review.reviewText:
Located right at union square, right on the cable car line and about 3 blocks from the Bart, location was perfect for our San Fran "car free" vacation.  This is a heritage hotel so if you are expecting perfection, go elsewhere. I personally love the "quirky" of heritage properties, so go out of my way to find them.  The lobby bar is beautiful and I love the staircase entrance.That being said, I also appreciate, renovations that honor the era but are more than a fresh coat of lipstick.  First off, yes, I'd stay here again, the close proximity of transportation and walkability is great.
so what didn't fit the bill? The new capet and wall paper looked OK but an old bathtub with new metal plug pulled away from the paint (and chipped) overshadows the newer carpet and drapes.  The second should be prefaced with thanks Sir Francis, you taught me for next time.  I booked a classic queen through Expedia, the reservation was confirmed and guaranteed for late arrival- all paid in advance. After a 3 hour flight delay, we arrived at 11pm only to be told the Francis Drake was "out of Cassic Queen rooms" but they would be happy to give us a double... really? a double? I then asked, you can't do anything about getting me a Queen?  They could, but it involved us staying the night in one room and then moved to another for the remaining 3 nights of our stay.  Next time, I'll stand there until they give me my "guaranteed" room or an upgrade.  next time.....

managementResponses.response:
Dear kimberly,

Yes, our location speaks for itself and sounds like you enjoyed our room. I'm sorry to learn that you found our staff not up to your standard. I will definitely bring this matter up to my manager who oversees the front desk operation and Starlight operation.

Thank you and happy holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is beautiful & the location doesn't get any better! I was not impressed with most of the staff they were rude & acted as if they were being put out. However our bellman Evan was great, very kind & helpful. As was the door man out front, he got us anywhere we needed to go. We had a two full bed, room & it was tiny!!!! No room to move around. It was very clean & decorated nicely. 
We took a stroll up to The starlight room only to be charges a large cover & again more rude staff. It was impossible to get a drink. Kind of a mess for such a high end hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Aileen,

I couldn't be happier to know that you had a great stay with us! As you experienced, our location is superb in visiting all kind of places to shop and dine!

Hopefully, you'll visit us soon for another quick getaway!

Thank you and happy holidays!

Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great value, highly recommended all around
review.reviewText:
It was my husband's birthday and we were looking for a quick weekend getaway to celebrate.
Online booking was a breeze (way to go, Expedia!)
We were settled comfortably in no time, thanks to the attentive front desk staff. Our room had 2 queen beds with a city view. It was well appointed, smoke and scent-free, very quietly nestled on the 15th floor.
We knew we were going to a historic building and adjusted our expectations accordingly. The bathroom is small compared with those found in newer hotels, but it was not as bad as what we read in some reviews.
The Starlight Room on the 21st floor is a definite plus, for its view and vintage ambience. The music was not bad either. It's not for the younger, 20s-30s crowd. As a couple in our mid-40s with young teen daughters who enjoy arts and cuisine, the restrained, friendly vibe was definitely to our liking. From bellhop to the red and gold-attired beefeaters, to reception staff - the level of hospitality is wonderful. La Scala Bistro is one elevator ride down. Its short but carefully crafted menu is an extension of the warmth of hotel service. For short stays, trade housekeeping (save water) for free drinks and other offers. For chocoholics and treats, we went to Tout Sweet Patisserie, known to locals for great pastries & espresso, located on the 3rd floor of Macy's (yes, the department store).
Desigual and UniqClo are go-to for comfortable, quality clothes' shopping. Ruby Skye for 
heady, bass-heavy dancing is nearby. Fun!
review.positiveRemarks: We were greeted with warm hospitality from check in to departure. Clean room, convenient location easy access to transportation, shops. Vintage charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of valet service. Also small amenities ($6 for a bottle of water is a bit much) - these are really unnecessary, given the pharmacy right across.
review.locationRemarks: Tram/BART right in front of the hotel. Chinatown is a few blocks away. Tout Sweet Patisserie, 3rd floor Macy's; Saks 5th. Yerba Buena is a nice stop

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I'm sorry that the trash wasn't taken out. I will readdress this with my housekeeping department during my morning meeting.

We hope you enjoyed the rest of your stay.

Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: the room still had trash in it from the previous occupants
review.negativeRemarks: better housekeeping
review.locationRemarks: less than a block from union square

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mallory,

It's always nice to hear that you found our staff helpful. We are constantly improving and trying to keep this 1928 Historic building in top condition; our current project should be done after the new year. Sorry if you felt a bit of inconvenience.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great staff, friendly and efficient service

Thank you and hope to see you soon.

review.title: Location was fabulous!  I loved the dcor!

We took full advantage of the wine tasting each night, a nice surprise!
