review.title: Good central hotel.
review.reviewText:
Stayed four nights at the Sir Francis Drake in October 2014. The location is a perfect place to set up home camp for your stay, close to the buzz of downtown and union square. There is also a BART station very nearby which provides a half an hour transfer to San Francisco Airport for just over $8.
Cable cars run regularly up and down the street outside, and a variety of bus tour companies will jostle for your business at Union square.
You can't miss the hotel as you approach, just aim for the beefeater doorman. The lobby and bar area are very opulent. The architecture fantastic to look at as you sit and have a drink in the bar.
The room itself was very small, but clean and well decorated and with everything that we needed. We were hardly in it anyway! We also took the option to forego housekeeping for a couple of mornings in exchange for $20 of vouchers that can be redeemed at the hotel which we promptly used at the bar.
There is a nightclub on the top floor that we didn't make it to unfortunately. Our room was a couple of floors underneath it on the the 19th and despite some evidence of it being heard by the lifts, we could not hear it in the room. It's only open till 1am anyway. Hey, you're on holiday.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Glenna,

It never fails to put a smile on my face when I read a review like yours! I'm really happy to know that you enjoyed your stay and our staff. The Drake being a 1928 Historic building, our rooms vary in sizes. Hopefully you'll get to experience our bigger rooms on your next visit with us! Our location speaks for itself and the city is better explored on foot like most San Franciscans do.
We hope to see you soon!
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: The hotel is older but has a nice charm to it
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Sir Frances Drake hotel SF for 3 nights and very much enjoyed our stay.  It is older and rooms are pretty small but we didn't mind after we got settled in and began enjoying our stay and visiting with staff.  Everyone was very friendly and the restaurant attached is excellent!  Location is absolutely perfect.  Walked every where (except Fisherman's Wharf).  Street noise in the room was a little loud but eventually everything settled down and it was fine.  Would absolutely stay at this hotel again!

managementResponses.response:
Hello,

Thanks for your feedback. As for valet, they are our 3rd vendor who manages many parking lots in the surrounding hotels. Nevertheless, it is not acceptable for me that they did not provide you with the best possible service. I don't believe any of the hotels' valet provide a free car wash, as most of the city hotels are limited with the space, not to mention, we are diligent and monitoring our water consumption. Our team of engineers and painters, as well as our housekeeping team constantly check for any maintenance we need to do. Hopefully, you'll give us another chance to 'wow' you on your next visit.

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: I was disappointed by the valet. Not in a rush to help me let alone notice me. I didn't appreciate the zero body wash and forgetfulness of the staff when I asked them to bring it up.   The fact that the hole of a bathroom didn't have proper ventilation was bothersome no surprise the wallpaper was peeling. It was pretty and loved the view. I was expected a better wow factor.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Nellie,

Thank you for staying with us! Our location definitely speaks for itself, very convenient to many things. Our doormen, each dressed as Beefeater is quite an iconic figure in San Francisco travel industry. They sure are one of the friendliest and most attentive staff we have. I'm sorry to hear that you weren't made aware of our complimentary morning coffee service. I make sure that our front desk agent to notify each guest they check in. We have heard others about the location of hair dryer hook, etc. We are on it! Thanks for reminding us!

We hope to see you soon at the Drake!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Experiences with this hotel
review.reviewText:
Very convenient location.  The door man was very helpful as he contacted the shuttle for us when it was late in arriving.  He also hailed us a cab when the cable cars were full!  We liked the idea of conserving by having the hotel not cleaned on a daily basis and in return get other amenities.  There needs to be a note saying that there is a free newspaper along with the free coffee as we purchased it every day across the street, not knowing that.  The idea of dispensing shampoo and other soaps is a great idea.  There needs to be more towel racks for the face and hand towels.  None in the bathroom within easy reach!  The light in the closet (in switch to turn on and off) so we couldn't see the combination to the safe.  Also, the hair dryer hook needs to be lowered.  Too high to reach!  

We would stay here again on our next stay as it is a great hotel to stay at!
review.negativeRemarks: See Above
review.locationRemarks: Great places to eat and shop.  We also went to see the Motown Musical at the Orpheum theatre and to hear live jazz music at the Blues and Bisquits.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Linda,

Just a block from Union Square, the Drake's location couldn't be better. Our staff loves to work here and glad that you found them friendly and helpful. Please know that as one of the 1928 historic buildings in San Francisco, there are so many types of rooms; some cozier, others much bigger. Our price varies, but we often offer great deals on our web site!

We hope to see you soon!
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location- boutique hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for two nights and the location is great. The staff was very friendly & helpful.
However the room was small, especially the bathroom. The bed was comfortable. Everything was in Art Deco style. I would recommend it but a bit pricey for size room

managementResponses.response:
Dear RCP,

Very well said! Thank you for the 5-star review.
We are definitely not a cookie-cutter hotel and glad to hear you enjoyed it.

We'll see you soon!
Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel, walking distance to many fun places
review.reviewText: Great place and great staff.  Historic hotel with lots of flavor

managementResponses.response:
Dear Melissa,

You LOVE this hotel, so do we! The Drake is a 1928 historic building and we've put our love into it while we put some modern amenities/upgrade few years ago. As you know, the Starlight Lounge is many people's favorite and I'm happy that you got to enjoy everything.

We hope to see you soon.
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Amazing Stay in Downtown San Fran!!!!
review.reviewText:
I LOVE THIS hotel! 
We stayed here while visiting with my in-laws and it  was magical! The history in the building is incredible and it was such a lovely atmosphere. the rooms were SO comfy, but I would suggest upgrading to a larger room if you can, rooms in SF are naturally going to be smaller, but it is totally worth the extra space.   I loved the decor and the lounge upstairs. The starlight lounge is fantastic. I can't wait to go back!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved everything about it. the room was perfect, the location was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: I loved it, but I would have loved more pillows on the bed and I would have loved a few more towels in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is nearby! Sears restaraunt and Lori's diner right there by the hotel are fab choices and the trolley is right outside. LOVE.

managementResponses.response:
Dear MJ,

Agree, our location speaks for itself and glad that you enjoyed our staff.
We are indeed a 1928 historic building and we try to maintain that old-world charm Thanks for checking out our restaurant!

Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good location but hotel is 'tired'
review.reviewText: The location just off Union Square was convenient, the staff was pleasant, but the hotel is tired and the amenities could use upgrading. The historic appeal is there, but if you're looking for luxury, this is not the place. There was a lot of street noise (cable car bells, whistles, sirens) and the old windows in the guest room were not up to the job of blocking it. The bathroom was only slightly bigger than those found on a plane, with an ancient - chipped - cast iron tub squeezed in (with no counter space) and the fixtures were falling apart. The hotel restaurant, Scala Bistro, was very good, but somewhat pricey.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Roadrunner,

Thanks for returning to our hotel! We are happy to upgrade our guests whenever rooms are available. I'm disappointed to learn that your 2nd time wasn't what you expected. Hopefully, you'll visit us for your 3rd time so that we can wow you!

Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Our San Francisco weekend
review.reviewText: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel. I think, without realising it, we must have been upgraded the first time and this gave us a great impression. Our visit this time was disappointing, for two main reasons - our room was too small, well furnished, but just not big enough. The bathroom was particularly small, no room for two people and little room for one. And secondly, considering the projected standard of the hotel, the staff were too casual and the standard of dress not in keeping with what we would have expected.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has a good theme, and we like the name. We also enjoyed the tasteful furnishings of the rooms, and other hotel facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: The size of rooms would be a hard one for the hotel to address, but our room was way too small. Having a shake up of staff is paramount.
review.locationRemarks: Absolutely the perfect location, it would be difficult to beat - unless you wanted to be nearer Fisherman's Wharf I suppose.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Pati,

Wow, you said it all...Thanks! Great hotel, clean, service and the drink that you can enjoy...what more can you ask for? Our location speaks for itself as it is close to just about everything anyone wants!

I'm glad that you really enjoyed your stay.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: The great stay in the city center
review.reviewText: The hotel is great, beautiful, clean, stuff is friendly and drinks at the bar are delicious. Bus and cable car stops right are right in front of the hotel. Walking distance to restaurants, shops and all u need while in San Francisco. I loved the view from my room I could even see the bay. I would highly recomend this hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I appreciate your 5-star review! I'm glad to know that you enjoyed your 4-day stay with us! Yes, our location speaks for itself and everyone loves our complimentary coffee/tea service in the morning and our wine hour!

We hope to see you soon.
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good hotel good location free coffee am happy hour
review.reviewText: Arrived early and was upgraded staff excellent good 4 day stay enjoyed the area very much
review.negativeRemarks: A little noise on 15th floor from street construction at time of stay
review.locationRemarks: Location excellent walk to everywhere in San fran

managementResponses.response:
Dear Arlene,

I appreciate your review. We listen to our guest comments. We are waiting for the shelves and once we have that in our hands, we'll be installing them to increase the storage area.
Most importantly, Union Square and our hotel's immediate surrounding area is a home to the world-class shopping and dining.

Thanks for visiting us.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Too small for comfort
review.reviewText:
If you like a little space, this hotel is not for you. The room was so small and the bathroom literally only had a 2 x 2 area to stand. The toilet, tub and very tiny sink were all up on each other. It was quite challenging to apply make up. There's no counter space. I had to utilize the toilet lid and place my stuff on top of it. Ugh!

The hotel is definitely historic and the rooms are filled with unique and beautiful furnishings, but in my opinion that did not make up for the lack of square footage. 

Overall, the area is boarder line seedy unless you head toward the shopping area where Macys is located. The hotel was overpriced and I will not return.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure if they can build out their bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: There were several homeless people and the area was noisy.  But it was walking distance to Macy's and some high end dept stores.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: I wrote a long detailed review and Expedia refused to publish it. So all I will say now is this hotel was horrible, loud, inconsiderate and overpriced. Never, ever will we return to this property.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Don't go to Union Square - it is a tourist trap and the stores are in every mall in America.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Trisha,

It always bring our spirits up to read a review like yours! We always strive to provide the best service, but it's nice to get a positive confirmation from one of our guests! Our hotel has plenty of history behind it starting with our 'Prohibition Room'. On your next visit, please ask for a tour!

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: One night wasn't enough!
review.reviewText:
We stayed one night so we could get in a tour of Alcatraz before our Cruise.  We had to rush from the airport to the pier to make our tour, stopping quickly to leave our bags.  My husband didn't even have to enter the hotel to check our bags - how wonderful!
The staff couldn't have beem more friendly, the room was clean, well appointed and very roomy, and there are no words to describe how beautiful the hotel was!  When we had to leave the hotel the next day to head down to our cruise ship, our requested taxi van was waiting for us.
Great location and fantastic hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of
review.locationRemarks: Sears food may be a tourist staple, but it was beautiful and had fantastic food with great service.  Trolley stops right in front of hotel!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Basile,

I appreciate your candid comment. I'm mostly disappointed that you felt our staff did not show the care you wanted. We do offer to move our guest to another room when requested whenever we have other compatible rooms available. It is likely that the hotel was sold out.

Please know that I will mention your experience with my front desk team.

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: great position, experience so so - Beware
review.reviewText:
we booked this hotel for 2 nights, paid A$828.00 for 2 nights. our room was small, which was fine as I had not paid a higher rate for a larger room.  however I was not impressed when I found that they had put us in a room on the 20th floor, directly under the night club dance floor n the 21st , the bar and dance floor where pumping until 1.30am close. 
I was very annoyed as I feel the hotel should have advised us of this prior to accepting our reservation and the room should have been heavily discounted as a result thereof.  I spoke to the night duty staff on the Saturday evening to raise my concerns, they were not very helpful and did not offer an alternate room.
For the rate paid, I did not get any value . the staff had a no care attitude.
review.positiveRemarks: position great, bar, foyer and Scala restaurant  great.
review.negativeRemarks: management and staff

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Great review! You said it all: location, our lobby and Scala's!

Thanks!
We hope to see you soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Very convenient hotel
review.reviewText:
Close to union square and all the key shops
Lovely foyer and excellent restaurant attached ( also good for room service)

review.title: Nice historic hotel, unbeatable location
review.reviewText: We loved the Sir Francis Drake. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are funky and not over restored. By necessity bathrooms are small. We had a corner room with great views (2010), but on the20th floor, which means LOUD at night, because their nightclub is just above. They provided earplugs once we requested them, and a  very nice gesture, took the breakfast charge off our bill. We would definitely stay there again, just not on the 20th floor.
review.locationRemarks: Location is right next to Union Square, on Powell St. where the cable car runs

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Great location in the heart of Downtown San Francisco.
Do some shopping and drop it off at home.
Go drinking downstairs and then go out.

Unique hotel.

Due to the location, expect to hear the traffic noise from a busy city.  Otherwise, completely enjoyable

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jake,

I really appreciate your detailed feedback...and it's a 5-star one!

You said it all...and we hope that you'll stop by the Drake soon for another stellar stay!

Thanks a million!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Classy Hotel
review.reviewText:
What an amazing stay! 

The Staff: The staff was very friendly and helpful getting the bags to the room, and room service was right on time. Check-out only took a few minutes too, even though it was their busiest time of morning.

The Room: Amazing! We were on the 11th floor and had a beautiful view of Union Square out one window and of Pacific Heights (I think?) out of the other. Some reviewers complained the rooms were small--well, it certainly wasn't huge, but really, how much room do you need in a hotel room anyway? The room was extremely classy and the bed was big and super comfy. Plenty of closet space and drawers for clothes etc. The hot water got hot right away and stayed hot.

The Location: It's a block from Union Square, and on the cable car line. Enough Said. 

Etc: Scala's. the restaurant on the first floor, has amazing food and great staff. 
       There's a bar/club on the top floor with great city views and good music and dancing. Loved it. 
       The hotel is really eco-friendly. They give discounts for saving water by not having your sheets changed each day, the shower curtain was made out of recycled water bottles, and a host of other things. Awesome!
review.negativeRemarks: Really wish there were recycling bins in the rooms. As environmentally-minded as they are, I was surprised that there were not.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Great location, small rooms...
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Sir Drake in July.  Upon arrival checked into a room that was not cleaned.  The staff immediately rectified the mistake, were apologetic and provided a complimentary cocktail.  The location is fantastic, very central to most things.  The rooms are tiny and dated, but clean.  The staff are amazing.  The lobby and bar are spectacular.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms could do with a face lift.
review.locationRemarks: Central to most things.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Greg,
It's always a pleasure to know that our guests having a great stay! It sounds like you were upgraded to one of our best suites on the 16th floor. It provides one of the best views from that room and I'm happy that you got to enjoy it!

See you soon.
Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Perfect Night
review.reviewText: When I checked in, the clerk was incredibly kind and friendly. Best of all, though I'd only reserved the lowest-priced room available, he spontaneously upgraded me to a massive 16th suite. The balcony had a wrap-around view of San Francisco, and was larger than some apartments I've been in. The room itself was breath-taking, with a full wet bar, numerous couches, two bathrooms, and a huge whirlpool bathtub. All in all we had a fantastic night and a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the room, the view, the location
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: It's in the heart of Union Square, so there's shopping, dining, bars, and general fun to be had.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thanks for your precise comment! I couldn't have agreed more!

We hope to welcome you back at the Drake soon!

Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Awesome! Best location and staff is great!
review.reviewText: Clean and neat and well located. Great friendly staff.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,

Great location indeed! It's so good that most everything is reachable by foot or Cable Car which you can catch right outside of our hotel. Please know that our parking is owned and managed by a separate parking company who also owns/manages compatible hotels in the same vicinity.

Thanks for your comment and hope to see you soon.

Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Kevin
review.reviewText: Great location and nice stuff , only downfall is the parking situation. Valet is like 55 $ plus tax per day .

review.title: Would possibly stay again...
review.reviewText:
We used this hotel as our home base for our small wedding party.  I stayed in a friend's room the night before the wedding and then my husband and I had our own room the next night.  Our friends and family also booked individual hotel rooms here and I believe that we ended up filling about 20 room nights with our entire party.  

THE GOOD:  Free wine hour, starlight lounge upstairs, fun bar in the lobby, nice decor, happy valet/bellman with great attitudes.

THE BAD:  Extremely small hotel rooms (think of a standard size hotel room but cut in half), VERY unhappy front desk staff, a housekeeping employee knocked on our door waking us up the morning after our wedding at 6am to ask us if we had ordered a coffee maker (no we had not!), the $125 fee to park for two nights is seriously excessive... plus you still of course have to tip every valet and bellman that help you, we had purchased an upgraded room for our wedding night and it was the size of a standard hotel room, also the mattress was hard and I woke up sore. 

Here's the thing... had the front desk agent not started my visit out so poorly, I probably would have been willing to overlook some of the other issues that I have noted.  Customer service is always top on my list and service was very disappointing here (minus the bellman, who were great!)
review.positiveRemarks: The fact that this hotel has a free wine hour is truly great and the club upstairs made for a fun night!
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff's attitude was cold and he seemed generally unhappy to have us bother him to check in.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,

Thanks for letting me know. It is definitely not acceptable and hope we changed it out for you.

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Better change bed spreadlay linen.
review.reviewText:
If you see the bed spreadlay through the light, you will see the dirtiness of the spreadlay.
I was not enjoying sleeping under such condition.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Terry,

It's always great to read a nice comment on my staff! They are bunch of happy people who love what they do! Everyone seems to enjoy our Bar Drake in a lobby. I'm glad you found our room comfortable.

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice downtown location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very accommodating, friendly and courteous. The lobby bar was very nice. My room was on the small size but comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Drainage in the shower
review.locationRemarks: Everything at your doorstep

review.title: Hard beds and small rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is just as beautiful as the pictures.  The staff was nice when we first checked in, and told them that we were on our honeymoon, but when a new shift started that mostly changed.  We had a problem with our room, mainly the size. It was much smaller than the bedroom in our tiny apartment and held a desk, dresser, and desk chair.  There was no mini bar in the first room.  The queen size bed is actually a full size bed.  We know this because my husband is 6'8" and on a queen size bed his feet hang off the end at the ankle, not the shin/calf like his did on this bed.  When laying in the bed, his feet were about 6" from the opposite wall, which meant that when I needed to go to the bathroom I hit his legs, waking him up...had we switched sides the same thing would have happened when I needed something from my luggage.  Also, the bed was rock hard.  They changed our room for the second night, to a room a with two beds on a higher floor and it was nice and spacious, but still the mattress was hard and aggravated my back.  We paid approx. $600 for the room, taxes, and fees for 2 nights.  Do yourself a favor and stay at the Westin less than a block away.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby was beautiful, free coffee in the morning and it is actually good.
review.negativeRemarks: The size of our first room should be for one occupant or for very small people.
review.locationRemarks: great location

managementResponses.response:
Dear LOUIS,

I appreciate your 5-star review! The vibe is definitely upbeat and I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed it.

Our iconic Beefeaters are staple to the San Francisco travel industry! I'm glad that they were able to help you.

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: located one block from Union Square.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the atmosphere & energy of this hotel and the beef eaters who will help you with anything you need.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms are bit small and beds more comfortable
review.locationRemarks: everything is at your fingertips with this hotels location.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thanks! The Drake's location speaks for itself, but glad to hear that you enjoyed our staff! We have limited numbers of coffee makers in our Housekeeping and can be brought up to your room at your request.
Although, Bar Drake in our lobby is not open throughout the day, the bar in Scala's Bistro is open during the restaurant hours.
We hope to see you soon.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Centrally located nice hotel. Staff was nice, room was comfortable & clean. Would like to be able to get a drink or a cup of coffee at any time with out leaving the hotel. Hotel had limited hours on those services, bar in lobby was not always open.

managementResponses.response:
Dear kim,

You said it right! Hopefully, many of the people are here to explore this beautiful 'City by the Bay'. If you opt to stay in a room, you can be assured that our rooms are nice and clean, some are much bigger than others.
Our location speaks for itself and hope you enjoyed your stay!

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice stay in the city
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and very conveniently located. The staff was extremely helpful. My only complaint would be the room size. It was a bit small, but when you're staying in union square, you aren't typically spending much time in your room anyhow!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Dee-Dee,

We love to listen to what our guests are saying... Very soon, we are putting more shelves in our bathrooms so that our guests have more space to put their toiletries! We certainly appreciate that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you soon!

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Luxurious and location great.
review.reviewText:
The only complaint is that the bathroom vanity was so small there was NO room to put toiletries. Plenty of room. Just poor design. Toilet paper holder hit your elbow and was right in the way of flushing the toilet!? Again poor design. 
Air conditioner could not be adjusted to where we were most comfortable, but we managed.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kelly,

Thanks for your review. Our location speaks for itself and sorry that you were disappointed with our room size. Although, some rooms are cozier than others, we do have bigger rooms. We often allow our guests to check in earlier, but please know that it all depends on how many check-out we have on that day. That said, if we have a room available, we can definitely meet your request!

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I loved the location of the hotel but was disappointed in the room size. It was tiny. There was barely enough room to move about. The queen sized bed was comfortable but took up most of the room. The compact bathroom required that I close the door to fit on the toilet and access the toilet paper and I'm 5'0, 110 pounds! I wasn't allowed to check in early and although I requested a room with the best view, I got to stare at windows of an adjacent building. It stayed noisy as well.

managementResponses.response:
Dear jessica,

The Drake is situated on the one of the most 'happening' block in San Francisco! We are surrounded by world-class shopping and dining, not to mention very central to all the places you may want to visit.
An extra pillow or two may be brought up when you request through Housekeeping.

Thanks!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Noisy downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Room was tiny, but well decorated. bed was clean but very hard. pillows were flat as could be and no extras to be found. Single pane window in our room on the 5th floor made for a very noisy and unrelaxing experience. However, location right near Union square and on the street car line is ideal for seeing and exploring the city.
review.negativeRemarks: new windows, softer beds, new pillows.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Julie,

It's always put a smile on my face to hear that you enjoyed our service. Hope that extra blanket kept you nice and warm. I have to agree that our bed is very very comfortable and make you want to stay in it all day long!

Come back again for a good night sleep in the city!

Thanks.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice and the staff was awesome. At night I needed an extra blanket and when I called, I heard a knock on the door about 5 seconds later with my blanket. There was a lot of older crowd in the lobby/bar area. The starlight lounge is nice, the only issue is there is no ventilation and it gets super hot. All the windows were foggy and it was hard to see the view. The bed was extremely comfortable the sheets were extra soft, all I wanted to do is stay and sleep. :)

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thanks for staying with us! On your next visit, please ask for a room with a nicer view. If we have availability, we'd be happy to move you to a different room. Glad to hear that you had a great experience!

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: We had a great experience for one night.  The view could have been more appealing, but otherwise, we had a great experience.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Carlton,

The Drake as locals call it is a 1928 historic building. I can certainly appreciate that it may not be new and not everyone's cup of tea. Instead of stark appearance, San Francisco history is found in many areas of the hotel; Prohibition Room as an example.

If and when you want to learn more about what 20's was like in this city, please visit us.

Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Older Hotel
review.reviewText: Not impressed. Would not recommend to a friend. Older room, dated bathroom, new furniture but old building. Helpful staff but out of date building.
review.negativeRemarks: Building

managementResponses.response:
Dear JS,

Thanks for choosing the Drake. I have to agree, our location is most conveniently located for exploring what SF has to offer. Our goal is to make sure that every guest leaves here with a huge smile. Needless to say, it is equally disappointing to learn that your experience was rather underwhelmed. The room size varies; smaller to larger to accommodate a family and depending on the availability, we are happy to find a room that is more satisfactory to your needs. As for my staff, I will definitely address your concerns to my staff.

We all hope that you'll choose us so that we can Wow you!

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: An ok experience
review.reviewText:
Not sure what I was expecting but felt somewhat underwhelmed by the place. The location of the hotel is excellent - close to Union Square, the shops and the cable cars. You could not really ask for better but this is probably reflected in the high cost of staying there. 

My disappointment really came in the room - really small; enough for a bed, a desk, tv and not much else. The bathroom was equally small- everything could be reached from one standing position! Room was clean but just all a bit claustrophobic when in there. Helpfulness of staff very varied - some could not do enough for you; others made you feel as if you were bothering them. 

Overall the hotel was ok but there are others I have stayed at in the vicinity that are better.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is expensive to stay in and realising that in return customers do not wish to stay in a 'shoe box' of a room.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square. Lots to do nearby in terms of shopping. Cable car stop right outside the hotel.

Hello,

Thanks for staying at the Drake! I'm disappointed to learn that you did not like our beds. They are one of the best qualities in the market. I can certainly appreciate that firmness of the bed wasn't what you were looking for. Our parking rate is very compatible to surrounding hotels as the same parking company owns and manages many of the hotel parking garages. SF is better visited on foot as parking spaces are very limited.

We hope that you'll visit us soon.

Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Uncomfortable hard beds, expensive daily car charge

review.reviewText: Good location for union square but rooms and bathrooms are very small. Not recommended for family. Parking is expensive, about $60 a night,  but in general sf is.

review.title: Great hotel, great location

managementResponses.response:
Hello,

Thanks for staying at the Drake. We have gone through a renovation few years ago but we also wanted to preserve the old-world charm of this 1928 historic building, which may not be everyone's cup of tea. The room size varies, much cozier room that is suitable for a single traveler to a suite size to accommodate a family. I am aware that our bathroom is smaller than more modern hotels, but we try to best utilize the space by adding extra shelves. Our parking rate is very compatible to other hotels in the area as most of are managed by the same parking company and there are public parking garages all within the area.

review.title: Never Again

review.title: BEWARE of Made Up Charges
review.reviewText:
They charged us for movies that we did not watch.  In fact, we did not even turn on the TV once.  It made no difference to them as we must have been lying in their opinion.  Their opinion is the only one that counts.

I will never stay here and recommend that you all stay away.  Bad Business.
review.negativeRemarks: Obviously their computer system that tracks charges for guests.

Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

review.title: Good location for a short stay

The hotel has an old charm, with friendly staff, it is clean and well decorated and has comfortable bed.
Bad point: the standard rooom is very small, the bathroom is very very tiny. It does not have any tea coffee making facility, but if you requested its available. It dows not have bar fridge.
Overall, its worth a visit for 1-2 nights
review.negativeRemarks: None

managementResponses.response:
Dear Don,

Please know that our valet parking company owns and operates most other hotels in the same vicinity and our parking rates are very compatible. I agree, San Francisco is a very walk-able and public-transit friendly city and maneuvering around town with a car can be challenging.
Instead of placing an individual coffee maker, we brew fresh coffee in the morning and served complimentary in our lobby every morning. We also have a very limited number of coffee maker in our Housekeeping and can be requested to be brought up, based on availability along with extra lotions and shower caps.

We hope that you'll come back and fully enjoy this city again.

review.title: Only hotel I will frequent in SF!
review.reviewText: This was an absolutely fantastic hotel experience. I hail from Las Vegas, so I am all too familiar with resorts and hotels. Sir Francis Drake has a gorgeous elegant yet cozy lobby and the staff was the most friendly and helpful I have ever experienced. There is a free wine social event every night with snacks and fun games where you can mingle with other visitors, as well as in the mornings with coffee and tea. It is centrally located so guests can easily find public transportation all around the city. We walked from the hotel to the Ferry Building one day, and the Fisherman's Wharf in 30 minutes, and were able to walk through China Town on the way. The upstairs Starlight Room has a great view at night and is a beautiful place to grab a drink or food right inside the hotel. Everything about this hotel impressed me, and I will stay here every time I come to San Francisco. Unbelievable how friendly every member of their staff was.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff attitudes, free wine nights, free coffee/tea mornings, style, ambiance, EVERYTHING!
review.negativeRemarks: To be picky, they didn't have HDMI cords available, but for a small fee they could fetch them for you. I normally have my own, but forgot it
review.locationRemarks: Near by is all of Union Square, China Town, the Wharf and the Ferry Building are not far, tons of shopping and food spots

review.title: Lovely hotel and very central

The staff was very helpful and the rooms were clean and well appointed. As an older hotel the rooms were a little small but they were well-furnished. clean, and modern. Great experience

Agree, the streets in SF can be challenging if not used to walking up and down the hill. Our concierge team has maps, although, they don't indicate the grade of the hills, they should be able to tell you which one is more steep than others or perhaps, you want to take our extensive public transit system to get around the city. We are here to assist in making your trip as pleasant and fun as possible!

review.title: Welcoming and respectful

A relief map would be a useful (and novel) addition for guests as the surrounding streets can be steep; plotting a longer more even route would save me from the sore legs I often get in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintaining an old building has it's challenges and sometimes the finish appears a little tired.

review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff with notable exceptions
review.negativeRemarks: Hot water and cold water come out of both taps: cold in the shower and hot in the sink. The bar in the lobby is obnoxious and very tacky.

review.title: Smallest room I've ever seen.
review.reviewText: Very dissappointed with this hotel. Their "historic" room is well named for a time when people were much much smaller. With a queen sized bed, there is less than 1 foot of room on each side of the bed. Likewise, you have to climb over your bed to reach the bathroom. So unless you are a little person, there is no way to be comfortable in this room. Likewise, it was very close to the elevator and there was a constant high pitched sound.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

managementResponses.response:

When we went through a major renovation, we wanted to keep the "old-world" charm as well as adding few modern amenities which many people seem to like. I'm sorry that bed wasn't what you liked. It may be "love" or "hate" situation with our beds: while some people don't like our beds, others LOVE our beds.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed our stay. Although at first we were booked into a less desirable room, they immediately changed our room upon request. Our 2nd room was more than desirable...it had a perfect view. I really enjoyed the concierge especially. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and was helped by 3 different gentlemen working the concierge desk. There was one in particular that recommended a fabulous steak restaurant that we thoroughly enjoyed. He was personable, helpful and had a sense of humor. I also liked the wine reception in the afternoon. The ambiance and the beauty of the decor really added to our enjoyment.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the concierge, the wine reception and the friendliness of the staff. Most were very nice with two exceptions.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything`
review.locationRemarks: Great location...love the proximity to Union Square and Westfield Shopping Center.

Although, I'm certain that it wasn't their intention to make you feel the way they did, I sincerely apologize. We hope that you'll visit us soon.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Good Location, not quite Kimpton Standards
review.reviewText: We got a great hotel rate at Expedia for this stay and so have no complaints about quality for price. The room itself while a bit small (as many are in San Francisco) but was very clean. It had great beds, great linen and was comfortable. That's what a vacation hotel is all about right? WiFi was advertised as free. When signing up for it though you have to sign up for a Kimpton rewards/membership otherwise you are charged 12.99 per day. It's a bit annoying.... if it's free, it's free and don't try to scam me as the sign up options are not clear when you are signing up. Yes the hotel reversed the charges but I found it sort of petty. The front desk laughed at me when I brought this to their attention which was rude of them, but they did apologize. Yes, I'd stay here again. The Bellman was great and the Beefeaters at the door were very helpful on several occasions. When staying here it is mostly about location, location, location. The Hyatt is a much superior hotel, the Hilton is a much superior hotel too, but not quite so close to everything. I expected this hotel to be closer in quality to the Hyatt and Hilton.
review.negativeRemarks: Hallways outside of room, ice machine doors that don't close, clearer information, mini fridge in room.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union Square and all of those shops. Adjacent to Powell street cable car, and four blocks to California line cable car line. Easy access.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Blair,
Happy New Year!
I appreciate your candid comments on your recent stay with us. The Drake really is a landmark, not to mention our Beefeaters are rather an iconic figure in the travel industry in SF!
Please know that some of the bathtubs were recently refinished. I apologize that our housekeeper kept knocking on your door. I already spoke with my director of housekeeping to re-emphasize on a proper handling of such situation. We hope that you'll visit us soon.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: A really fun novelty type hotel in Union Square.
review.reviewText: When I arrived at the hotel the bellman were dressed in old fashioned uniforms and the hotel is really busy, so the one bellman working has a handful, so you might have to carry your own bags to your room like my friend and I did. I am transgender and when I checked in they didn't question my identity when I showed them my id with my legal name on it (an issue I commonly have with hotels) about my booking under the name I go by. The lobby is beautiful and full of classy , nice , friendly tenants quite often . When I arrived in the room after my trip all the way down the hall because I got a corner room I unlocked my door and it's annoying because it pushes inward and is a tight squeeze into the room with all your stuff with the door repeatedly hitting you. The bathroom was a shock , it's really small with no counter and only a standup sink across from the toilet about two feet away and then next to it is just a bathtub . An old bathtub that could use a replacement I may add. Theres also a big window next to the shower that is only single pane and lets a LOT of cold in . Ladies good luck shaving your legs with goosebumps. It's quite an annoying experience . The room was a little more small and quaint than I expected but it was decorated nicely and really comfortable . Housekeeping was majorly annoying and knocks every 5 minutes in the afternoon even with the privacy sign up , they still unlock the room and walk right in, I'm often sleeping and it's really bothersome .

review.positiveRemarks: Great stay. Clean, friendly and it was a good deal.

managementResponses.response:
Hello and a Happy New Year!

Please visit us soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: great if you only sleep there!
review.reviewText:
For the amount of money paid I felt that the room was not "well appointed". Upon arrival I went to the restroom, there was no flush handle! I called the front desk and 20 min later a maint. guy shows up with a snake!, I had made it clear that there was no handle.....he says oh, we are out of those we'll have to move you. 30 minutes later he comes back with a handle, he robbed it from some other room!
with that fixed we move on.. The bathroom is very tight, no room to store even a toothbrush, the room has no coffee maker.....beds were ok at best. I travel extensively, this was not a good experience in my opinion, for the price paid I would expect a little bit more. It is important to remember that this is a 2 queen room, thats 4 adults, with no place for anything in the bathroom! there are 4 shelves but they are high, and when I placed my toothbrush and toothpaste on them, the maid moved them and but all of ours (3 adults) into the sink.
review.negativeRemarks: add a coffee maker, and provide some sort of space to set a shaving kit / makeup bag down in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco, it really has it all!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The Hotel itself is very old and hasn't really been updated aside from a few cosmetic touch ups. We stayed for 5 nights in a "classic" queen room that had a teeny tiny bathroom with an aged and stained tub. There were cracks in the wall, old doors, super thin walls and a bad paint job. The only thing we felt comfortable with was the bed. We spent the majority of the time feeling uncomfortable about the cleanliness of the place.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wifi helped and the location perhaps. I'd rather compromise the location and stay at a nicer and cleaner hotel

review.title: Do not accept a room next to the elevator
review.reviewText: Everything was ok. Learns about the 58 dollar overnight parking fee we were not too happy about. In the middle of the night at around 2 am the walls and the ac vent started vibrating non stop. Tried to sleep through it but could not and ended up calling the front desk. Found out that all the noise was coming from people emptying the bar from up stairs. Found out the elevators cause the noise. Got moved to another room, and that room had construction noise all night. Advice to staff, fix the elevator noise and invest in triple pane windows.

It's not a quiet hotel if you room faces the street, you constantly hear noises from the cable cars and crowds even at night. You get $10 back if you don't need bed making so I took advantage of the deal for the Bistro downstairs hoping to treat myself a full course. But they put me at the counter with even children were waiting around and it was very disappointing. Better not to receive the deal and should've gone somewhere else.

review.reviewText: Truly beautiful SF landmark. In the middle of everything....Union square is literally across the street and Chinatown is a few blocks blocks away. Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Regal hotel, close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a great location - close to Union Square and a cable car stop right out front which was really convenient. The hotel is also dog/pet friendly which is good for dog owners - so if you don't like animals, this isn't the hotel for you.
For the foodies: You have to try the chicken for two at Zuni Cafe (make a reservation to be on the safe side) - it takes an hour to cook, but it's well worth the wait! Ike's place is also pretty good... very popular, so the small shop does get crowded.
Cable cars are $6 USD for one trip and you cannot hop on and off - this is just a one way fare so remember to make the most of it. The cable car stops at the famous Crooked Street (Lombard Street) so a lot of people hopped off for to take pictures there. Fisherman's Wharf is freezing, but a lot of fun - we hired bikes and ventured to the Golden Gate Bridge from there. It is hard work (especially the uphill climbs) but definitely worth it. San Francisco was amazing... loved that the hotel was so close to everything I needed and Union Square shopping is phenomenal.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car stop right out front of the hotel - takes you to Fisherman's Wharf (pack warm clothes as it gets pretty cold) and shopping at Union Square

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
I appreciate your feedback. Although, it is certainly not our intention to cheat our guests, the price list should be placed more visibly. Additionally, we have a note informing our guests about our linen change policy, but I apologize that it was not placed in your room. This is in effort to save natural resources by not washing the unused linens.
I will make sure that these notes are properly placed in every room.
Happy Holidays and a Happy New Year.
Jim Gross General Manager

review.title: Lacking in basic facilities
review.reviewText:
Initially my family and I were pleasantly surprised when we saw 2 bottles of water as we entered the hotel room. To our dismay, we were billed for the 2 bottles when we took them out for our use. There were no indication on the bottles itself that they will be charged. We only realized it when 2 subsequent replacement bottles were tagged with the price on the cap of each bottle. We felt cheated. If the original 2 bottles were tagged with the price, we wouldn't have use them.
Secondly, when we bathed, the bottles that contained the shampoo were so difficult to press.
Thirdly, used towels that were not placed on the floor were not changed. Not many tourists were aware of this procedure. Notice should be put up to inform the tourist.
review.negativeRemarks: Have a kettle for tourist to use. They might not know where to buy water on arrival. Have toothpaste, toothbrush, slippers

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mike,
Thank you for staying with us during this holiday season! We are indeed in the hub of all, especially during a holiday season, Union Square gets 10 times more festive and lively! I'm happy to learn that our staff was able to make your stay a pleasant one. Although, I appreciate your understanding about the street noise, we are trying to work closely with some of our vendors to lessen the noise level during early morning hours.
Happy Holidays and a Happy New Year!
Jim Gross General Manager

review.title: Classic San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The downtown core of San Francisco is a bustling hive of activity which is what is so great about staying in this grand old lady of hotels. One step out the door and you're right in the thick of the energy that is eclectic San Francisco. The staff are uber professional, friendly and helpful and accommodated our every wish, we extended our stay and the desk staff made sure we got the best rate. The one drawback is that because of the central city location delivery and utility trucks need to operate at night and the noise can be a little much if you're a light sleeper. As a dog person I really enjoyed the pooch parade through the lobby every day.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has a posh style you feel as you enter the grand lobby The rooms are small but well furnished with plush beds & modern classical fittings.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proof the windows! Management - adding an interior sound barrier window would solve the majority of the complaints about your hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Shopaholics central :)

managementResponses.response:
Dear FJ,
First off, I apologize for the experience you had on your stay last week. Although, we offer complimentary coffee/tea service in the morning, our mini bar should have been fully-stocked, and I agree that you have been informed of our business closure. Please know that I will be working closely with the restaurant management to ensure things in this nature will not happen in the future.
Happy Holidays and a Happy New Year!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: First and last time
review.reviewText:
When I booked the hotel every thing looked so great on Expedia.
When we arrived on December the 24th, at 6 pm we were told the bar was close, the restaurant too, and no room service available.
Our mini bar was almost empty and no coffee maker
None of that was mentioned when I booked the hotel.
The following morning I tried to order breakfast and was told they ran out on things and had nothing to offer.
No apologies from the staff when we checked out
They were obviously under staff
A real poor management
Unacceptable for the price of the room

We were at the Westin on Union last year and it was great.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Lori,
Thanks for a very precise feedback!
Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: SF 2013
review.reviewText: Beatuiful hotel in a great location.

managementResponses.response:
Dear cassian,
Thank you for the review! Very typical of a historic building, our rooms vary in sizes; some smaller and others much bigger. I'm happy to know that we were able to relocate you to a different, bigger room! Hope you enjoyed what SF has to offer and its festivity!
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Excellent hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel and the staff were fantastic. Only negative was the room sizes were small, but we upgraded to a bigger room with no hassles and loved it. Staff were very helpful. Location was amazing right in the heart of everything.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Cedric,
Thanks for staying at the Drake and appreciate your feedback. I'm glad to know that you enjoyed our morning coffee service and our nightly complimentary wine hour. Our housekeeping team is very diligent in making sure everything is clean. Thanks for noticing it!
Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location, nice wine/pizza happy hour!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very welcoming staff (everybody, including the doorman!). Free coffee in the morning, and free wine between 5 and 6p. I stayed in the old wing and the bathroom was a little old, but kept very clean.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you for staying at the Drake! I'm happy to learn that you enjoyed your stay.
Happy Holidays,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Typical small San Francisco hotel room. However it was decorated very nicely! Comfortable bed and great bedding. The room was very clean. Great San Francisco charm.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Old SF style. Very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, shopping & restaurants just a short walk.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Quinn,
Thanks for posting your review and letting me know about your experience. We always aim to make every guest's stay as memorable as possible and We are happy to know that our housekeeping staff was able to make that happen!
Our culinary team is always trying to spruce up our menu, especially using the locally grown organic produce. Thanks for stopping by.
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText:
I wrote a note to myself in the morning of things to buy at the Walgreen's across the street: shaving cream and razor, nail clippers, moisturizing lotion, etc. When we got back from our tour of Alcatraz, all of the items on my list were on my bed, left by the housekeeping staff. What a pleasant surprise!

The hotel also has a nice Italian restaurant on the first floor, a bar on the first floor, and a club on the top floor, which seemed to be the happening place in SF on a Saturday night.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is right next to Union Square, so close to restaurants, shopping, etc. The staff was professional and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are small and a little noisy until the traffic dies down. Doubled paned windows would be a great improvement.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
I appreciate your feedback. First off, please know that we are NON-SMOKING hotel and absolutely NO smoking is allowed in the hotel. We have fridge and can be requested from our housekeeping department, and provide a complimentary coffee/tea service in the morning in a lobby.
Hope you enjoyed our location and visited many stores and attractions!
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Excellent location near Union Square and Transport
review.reviewText:
Negative - We stayed on 14th Floor which stunk of cigars, but room smelt fine. No fridge or tea and coffee facilities in the room which was a bit annoying.

Positive - Location is great, on Powell St by the Cable Car, right next to Union Square which had an excellent Christmas lights and ice skating going on, close to Market St and the Westfield and Transport. Staff were really good too, Wine hour was enjoyable and the Eddie the Doorman dressed as a Beefeater was really friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: We stayed on 14th Floor which stunk of cigars, but room smelt fine. No fridge or tea and coffee facilities in the room which was a bit annoying.
review.locationRemarks: Transport to everywhere/everything is very close by :). Work out yourself what you want to do!

review.title: Great Hotel In Union Square
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great. Friendly, courteous and very helpful staff!

managementResponses.response:
Dear how,
Thanks for a precise comment!
We hope to see you soon.
Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good location . Staff was amazing ! Very nice and clean

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you for the review. The Drake was built in 1928 and even after our extensive renovation, we wanted to preserve the old-world charm details. Our staff, whether front desk or housekeeping, works hard to make your stay a pleasant one.
We hope to welcome you soon.
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Central City Location
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for two nights right after Thanksgiving. The hotel lobby is absolutely beautiful with high arched ceilings, gorgeous detail and old world charm. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean however they are small. Pretty standard for staying right in the heart of any major city. I would definitely recommend the hotel for it's location, staff friendliness and cleanliness.

managementResponses.response:
Dear kelly,
Thank you for being a loyal Kimpton guest. Although, I'm happy to know that you enjoyed the food at Scala's, I am disappointed to learn about your experience with the Bar Drake mixologist. As for our bathroom, we are brainstorming as to how we can improve the guest experience. We have great ideas, so it will be improved in the near future. Hope you'll give us another chance to experience it.
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Not the typical Kimpton I've enjoyed in the past
review.reviewText: I always choose to stay at Kimpton Hotels when possible. I was disappointed in this property. The beds were very uncomfortable, and the bathrooms were too small. The sinks allow no room to put anything on and had to use the toilet tank to put my make up on. The lobby bar staff were not friendly in the four nights we stayed there. The restaurant was good but not as good as other Kimpton properties I've stayed at. My husband and I are planning another trip to San Francisco in March and will not be staying there.
review.positiveRemarks: The doormen are great. Attendtive and personable.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom layout and beds.
review.locationRemarks: Loved the location

review.title: close to shopping
review.positiveRemarks: close to shopping and city transportation options
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kim,
I appreciate your review. I'm glad that you enjoyed our food at Scala's. However, I am very disappointed that our hotel didn't meet your expectation. Please know that our rate fluctuate depending on our occupancy and very compatible to what other hotels offer in the same area. There are several room types, some smaller, some bigger and we are always happy to move you to a different room based on our availability.
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: expensive. extremely small room. nothing like pics
review.reviewText: the restaurant attached to this hotel is divine. everything else about this hotel was disappointing considering the money we were paying $$$ it is old and very tired and you couldn't swing a cat in the room.
review.locationRemarks: union square. shopping. theatre. dining. cable car

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you for posting your review. Our housekeeping team works hard to keep our rooms clean and thank you for mentioning that! The Drake, not only offers a great place to stay, but a place where most attractions and stores are within walking distance, if not a hop away on a cable car!
Hope you'll visit us soon.
Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location. Room was great, although we were surprised by the very compact bathroom! The room was clean and very comfortable and the gym was great! We were able to walk to great shopping and had great restaurants on the block. The cable car stop was just outside the lobby door, very convenient!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was ridiculously expensive - I realize it is a city issue, however when staying at such a nice upscale place, there shoud be some deal.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
I'm sorry to learn that your recent stay wasn't what you expected. Please know that there are several types of rooms; some are smaller, some are much bigger. We are happy to move you to a different room based on our availability.
We hope that you'll give us another try.
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Redefines "poor taste".
review.reviewText: Room for 3 persons was minuscule. Bathroom was so small that thee was not even room on a wall for a toilet paper dispenser! Room was quoted to have a "view of Union Square" which turned out to be a view of rooftops below the window which totally obscured the square. BIG DISSAPOINTMENT!
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, but not much else to offer.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and start over.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Candace,
Happy Holidays!
Thanks for staying at the Drake and hope you took advantage of our location to visit as many stores as possible could!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Wonderful experience.
review.reviewText: Very relaxing and in the heart of all of the best shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are lovely. The hotel staff are very polite and on the ball with every request.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds are extremely hard and the pillows are the worst I have ever laid my head on.
review.locationRemarks: The BEST location in the city! The BEST shopping available anywhere!

managementResponses.response:
Dear lawyer,
Thank for your review. Please know that there are several types of rooms at the Drake; some smaller, some much bigger. If you are not happy with your room, we are always happy to move you to a different room based on our availability. Our parking fee is fairly compatible to what other hotels charge in the area.
Hope to see you soon.
Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Small small small
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Great location. But rooms are super small. Bathroom is hardly big enough for 1 person. Kind of loud too on the 6th floor. Hard to sleep. Get a higher room. Parking cost us $57 per day and 57$ for 12 more hours. But overall nice hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thanks for your review. The Drake as locals call it, is definitely centrally located for convenience. Sounds like you enjoyed visiting our Bar Drake (where the big red statue is) and the Starlight Room. I'm glad that you were able to retrieve your phone!
We hope to see you soon at the Drake.
Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross General Manager

review.title: Central hotel
review.reviewText: Right where you want it. Beefeater bar is great and the Starlight rooms. Just don't drop your phone out of the windows up there like I did. Had to get the bell hop to let me out onto the 14th floor to pick it up. And it was fine, couple of scuffs but not broken!!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were great. At check in and the Beefeater bar, and of course the Bellhop.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Square. Cable car stop outside. Perfect location.

managementResponses.response:
Dear quarterdutch,
Thanks for staying at the Drake! It is disappointing to know that someone left the beer cans and didn't get picked up. Our parking is managed by a vendor who also manages several hotels in the vicinity and our rate is pretty compatible to others. I'm glad to know you enjoyed your stay watching over the ice skaters in Union Square!
Happy Holidays!
Jim Gross General Manager

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great staff...$50 per night to park your car, which is about standard in the city but still a rip off. Only negative I could say would be the beer cans we encountered in the elevator Saturday night. Other than that a great room overlooking the ice skaters

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great location.
review.locationRemarks: Union square close, the shopping within walking distance. Cable car stops at the hotel entrance and my new addiction, Starbucks outside the hotel.

review.title: Great location near many activities
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from the street penetrated the room. Would be great if double-paned noise blocking windows could be installed. Coffee maker would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car, shopping, restaurants, Bart station

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
That sounds great! I'm happy to know you enjoyed your stay. Please know that we have bigger rooms, too and if we have availability, we are always happy to move our guests to a different room.
The Drake's location is one of the most convenient as you know. Hope you'll visit us soon.
Happy Holidays.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Nice place to stay downtown - Union Square
review.reviewText:
we stayed for two nights and liked it alot. the room we got at the expedia rate was VERY small - so small that we laughed that there was no place to use the yoga matt they provided in the room.

Other than that is was clean, a little od, but nicely furnished. We loved bieng so close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: wifi could be better
review.locationRemarks: SHOPPING and sightseeing oppportunities abound.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Badonna,
I appreciate your great feedback on your recent stay. The Drake was built in 1928 and is one of the historic buildings in SF. Did you know that there is a "Prohibition Room" to reflect that era? With a combination of Classic and the recent renovation, we definitely have something to offer for everyone who visits us. Sounds like you enjoyed our brunch in the Starlight Room. Leif has the magic wand in his hands...for sure!
We hope to welcome you at the Drake soon.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Enjoyed the Past
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, I enjoyed the lobby especially. The Chandilerswere beautiful in the lobby, the bar was very nice, but thought the drinks were a little expensive. I guess that is what they chargein San Francisco, but I am use to Washington prices. The hotel room was beautiful decorated , but kind of small. We had two full beds and they took up a lot of space. The bathroom was smaller then I expected,but that was from the time they were made. The entertainment upstairs for Sunday is a Drag was very good and the food was really good for the brunch. We went to Scala for dinner our first night there, we thought it was a little dark. The food was excellent but a little more pricey then we were use to. The staff in the hotel from the people at the counter,to the handlers of our baggage were very accomodating, the people who cleaned our room did an excelllent job. I would like to say a special thank you to the conceirge, Leif. We wanted to see the Sunday is a Drag show , we ask him Saturday night about getting us some seats. He called and they said it was all sold out, but he said he would try to get us in. He managed to get us tickets and we went to the show, and enjoyed every minute of it.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have a coffee pot and refrigerater in the room.
review.locationRemarks: we visited the Pier 39, went to japan town, the mall , macys .

managementResponses.response:
Dear B. G.,
Thanks for staying at the Drake. We were built in 1928 during Prohibition Era and it is one of the historic buildings in SF. Indeed, it is a classic hotel! Our rates are very compatible to other hotels in the area and we often offer several attractive rates via few web sites.
We hope to see you soon.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: "OLD" Classic hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is near Union Square. There is significant construction being done at the Square, therefore the area is very noisy (even at night). The day rate was very, very high because of a large convention in town.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thanks for making me aware of your experience. By any means, what you experienced is our standard. I have already spoken to my Hotel Manager who oversees the Front Desk staff that this kind of behavior is not acceptable. Hope you'll give us another try in the near future.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Staff was rude, had a I don't care attitude.
review.reviewText: Check in was a nightmare. They were more interested in their own conversations than helping their guest. I like Kimpton but not sure I would patron this establishment again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jen,
Thank you for staying at the Drake! It must have been very convenient that the start line was just 1 block from our hotel! We hope you did great on your marathon and hope to see you on your next visit to SF.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: We stayed here the night before the Nike Women's Marathon. It was confortable and very convenient.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Delores,
Thank you for staying at the Drake! I'm glad that you notice the beauty of this historic building. Instead of a coffee/tea maker in our room, we offer morning coffee/tea service in the main lobby area. Hope you were able to enjoy it.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Vintage hotel close to Square.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a lovely place with a great restaurant and beautiful rooms. It could be more up to date with a mini frig and a microwave for added convienience. I also like to have coffee/maker in room for morning routine.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms decor is lovely; the lobby, elevator and service were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: It could be more up to date with a mini frig and a microwave for added convienience. I also like to have coffee/maker in room for morning routine.
review.locationRemarks: The location is excellent for a San Francisco experience. It is four blocks from China Town and close to many restaurants and stores.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Mike,
I appreciate your feedback. Please know that we offer complimentary coffee/tea service in the lobby area in the morning. Hope you enjoyed your stay with us.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Hotel is on the cable-car route.
review.reviewText: Nice old-fashioned hotel, but would be so much nicer if there were tea/coffee facilities in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Lively foyer/bar area, with courteous, friendly staff. Hotel's Scala Restaurant is pretty good, with a brasserie atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Tea/coffee facilities in our room were greatly missed.
review.locationRemarks: Several eateries are nearby on Powell Street, and the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf stops just outside.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
I appreciate your review. The Drake as locals call it, is a historic building that was built in 1928! I'm sorry to hear that you didn't get to enjoy our Scala's Bistro.
It sounds like your stay was wonderful taking taking advantage of our location. We hope to see you soon and hope you'll get to enjoy both our restaurant and the Starlight Room on the top floor. The view is absolutely gorgeous from the top floor!
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Beautiful old world hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Sir Francis Drake. Our room was on the 4th floor and it was quiet and a decent size. I love the 1920's decor. We never got to try the restaurant Scala at street level as the conventioneers were always there ahead of us. It is a very convenient location for catching the streetcars or shopping. All of the car rental places are just 3 blocks away. There are so many restaurants nearby that it was always difficult to choose where to eat. There is a nightclub on the top floor of The Drake but we never went up there. It seemed to be quite popular though.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Stuart,
Please know that I also wrote a short response on Yelp as well.
I am very disappointed that we did not live up to your expectation as our aim is to make all of our guests leave the hotel with 100% satisfaction.
The Drake is a historic building built in 1928 and although, there are smaller rooms, we have rooms that are much bigger. Additionally, if we have availability, our front desk agent is more than happy to move you to another room.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.reviewText: Hotel is old and seedy. The rooms are incredibly small, in particular have very limited storage space. The sounds insulation between the rooms is terrible, which meant we didn't sleep well. One of the bizarre issues was that the closet is so narrow that the hangers do not fit properly. This meant that when our neighbor put something in their closet, the hangers banged against the back of the closet - reverberating through our room. The fact that this always seems to happen between 1 and 3 am did not help our experience! We have stayed in many hotels in the Union Square area, and they all have issues and we know what to expect, but the Sir Francis Drake really didn't live up to its 4 star rating.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Staff were friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Could do with some renovation. More spacious rooms - not an easy one to fix, though.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Johanna,
Thank you for the review. I'm very please to know that you had a good experience at the Drake! You are absolutely right about our location; Union Square is just around the corner, SF famous Cable Car runs along Powell Street. Great to hear that you were able to stop by the Starlight Room!
We hope to welcome you at the Drake on your next trip to SF.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Clean hotel at a great location
review.reviewText: My stay at the Sir Francis Drake hotel close to the Union Square of SFR was a good experience. The location of this hotel is great and everything was very accessible either on foot or by one of the San Francisco Trolleys. Also BART station is within 5-10 min walking distance. The bar upstairs presents a great view of SFR over a drink.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jenny,
Thanks for staying at the Drake! I have to agree that our hotel is located in one of the most convenient location in Union Square! Hopefully, you were able to take the cable car and explore the city like a San Franciscan.
Please know that there are several types of rooms at the Drake and we'll be happy to move you to a different room based on our availability. Hope to see you soon.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, right by Union square and upscale shopping and fine dining. Near the famous cable cars locations and your trolley bus pick up spots. Only thing we didn't like was the room and bathroom was really small. I would stay there again though!

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
I appreciate your feedback! It sounds like you had a wonderful "San Francisco" experience with shopping and watching the cable cars, and the Drake is a perfect spot to do all that! The Drake is also a historic building that was built in 1928 and we even have a "prohibition" room from that era! Hope you will be able to get a tour on your next visit to our hotel.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Awesome location for shopping.
review.reviewText: Very CHARMING hotel. Loved the character and front lobby is amazing. Loved watching the cable cars stopping out front. Very San Fran.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
I am happy to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. Our building has some history; it was built in 1928 and is recognized as one of the historic buildings in SF. Wine hour is very popular among our guests, too. Thanks for dining at Scala's; an exciting Fall menu is coming soon.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great and convenient location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Close to everything and great wine hour from 5-6 nightly. Beefeaters are courteous and helpful as is the front desk and concierge. La Scala, the restaurant has excellent food and service. The rooms and baths are not luxurious but they are pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: It is fine.
review.locationRemarks: The street car stops right out front. Shopping, theater and good restaurants are just steps away.

managementResponses.response:
Dear robin,
I really appreciate your loyalty! I must agree that our location is one of the most convenient when you are away from home.
We hope you'll visit us soon!
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: The best location ever!
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at The Sir Francis Drake many times and it is my GO to hotel in San Francisco.
The location is PERFECT, the rooms are GREAT and everything you could ever want is within walking distance. I would HIGHLY reccomend staying at this hotel. Right down to the zebra bathrobe!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
