Thank you for your review. Please know that there are several types of rooms that vary in sizes. I'm glad that you had a great experience with our valet service as well as enjoying our complimentary wine hour service and coffee/tea services in the morning!
Hope to see you soon.
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: The Drake SF
review.reviewText: Small room, very small bathroom, old fixtures. Hair dryer died; it was pretty old, but they did replace in about 20 min. Fantastic valet parking service, but pricey. The Drake does offer some nice extras like evening wine social and complimentary coffee in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square shops, cable cars, restaurants. Concierge very helpful and knowledgeable.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Scout,
I appreciate your feedback! Our location speaks for itself and everyone seems to enjoy it. All of your shopping and dining needs are around us and hope you took advantage of it.
We hope to welcome you back soon.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were happy with the locale of this hotel and the room. The street noise carried up to the 5th floor because we were right above the cable car route, but if noise bothers you, ask to stay on a higher floor. Bed was comfortable, room was clean, lots of action right outside the front door with tourists, locals, everything nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee maker in the rooms would be lovely. Maybe they had them and we didn't ask. Not sure.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is accessible. We never took public transit at all and just walked everywhere. If you love to shop, this hotel is the one for you.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thanks for your feedback. Did you know that we are one of the historic buildings in SF? It was built in 1928 and we definitely represent that era well. Sounds like you had a wonderful dining experience at Scala's.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Old, elegant City hotel
review.reviewText: Generally very good. Room quite small and bathroom tiny. Restaurant and amenities very good to excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Great central location and good service.
review.negativeRemarks: Main criticism is the tiny, tiny bathroom and in an old city hotel this probably can't be remedied.
review.locationRemarks: Center of San Francisco, lots to see and do.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
I can definitely appreciate your decorating opinion and I agree that it's not for everyone. I believe our designers tried to go with the "Sir Francis Drake" theme. In any rate, our housekeeping staff does a great job in keeping our rooms in tip-top condition; thanks for noticing their great work!
We hope to see you soon.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Dark decor with friendly staff
review.reviewText:
The Room decor is too dark - black/brown curtains - and too bright - red credenza
Everything is clean, new, well-appointed, carefully chosen
The hotel decor is just a little too camp for my taste.
The staff if the kindest, most friendly and natural that you could possibly expect.
Obviously well-managed but they need a new decorator with lighter tones.
You have to pay to use the business center, which is empty. But the staff will print out your boarding passes and perhaps other important documents you need while traveling.
review.positiveRemarks: .will print out your boarding passes and perhaps other important documents you need while traveling.
review.negativeRemarks: New decorator - softer tones. Free business center.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,

Yes, you are absolutely right. Thanks for the feedback.

Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: This hotel could use more smile from the staff...
review.reviewText: Greet customes with a smile... do not throw the room card on the counter, hand it to the customers with smile and an eye contact... thanks the customers for being a guest at the hotel...

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
LaBan is one of our 3 Beefeaters. Not only that his smile is infectious but he's a great doorman who has one of the most positive attitude even when it is raining outside and 50 people walking up to him wanting to get a photo of themselves with him! I am so pleased to know that you also recognized his attitude! I will definitely give a pat on his shoulder!
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great Location - Great Accommodaton
review.reviewText: From when were greeting by the Doorman Taman(I belevie that was his name) with his warm smilenad totally helpful apporach and attitude to when we left two days later and again the doorman Taman helped us get heading in the right direction - it was a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff attutudes, concierge assistance, detail attention in the rooms, atmosphere in the lobby area - all good
review.negativeRemarks: We arrived at 11:15. Room not available. Consider modifying housekeeping priorities when guests waiting. DId not get access to room until 3pm.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union Square, tours and restaurants and high end shops and cable car outside -- all part of the City!!

managementResponses.response:
Dear grannyhands,
Thanks for staying with us. Our location speaks for itself; close to major shopping area and restaurants, Chinatown and other attractions. The Drake as locals call it, is one of the historic buildings in SF. It was built in 1928 and we tried to keep the "old-world" charm when we went through a major renovation in 2011. Although, some of our rooms are "historic", there are other rooms that are bigger.
Hope to see you back at the Drake in the near future.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Perfect location, tiny rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location-close to shopping, restaurants & transit. The hotel itself is beautifully ornate-loved the bar in the lobby. Unfortunately the rooms are WAY TOO SMALL, especially the bathrooms. Also, even on the 15th floor it felt like we were on the ground floor with the windows open to the street as the street noise is all night long & very loud-soundproofing needs to be done. It's a bit overpriced for what you get.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproof the windows to the street
review.locationRemarks: We shopped, went to Alcatraz & the wharf taking the cable car or street car, which was right outside)

managementResponses.response:
Dear MT,
Thanks for your loyalty. The Drake is a great hotel with much history behind it. It is one of the historic buildings in SF. It was built in 1928 and with our recent renovation, we offer an eclectic feel throughout our hotel.
If you like to be moved to a different room, our front desk team can try to find you a different room based on our availability.
Hope to see you at the Drake soon.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great hotel if you have a upper level room
review.reviewText:
The hotel is delightful. The room 315 was on the street side - felt like really on the street. There was load noise ALL night long.

I have staying in the hotel a number of times before, but I have never experienced such a loud room.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and staff were wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: The room we had was clean and neat, but should not be rented out due to it location, use it for storage.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is in the perfect location to restaurants, shows, cable cars, shopping.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Rahul,
The Drake was built in 1928 and we recently completed a renovation. We have preserved the prohibition room in the hotel which can be toured upon request. If you missed it during your last trip, hope you'll get to see it on your next trip to SF.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: Great location, right in the heart of the city @ Union Square. The hotel was beautiful, took us to an era gone by and impeccably maintained. The inly complaint I have is about the size of rooms, they were a bit cramped.
review.negativeRemarks: All rooms definitely need a fridge.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the city and close to everything, historic street car rides at your doorstep, all the places easily accessible via public transport.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thanks for the review. We recently completed a renovation in our guest rooms and meeting rooms. I'm glad to know you found our hotel impressive. Please know that there are several types of rooms available; smaller historic rooms to much bigger suites. If you have any questions regarding the size of our rooms, our reservation team, as well as our front desk team are happy to answer your question.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Unique hotel but small room
review.reviewText: The interior of the hotel was good and impressive. but size of the room was terrible. Room was very small, also the bathroom too.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Congratulations on your engagement! I'm glad to know that our staff was able to make your special occasion a smooth one!
We hope to see you in the future!
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Best Hotel & Vacation ever
review.reviewText: I got engaged to my fianc this weekend. The staff was very personable & helped with dinner reservations, a town car, and respectable. Couldn't of asked for a better hotel spot, right in the middle of Down town SF

managementResponses.response:
Dear Alexander,
Thanks for posting your review. The Drake's location is very convenient and accessible to most of your Bay Area activities. It is within a walking distance to BART station, Cable Car stops right in front of our hotel, etc.
There is always something fun going on in SF and hope you enjoyed your visit!
We hope to see you at the Drake soon.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Great Location to all Union Square activities.
review.reviewText: If you plan to stay in the Union Square district, The Sir Francis Drake is a great choice. However, if you like a spacious bathroom skip this hotel. It had the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. You could barely move in it. Other than the bathroom, the hotel is "old world" beautiful and offers a lovely wine hour (free) from 5 to 6 PM. Leif, the concierge could not be more helpful...he's an ace. You also must take the cable car... ($6) one way...to Fisherman's Wharf or a cab...about $12. It is not convenient to the "tourist trade". However if you want to shop...Saks, Neimans, Nordstroms, Barneys, Bloomingdales, Macys and a host of high end stores are right outside the hotel door.
review.positiveRemarks: The charm can't be beat if you like historic buildings. The room was clean and neat.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no room refrigerators. I expect one at a 4 star hotel. Disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping is nearby....everything else requires transportation via cablecar, taxi, metro or trolley car.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Page,
Thank you for for review! I'm happy to know you had a great 1-week vacation.
We hope to see you soon at the Drake.
Regards,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Perfect stay
review.reviewText: Our stay at Sir Frances Drake was perfect. We were concerned when we saw the size of the historic rooms on a map at arrival, but the room was exquisite and not too small. The venue was beautiful, so clean, comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, the location convenient. We had everything we needed for an amazing vacation week in San Francisco. We had not one complaint. We would definitely go back!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Dubb,
Thanks for the review. We are not just "old"; we are "historic" and was built in 1928! As you mentioned, I think it's quite charming actually.
We hope to welcome you back in the near future.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: A change of pace
review.reviewText: The hotel was older, but we knew that prior to booking the hotel. It was charming, but did smell a bit old.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were small, but quaint and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: A modern amenities and the elevators could prove challenging at times.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good, lots to do and see

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thanks for your review. The Drake is indeed a spacial place to stay. Our building is one of the historic buildings in SF. It was built in 1928 and with our recent renovation, it has a lot of charm as you mentioned! Our location is conveniently located from many attractions.
Hope to see you at the Drake in the near future.
Sincerely,
Jim Gross, General Manager

review.title: Classic old Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is special. It has a lot of charm. Rooms were small but adequate and very clean. There is definitely street noise but it is in the heart of the city! Location was great and the staff were excellent!!

review.title: SF business trip
review.reviewText:
Room suppose to have sound proof rooms and my neighbor next door or below me was very loud at 830am. Their voices were loud and their child was running around; I was woken up to their activity.

Was in a handicap bathroom with no tub, it was a bit dim with the lighting. My room didn't have a mini bar to put cold drinks/yogurt in the fridge.
review.positiveRemarks: Large spacious rooms and lighting in the main area. Free wifi. Iphone docking station to charge phone/listen to music.
review.negativeRemarks: I waited 45 mins for my luggage to be brought up to my room.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of tourist hell and if you want to shop there is plenty to choose from.

review.title: In center of town, close to China town
review.reviewText: When we checked into the hotel at noon, our room was not ready so we checked our bags and ventured out. When we returned to the hotel, the line to the front desk had about 10 people in it, with 1 person working the front. When we were finally given our room, there was a male in the room, he had the door closed. He stated he was vacumming the area behind the bed? So, when he seen us, he left. When the bell hop brought us our bags, they were someone else's bags! So, my husband decided to turn on the airconditioner and it barely blew a puff of cold air and when he went to take a shower, there was no hot water until he ran the water for over 10 minutes. It was his birthday weekend, so we made the best of it. I would never pick this hotel again simply because the quality of service was poor, along with the condtion of the hotel. I think my money would better be spent elsewhere.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to hire staff. The cutbacks were too evident.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and some moderate priced restaurants.

review.title: Center of SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the center of SF. Room was comfortable but small. Bathroom was small as well and didn't have the amenities of a four star hotel. This hotel is great for location and for the Starlight Room club on the top floor. Taxes in SF are becoming prohibitive so unless you definitely have to stay in the city your better off staying outside the city and renting a car to get around.
review.negativeRemarks: Mini bar in room was great but didn't have any mixers to go along with the alcohol. Also no fridge to keep drinks cold. Install a mini fridge!

review.title: Just the lobby !
review.reviewText:
When you see lobby you think the hotel is awesome but it's not.Very old rooms.
Internet pictures makes you dissapponted.Believe me.Bar is nice.Staff is cool.Hotel
Place is centre.

review.title: old world charm
review.reviewText: if not for location Id look for a hotel with bigger rooms except old charm remains.
review.positiveRemarks: location and the charm of the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom and room when used by 2.
review.locationRemarks: fabulous location with my favorite diners nearby

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: My whole family loves this beautiful hotel. The only draw back is that the room's bathrooms are small. I kept dropping things on the floor because there is hardly any room on the sink counter. Other than that this is a great hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the architectural style through the entire hotel (rooms, lobby, salons). I absolutely love how the sheets feel (crispy and clean) on the beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe changing the sink counters to bigger ones. The two times we stayed there this was the case.
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located. There are plenty of restaurants and transportation around. We took the cable car from the front door.

review.title: Only if you've got money to burn.
review.reviewText: The staff made me feel as if I was in their way. For the cost I expected top not h service and just never got it. The hotel is beautiful and the room was nice. For the money it would have been nice to get more than one towel in my room. The " city view" was of a roof top of the building next door. My bags where left on the street and it took over an hour to get my car from the valet.
review.negativeRemarks: For such a premium price I would like premium service.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Right in the mix of SF.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Great location but he room was small and cramped.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location

review.title: great hotel close to everything in SF
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the Drake. The rooms were clean and comfy. The beds were incredible. You can walk everywhere from this hotel. The Drag Queen Brunch was a blast.

review.title: Drake's is special
review.reviewText: This location is fantastic and central to the great shops and restaurants on Union Square, walking distance to Moscone Center & AT&T Park.
review.positiveRemarks: Classy rooms, quiet on upper floors
review.negativeRemarks: Larger bathrooms, more bath amenities
review.locationRemarks: Many fun bars & restsurants nearby, a few late nite clubs including the Stardust Lounge

review.title: A grande old dame but tarnished.
review.reviewText: This was a pleasant enough hotel, but the room size was tiny. They provided a single bath towel. Most of the staff were friendly, but a few were a little terse. It is architecturally interesting but in need of upgrading.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms and housekeeping.
review.locationRemarks: The location is good: it's a block from Union Square.

review.title: Girl's Weekend
review.reviewText: We booked two rooms for a girl's weekend. Front desk staff were very welcoming and pleasant. They gladly arranged to put us in adjoining rooms, so that we could be close to each other. The lobby was inviting, complimentary fresh water and coffee was available for guests in the lobby. Rooms were decorated very nicely. The bathrooms were a bit small, but very nice and clean. We had breakfast at Scala's next door to the hotel and it was very good and staff were wonderful. All in all it was a great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: There were some very small (pinpoint) blood spots on the comforter cover. Could be easily missed, but not very pleasant for a guest to see...
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Within walking distance to everything in the Union Square area. Very easy to get a cab at the front of hotel if necessary.

review.title: We recommend this hotel to friends
review.reviewText: We have stayed several times at this hotel, and we have recommended it to friends. One of the main features is its location. It is located close to Union Square and has easy access to the whole of the old downtown area. We opted this time for a larger room, and think that the extra cost was worth it. The facilities are fine, perhaps just a little on the old and close to tacky side. When we arrive in the early morning at hotels, we nearly always book the night before. We did not do that this time, since we arrived at 1.45 in the afternoon, only to be told that the official check-in time was 3 pm. The desk person was just a bit officious in the way he handled this, although we recognize that it is reasonably standard that hotels have a 3 pm book in time (we were not pleased after a 14 hour flight, however). In our time in San Francisco some years ago, the wonderful view in the afternoon from the Starlight Roof was a highlight, and it is too bad that it only opens now at 6 pm (although the layout seems improved on our stay a couple of years ago). What you get from this hotel is location and a reasonable line of service & facilities. Obviously, there are better hotels in SF, but most cost a bit more money, and none will beat this location.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location, and the decent layout of the larger room
review.negativeRemarks: The staff could be more helpful
review.locationRemarks: It is close to Union Square and the old central downtown district of San Francisco,

review.title: Nice vacation hotel
review.reviewText:
The Francis Drake is a very old building with moderately sized rooms and super small bathrooms. I travel to the Bay Area often for travel and found the building a little noisier than I like.
The parking, though the steepest rate I have come across to date the service was some of the fastest.
review.positiveRemarks: Service was impeccable, the desk personnel were very professional and friendly. Location, location, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Open the Starlight bar every night. Disappointing to find the buildings nightlife closed on Mondays. Ensure the bath drains, mine did not, at all.
review.locationRemarks: Central location, right on the cable car line for the touring visitor

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Best location in the city, close to union square and for anyone who enjoys shopping or city tours you're simply steps away. Definitely will be staying at the Sir Francis Drake hotel on my next visit to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Breathtaking architecture. All hotel personnel were knowledgeable and extremely courteous.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom a little small.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location - steps to union square.

review.title: Mixed
review.reviewText:
The hotel's entrance, lobby, and restaurant were nice and well maintained. However, the room itself was rather dated with dust in the bathroom window's mantel. The room had a distinct odour - as if it used to be a smoking room and they'd tried, unsuccessfully, to deodorize it. Additionally, the walls were very thin with noise between rooms travelling easily.
Of note, the bed was incredibly comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The room itself.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located and convenient for catching public transit.

review.title: Beautiful historical landmark!
review.reviewText:
First off let me say this hotel is beautiful! The lobby maintains is still all original from the 1920's when it was first completed. I instantly felt transformed back in time every time I walked through the lobby. It's stunning! Newer hotels just can't compare to the opulence of this hotel!

Hotel staff was very accommodating, as expected for an upscale hotel. The daily complimentary wine tasting in one of the ballrooms was a nice perk.

While the lobby is original, the guest rooms were recently renovated (it was much needed from what I understand). We stayed in the deluxe room, which was roomy and nicely designed. Our friends however, stayed in a standard room which was a bit on the small size.

The location is great. Less than 100 yards to Union Square. Dozens of restaurants and bars nearby. A Powell St. cable car stop is just outside the hotel. A Muni, BART, and bus stops are very close by. A perfect location if you plan to use public transportation.

Overall, the hotel is absolutely stunning! The staff is very friendly as well. My only complaint is the standard rooms, while not extremely small, feel a bit cramped

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful place to stay for a vacation in SF. The lobby bar is great to grab a cocktail before heading out for the evening. The Beefeater bellmen are very helpful and knowledgable. I think they act as concierges since there wasn't one staffed at the concierge desk.
review.positiveRemarks: Outstanding location, condition of the hotel, and rooms. Lobby is amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge was typically not there.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of wonderful restaurants nearby (Sears for breakfast across the street) and the excitement of Union Square.

review.title: "Could be better..."
review.reviewText: Lobby looks good, as well as room. Other than that, quite noisy and room is pretty small. You can clearly overheard people talking in next room. And music from the very top floor. Location is right on the spot though.

review.title: Great staff and location
review.reviewText: It was wonderful stay. Staff was first rate. Appreciate free wifi with Kimpton membership. Only bad part was room and bath were very small.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Francisco. This hotel was in a great location for our daily outings, being close to shopping and the main transportation lines.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: You are paying for location and the fabulously helpful staff. We went to SF on a short family vacation so we stayed here because of the location, the room had to queen beds instead of full beds, and I read that the hotel had been recently redone. The work out room is small but adequate. The actual rooms are really small. We tried to put two adults and two kids in one room and there was hardly space to move around. The bathroom is clean but also tiny and without ventilation. The beds weren't very comfortable, either - they don't hold a candle to the "heavenly beds" of competitors.
review.negativeRemarks: tiny rooms, uncomfortable beds
review.locationRemarks: cable cars, shopping, chinatown

review.title: OVERPRICED, SMALL ROOMS, EXTRA $$$ FOR PARKING
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL IS BEAUTIFUL. THE ROOM WE STAYED IN WAS NOTHING LIKE THE WEB PHOTOS. IT WAS VERY SMALL INCLUDING THE BATHROOM. THERE WAS NO COFFEE POT, FRIDGE, OR MICROWAVE. PARKING WAS ABSURD; IT COST US MORE THAN DOUBLE TO PARK THE CAR FOR THE WEEK THEN WHAT IT COST TO RENT THE CAR. WE WERE VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH THE ACCOMODATIONS; THE BED STUCK OUT FARTHER THAN THE WALL AND WAS RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE STAND-UP MIRROR. THE AIR BLEW RIGHT ABOVE YOUR HEAD WHILE YOU SLEPT WHICH MADE FOR DRYNESS. THE ROOM WAS INCREDIBLY SMALL AND MADE FOR A LONG WEEK STAY. IF IT WAS ONLY FOR ONE NIGHT, PROBABLY WOULD NOT HAVE BEEN A PROBLEM. THE BAR WAS NICE AND THE BARTENDERS WERE FRIENDLY. IF I WENT BACK TO SAN FRANCISCO I WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN AND I WOULD RESEARCH THE PRICE OF PARKING.
review.negativeRemarks: OFFER A BETTER PARKING PRICE!
review.locationRemarks: THE LOCATION WAS NICE AND NEAR ACTIVITIES/FOOD FOR WALKING DISTANCE.

review.title: Great location. Very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Wonderful weather. Very close to great shopping and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the history and the dcor.
review.negativeRemarks: Larger bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping. Close to the tour bus stop.

review.title: Great and historical. amazing placing.
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel. I will deffinitely stay in it again.
review.negativeRemarks: Due to the fact that this is a really old hotel, there is a smell in the toilet. However it was ok
review.locationRemarks: Union Square)) period

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel in great location!

We walked from the BART station to hotel, only took 10 mins (up hill)

Very nice decor throughout the hotel

Room was on the small size but that's expected when in a city

Cash machine in hotel is very handy and there is a shop across the road for water, chocolate, fruit, etc and Starbucks next to the hotel

Close to union square where we got the "big bus" tour

Would stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, nice bar, Starbucks next door
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive mini bar
review.locationRemarks: Great location, next to cable car stop and very close BART

review.title: Fancy, great location, and hospitable staff
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a bachelorette party and we had a blast. The staff were generous, friendly, and put up with our millions of questions and needs.

review.title: Marvellous Hotel
review.reviewText: the Sir Francis Drake makes itself proud - this is a wonderful hotel from the moment you step out of your cab to the moment you speak to the staff. the staff are very knowledgeable, we booked a tour through them. Also they are incredibly accommodating - I was travelling with my mum and we landed in San Francisco at 6am, arriving at the Sir Francis Drake at about 8 am (WAY before check in time), suffering from a horrible cold I went to check in and the staff managing the reception was very accommodating and offered us a room immediately. the rooms are tastefully furnished, quite large, very clean, beautiful linen and bedding (I could be wrong but i'm pretty sure they have feather pillows and quilts). They provide complimentary tea and coffee at the downstairs bar. I didn't get a chance to go to the bar, but it was highly frequented. Very impressed with this hotel, the only hotel I have stayed at that has exceeded this one would be the Four Seasons in Sydney.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: in the centre of San Francisco

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again. Location is excellent, staff were nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: None that I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Located on Powell St. very close to Market St. where you can find the cable car terminal.

review.title: Francis Drake in May
review.reviewText: The hotel was very central. Perfect to get around San Francisco from. Great Area in which to shop. Did wish they have some hotel computers you can access the internet on and in house laundry facilities. Otherwise no complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of in house laundry facilities you can use and computers to access internet
review.locationRemarks: Very Central

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Love this hotel. Staff is friendly, efficient and very helpful. The location is tops, everything nearby and accessible. Quiet room with every comfort. Food is excellent. The bar has that Rat Pack vibe, like Frank and Dino may stroll in at any moment. I'll be back!
review.negativeRemarks: I wanted to watch CNN Headline News and it was supposedly available, but I could not access it.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square a short walk away, cable cars pass the hotel often, great shopping, and people watching. It's near BART and the cable car turnaround.

review.title: Great hotel for central San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a. Location next to Union Square. Great bar and superb restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, quality of hotel. Good decor
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy neighbour. As far as we can tell the radio/alarm was located by the inter joining door.

review.title: Great hotel, choose a different tour bus
review.reviewText: Rooms were small, but don't let that stop you. The service was absolutely great. All staff was wonderful. Rooms were clean. Great location right next to the cable car stop. One note: the hotel Concierge suggested a certain city tour company called CitySightseeing San Francisco. That was the hotel's only mistake. The busses are old and rickety with broken seats and speakers that didn't work. Other tours had much nicer busses. Out of 4 tour trips, we got the same guide twice and it was like listening to a spoiled 14-year-old Valley Girl work through her personal issues. Pick a different tour, but don't let that dissuade you from choosing the Sir Francis Drake.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Fabulous service from all staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Bad advice on the city tour company.
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from Union Square, cable car stop right outside the front door. China town just 2 blocks away. A pleasant 25 minute walk to AT&T park.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake Kimpton
review.reviewText:
A grand hotel which provides great service and services and is in a convenient location.
The room size was the only minor issue.

review.title: too close for comfort
review.reviewText: Housekeeping was bad, dusty and didn't change our trash cans. Wasn't set up for 4 people like we asked. Doormen were helpful. Rooms are very small. Bathroom was very tiny, could hardly turn around, no where to set toiletries.

review.title: Green hotel with great perks
review.reviewText: Love that they give you a $10 credit for food if you opt-out of having your room cleaned. This credit is given everyday, with the exception of the day you check out. Also, they are very green with their toiletries--dispensed from large containers, rather than creating an environmental nightmare with tiny bottles. They offer happy hour in the lounge, but I missed it both nights. Elevators are super slow, and that is annoying, but expected in an old building. Great location within walking distance of shops and transportation. Ask for a room away from the elevators, otherwise you will hear them throughout the night.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient. Well located close to everything!

review.title: Good service.
review.reviewText: The first night was in a room next to the elevator - noisy. We requested a room change for the following three nights. They did so with no problems - pleased with their service.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy room next to elevator
review.locationRemarks: Good central location

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Older hotel but very clean. Staff and service were excellent. Would definetly stay again.

review.title: nice extras
review.reviewText: hotel is old but very plesant the staff helpfull the room small but good the free coffee served in the morning a great addition also the wine tasting in the afternoon very plesant after a hard day shopping and sightseeing hotel in a great central location for all that san francisco has to offer

review.title: Great shape, SUPER SMALL ROOMS, $50 parking
review.reviewText: Old Hotel, totally rehabbed, in great shape. SUPER SMALL ROOM and SUPER SUPER SMALL BATHROOM. Parking $50.00 per day
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, Room and Parking

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Sir Francis Drake hotel many times and each time we have found it to be clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The location is perfect for just about anything. The concierge at the hotel was fantastic!

review.title: Great location, beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the location and the facility. Would stay there again.

review.title: Its ok, but don't expect 5 stars.
review.reviewText:
The Hotel it self is in a great spot, right near Union Square with the Powell St trolley out front.

The staff were somewhat welcoming, well some staff were better than others. A couple of times I was complete ignored at reception. However when they did decide to talk to you, they were friendly to a degree.

The foyer & lobby has been refurbished quite nicely and is a comfortable place to sit and have a drink.

The room has been refurbished quite well, the air conditioner was very noisy and I had to wear earplugs. The shower had someone's hair in it, like someone just had a haircut and there was a fair bit of mould or similar in the corners of the shower. Needed a really good clean.

There is also no storage for your vanity needs, as the sink is a standalone bowl with no vanity space.

Other than that, it was an enjoyable stay. I rarely spent anytime in the Hotel as we had so much to do in San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms are small and this one was dirty
review.locationRemarks: Great spot. Right near Union Square

review.title: Good
review.reviewText:
City view was non existent.
Room was a little loud.
Otherwise good experience
review.negativeRemarks: Noise and view

review.title: walking distance to shopping & dining
review.reviewText: Front Desk staff were not as accommodating as we would've wished- room was very small and bathroom was a bit dirty- not happy with brunch options either.
review.positiveRemarks: decor was cute. location was ideal.
review.negativeRemarks: better customer service- cleaner rooms- updated bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining, close to Chinatown and Nob Hill

review.title: Good Hotel in Central San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Fantastic Central Location. Cable car outside hotel.

review.title: Travelers from New Jersey
review.reviewText:
The Sir Francis Drake is a gracious hotel to stay in. The staff (Especially Elgin) were very professional and helpful. The Drake is in a perfect location for touring the city.

We hope to be back again this year.
Travelers from New Jersey.

review.title: Great but Needs a Makeover
review.reviewText: The nostalgia of The Sir Francis Drake was very appealing and the hotel staff are very customer service oriented. Our room was large, but the bathroom VERY small. We booked a larger executive room which provided a larger area, but it was near the maid's closet and we were disturbed quite often at night and when in the room. The hotel is very art deco, but it needs a makeover. The hotel restaurant Scalia is wonderful and the cable car stops directly in front of the Drake - making it very easy to get to Fisherman's Wharf. Union Square is to the left all the best shopping and eating are located within one block.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom, old tub and VERY small sink.
review.locationRemarks: The location is incredible and everything is nearby or easy to get to because of transportation.

review.title: Nice, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: This was quite a comfortable hotel right next to Union Square and the San Francisco Cable Cars. Very handy and central.
review.negativeRemarks: Paid internet access - which was a bit on the slow slide
review.locationRemarks: Central and hand for the conference centre (Hilton). Much less expensive that the Hilton though.

review.title: good and convenient hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is located on Powell St. and just two blocks from Union square. I was a little concerned about the size of the room after reading reviews, but it wasn't too small. I mean the room was smaller than other hotel rooms that I stayed in, but you can't beat the convenient location of this hotel. The room was remodeled and clean. The TV didn't turn on several times for whatever reasons, but they fixed the problem in a timely manner. When I visit SF again, I may stay in this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient location. has good cafes and restaurants within a few minute walk.
review.negativeRemarks: the size of the room
review.locationRemarks: Sears fine cafe/restaurant is across from the hotel (famous for Swedish pancakes), Walgreens is just across from Powell St, many cafes/restaurants

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Stayed in a double-bed room. Nice space overlooking Union Square. The staff was friendly and helpful. Seems like a great deal for what we payed for.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping in Union Square and Downtown Area

review.title: Beautiful Hotel Perfect Location comes with a COST
review.reviewText:
Stayed two nights, a beautiful hotel located in the perfect location but this does mean its expensive. We decided to treat ourself for our first two nights on our West Coast flydrive tour of the USA.

TIP: if you have hired a car Valet Parking is the only option at this hotel and it costs $54 per night (24hrs) so be warned. There are multiple parking garages close by which enable you to self park and are more reasonably priced at between $29-40 per 24hrs BUT if you are in a fly drive holiday like we were a car really isn't needed in San Francisco.

Room was small but beautiful. TIP: Bottles of water on the table are not free as my wife discovered when she noticed the $6 sticker on the lid after drinking it, most places we stayed on our trip had free bottled water in the room which when you considered the price of the hotel you think it would be included.

We did have room service which was nice, a touch expensive

We stayed a further two nights in San Francisco at a hotel just around the corner which got us parking at $29, the rooms were bigger, cheaper because we just needed a base not a luxury hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Costly Valvet parking
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT, located just outside is a tram stop which means you are short tram ride away to Fisherman's Wharf etc

review.title: excellent service
review.reviewText: The hotel found and are willing to send my husband's razor back to the UK, I think that probably describes the excellent service. Really good location next to Union Square. The reception area is lovely in which you can sit to while away time and have a drink. Hotel was clean, good sized room for city location.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for union square

review.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY AT SAN FRANCSCO
review.reviewText: VERY NICE LOCATION, BUT THERE IS NO FRIDGE IN THE ROOM
review.negativeRemarks: NO FRIDGE
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT FOR TOURISTS

review.title: Centrally located hotel that's showing its age
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake hotel is a centrally located, "name" hotel that's showing its age. I was on a business trip and only stayed for one night, so I cannot comment too much on service or dining, but I had no problems at all during my stay there. Check in and check out were quick and easy, the bed was comfortable enough for a good night's sleep, and the staff were friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Old building with old rooms. Windows could definitely use a retrofitting.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square, making it a perfect launching pad for daily excursions when visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Not again!
review.reviewText: Front desk staff not too helpful. The parking attendant did not help us with our luggage at 5:30 am; we are older and cannot lift heavy items. The front desk clerk gave us inaccurate directions go the airport; we got lost at 5:40 am in a undesirable area in SF. Scala restaurant was great and the bell man who took our luggage to our room was pleasant and friendly. The one night overnight parking fee of $57 was hard to swallow.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom too small, parking lot fee and staff, front desk not too helpful
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Prime location
review.reviewText:
Right by Union Square, this hotel was clean, comfortable (the king bed was amazing) and it had a great vibe. The cable cars out the front are a tad loud but take you right to Fisherman's Wharf which is very handy. Concierge was helpful and loaded with brochures and information regarding San Fran.
The room itself wasn't huge but considering the amount of things to do here you won't be spending too much time in the room. Wifi signal was weak but did the job. All in all recommended for all travellers!!
review.positiveRemarks: The amazing king size bed that was sooo comfortable!!
review.negativeRemarks: The noise that was heard in the nights from the street. But nothing to avoid booking over
review.locationRemarks: So handy, walking distance to so much, and cable cars right out front!! Couldn't get a better spot.

review.title: "Great Hotel and awesome service"!
review.reviewText: Everything was awesome and the service at the front desk was the best I've ever had! Please don't change a thing!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. A block from Union Square, lots of shopping, restaurants and close to muni, cable cars, and BART is just a 10+/- minute walk depending whether you're going up or downhill. Starbucks in hotel and Scala restaurant was good. Staff is friendly, rooms are small, but adequate.
review.locationRemarks: A block from Union Square, lots of shopping, restaurants and close to muni, cable cars, and BART is just a 10+/- minute walk.

review.title: Coffee!
review.reviewText: Having a complimentary coffeemaker, coffee and sugar in the room would help.

review.title: Good place to stay for the price
review.reviewText: Room was a little small but clean and functional. You could hear other people from their rooms talking often but there was little city noise that could be heard. Starlight lounge has an awesome view. Location is right next to Union square but I little bit of a walk if your going to the convention center.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size and lack of features. Ambient noise from other guests.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location and view from the top. My husband and I had a two day getaway here and we had never been to San Francisco before. It was great being in the middle of town with cable car and easy cab trips to other locations. The first night we had drinks and appetizers at the top of the hotel watching the sunset. It was perfect!!
review.positiveRemarks: Its right on the cable car line which is very convenient!! The staff were extremely helpful and polite
review.negativeRemarks: Its a classic hotel that has been kept well

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: If location is important, this is the place for you as it is right at Union Square. The check-in was simple and without complications. Our room OK in the sense that the bed was great but the bathroom was not very big. In fact, it was tiny. But who needs a bathroom anyway? The hotel supplies liquid soap, shampoo and hair conditioner. The housekeeping staff did not replace the soap when it was empty. We, by chance, ran into a housekeeping supervisor who got us a fresh bottle. The floor was relatively quiet but there was noice from street work. I don't exactly know what the price was because we did the flight and hotel through Expedia which i thought was a good deal. Overall, i would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom

review.title: Great San Francisco hotel!
review.reviewText:
I love this hotel! It is in the best location in San Francisco; Cable Cars stop right outside the front door. It is a half block from the heart of the city - Union Square. Easy walking distance to Chinatown, Embarcadero, theatre district.

The entire staff is very friendly and so helpful. Pets are welcome. The restaurant in the hotel is wonderful, as well as having dozens of other fabulous restaruants to choose from in a 2 block radius.

review.title: Great San-Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, its easily accessible, and conveniently right off Union Square. The cable cars stop right out front and there are great restaurants all around, and a Starbucks! The room was really nice and very comfortable. All the staff were super helpful. I had a really good time there.

review.title: Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: Charming hotel beautiful lobby area rooms are very nicely decorated bathrooms small but perfect for the age and location of hotel is amazing. Restaurant attached is wonderful food and service great.
review.negativeRemarks: small bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Great Location, Staff
review.reviewText: Great stay, wonderful staff. Valet parking was pricey, but generally in line with the area and offers unlimited in&out which was nice (so it was worth it). Made a special weekend very special.

review.title: Stay away!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is the worst place I have ever booked with Expedia. We were put in a third floor room which may just as well have been on the street as the noise level was about one decibel less than what street level was. Tiny doesn't accurately describe the size of the room and the bathroom was not only microscopic but the door wouldn't close unless you slammed it HARD. Also beware the parking charges for your car. We arrived just before midnight and yes that was an extra $57 for another night of parking. Never again would I book this rathole.
review.negativeRemarks: Wow too hard to pick just one.
review.locationRemarks: Location is the only positive for this hotel. Stay at the Orchard or anywhere else.

review.title: pleasent experiance
review.reviewText: We liked the location, and the decor of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Happy hour with wines from Chile not very good, and not appropriate for California.

review.title: A beautiful boutique hotel
review.reviewText: A beautiful boutique hotel. Queen size bedrooms a little cramped though. A pleasant stay. Most of the staff friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful foyer. Wonderful bar and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: One reception clerk quite unhelpful and I chose a very small room on-line
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Central to all the shopping and transport

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, well managed with great staff. Room was well appointed however could have used another comfortable chair (only complaint). Would have liked a coffeemaker in the room however coffee was provided in the hotel lobby which was fine.

We really liked the fact that the best Trolly line direct to Fisherman's Wharf is located right outside the hotel and the doorman was enthusiastic in telling us how to make use of it. We found the area the hotel was in was great for taking public transit to any spot we wanted to visit in San Francisco. A short walk to the appropriate bus took us to Haight Ashbury as an example.

There are lots of great restaurants in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in lobby
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for getting around the city

review.title: Average hotel in great location
review.reviewText:
No soap on the soap dispenser in the shower, not refilled while i was there
Lobby shabby, could use new carpet painting. Mezzanine in disrepair
Great location
review.negativeRemarks: physical plant not kept up
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Square

review.title: A few hiccups but still great!
review.reviewText: My husband, 2 year old son & I stayed here in February 2013. The staff were lovely; so friendly & kind. The rooms are (especially the bathrooms) quite small but we didn't mind because the rooms & hotel have so much character. The elevators never seemed too busy & the location was great. We called ahead to let the hotel know we were travelling with a small child as the Kimpton website offers a variety of child friendly services such as: "baby proofing" the room, providing a nightlight, & an adorable child's housecoat for the duration of your stay. We were assured these services would be provided to us but when we arrived none of these things had been done. I was disappointed; however I'm not going to condemn anyone over it as I never went to the front desk & complained, in which case I'm sure the very nice staff would have complied. We weren't too concerned though as there weren't a lot of exposed outlets or other safety hazards. We were also told when we phoned ahead that there would be a coffee pot in the room which there was not but there was a mini fridge! Room service food was awful, awful, awful; so gross & $50 for two non-extravagant breakfasts. But again  we never complained or tried to get our money back. Finally, I thought $57 a day was a bit pricey for parking, but Im not familiar with S.F. valet parking costs so maybe it wasnt unreasonable? All in all we still loved this hotel despite a few hiccups, would definitely return & recommend to friends & family.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the hotel's character and friendly/helpful staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Gross & expensive room service food and pricey parking.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location with front door access to the cable cars!

review.title: Mixed Feelings- GREAT DOORMEN!
review.reviewText:
This was our first trip to San Francisco. The hotel was perfectly located to walk to China town, union square, all of the shopping areas and market street. Literally you could step outside and catch the cable car which was great to take you right to fisherman's wharf. However we have travelled alot and found the size of the room unsatisfying for the price as well the lack of free wifi was disappointing again for the price. On our second night at the hotel pulling back our bedding we found ripped bed sheets as well as stained from rust or blood, it was very uncomforting. I brought this to the attention of housekeeping and the front desk, they were very prompt to fix it however the front desk agent paid us no sincere apology.
The door men are absolutely FANTASTIC!!! We stayed 5 days and by the 3rd day the one gentleman would see us walking a block away and wave to us ask us how our day was and had great recommendations for food!
review.negativeRemarks: The size of the bathroom was difficult with 2 adults.
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT LOCATION!! close to everything, a hop skip and a jump to anywhere!

review.title: Worst Hotel Room Experience
review.reviewText:
This Queen Bed room i took was smaller then any hotel room i have ever seen in my life. Room had no coffee maker or Microwave. Parking Provided by hotel is too expensive (60$ /Day)

Only good thing about this hotel was its location , if you desperately want to stay at union square take this hotel but room quality is extremely poor.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel Room
review.locationRemarks: Location was good

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Our room was smaller than expected and the window didn't open, also bathroom was small but toiletries were nice and bed was comfortable ...location was great with trolley stop out front and cool lounge downstairs and bar/restaraunt on top floor
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room

review.title: Great hotel with simple amenities.
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake's building is very old but the entire hotel has been through a recent facelift. The lobby, elevators, corridors, and rooms are all in great condition. Our room was simple but comfortable. The linens were clean. There was a mini bar, LCD TV, and free wireless Internet (although we did not try the Internet). The bathroom was quite small and lacking in counter space. It was functional though, and very clean. We had a nice view of Macy's in Union Square, which was a 2 minute walk away. We will definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: 2 minute walk from Union Square with views overlooking the square.

review.title: Charming and Perfectly Located
review.reviewText: What a charming boutique hotel in the midst of Union Square! It is walking distance to lots of great shopping and restaurants, and close to the best public transportation in the city. The staff was outgoing and the epitome of professionalism. The rooms were small, but very cozy and comfortable with eye-pleasing decor that had an eclectic and modern flavor that was somehow very appropriate for the old-world architecture of the building...classical meets neoclassical! I would stay here again in a heartbeat!
review.locationRemarks: Pefection!

review.title: Stinch of sewage and bathroom for Twiggy
review.reviewText: Upon arrival we noticed the carpet on the stairs was tattered and torn. We then had a cocktail at the bar in the lobby before going to our room. The bar staff was pleasant but upon arrival to our room we were broadsided by the stench of raw sewage. Nevertheless we called the front desk and they asked us to come down and they provided us with another room. I will say that I was expecting something nice due to our misfortune of that last room but the room was much smaller in size and if you are anything other than a ballerina I would not expect to take a nice shower in this room. The shower was L shaped, now you would expect this to be large enough but it was in fact two feet in depth and three feet in width. However there is another sixteen inch by sixteen inch area that completes the L shape, where they installed the body wash and shampoo dispenser. Now I am 65 and weight about 240 so rubbing walls wouldnt have been an issue had I been in my own shower and I know how clean it is. Ah, that leads me to the toilet which is of the charm of the old world size which the toilet paper holder pokes you in the ribs and the door barely clears the front of the toilet. Total size of the bathroom (shower only) was 6x5 and this included the shower, toilet, and sink I would suggest you stay far away from this establishment and look more toward the Westin or Hyatt which are much nicer hotels. Personally stayed at both in the past with no problems.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower
review.locationRemarks: Location was fine

review.title: way too expensive for what it is
review.reviewText:
disapointing. expected way mor for the price
the deluxe room was really small. there was a convention in tyhe hotel, had to wait at least 10 min for an elevator....

review.title: Great Location and staff!
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel in a fantastic location. All staff within this hotel were absolutely lovely and VERY accommodating. Staff suggested places for us to eat, booked our tours to Yosemite and even gave us advice on our next destination Las Vegas. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone! Rooms were beautiful, bathrooms were a little small but this was no inconvenience.

review.title: Historic Hotel, Great Location

review.title: Noisy

review.title: OUR FAVORITE PLACE TO STAY IN SAN FRANCISCO!
review.reviewText: Treated us like royalty! The Sir Francis Drake Hotel is the only hotel that we will stay at in San Francisco! We love it.

review.title: all fab

review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Good location, but shaby.
review.reviewText: Excellent location, very centric and near the Powell station. However, the hotel is a bit shaby, need some update.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel need some maintenance. The rooms are very small.
review.locationRemarks: Near unions square and important metro and bus stations.

review.title: Great hotel for union square
review.reviewText: This is a great location, with friendly staff, and a beautiful lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom, minimal water pressure and counter space

review.title: Amazing location
review.reviewText: Overall a good choice, the hotel could use a refresh but you can't beat the location for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is amazing, steps from Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Could use a refresh, it's a little worn and the last overhaul did not take care of all the details. Still old fixtures in the bath, closets..

Hotel OK good convenient location but very small rooms and really no amenities in hotel. Went to nightclub had good view but very poor table service. Also $57.00 a night pretty steep to park car.
have stayed at other hotels around Union Square and found this to be least likely for me to return to.

review.title: Horrible Stay

review.title: Old School Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I visit San Francisco every year just before Christmas and like the Sir Francis Drake Hotel because of it's prime Union Square location. Overall, a nice hotel, however, you have to keep in mind it's very old with small rooms and small bathrooms. One thing I'd like to see improved is a larger bar area in the lobby. The Bar Drake is too small for the number of guests the Sir Francis Drake accommodates.

review.title: Great location, service and comfort
review.reviewText: The service was professional and excellent...location was great, close to cable car and shopping, very easy to get around
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, it was excellent
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to lots of great bars and shopping

review.title: Better choices, higher costs around Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Good value for the location. That being said...no WIFI.

The room was small and dated.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake - central & worth it.
review.reviewText:
Travelling from Brisbane, Australia, I recently stayed with my teenage son & his friend for 4 days at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel as part of our California holiday. With the many options for accomodation in San Francisco, we are extremely pleased with our stay at Sir Francis Drake. The location is excellent, with the convenience of shopping, cable cars & eating places and the tourist attractions being close at hand. Having the Beefeater doormen at the front of the Sir Francis Drake was a tourist bonus that the boys appreciated.
I love the character of the hotel and the ambience that permeates throughout the hotel. I rate the service of all staff we dealt with as first class. We got a reasonable rate through expedia to stay at the hotel, which is slightly more than other rates that I paid at other locations that we stayed at, but definitely worth it, considering our limited time in this wonderful city.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Service & character of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Very central. In the midst of the city. Easy access to Cable cars.

review.title: Family and pet-friendly
review.reviewText: Love that they are family and pet-friendly. Made it easier to bring everyone along for a holiday trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Again, loved that it was both family- and pet-friendly. Truly centrally located and easy to get around the City from here.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost of parking is ridiculously expensive.

review.title: Not a family hotel.
review.reviewText: Room was small, especially the restroom. Wouldn't recommend it for families with little ones. Very cute rooms though. Hated that there was no parking !
review.negativeRemarks: The size of the restroom.
review.locationRemarks: Busy street, could not find parking.

review.title: Danced the night away :-)
review.reviewText: Not only was I impressed with the comfort of the room but the food and entertainment at the hotel was superb :-)
review.positiveRemarks: Everything under one roof, food, entertainment
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints at all

review.title: Just for fun
review.reviewText: We chose to go to San Francisco just for fun. The hotel was very nice. I enjoyed it. I loved the feel of history and the atmosphere. Our room was a little small, but we didn't spend much time there, other than to sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the history and the restaurant and lounges on site
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was a bit small and there could have been more bedding. I would have appreciated an extra blanket.

review.title: Classic hotel and service

review.title: a fun get away hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Very nice and clean hotel, just seconds from Union Square. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only thing missing was coffee maker in the room.

review.title: Roach Motel?
review.reviewText: Beautiful decor. Lovely amenities. Saw a cockroach in the A.M I the bathroom!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The 6.00 water. The roach I found

review.title: Classic charm, modern amenities, small rooms
review.reviewText:
The Sir Francis Drake is a great hotel if you're looking for a place that has the elegance of days gone by but is up-to-date with the latest amenities. As an early 20th century hotel that has been extensively renovated, even the "deluxe" rooms are small by modern standards, which is okay as long as you're prepared for it. Amenities in the rooms such as free Internet and a charging station for your phone, tablet, etc. were nice.

We stayed with our infant and the room was pretty cramped for the three of us. The bathroom was *very* tiny and the floor space in the room once a crib was in there was pretty limited. The bed was not very comfortable and the foam pillows we requested #instead of the normal down pillows# were the worst of any hotel I've ever stayed in. The decor was nice but, when it comes right down to it, comfort trumps looks and this was definitely the weak point of the room.

However, we did have a corner room on the 14th floor, though, which provided great views of San Francisco! The hotel restaurant, Scala's, was good and the lobby bar was very lively during the week and throughout the weekend.

The hotel's location is great for shopping and the famous San Fran cable cars run right up the street alongside the hotel, which provides easy transportation out to Fisherman's Wharf.

Overall, the location was excellent, the service was very good, the rooms were okay. Probably best for couples, not so great for a family.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed, bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, centrally location, easy access to tourist destinations.

review.title: Great Location, Beds, Rooms a Little Small
review.reviewText: Location is great, bed is great, service is great, oiur only downside is the rooms and especially the bathroom are small. We will definitely return.
review.negativeRemarks: Room Size
review.locationRemarks: Very accessible to most anything you want to do in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Room was not ready when we checked in at 2pm (no problem with that). But when we returned at 4pm the room was still not ready. We had to leave our bags with bellman (again, no problem with that) but it took literally 10 minutes for the single bellman to help us and the line that had gathered. After we eventually checked into the hotel, everything else was fine. Nice hotel, in the middle of Union Square, great view of the City from our 12th story room.

review.title: Good hotel for location.
review.reviewText: Super location to all amenities. Superb staff, who were very helpful and accommodating. Bathroom very small and a job to sit on the toilet and avoid the toilet paper holder hitting one's shoulder.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet
review.locationRemarks: Central to all one would require to visit and see in San Francisco

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Bathroom was left untidy and certain staff at the reception desk were very unhelpful.

review.title: Business/Single travel or get a bigger room
review.reviewText: The rooms are very small. I know it's a city and to be expected, but if you're a couple on a romantic getaway, be prepared to hear each other in the bathroom. Restaurant looks nice, lobby bar is a fun scene, bedding is very nice, and the location is ideal.

review.title: Great hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: My stay at the Sir Francis Drake hotel was enjoyable. The staff were knowledgeable and friendly. Although the room was not large, it was clean and comfortable. The location of this hotel was excellent because it was near the shopping district and transportation lines. If I were to visit this city again I would definitely book another stay at this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel, perfect for shoppers.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, well located for easy walking access to most of downtown area and perfectly located for shoppers. All the usual design touches you would expect from a kimpton hotel, they really know how to make the most of a building without going over the top. Front desk staff were incredibly personable and helpful.

review.title: Great location, small room.
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is perfect, our room was quite small.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room

review.title: Comfortable, Classy, Central
review.reviewText: I wanted somewhere central and comfortable upon arrival in San Francisco after 24 hours of transit. I got what I paid for. This place has class, vibe and charm. Quality furnishings; a mixture of modern and old-fashioned. Very comfy bed. Fast and reliable wifi. Hot water with good pressure. The toilet got blocked and they unblocked it and cleaned up very quickly for me. Only thing is that their restaurant and room service menu was a little limited and pricey. Would have been good to see a breakfast buffet or a continental deal for this kind of place. Also would have appreciated a kettle to make my own cup of tea. But on the other hand this place is super central and their are food options galore within 5 minutes of the hotel. Other than that - can't really fault the place :)

review.title: Great San Francisco Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and in a great location. The cable cars on the same street which my kids loved. The only downside are the small rooms. Is a bit crowded for a family of 4. Also, there's a much cheaper parking lot around the corner. So avoid the hotel valet.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Very friendly staff. Small bathroom, but nice rooms and a decent price. Highly recommend!
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Grand and Historic!
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel a lot. The rooms were nice, but I did find the bathroom quite small.

review.title: The Sir Francis Drake
review.reviewText: Its an older hotel. The room we were in was on 11th floor. Room was a little on the small size but that was ok with us. The windows are old and we got a lot of street noise. Most everything else was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Very small disappointing room
review.reviewText: I was disappointed about room quality vs photos and 4-star rating. Room was also too small.
review.negativeRemarks: room sizes and quality
review.locationRemarks: Strict center (union square)

review.title: A great hotel disappoints with a tiny room.
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at the Sir Francis Drake many times but this was the first time that I was disappointed with the room given to me.

It was no larger than a college dorm room. It might have been OK for one person but two people and it got crowded. When a friend came over for a bit to catch up, it was absolutely too small.

The second issue we had in the room was the maid service. For our second day there, we were given new towels but no wash-clothes. The first night we were given no lotion but second day we did. Sadly the lotion given had already been opened and used! What a gross disappointment.

Overall I will go back to the Sir Francis Drake but will specifically request a real, adult room. Not a room the size of a hostel's.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was far too small, especially considering the cost of it.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for tourists.

review.title: Fun in SF!
review.reviewText: The drake was great! Comfortable, clean. Leban the doorman was really helpful! In a great part of town, easy access to the powell st cable car to fishermans wharf, also and enjoyable walk across town through Chinatown, little Italy, up Lombard street, down to fishermans wharf! I recommend it!
review.negativeRemarks: Desk staff could have been a bit more helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent! Close to grat shopping.

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText:
This hotel's interior architecture and decor are quite charming, and a nice change of pace from your typical contemporary hotel. There was miscommunication and confusion with our check-in process, which we weren't too pleased about. I don't have enough characters here to explain completely and fairly, so I'll leave it at that. But since we had to wait a bit for our room to be ready, we did get two free drink coupons for the bar.

We stayed in a Grand King room, which was rather spacious, and included a sleeper sofa, although I was told that not all Grand King rooms have a sleeper sofa. The room was clean and had nice decor as well. The bathroom had very little counter space, and no convenient towel rack. The only towel rack was in the bathtub/shower. Yes, IN the bathtub/shower. To use the shower in the bathtub, we had to remove all the towels from the only towel rack, so that they don't get wet. The toilet tissue holder also was not very ergonomically positioned.

For each night you request no housekeeping for the following non-checkout day, they give you a $10 voucher useable at their restaurant or bars. That was a nice plus, that we made good on.

This hotel has a guy in a red get-up at the front door to greet you. One of these guys was not at all cheerful. My wife wanted a picture with him, and he didn't even smile for the camera. On another day, a different guy there was much more cheerful and friendly, as I would expect.
review.positiveRemarks: Charming interior decor and architecture. Grand King room was quite spacious. Location.
review.negativeRemarks: The one doorman who was not friendly/cheerful. Poor towel rack and toilet tissue locations in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great location right at Union Square. Starbucks and Walgreens right downstairs.

review.title: Never ever
review.reviewText: Dirty. Broken window. Our room need to be remodeled. It was like cheap motel

review.title: drake's review
review.reviewText: rooms are super small and you can barely fit one person in the bath room. Not good for family , ok for one person maybe.

review.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel In the Heart of Union Square
review.reviewText:
From the moment that we pulled up to the Sir Francis Drake we had a wonderful time. The gentlemen who "guard" the front door are so efficient and take such care of you that you truly feel special, both coming and going. The room itself was exceedingly comfortable (we stayed a full 7 days). If there was anything we would have liked to have seen different in the room was a couch rather than the two wing chairs (so we could sit together) and possibly more space in the bathroom (but not at the expense of "living" room). We had a room on the 3rd floor, so there was a lot of street noise (be warned, it is in Union Square after all).
If there were any complaints that were to be had, it was that we had a tough time contacting the concierge, both before and during our trip. During our stay typically the front desk staff would pick up the slack but we had a few questions that occasionally needed to be deferred to the concierge, who seemed to always be away. Eventually we would track them down (during our stay) though and we always got what we needed (I was never able to get them on the phone to pre-arrange something for our room, but it did not hinder our stay in anyway whatsoever).
All in all it was a wonderful stay in a lovely hotel in an excellent location.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge was difficult to track down
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square with a trolley stop outside the door (That is both good and bad, as they are loud and run all night)

review.title: Staff sent us to a different hotel for cocktails!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. The only issue we encountered was that the bar in the lobby closes at 11:00 pm. We couldn't get into the nightclub because we were wearing shorts so the hotel staff sent us to a hotel down the street so that we could have cocktails past 11:00 pm! Seemed crazy that we had to go to a different hotel just so that we could have a drink.
review.negativeRemarks: The bar in the lobby does not stay open past 11:00pm. The staff sent us to a different hotel for drinks.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: BEST LOCATION IN SA FRANCISCO TO SIGHTSEE
review.reviewText: THE CONCIERGE AT THE DOOR WAS GREAT. THE FRONT DESK HELP WAS VERY GOOD.
review.positiveRemarks: THE GREETING AT THE FRONT DOOR AND THE GRAND LOBBY AREA
review.negativeRemarks: SMALL ROOMS, DINKY BATHROOMS
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT LOCATION TO REACH MOST SIGHTSEEING POINTS IN THE AREA

review.title: great location great value
review.reviewText:
Great service and the room and hotel were very clean
Room and bathroom a bit small
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: fabulous

review.title: Be aware of the room noise!
review.reviewText: Great location! Rooms were very noisy. Had an adjoining room. Had to call manager 3 times to keep the other guests quiet. We stayed 6 nights. Ok if you are passing through fot 1 or 2 nights. - Australian travelers.
review.negativeRemarks: Very noisy room (adjoining)
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Beautiful hotel with great sercice
review.reviewText: Our experience was a 10 all the staff was a 10 it is a beautiful older hotel the rooms are not big but really do you need a big room for two people. The location is so close to everything and close to public transportation stops. We would defiantly stay here again.

review.title: Bring your own towel!
review.reviewText:
When we arrived there was only one towel in the room, three calls to housekeeping and two days later we get another towel. Then when they serviced the room they took our bath mat and never replaced, with a leaking shower this was not good!!
The bathroom is tiny!! seriously tiny, my husband could not fit on the loo sitting straight, he had to bend his legs to the side to fit in behind the door.
The night club upstairs attracts so many people from outside the hotel that on Friday or Saturday night you have to que to get into the lift just to get to your room.
The bar downstairs has very good cocktails but they line the bar with chairs which fill up quick each day and then you cannot get to the bar to order a drink, we did not notice any table service so we had one drink then gave up, only to discover they charged us for 4 on our room bill (they did amend on check out which was good)
Overall the decor is very nice. I was quite impressed by the room, and the night club upstairs is amazing, no wonder it is popular.
The door men out the front are so very helpful and kind, they are the best part about the whole experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor is very nice and the door men are excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom way too small
review.locationRemarks: Right in town, very good to see the city. Tram line right out front.

review.title: Too small for 4 in one room.
review.reviewText: The location is great and the staff very friendly. Our room was rather small for 4 people. The bathroom is tiny. It is a lovely, classic old hotel, but it was quite cramped.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms small and bathroom tiny.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Best hotel in the city!
review.reviewText: We loved the option to go green and not have the room cleaned every day. We loved the decor of our room and the entire hotel. We loved the staff (particularly Leif), and breakfast at Scalas. We felt like royalty the whole time we were there. If we get a chance to return to San Francisco, we will only stay at the Drake!
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect!!

review.title: Good hotel with great location but small room
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel in a great location (two blocks from Union Square). Expedia rated it a 4 star, I would give it a 3.2. It's a cool boutique style hotel, but it lacks amenities and the parking is ridiculous ($50/night - we got $20 two blocks away at Best). The bathroom was tiny with no ventilation and the room wasn't much bigger proportionately. Not great when you have four in the room. The fitness center was also small with a few aerobic machines and only one weight trainer. There was no pool.
