We booked the hotel based on price, location and the fact that it was the only one that offfered two queens (although the two queens took up most of the room).
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny bathroom and small room
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Perfect for a young couple
review.reviewText:
I arrived at the hotel on Thursday morning, 6 hours prior to check-in (it's when our flight from Canada arrived#. We walked from the BART - highly reccomend - Powell St - to the hotel. Once inside, it was a beautiful lobby with nice music and friendly staff. I was greeted by a man at the desk, very pleasant #Manuel I believe was his name#, and immediately advised that our room was ready. I told him that my girlfriend and I flew from Canada and are celebrating our anniversary together, he said he would see what he could do for us. After checking, he upgraded us to a corner room which was beautiful. The staff was always smiling, the lobby bar was alot of fun from 5pm-11pm #got pretty busy) and the hotel was clean. The only negative is the street level noise. We were 4 floors off the ground and it was pretty loud outside even with the windows closed..... you can tell the hotel windows/walls are outdated. Our A/C didn't work but it didnt bother us, it was plenty cool.

This hotel is in an amazing location, easy walking distance to everything. We made the 20 minute trek to Fishermans Wharf on two occasions, very nice.

The value of the hotel was hard to beat. I would definately reccomend this hotel to any young couple looking for a fun time in San Francisco.

I
review.negativeRemarks: Loud street noise (5 floors up or lower)
review.locationRemarks: Great location, right in the heart of the city.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel / Small Bathrooms
review.reviewText: The building itself is absolutely beautiful and very awe inspiring when you first walk in. The foyer, and Bar Drake area near reception are breathtaking. Rooms are on the small side, but that is to be expected with a building its age. The small bathrooms however are somewhat cumbersome both to move around in, as well as store your toiletries. There is next to no counter space, and three small shelves above the toilet. I would not let this be a deciding factor for someone not staying here, but it's merely a heads-up. Staff were very eager to help with anything required, but did not follow through on several small things. (Again, nothing major, probably mere slips of the memory, but I wouldn't expect such things to be forgotten in a hotel like this). I rated a 4 on the cleanliness of the room merely because our ice bucket was never cleaned or emptied. Seemed funny that every time we would come "home" for the day, the room was made up, but there was luke warm water waiting for us in our ice bucket. Comfort of the room rated a 4 for the small size of the bathroom. Overall it was a very pleasant hotel to stay at for the week and I would definitely stay there again given the chance.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom size
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located on Powell street, one of the cable car routes. Walgreens and Bank of America across the street. Close to restaurants and theatres.

review.title: a great find in San Francisco
review.reviewText: great hotel, superior service, clean room and comfortable bed. Great location next to Union Square. My only gripe would be the small cramped bathrooms. Overall, I highly recommend the hotel and will stay there again. The front desk team specially Nelson's service quality is outstanding.
review.negativeRemarks: small bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: out standing, close to Union Square in the heart of San Francisco.

review.title: An clean and enjoyable hotel in downtown San Fran
review.reviewText: We stayed for four nights and checked in during the early hours of Monday morning. Helpful staff that checked us in and organised for bags to be delivered to the room. The room itself was definitely clean. We have a two year old, but didn't inquire about a baby cot. On the eighth level, we did hear a little bit of street noise. The rooms are also quite small. However, the location is a definite bonus, being so close to Union Square. The doormen are friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room
review.locationRemarks: Half a block away from Union Square...easy access to everything.

review.title: Charming Hotel for a Short Stay
review.reviewText: Overall the Drake is a clean, nicely renovated hotel. The usual Kimpton service was evident throughout our stay. Our only issue was the size of the bathroom. We stayed in a historical Queen room and the attached bathroom was tiny, tiny, tiny. We made it work for this trip but would definitely upgrade to a different room next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the bathroom, toddler in the room next door waking up at 6 am daily.
review.locationRemarks: Terrific for our trip; close to muni, cable car and terrific restaurants.

review.title: Read all of the reviews!
review.reviewText: I believe all of the prior ratings were correct. I ended up with the dreaded room next to the elevator!!! Took some getting used to. I did enjoy getting the $ credit for not having maid service to use for resturaunt and drinks ect.! I didn't get to go to the dance club upstairs. Maybe next time.
review.positiveRemarks: The peppermint soap w/a very deep bathtub! The beautiful Lobby!
review.negativeRemarks: Having the room next to the Elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and felt pretty safe...Wallgreens across the street a real Plus!

review.title: small rooms
review.reviewText: Rooms are very small. Staff are very friendly and helpfull
review.negativeRemarks: Room Size
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. Close to many spots

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location! On trolley line, blocks from BART, and near Chinatown. In hotel food/drinks pricey but awesome breakfast across street at Sears Fine Foods and other nearby resturants. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Matress was a little hard for my taste.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel - Awesome location
review.reviewText:
I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - we had an upgrade on check in to a better room on the 16th floor - what a view of the city!
The location is right on union square, near the shops, its a bit of a walk (1.4 miles) to fisherman's wharf (or a cable car if you can brave the ridiculous queues) but Im not sure I would have wanted to stay up there anyway - good area for a visit, but not to stay in.
You dont have to have your room cleaned and if you choose not to, you get a $10 voucher to be used in the bar or the restaurant - essentially giving you a cheap breakfast every day.
The staff were always friendly, the bar staff would chat and tell stories, everything was fantastic.
Some have said the hotel looks quirky - which is probably true, but it has a lot more character than the modern all white hotels.
The only point to note is that there is a LOUD nightclub on the 21st floor, which we could hear from the 16th so I imagine it gets louder as you go up. No problem for us as we were out but if you are a family with children, it may be a little loud!
review.positiveRemarks: $10 rebate for not having housekeeping, friendliness of the staff
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from the top floor could be an issue
review.locationRemarks: right on union square, good for shopping

review.title: Best Location!
review.reviewText: My husband and I visited San Francisco for the first time and stayed at The Sir Francis Drake Hotel. We could not have asked for a more convenient location. The trolly stopped right out front. Walked a block to the bus to Fisherman's Wharf & Pier 39. Sacks Fifth Ave on the corner of our block, Starbucks next door, Macys across the street, Union Square a block away as well as Cheesecake Factory, Burger Bar, etc. Walked back to Hotel from Chinatown. I'm glad we decided to stay here and not down by the Wharf where it was very crowded. We loved our stay. Only one minor complaint...the bathroom was very small. We generally share the bathroom when we get ready to go out. Can't do that here. Overall, we were very pleased and would recommend this hotel. Best location!!
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to everything!!

review.title: Terrible service and to small room.
review.reviewText: Absolutely terrible service especially by the valet service. Waited more than 10 minutes to have someone take our car to valet. Plus picking up the car they required 20 minutes....which is absurd. Room was upgraded so very surprised how small both the room and the bathroom wre. Also, extremely noisy. Room on 11th floor but could hear all of the street noise as if we were on the ground floor. Considering how many very good hotels are in walking distance to the Sir Francis Drake, I will never stay at that hotel again no matter what the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Service and small rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square and great shopping and restaurants.

review.title: a great stay
review.reviewText: I rated the comfort as a 4 because the bed was very comfortable but we were situated right under the nightclub and it was noisy late at night on the weekend only- we were warned of this and could have changed but decided to try it as we are good sleepers so it was not as annoying as it might be for lighter sleepers. Great locale . We took the BART from the airport and then walked to the hotel - the hill was a bit steep when you were dragging luggage but not too bad and then the cable car was right outside the door - so that was very convenient. A great view of the Union Square from our window . Stop at the tourist info site at the bottom of Powell street for a bus map and city pass ( a good value) - it is very easy to get around here.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice , grand hotel complete with beefeaters outside the door who were able to offer help anytime you needed it
review.negativeRemarks: No bathtub and the noise from the nightclub..
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't be better - everything was easy to get to due to the bus lines at the bottom of Powell St and of course the cable car right outside the door!

review.title: Fun in San Fran
review.reviewText: Nice visit but would have liked to know ahead of time for the $57/day parking fee. The valet/man in the Sir Fransis Drake outfit was very helpful......
review.negativeRemarks: parking charge
review.locationRemarks: Great location to watch the trolleys go by.....

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: My boy friend and I stayed here for a night. The staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the location was perfect. The only complaint we had was that the walls were very thing. Several times through the night you could hear horns honking and noisy drunks on the street.

review.title: Sweet San Fran
review.reviewText: It was pleasing. The employees were helpful and polite. The hotel decor was different, in a good way. Overall, we will choose to stay here again when we return for another visit.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed, it was hard.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome and convenient.

review.title: Great hotel for anyone!
review.reviewText: We loved this unique, perfectly located, beautiful hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were helpful and the lobby elegant.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were a bit small.
review.locationRemarks: The location was absolutely ideal for enjoying beautiful San Francisco!

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Me and my wife stayed in the Historic Queen room. The room is big enough for two people, comfortably. The bathroom is small. One person can be in the shower and the other person at the sink. For us, it was me first in the shower and the wife was second (she takes longer to get ready). But we choose to stay in the older hotels, which tend to have smaller rooms (this one built in 1928) when we travel to San Francisco. Its more for the experience of how it was. The rooms and the entire hotel is very clean. The staff was great! If you don"t want room cleaning service, you get $10.00 coupon for each day you decline. Coupon is good for bar drinks and food. Great hotel! Don't be afraid to book this place, you will love it. We flew in to SFO Airport. And took a shuttle to the hotel. No rental car is needed here. Transportation is easy and cheap. Make sure you buy a Munni Pass.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel and staff was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. Really nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Location is at Union Square. The Cable Car stops at the front door of the hotel. Cable Car goes to Pier 39.

review.title: Good But....
review.reviewText: I had requested for room with views which I did get, however just remember if you do get placed on the 20th floor, bear in mind there is the lounge bar upstairs (floor 21) and you can hear pretty much everything in your room. Not recommended if you're wanting peace and quiet in your room. Location is great, however avoid 20th floor if you can.
review.positiveRemarks: Location of Hotel. Nearby shopping and not so far to china town and north beach.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location

review.title: Fire Drill?
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Drake. It was a perfect location for touring the city. The reviews have described the hotel perfectly. Small, somewhat noisy, but really comfortable. I only have one complaint. I awoke in the middle of the night to the sound of the fire alarm. (There had been a fire earlier that day at one of the piers, so it was a bit frightening.) As anyone would, we rushed out of our room and began the decent down twelve flights of stairs. When we finally came out of the stairwell, we were surprised to see that everything was as it should be. The staff looked at us like we were morons. They said that someone had pulled the alarm manually and only the Fire Department could turn it off. Was it too much trouble to try to alert your customers that this was a false alarm? Maybe place a staff member in the stairwell? Apparently so. I was very ill that night and we met older customers in the lobby that had complaints as to how the hotel handled the situation as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls

review.title: Comfy hotel, noisy city
review.reviewText:
After you find your way through a series of one-way streets to the hotel, you get to stay at a very nice hotel. The front desk staff was courteous and fun (they are allowed to be themselves rather than robots). The concierge knew the area really well and recommended we try Puccini & Pinetti for dinner. Best meal and staff ever.

Our room was actually pretty small. The bathroom has just enough room to fit a human being without feeling cramped to me. The bed was spacious and comfortable but I was kept awake most of the night by the noise coming from the other hotel goers and especially the city. Couples concerned about their own noise can rest assured that the beds themselves are quiet, even under stress.

The concierge then recommended Sears Fine Food across the street. Overpriced, average service, unremarkable breakfast. The food made my girlfriend sick so we had to leave the city. It's also worth noting that the guy in the valet booth was quite rude. He mumbled something and got irritable when we couldn't hear and understand him.

Ultimately, the hotel was really great; the only problem is San Fran itself.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, great concierge, clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room, smaller bathroom, very noisy city.
review.locationRemarks: Puccini and Pinetti is a fantastic place to eat. The city is too loud, crowded, and confusing to be comfortable.

review.title: A Charming hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: This is a charming hotel with a great location. The cable car stops right outside the front door. The hotel is somewhat old-school, in that the room we had was small, and the bathroom was REALLYsmall - but, again, this is to be expected from an older hotel. The beds are quite comfortable, but the flat screen television is hard to see from one of the beds (again, due to the tightness of the room). The room we were in (7th floor, west side), had poor wireless internet reception, but it was usable. The staff was friendly and very willing to help and answer questions. We would definitely stay here again, the next time we're in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: small room, small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: convenient

review.title: Great if you like Cramped, Noisy Rooms
review.reviewText: Upon arriving, there were no doormen (Beefeaters) around to help us with our luggage or where to park for valet service. The check-in was fine and efficient. Our rooms were ready early. The room itself with 2 double beds was very cramped. The bathroom was the size of a postage stamp (the shower curtain would rest against the bathroom sink). The bed was comfortable but the noise from the streets (and the saxophone players) could not be blocked out. It was very noisy. The restaurant had terrible service! The waiter, Nick, took at least 15 minutes before coming to our table to take our drink orders. Another 15 minutes to bring our drinks and then took our order. He disappeared the rest of the time and was eventually replaced by a new waiter who was equally as absent. Our glasses were often empty and we'd have to request refills. The food was good, but it took a long time (at least 25 minutes) from order to service at the table. The restaurant was not that full either, so I'm not sure if the staff treated us horribly on purpose or not. We did not go back to Scala's. Housekeeping never came to our room so we made our own beds. The only good experience was when we left our luggage with the doorman so we could shop a bit more. He held onto them well past check out.
review.positiveRemarks: The man at the check out desk who held onto our luggage while we shopped longer after we checked out. He took care of us very well.
review.negativeRemarks: The cramped rooms, the noisy rooms, the tiny bathroom, the shaky elevators, no coffee makers in the rooms, not refrigerators in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: The location was fine for shopping in Union Square. If the price of the hotel was less, then I think this would be a great place to stay.

review.title: Nice hotel ina great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely and our room vas very nice. The main gripe was the lack of follow up from the staff and they forgot our 5am wake up call making us rush to cath the bus in the morning.

review.title: A real treat in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Amazing location, and lot's of great places to see and eat right at your doorstep. Awesome views and so cool to be to in the heart of the city, but to be able to sleep peacefully.

review.title: A Great Get-a-way
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel is perfect -- close to Union Square -- close to all modes of transportation -- easy to walk to China Town & Market Street. Hotel is older but clean and staff are very friendly and helpful. Starbucks and a great little restaurant are on the main level of the hotel. We were only visiting for 3 days and felt this hotel was in an ideal location.
The hotel decor is "quaint/tacky" but fun !! Would definitely recommend

review.title: great location but room was underwhelming
review.reviewText: The hotel had a great location and if that's the top priority then this is a good choice. However, probably because the hotel is quite old - built in the 1920's(?) - the rooms are very tiny. The restrooms were especially surprisingly small and was quite uncomfortable. Also, on our last night when we needed extra towels - no one answered my call to housekeeping and guest services. I called around 3 times with no luck! But of course room service answered right away but they couldn't get me towels...
review.negativeRemarks: tiny restrooms, uncomfortable bed and pillows were so soft they would end up flat!
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to everything - BART, shopping, etc. trolley stops right in front of the hotel too!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
A very convenient location and suited our needs - staff were helpful with advice on things to see and how to get there
We were given useful tips
review.negativeRemarks: Non existent view from room
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Inconsiderate neighbors
review.reviewText:
Good but I heard my neighbor's noisy kids{crying}.Probably insulation is not that good.Didn't
stay much in my room because I was @ the conference all day.I hope neighbors can be considerate enough not to bang their doors.
review.negativeRemarks: There's no swimming pool
review.locationRemarks: Very good since it's near the shopping centers

review.title: great hotel near union square
review.reviewText: just a comment: I heard the people in the next room. That was weird.

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: Close to everything! Great experience. Excellent and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Sir Francis Drake
review.reviewText: A quality classic hotel in a great area of the city. The rooms can be small compared to more modern hotels and there are still some renovations going on, but I loved my experience.
review.negativeRemarks: There was some noise from workers
review.locationRemarks: Exceptional right off Union Square

review.title: It is not a 4 star ....
review.reviewText: Front Desk person was incredible unprofessional and downright rude. I contacted the front desk manager, and she did assist with the situation, she was very nice and helpful. The bathrooms are way too small and have horrible lighting. On my second night my bed linens had black stains on them. Starlight Room was the only plus to the property.
review.negativeRemarks: Service is not up to par and the bathroom is too small.
review.locationRemarks: location is great

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Staff is so professional. Rooms are clean and comfortable.

review.title: Gorgeous & Central location to experience San Fran
review.reviewText:
The Sir Francis Drake is a stunning hotel. From the doormen dressed in beefeater costume to the sumptuously decorated Lobby bar and the stunningly styled rooms this hotel delivers esthetics plus! The staff was extremely helpful and prompt when called down for things.

The rooms were on the smaller side but beautiful. The downside was the old casement window that let in a bit of the outside noise. Drawing the blinds and closing the drapes did help with that.

We took advantage of the offer to not have housekeeping come in and received a $10 voucher per day that we used in the hotel restaurant "Scala" which was fantastic.

I would recommend this hotel for almost everyone, perhaps not the best set up for families as the rooms are a bit small.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from window
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, steps from Union Square.

review.title: Foothill Ranch
review.reviewText: Great location. Elegant and nicely upkept hotel. Staff was very friendly. The room wasn't as small as I expected. The only thing I had a little problem with was the bathroom didn't have much counter top space or storage space. But it wasn't a big deal.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom storage space
review.locationRemarks: Convenient. Walking distance to everywhere. We were able to take a break in our room in the mid afternoon and go out again later.

review.title: To Close for Comfort
review.reviewText: The room was very small. Actually requested a larger room because of this. No place to hang towels and not sink counter space. Bathroom was very small as well.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby was very nice. If you choose not to have your room cleaned you get a $10 voucher to use at the hotel. For room service, bar or etc.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was very smaill. No place to hang towels. No sink counter space.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. May take the Bart from the Airport to the station near hotel with a short walking distance. Did not have to spend money on a taxi.

review.title: The best stay ever!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our room & the Hotel, great coffee every morning in the lobby, friendly helpful staff
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds, quiet room, great staff
review.negativeRemarks: The smallest bathroom I have ever seen, but not a problem
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to great shopping, Saks 5th Ave, Williams Sonoma, Union Square, & best of all on the Cable car line, stops right out front !

review.title: Good location but ...
review.reviewText: Hotel room was too small and the bathroom was very small and inconvenient when trying to get ready. There was no coffee service in the room. The hotel lobby was nice with a bar and places to sit, but very cold due to being just up a short flight of stairs from the front door, which was always opening and closing. Hotel looked a bit threadbare, but is in a good location for shopping, dining, etc. Front desk personnel and other staff were friendly and helpful. Don't know that I would stay there again, though.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and bath too small
review.locationRemarks: Great location for dining, shopping, close to bus and trolley stops.

review.title: Historical classic room
review.reviewText: It is very nice. Too small for the price. Won't stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel charges $50 plus tax a night to park in their garage.

review.title: A Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel it was in a great location and everyone was very helpful and friendly

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in an excellent location, right on the Powell St. street car line. Take the Bart from the airport to Powell St. station and it's an easy 3 block walk up Powell. Everything is close shopping, restaurants, street car line I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Right at Union Square"

review.title: Awesome for San Fran visit!
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel, hear the sounds of the city from your room :)
review.negativeRemarks: City is pretty loud from the windows.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location!

review.title: Well I'll definitely be back
review.reviewText: A nice centrally located hotel in walking distance from just about anywhere in the centre. The room was small but efficient (space well designed) and clean with plenty of plugs for the many gadgets one travels with these days. The wi-fi was the fastest I have ever experienced in a hotel and better still free for as many devices as required. I view this hotel as extremely good value and will make sure with the help of Expedia I use this hotel again for my next trip.
review.negativeRemarks: The bar, far too public for me.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location, centrally located for my requirements

review.title: Happy Guest
review.reviewText: I would certainly recommend and use The Sir Francis Drake Hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the decor of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Busy

review.title: Sir Francis Drake Review
review.reviewText:
The staff was very cordial and had personality. I was attended to quickly and the hotel was extremely clean. I enjoyed the hygienic selection of soaps and appreciated the USB ports to charge my phone. I thought the internet use could have been easier in accessing Wi-Fi and the rooms were very small.

I think the bed could have used a few more pillows and an extra blanket. The TV remote was hard to use as well.

Overall my stay was comfortable and it was perfect for a short business stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, friendly, and unique. This hotel also has a gym- very few that I have stayed at have this commodity.
review.negativeRemarks: Small size and lack of bedding
review.locationRemarks: Good walking distance from Financial District and shopping.

review.title: Very convenient with a great bar
review.reviewText: This is a very convenient hotel with a great bar in the lobby and a really good restaurant attached.

review.title: Fun getaway...
review.reviewText: I loved the lounge/bar area. It's very modern yet old world kind of like your grandfathers brandy/cigar room. The staff were excellent from the initial greeting at curb side to the concierge's desk which made reservations for Liberty Tours (Annon: great driver) to see wine country and dinner at Waterbar (very beautiful with the bridge lit at night, great food and service) near the Wharf. Saturday night at the Star Light Lounge on the 21st floor was so much fun! Robert acted as a "personal" host and made sure we had a great table by the dance floor and made sure our seats were safe while we danced. The room was small but fun with bright glossy red furniture and large modern full length mirror at bedside. The bed was very comfortable! The street outside was a bit noisey from time to time (but I think that added to the hotels charm- being in the thick of San Franciso life) and Sir Drake decided to take down metal scaffolding (they had been cleaning the windows) in the middle of the night, but with that said, it didn't bother me enough to report it. Great location to Union Square shopping and fun little pubs/jazz bars along streets.
review.negativeRemarks: Scaffolding
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was amazing and in the heart of Union Center. Everything was so easy to get to from this hotel. All access to transportation was right in-front of you. We walked alot too, to Fisherman's Wharf and to the Ball Park only a 30 min walk. Love how it was centrally located to amazing food, shopping and tours. Staff very friendly, and helpful. The offered a conserve you room cleaning package and we got an amazing breakfast for free (just left a tip) since we skipped room service 3 nights. So happy we choose this hotel. The room was smaller than what I am used to but this is city hotel. We have a queen bed, a desk, a dresser, and a amazing chair all in the room. Internet was easy to connect too with my smart phone and laptop. The whole process was easy and great, would stay again
review.positiveRemarks: The original character, and the updated decor
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great hotel and in the heart of the city

review.title: Good location, small noisy room.
review.reviewText:
The location of this hotel is excellent. Just off Union Square, close by to all transport links in, out and around the city. Great restaurants within 1-3 blocks, including the excellent Scala which is part of the Hotel.

Our room was on the small size, but very well furnished and clean. We had asked for a room on a higher floor so we were away from the street noise but even on the 12th floor it was noisy throughout the night. I would ask for a room on the opposite side of the g
Hotel.

Very disappointed that there was no free in room Wifi, it cost an extra $10 per night if you wanted to use it which I think is a big ripoff to customers.

Some of public areas, ie corridors and reception area need some updated as they looked a little outdated and shabby but not in a "chic"

We would stay again there again but perhaps pay a little more for a bigger room and on a higher floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms and in need of modernization in public areas of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent, central in the city for transport links and great restaurants.

review.title: Overall Good
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is beautiful; however, the rooms are VERY small. A little too small, honestly. I thought the Chancellor was a better overall hotel due to the size of the rooms. The Sir Francis Drake did have a nice lobby area and the staff were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room
review.locationRemarks: Location was very good.

review.title: Sir Fancis in April
review.reviewText: We stayed at SFD for 5 nights. The hotel was beautiful and the staff were all very friendly. The room was very comfortable. The only draw back...the noise of the city at night. It would not prevent from staying there again, because if you walk enough, like we did, you're so tired it doesn't matter.
review.negativeRemarks: Night city noise
review.locationRemarks: GREAT location! Very safe!

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: The staff were wonderful. Very friendly and helped with any queries we had. The hotel decor was gorgeous and nice and clean. Our room was very comfortable and clean and had a good view looking over union square. It was nice to watch all the hustle and bustle of the city and the people in the square. Very easy to get about the city from the hotel with a cable car stop being right outside the front doors! Would definitely consider staying here again. San Francisco is now my favourite destination!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff being very helpful and a cable car stop right outside the front doors of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of things by union square. A very good location to stay at and very easy to get about the whole of San Francisco from here

review.title: good price and location
review.reviewText: Window was so dirty could hardly see out . Miniature bathroom for a room with 2 queen size beds.
review.locationRemarks: Great for shopping and union square sites

review.title: pretty good
review.reviewText: Hotel room was very small. Coffee was in lobby and not in room and this was rather inconvenient. Hotel has old world charm.
review.negativeRemarks: room too small
review.locationRemarks: neighborhood was seedy.

review.title: great service
review.reviewText: Great location and very friendly staff at the hotel. Check in was easy and a few complimentary drinks was a nice touch. The decor in the rooms was a little creepy for my, I awoke to a very strange picture of a child praying that kind of freaked me out. Great diner across the road Lou's, fantastic soup on a cold evening
review.positiveRemarks: the location and the doorman dressed as a beef eater
review.negativeRemarks: the creepy decor
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the perfect spot for sightseeing and dining opportunities. Easy access to all Muni transportation and shopping.

review.title: A wonderful surprise awaits you here!
review.reviewText: This hotel has a unique feel to it that only happens when a place spontaneously becomes a destination. There is magic in the air in the lobby, the stairs down, and the area where the doormen interact with guests and passersby. There are business travelers, tourists, beautiful people, families. Overall a complete surprise as we had no special expectations really. None of the other nearby hotels seem to have this magical ambience going on like this one does. I don't know if this is a recent thing or not, but enjoy it while it's still going on!!
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby, lobby staff, doormen, room decor, lobby decor
review.locationRemarks: Excellent union square-adjacent locatipon

review.title: Fancy, but not worth the price
review.reviewText:
For such as expensive room I would expect it to be clean and dust free which it was not. The windows were extremely dirty and the room itself was tiny, like a child's bedroom. The bathroom was only big enough for one person at a time. TV was standard non-cable non-pay channels and if you wanted anything else it was a fee (like $4.95 to watch one standard cable show). Parking was ridiculous, $50 a night plus mandatory 14% tip. Also the room wasn't quiet being so close to the starlight room dance club. In room service was also insanely priced, an example would be $17 for a ham and cheese omelet which of course comes with a mandatory $3 delivery fee as well as a mandatory 20% tip making that a $24 omelet.

Save your money and stay 3 blocks away where the price is half and the rooms are probably better.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed, it was very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: the size of the room
review.locationRemarks: Great if your thing is spending hundreds of dollars on overpriced fashion

review.title: Exactly what we wanted!
review.reviewText:
- Easy to shuttle from the airport to this hotel.
- Very central/convenient to connect to public transport (Union Square, tour buses, cable cars, trams).
- Friendly and very helpful staff, knowledgable concierge.
- Free internet if you signup with Kimpton (it's on their intranet).
- Hotel has a nice antique and authentic feel to it.
- Room (standard queen size bed) was a bit small but still could fit a queen bed and 2 large suitcases laid flat on the floor.
- Very clean room with modern lcd tv/furniture, decent sized bathroom, comfortable bed - overall very happy; hotel deserves its 4 star rating!
review.positiveRemarks: antique feel - stays true to its heritage (nice experience for a tourist)
review.locationRemarks: central and convenient

review.title: lots of character.....
review.reviewText: Very small rooms with paper-thin walls. No extra pillows or blankets. But staff was nice and location was great for exploring the city.

review.title: Too Loud
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms are nice but the sleeping conditions are horrible. Single pane windows in the rooms. We could not sleep due to the noise on the streets.
review.negativeRemarks: Single pane windows. We heard the clarity of nightlife of San Francisco streets as if it were in our room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Great value hotel with old style class
review.reviewText: Outstanding hotel staff ~ They really go beyond what is "standard service" and will treat you as a real VIP. Scala's Bistro is a solid value with again excellent wait staff serving quality dishes @ reasonable prices. Of course, the location is PRIME !!! The only slightly disappointing note is that there was no mini-frig or coffee maker in the room. Other than that, the room was of adequate size and had updated appointments. Would I go back again ? Definitely.
review.positiveRemarks: If you opt out of house cleaning for the day, the hotel will give you a $10 voucher to use @ Scala's Bistro, or in the hotel bar
review.negativeRemarks: No mini-frig or coffee maker.
review.locationRemarks: Can't beat the location ~ right in the middle of all the action of Union Square ! Very convenient.

review.title: Birthday in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the bed and pillows were comfortable, the lobby was lovely, doorman dressed as a beefeater was charming. We took advantage of energy conserving choice of no daily housekeeping for a $10 food/ drink credit daily. Would definitely recommend a stay here. The Starlight Room has fantastic city views!
review.positiveRemarks: Great architecture, wonderful location, Wi-Fi ,friendly and courteous staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have loved in-room coffeemaker, refrigerator, but coffee was available in lobby.
review.locationRemarks: This was a fantastic location for touring the city from, on the cable car line, dining options and shopping close by.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Great hotel! The staff were great. The hotel is very centrally located so we could walk or take the trolley to most things. The valet parking guys were very quick bringing the car around when we wanted to venture out further. We really enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: The room decor was very unique.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a little small
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous central location

review.title: A small "ouch" on the v-ouch-ers ...
review.reviewText: This hotel is located close to Union Square and has real charm. For your stay, you are given a choice of having the room cleaned or "conserving" and declining that service in exchange for a $10 voucher good at one of their restaurants or bars. I opted for the vouchers, but only received one voucher instead of the two that I was due. Overall, however, that was a small grievance. Now that I know how the system works, I'd take care of the oversight on the day it happened. Overall, that was a small grievance when considering my stay. I'd book there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Distinctive old-world charm, quirky doormen in period costume, location, decent room.
review.negativeRemarks: CIty noise during sleeping hours ... but that's what ear plugs are for.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, BART.

review.title: Pleasant Downtown Location
review.reviewText: Every employee we spoke with was courteous and helpful. The atmosphere was pleasant and there are many lovely areas. We love Scala's Restaurant and the location off the hotel is ideal for visiting downtown.

review.title: not 4 star
review.reviewText: The lobby is pleasant and staff at the front desk were friendly, however the rooms and services provided were not at a 4 star level which Expedia rated, I was a bit disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: the rooms
review.locationRemarks: a good central location by the trolly, however if you are not used to urban life it can be a little intimidating at night

review.title: San Franciso 2012
review.reviewText: Excellent location. If you like to walk, almost everything is at a reasonable walking distance.

review.title: Best location in the City.
review.reviewText: What I like about this hotel is that the room was very quiet for San Francisco. Simple, clean, and basics like cable and wi-fi. The location is the best in the City. Charming old San Francisco establishment. Not a lot of frills, just a great simple understated nice hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Also the starlight home which is at the top of the hotel offers one of the best views in the World.
review.negativeRemarks: No lotion or other thinks like coffee in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Best in the City.

review.title: quirky but nice!
review.reviewText: a hotel from the black and white movie era , of real quirky character combining old fashioned features , a bit of kitsch but with modern levels of comfort and service .And all at a very reasonable price in an excellent central location . All staff eager to please and helpful . Perfect for a short stay for work , shopping and sightseeing
review.positiveRemarks: central location, old fashioned look and feel , antithesis of the modern business hotel
review.locationRemarks: very central , close to shops and convenient for streetcar to toursist areas

review.title: no fridge, no coffee marker...
review.reviewText:
it's good location and clean facility even in such an aged building.
however, no fridge, no coffee marker...
can't store food at room...
review.negativeRemarks: no fridge, no coffee marker...
review.locationRemarks: prime

review.title: Just one problem
review.reviewText: The only problem was that a $200 hold was put on my debit card which caused me inconvenience as even though I didn't have any incidental expenses, I couldn't access this money. I am at the end of my trip and funds are low. They should have warned me what would happen when a $200 "hold" is put on to a debit card.
review.locationRemarks: excellent location right by Union Square in the middle of town.

review.title: Spend another 5 minutes searching.
review.reviewText: The hotel needs renovating and the rooms are to small. I've stayed at nicer Garden inns.
review.negativeRemarks: room size

review.title: Great place to stay right off Union Square!
review.reviewText: Great location a block from Union Square so super convenient! Though it is an old hotel the room decor was funky and really great! Bathrooms were a bit small but beds were super comfy. The lobby bar was a cool scene and the Starlight Room was classic - great view!
review.positiveRemarks: Great decor in the rooms... Starlight Lounge on the top floor - very cool!
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom.... but still nice!

review.title: very Good location!
review.reviewText: the hotel is in a very very good location, the staff was very friendly, the room was cozy, little but cozy. Highly recommended!

review.title: Pretty and central, but small and dark
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and centrally located. The staff is very nice, and the lobby is pretty. But, the rooms are tiny and dark. In fact, I could not see in the closet to find my clothes or shoes. Also, for some reason, the cleaning staff continued to bring us new towels, but would not retrieve the used ones. Thus, our already crowded room was filled with mountains of used towels.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby was very nice. The location could not be beat. The staff was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were VERY small and dark.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location!

review.title: Good Enough but Not Great
review.reviewText: You cannot beat the location of this hotel. It is in the center of Union Square and within walking distance of most attractions in San Fransisco. But that is where it ends. Our room was tiny, our bathroom even smaller and the window so dirty you couldn't even see out of it. The lobby has no shops, places to grab coffee or any other items of convenience. The room only has shampoo, conditioner and shower gel, no lotion, q-tips or mini bar. There is nothing special about this hotel other than the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room and bathroom and lack of amenities.
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of Union Square and within walking distance of most SF destinations.

review.title: Proximity and Ambiance
review.reviewText: The best thing about the Sir Francis is its proximity to Union Square, Market Street, etc. We love the entrance and lobby - an Old San Francisco feel to it. Our room was very small with an even smaller bathroom. It had a great tub, however, which we like better than shower only rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of rooms
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't be better

review.title: San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: I wish the bathrooms were a little bigger with more counter top space. Also, I would like a coffee maker in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Very beautiful. Starbucks next door. The Starlight Room at the top is very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking fee is outrageous at $50.00 per night
review.locationRemarks: location is great. Shopping and restaurants are all nearby walking distance

review.title: Great Place shame about the parking
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine, although the bathroom is rather small, and its in a great location. The only down side is the parking. At $57 a day and a 25-30 minute wait for valet to bring it, its an expensive pain.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet Parking
review.locationRemarks: This is central to all the stores and restaurants around Union square

review.title: Lovely:)
review.reviewText: Just finished our Christmas holiday at the Drake, and can't wait to return. The location was perfect, and the staff so attentive. Our little yorkie was treated like a prince, and we never had to look far for help regarding places to go or things to do. I loved the decor, and the hotel really does everything they can to help you make the most of your visit. Loved it!

review.title: What I think
review.reviewText: Very small room as like all the other ones in San Francisco. I was just expecting more given the reputation of Kimpton hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: In the heart of union square.

review.title: A grand experience.
review.reviewText: A perfect location in Union Square. Cable car stop in front of the hotel. Starbucks right next door. Sears and Lori's restaurants across the street
review.positiveRemarks: Eddie the Doorman gave us the most customer service.
review.negativeRemarks: The $57.00 parking fee per day.
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect, walking distance to Union Square.

review.title: The Closet
review.reviewText: Room was the size of a closet and bathroom was smaller the a telephone booth!

review.title: Short holiday stay
review.reviewText: Great location wonderful restuarant. Hotel is old but rooms are renovated. Friendly and efficient staff. Not a five star hotel but a good and comfortable hotel. Excellent value.

review.title: not what expected
review.reviewText:
I didn't expect the lobby to be under renovation. Also, in the smaller older room, our television was to the right of the bed which made watching tv in bed really tough.

Didn't feel like a good value for the money

review.title: nice old quality feel
review.reviewText: The rooms are really tiny so get the biggest room you can afford.

review.title: love San Francisco
review.reviewText:
the hotel is centraly located...from here you can go everywhere without a car..
troley, buses or taxis available all the time..
review.locationRemarks:
The hotel is centraly located...I like Union Square from here you can go everywhere without a car...trolley, buses or taxis available all the time
great location.....

review.title: It is a good hotel in a wonderful location
review.reviewText: It is a good hotel in a wonderful location

review.title: Great service and location with small rooms and old charm.
review.reviewText: Excellent location in walking distance to the heart of Union Square. Outstanding service with smaller hotel charm. Extremely small rooms.

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText:
Definitely impressed with our stay! The hotel restaurant's food was exquisite. Centrally located, rooms and beds were very comfortable. The hotel club had a wonderful view of the city, good music depending on the day.
Will come back one day! Miss you San Francisco.......
review.locationRemarks:
San Fransico
Sausilito
Napa Valley

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the best location, Half a block from Union Square and the cable car stops right outside the front door. Lobby was beautiful and the staff were efficient. We stayed in a historic queen and it was very small but just fine for two. The bathroom was very small as well and the only complaint I have would be that there was no counter space at all to put your toiletries. But other than that the room was clean and was done up well. We would stay here again based on the location. It was in the heart of the action.
review.locationRemarks: We enjoyed the tour of the historic Haas-Lilienthal house in Pacific Heights. We also really enjoyed Alcatrz.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Location is excellent, good access to shopping , cable cars, BART, restaurants. Friendly staff, no complaints.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: Great People, Great Location!!! Pet Friendly!!

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText: Great location and fabulous rooms, even if the bathroom was a little small. And of course, a gorgeous lobby that's perfect for a glass of champagne.

review.title: Fantastic Experience
review.reviewText:
I was in San Fransisco for business and previously was booked into a different hotel (Pickwick). I was absolutely desperate to get out of it. All the hotels were crazy expensive due to a conference ($350 - $480 a night).

I turned to Expedia and it showed me a four star hotel at Union Square, but didn't give me the name. I bought a week and it turned out to be the Sir Francis Drake. I was a little hesitant because I just came from a 1920s hotel that was badly ran.

The Drake was an amazing difference. It was super clean, and everyone there was very nice and super professional. The downs were a slow elevator and a small bathroom. The street outside was a little noisy, but it didn't prevent me from sleeping soundly.

The location can't be beat. I took a cable car home from Fisherman's wharf on the weekend and it took me right to my hotel step. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. I would go back for business or pleasure.

Thanks Drake! :)

review.title: Great location at Union Square
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for its convenience to Union Square and was very happy with my choice. Loved the decor and the staff was very courteous and attentive. Had to wait awhile for valet service getting my car, but that might have been because of the road construction going on the block. Parking was pricey...but that's San Francisco in general. I had my kids with me and the room was small for us, but would like to come back for a romantic weekend.

review.title: Loved our San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: Great hotel close to everything, trolley stops in front of hotel

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: "The Drake" didn't disappoint. The staff were helpful, the room (renovated) was neat and clean. The safe in the room worked without issue. Starbuck downstairs. Best of all is the location, just a block north of Union Square and easy walking access to just about everywhere in SF.

review.title: we were very happy with all aspects of the hotel.
review.reviewText: The location is very good,and the staff very efficient.

review.title: Fabulous and Fun
review.reviewText: Well situated at Union Square. Beautiful room. Great restaurants inside and close by. We were well looked after, and would return in a flash.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Not my first time at the Drake, but a while since our last stay. All of my contacts with hotel staff were friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. My room and bath were small, but spotless. The hotel restaurant, Scala's, is excellent and beautifully paneled and appointed. The cable car line runs directly in front of the hotel affording fun transportation to many places.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: A nice place to stay. Nearby everything you would like to have.

review.title: The Big Apple room size meets SF
review.reviewText: While the hotel has a great location and decent amenities don't plan on spending any time in your room unless it's to sleep (after you crawl over your luggage). The "historic queen" room fits the queen bed and not much else. The bathroom is the size of a small closet and you are wedged next to the door to sit on the head. I haven't seen rooms this small for the price except in Manhatten or parts of Europe. The room was clean but old (historic).. Spring for the extra few bucks to stay at one of the newer hotels. At least you can walk around the beds there.

review.title: Extremely small rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is in great location! That is it! Rooms are extremely small! With Two suitcases on the ground there was not enough space to stand in the room. For that money there were much nicer hotels in Union square I will be choosing in the future!

review.title: Great Find!
review.reviewText: I found The Drake through expedia without having heard anything about it and it was a great find and a wonderful deal when packaged with flights - especially for labor day weekend! The hotel and rooms were very true to the pictures, funky decorating and comfy beds. A little tiny since it is a very old building, but the closet was reasonably sized and so there was room to put away all of our clothes and luggage. A little noisy outside the windows, even on the 9th floor, but didn't keep you up at night and was neat to hear the cable car and whistle going by. Bustling area!

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, staff was good and its in a great location but the bed was rather uncomfortable and you can easily hear everything in the hallway so we didn't get much sleep. I would still recommend this hotel as everything else was great and I'm sure not all beds are as bad as the one we had and we were next to the elevators so there was a lot of traffic in the hallway.

review.title: Made our stay in San Francisco even more fabulous!
review.reviewText:
I had stayed at the Sir Francis Drake on a trip to San Francisco with my parents when I was a kid and now we have taken our kids. The decor in the hotel was outrageously fantastic in the lobby and in the rooms. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

It was close to Union Square and all the shopping, taxi's were easy, the Trolley stop was right outside the door and BART was only a few blocks away. Location was extremely convenient. And to top it off...a full service Starbucks was right downstairs....Great place, my family and I agree that coming back to a great hotel, at night was a great end to a fabulous day in the city.

review.title: Great location in Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square, room was upgraded for free because we were on our anniversary trip. Disappointed the Starlight room was closed for rennovation, but overall we enjoyed this beautiful hotel.

review.title: Best concierge!!
review.reviewText: Location was fantastic, rooms were a touch samll but thats the price you pay for a historical building. The bar in the lobby was beautiful but pricey. But the staff were amazing! Our concierge went above and beyond, the hellhole and doorman were always friendly and helpful, and the front desk was always happy to help. Overall we were very happy with our stay there and would highly recommend it!

review.title: Sir Francis Drake great hotel
review.reviewText:
As a frequent traveller I stay in a lot of hotels, The Sir Francis Drake in San Francisco is a pleasure to stay at from the freindly staff to the exceptional comfort of the rooms. My best hotel experience of the year.
The windows are a little thin and odd fitting, but this adds the the charm of a very old but well maintained and appointed hotel, in a convenient downtown location.
Cannot wait to go back and experience it all again.

review.title: Last minute delight
review.reviewText:
Great hotel. Awesome location and comfy rooms. Last minute planning left us with limited options, but with most hotels in the same price range finding the Drake was like finding a diamond in the rough.

The only items I found a bit irritating were having to pay for almost everything on TV and the lack of a simple radio (although had we known about the iPod base we wouldve been fine). The internet was free after signing up for some Kimpton marketing scheme, but all in all not bad.

Really nice place!

review.title: An "OK" hotel de luxe
review.reviewText: It looks like an old mansion palace like the Pierre in NY (before renovation) with XIXth century feeling, but with a Starbucks in the lobby. The decoration of the room is not so much of my taste, but, eh, no matter, it can be yours. What I did not appreciate is how dirty was the window (from outside) when I lifted the roller. Not something you want to see in this category of hotel. Also, I required for the top floor. Was promised it in the morning, but didn't get it when I came back for the checking process later in the afternoon.

review.title: A Night at the Francis Drake
review.reviewText: I had a great night at the Sir Francis Drake. The doorman was awesome, I told him I wanted valet parking and he was right on it. He was also in command of the area right in front of the hotel, which was nice to know. The rest of the staff were helpful and the bar was hopping all evening. The Starlight lounge was closed so that was a bummer, but the yummy calamari made up for it. I loved my room, I had a historical queen room (not sure if they are all historical). It was unbelievably beautiful. It even has an old styled tub. The street noise was not enjoyable but to be expected. The location is really good. Would not recommend breakfast at Lori's Diner (kitty corner). The fellow next to me thought it was a great breakfast but I did not agree.

review.title: Love the look and the location
review.reviewText: Everything about the Sir Francis Drake is beautiful but the air conditioner in our room broke. They were unable to fix it that night. They did not move us to another room or even offer to pick up our room service bill. For being such a great place we were disappointed that they did not try to make up for our discomfort. But otherwise this hotel is a dream.

review.title: Loved the ambiance
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the heart of union square and close to everything. The newly renovated rooms are great as well as the Drake Bar.

review.title: a good stay
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel with old-time charm. The public rooms have a lot of personality and beauty, and the private room is comfortable with thoughtful design. I was in the "historic" style room, and it was definitely small, but fine for one or two people who are going to spend most of their time out and about, which is what you should be doing in the heart of SF! Only downside is that they were remodeling the entry and some of the lobby area, so you were greeted with scaffolding and hanging fabric as you walked in, which was a bit disappointing, especially in August--such a busy time. Helpful staff, and a wonderful Italian restaurant adjoining. I would stay here again.

review.title: first choice in SF
review.reviewText: This is the most satisfactory hotel during my trip in US. Historical decorations and dress enchant everyone. Nice and welcoming crews are always there. Room is a bit small but very clean and newly furnished. definitely worth a try.

review.title: Nice ornate hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is ornate, but under renovation. The rooms are very small.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Next to Starbucks and Walgreens. Two blocks from China Town! Easy walk to Market street and lots of shopping. The staff was courteous and efficient. The room was very nice.

review.title: worst hotel I ever stayed
review.reviewText: For the first time I used Expedia's "unpublished listings" and regret about it. Hotel is super old and ugly. Valet charge is $52 overnight?! parked in parking across street for $32. Rooms are very small, bathroom is 6'X3' or less.

review.title: Great location and access to tourist attractions.
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was great for cable car and tourist bus access. Starbucks was a wonderful surprise, just around the corner from the hotel. The hotel lobby was beautiful.
The initial experience with the hotel concierge was not good. She was abrasive and borderline rude, telling us, "Well, that's why you should have called me first, before you reserved a car!" This behavior was a bit shocking to us!! I called room service only one time for a tooth brush, which never did arrive. I mentioned the issue at the front desk and they remedied the situation quickly.
Overall we had a nice stay there.

review.title: Great place to stay for shopping and transportation
review.reviewText: The Drake has a program where you may choose $10 couponsin lieu of daily maid service for use in the lounge, nightclub, or Scala's dining room. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. The room was small as were the sheets, but fairly adequate. Very nice early century ambiance and a very friendly and helpful staff. The air conditioning worked very well. Our room had a view of Giant's stadium and the bay.

review.title: San Francisco's Best
review.reviewText: Location, decor and service are fantastic. Have stayed here twice and each time has been perfect. A little on the spendy side, but well worth it.

review.title: Excellent.
review.reviewText:
This was the first stay at the Drake for my wife and I. It was a great experience, and I would recommend this hotel. The room we had was very comfortable and was worth the price. The desk staff and the concierge were very courteous and offered great ideas for sightseeing. Scala's Bistro continues its excellence. We didn't go to the Starlight Room on the top floor, so we can't comment on that.

My only quibble would be for those who will stay on the 20th floor. The views are excellent there, but you are right below the Starlight Room, which is on the 21st floor. On Friday and Saturday nights, the club noise was distracting, but not so distracting that our rest was disturbed. There was no noise from other guests, just the club. On the whole, the hotel was great, just be ready for that.

review.title: Charming and romantic
review.reviewText: great to be in such a great location. easy to get to from airport and rest of the city! we loved it

review.title: minimal amenities
review.reviewText: although the hotel lobby is beautiful, the rooms are small and "musty".Amenities are nil, coffee was gone by 8:00am and there's no microwave or fridge in the room. Seems like they cater more to pets than people. I would like to say that the front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly at check-in

review.title: Great location but beware
review.reviewText:
There were 7 of us staying in 4 rooms for 3 nights as part of a longer vacation. Not our first visit to SF.

Couldn't fault the location right in the centre of downtown.

Most of staff friendly, particularly front desk & concierge who were very helpful. Bell boys very curt though.

Our rooms on 6th floor were satisfactory. However, they were very noisy... from late night partying guests, guests making out next door (what stamina!) and garbage trucks/traffic from 6am. Also, there are no safes in these rooms.

Watch out for scam in lobby bar. On four occasions, despite bringing it to the barperson's attention each time, they tried to charge us 33% more on a bottle of wine compared to the drinks menu price. Also, they try and charge a gratuity (I thought they were voluntary) of 20% on parties of 5 or more in the lobby bar. When challenged they said it was in the menu. It isn't. They then said that it's in the restaurant menu and, because you can order in the lobby bar, that's why you have to pay. I challenged them and got a reluctant refund. I don't mind tipping generously for exceptional service but this is just a rip off.

If you don't need/want your room made up every day of your stay you can claim a $10 voucher, redeemable in the hotel bars/restaurant/nightclub. Thought this was a great idea. Got me $40 of free drinks!

review.title: Big disappointment
review.reviewText: Great location but overpriced for small rooms with worn out decor . Windows are so dirty you cannot see out at all . (second time I found this) . Hotel common areas are magnificent belle epoque !. Staff at reception helpful and charming but none of this makes up for over-priced room for the mediocre quality .

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time / great hotel / right in the middle of everything!

review.title: Great Staff all the time!
review.reviewText: We stayed in one of the newly remodled rooms and it was nice! The Hotel is beautiful lots of old world charm with modern updates. Location Location Location PERFECT! And the staff was very friendly and always willing to help and if you travel with your pets you will find a nice friend named Elvis to great you at the front lobby most times........

review.title: Older Grand Dame in the heart of Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great old hotel in the heart of the city. The first room we were provided was small, cramped, and not very bright. I asked to be relocated and were moved to the corner suite overlooking Union Square...2 windows so very bright and much more space in the room.

review.title: Almost Perfect
review.reviewText: A fine, traditional hotel in a great location, this upscale hotel has a great deal of character. The staff is efficient without being impersonal -- the front desk is particularly effective -- and in general the standards are very high. Hotel location is quite good for a number of San Francisco activities. If there is one glaring weakness, it is the Valet service which often seems AWOL. Thankfully, the concierge, parking staff themselves, and Beefeater (who my wife really liked) made up for the absence.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The room was very nice, close to the elevator. My only complaint is that most hotels now provide a coffee maker in the room. This hotel did not. I missed that convenience of having coffee in my room in the morning.

review.title: Wedding in San Francisco :)
review.reviewText: The hotel location is perfect! The wait for the trolley cars is long in the afternoon, but easy to hop on in the morning. The bell hops are wonderfully accomodating. We had an amazing stay here!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Sir Francis Drake for 2 nights.
The staff was helpful and very friendly.
The hall and rooms were very much to our liking. We loved the decor! It is an older hotel which is what gives it it's charm.
The room was very clean and pleasant.
The bathroom was on the smaller size. However, we didn't come to San Fransisco to spend our time in the bathroom. It had good lighting to apply make up and the tub was large. Again, it was pretty and clean.

So yes! I would recommend Sir Francis Drake. The location is perfect...Right on Powell St.
BTW Starbucks is next door for your morning coffee;)

review.title: Noisy and trashy
review.reviewText: Even though the hotel was not full and we are Kimpton loyalty customers we were given a room directly under the club which was so noisy it was impossible to sleep. We ended up having to move rooms in the middle of the night. No warning was given about the noise or that we would have to deal with lots of drunken revelers in the elevators.

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel! Some people may not appreciate it due to how old it is however we thought it was great!

review.title: Drain was clogged. No shelf space in bathroom. Noisy as hell.
review.reviewText: The hotel has some charm but the windows haven't been washed in years. There is no counter space in the bathroom. The tub took 30 minutes to drain after a 5 minute shower. We were on the fourth floor and the noise was as if we were at street level. Not a bargain for the price.

review.title: Unnecessary Regret
review.reviewText:
Location's great, atmophere's great. location's great, restaurant's great.
However, hotel service in terms of responsiveness and clarity of offer is a let down. Room/toilet looks larger in the photo.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: It was the second time I stayed at the hotel and I decided to go back specially because of its location.

review.title: Great hotel, would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with a grand feeling in a convenient part of town.

review.title: Nice But Older Hotel
review.reviewText: I spent 3 nights at the Sir Frances Drake just after New Year's Weekend in January 2011 with my spouse. Overall the hotel is a pretty good value with friendly service, great location and nice ambience. However, it is an older hotel and one can't expect all of the modern conveniences. The bathroom was tiny with no counter space other than above the toilet. Room was on the small side and had an old television. Room service was terribly slow and overpriced. It might have been the type of room we were in as I have heard that there are larger nicer rooms, but I was a little disappointed.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Had a SMALL corner room right off the elevators. For the price???? Not impressed with the size. It was clean and comfortable, but no coffee in room, and no place to put luggage without tripping! Have stayed in MUCH cheaper rooms with a lot more "oomph"! For the price, would not go back!

review.title: Christmas Miracle in Union Square
review.reviewText: Wonderful time in Union Square for Christmas, very romantic, comfortable and magical. A walk to all shops, great food, amazing views.

review.title: Good value on Union Square, San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is an aging/aged hotel just off Union Square in San Francisco -- terrific location. The room was clean and well-appointed, albeit a bit weird (the closest was a larger space than the bathroom). There was a connecting door to an adjacent room and, when people were there, I could hear every sound. Happily, the neighbors left the day I moved in.

review.title: Don't Duck the Drake
review.reviewText: With a jaunty Beefeater to help with bags, you know you're in a slightly different world. Just a 1/2 block from Union Square and 2 blocks from Chinatown's Grant Avenue, this 1920's hotel is grand, indeed, and the lobby seems always busy with guests and party goers (lots of wedding business). Yet the rooms are quiet and well maintained. Have stayed here many times over the years, and never disappointed.

review.title: Disappointing for the price
review.reviewText:
In 2009, we went to San Francisco and stayed in a really nice hotel for the same price in the same area. This year, they did not have availability, so we decided to try a different one in the same area and that a had a similar price. What a disappointment. First, they try to push us to a room with less amenities that we paid for! And the new room was not that much better either! The towels were poor quality and the carpet was so dirty that made my allergies get worse!
Seriously, there are better hotels in the area for the same price and that are unbelievably better than that!

review.title: Sir Drake - cool and good location
review.reviewText: Cool hotel smack dab in the middle of union square. Would be nice if there was a middle ground between relatively dead lobby bar and over-the-top starligfht lounge, but what can you do. As with most other SF hotels, the raping you take on parking is ludicrous...but again, what can you do.

review.title: Great Old hotel w/ some very small rooms and some really nice rooms
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights and the first night was in a TINY shoebox of a room-very stuffy and the sink was so close to the toilet my wife hit her head sitting down. We complained and the staff was VERY ACCOMODATING and moved us to a lovely room. Based on our first night- we would not be returning. Based on our second night- what a great old hotel.

review.title: "Expected So Much More"
review.reviewText: Entering the Sir Francis Drake and checking in went well. The hotel lobby is quite nice, and location is great! My problem is the room itself, which is a big problem and disappointment. I paid for a suite, and expected something really special, especially since their website led me to believe that it would be quite elegant. The suite was old, small, and had an odor about it. The bathroom was truly horrible. I tried to switch rooms, and check a few others out, but they were all pretty much the same condition. My only relief was that I didn't stay in my room for any length of time.. I just wish it would have been what the website led me to believe I would be getting.

review.title: Worst hotel ever
review.reviewText: The reception team were rude, unhelpful and failed to explain their deposit taking policy thus causing my card to be incorrectly debited and then they found every excuse to not rectify the situation quickly. The dcor was tired, the wall coverings stained, the paintwork dirty. The room was dirty the skirtings had not been cleaned for years, the windows were so dirty they were opaque. The heating system was noisy and it was impossible the get a comfortable room temperature. The room was tiny with insufficient space to open 2 suitcases at the same time. The linen was clean, but the bed covering was dirty and needed dry cleaning. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, with the most unhelpful/rude staff, and it wasn't cheap either. I will not be staying there on my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Wonderful experience
review.reviewText: Excellent from start to finish.

review.title: Convient and comfortable
review.reviewText: This is a good no-frills hotel for a brief business stay.

review.title: Hotel right in front of cable car line!
review.reviewText: Had a great time in SF and a nice time at Sir Francis Drake. The hotel was clean and staff was great. Rooms are as expected, small. The corner room was an excellent choice. Didn't hear a peep from the neighbors and had nice windows. I called ahead and requested the corner room after reading other reviews and I was very pleased with the end result.

review.title: Disappointing hotel in great location
review.reviewText:
Great location, fancy hotel. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny. Like most other hotels in the area, there is no parking lot. They offer very expensive valet parking.

We used their offer for a $10 voucher if we waive housekeeping. Thought we would use it in their breakfast restaurant for a cheap breakfast. Not so! Breakfast was very expensive even after our voucher. You would think coffee/tea/OJ that are not priced on the menu would be free, but no, they are $4.50 each.

review.title: Drake-Fred
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, I enjoyed seeing the old style rooms. The rooms may be a bit small if two people shared the room. For me it was fine, I was alone. Bathroom very small, but again for as much as I was there it was fine. The Drake was fine since I spent very little time there

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Room was great. The ice machine was out of order on my floor during my stay, but otherwise I had a great experience. The nice thing about this hotel is that if you choose to not have maid service for a day, they give you a $10 credit to their hotel restaurants. Scala's Bistro was fabulous, I ate their for breakfast most mornings and their Strawberry French Toast was to die for. I loved the location, and the trolley stops right outside the hotel. Also Union Square was just a block away. Their conference rooms were rather cold, and the chairs not very comfortable. We had a training class during my stay.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Our experience at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel was great! We took BART in and it was a 4 block walk to the hotel from the Union Station. The front desk staff were friendly and and helpful with things like maps.
We we arrived to our room, we found it to be small but very clean. The cleanliness was maintained throughout our stay.
The only negative experience we had during our stay was a rude concierge - so we got our travel information elsewhere. It was disappointing because the rest if the staff was great.
The area is excellent - there is a cable car stop outside of the hotel. It is a short walk to Chinatown and then you can walk through North Beach to Fisherman's Wharf. There is lots of shopping and tons of restaurants all around the hotel.
I would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The room was small but clean and the bed was comfy. I had a pipe in the bathroom that started dripping water on the 3rd day. I called and asked to change rooms and was moved immediately. For the price and location, I was very satisfied. You can walk to BART and it's a 8.10 ride on BART to/from the airport. The trolley cars are at the bottom of Powell Street. Great location - go outside the downtown area for the real good food.

review.title: Classic hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel. Good, friendly service. Room was nice but small, which was expected due to the age of the hotel. It could use an update, but has a very classic look and feel. At the starlight lounge we were treated extremely well as hotel guests. Location was great with easy access to the cable cars and easy walking to chinatown. We walked all the way to the golden gate park which was a bit of a hike, but there are many sights on the way.
