review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Parking 50.00 plus per night.
The old girl is a little long in the tooth.

review.title: a wonderful stay
review.reviewText: We found the staff to be very welcoming and helpful when we checked in. We also enjoyed a meal in the restaurant downstairs. The room was very comfortable. We really couldn't find any fault with the hotel and its central location is excellent. We would definitely stay again when we are in the area.

review.title: A fading grand dame in a brilliant location
review.reviewText: The "Drake" has seen better times, but the location is wonderful. Less than a minute's walk to Union Square, across the street from Borders and several yards from a Starbucks, and at a cable car stop, one can perhaps forgive the begging homeless that are generally about this area of San Francisco. Another bonus is that the restaurant Scala's is next door, and is a great place to eat.. (reservations are recommended). I would suggest asking for a room in the tower, (the highest three floors), but be aware that on the 21st floor Harry Denton's Starlite Room becomes loud when the music starts at around 8:30 in the evening, you WILL hear the music in your room. The best time to visit there for an amazing view of the City is around 6:30 or so, before the action begins. I would definitely return to this landmark property.

review.title: Perfect SF location
review.reviewText:
Right at Union Square, near lots of shopping and restaurants. 3 blocks to BART or Muni transportation station. Chose it because last time we were in SF, staying elsewhere, we asked a local business for restaurant recommendation. They said "Scala Bistro," hands down and we ate there twice that trip. Decided to make Scala Bistro's hotel OUR hotel! Good choice. Actually brought our extended family for dinner to celebrate a 60th wedding anniversary.
Older, cozy place with long, famous SF history. Beautiful lobby bar. Rooms/bathrooms not huge, but fine. Skip maid service and they give you a $10 coupon for the restaurant breakfast, which is incredible. Wouldn't stay anywhere else.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: The location was great, and the service (especially the doormen) was exceptional. The bathroom was a bit small, but it worked well for just the two of us. The location--only a block or so from Union Square--was great. We wouldn't have needed to rent a car (although we did) because of the location and the proximity of many destinations within walking distance and several alternatives for public transportation. The hotel offered the alternative of $10 a day to spend at the hotel restaurants if we agreed to forgo the cleaning services for that day. It was an alternative that we took advantage of.

review.title: First rate hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel! The room was very attractive, clean and bright. The hotel was historical, clean, and well-maintained. All the staff were courteous and helpful. Great doormen. Convenient location, good restaurant. Loved the ability to opt out of daily cleaning service to save on environment. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends!

review.title: Glad I tried it
review.reviewText:
The lobby and common areas of this charming and historic hotel have been beautifully maintained, but the guest rooms are definitely showing their age. While clean, peeling paint and wallpaper were clearly visible. The room - and especially the bathroom - is very small (think European hotels), but if you use the hotel mostly as a place to sleep and shower, they're plenty big. If you like to spend a lot of time lounging in your room, you'd probably be more comfortable someplace else.
The front desk staff was friendly and helpful with everything from extra towels to restaurant recommendations, but the doormen were a mixed bag.
A word about the Starlight Lounge on the top floor - if you go, be prepared to dress up a bit (we were out of place in nice jeans), and have a 70s disco frame of mind (a little chest hair and your heaviest gold chain will fit in just fine). It struck us as being a little cheesy, but the place was packed.

review.title: All Booked Up
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay, but upon our arrival, the Sir Francis Drake had over booked. They sent us down the street to another upper end hotel. It was actually nicer than the Drake. The service was excellent and the rooms were great.

review.title: Drake disappointing
review.reviewText: Room was shabby, bathroom was out of the 1950's Furnishings looked like thrift shop rejects, badly in need of a make-over. Hotel staff were excelent.

review.title: asi-asi
review.reviewText: The decor, design is pretty cool but customer service for special circumstances is definitely lacking. Probably ok for regular check-in, check-out guests but if you need special services, don't expect efficient service.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Hotel was great and in a convenient location. Karen, the concierge was awesome. She helped us prior to our stay with a car rental and during our stay with winery suggestions and reservations for our trip to wine country. The only complaint is that the bathroom is too small.

review.title: Not as Great as Advertised
review.reviewText: I agree with earlier reviews that said this is a mediocre hotel. My 2 main complaints were that we paid for a room that was supposed to have 2 queen beds, and they said they were queen beds when we checked in, but in fact they were doubles. The whole room was tiny, as others have said, and the bathroom was really cramped too. Secondly, I don't believe the air conditioning worked at al during our 2 night stayl; despite the controls on the wall that said otherwise, it was just a fan, the air wasn't cold, and the room never got down to the temperature I set it at. Because the hotel lobby was so busy, as others have also said, I never took these matters up with the management, because I guess I didn't expect that they would do anything about it anyway. Overall, the location is good, and the price was ok too, but I think there are better hotel choices in SF, and next time I'll likely try something else.

review.title: The Drake. A Historic Mark In Union Square
review.reviewText: Had a blast in SF. The Drake was beauttiful and I cannot wait to go back.

review.title: SanFran - never again
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small but functional.

review.title: A mediocre tourist hotel
review.reviewText:
Long story short, the Sir Francis Drake's heyday is long past. It may once have been a landmark hotel in San Francisco, but today it's yet another middling Union Square tourist trap trying to jam people into tiny rooms.

From the lengthy check-in queue at the front desk to the bored doorman who couldn't seem to flag down a cab during rush hour, expect to be underwhelmed by the service. The rooms are similarly unimpressive, suffering from crammed bathrooms, ugly decor, and poor-quality bedding (cheap mattress pads, tiny awkward pillows). Even getting a bath mat after our first night's stay required a call to the front desk.

If all you need is a room, it's not a bad option. But if you're looking for a nice place for a vacation or a business trip, avoid the Sir Francis Drake. The crush of tourists and the noise and grime of Union Square make it an unappealing option, even at a discount price.

review.title: What an Electrical Nightmare
review.reviewText:
My room was not ready at check in. I had to call back in an hour.

After finally getting into my room, I had a shower and went shopping. On my return, the maid had visited the room, and I quickly discovered the room had no power. Lights Only.
I had to manually visit the front desk, and inform them. (No phone without power).

It took hours to discover the fault was in the room next to me. (Shorting out the circuit breaker.).

The Hotel is in a great location, but under new management.
Rooms are small, but adequate. Still I won't go back after such a bad experience.

review.title: Amazing Location
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake Hotel is one of those fantastic,old buildings that you expect to find in Europe. The lobby is stunning and really a comfortable place to hang out. The doorman dressed in full Beefeater costume is a great touch when you come and go. The front desk and concierge staff were helpful and really friendly and upbeat.The room were a bit small and while it was nicely decorated and very clean it was showing its age in places. We were not there to spend time in our room so it certainly didn't bother us. The location is fantastic. A half block from Union Square and the cable cars stopped within feet from the front door. We loved it.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Very good hotel, the best location for hotel in St-francisco. If you want to feel the beat of a old and historic hotel, it's the place to be.

review.title: Room is small but great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is at great location next to union square. It's very easy to go anywhere! However, if your big interest is the FOOD near hotel, it could be a hard thing to do. :-( Hotel rooms are fairly small which you should know about it before you book it. Over all it's a nice hotel.

review.title: Historic charm
review.reviewText: Great location at Union Square. Older hotel that still has the modern feel. I enjoyed the evening cocktails in the lobby bar. The roof top bar was straight out of the seventies and over the top (not in a good way). The restaurant/bistro at street level was great. There was a Walgreen directly across the street for day-trip shopping. Starbucks at street level too.

review.title: Treated like Royalty at Sir Francis Drake
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Francisco and our stay at the Sir Francis Drake was great. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The lobby and reception area are beautiful! Our room was small, but we knew that going in. It could use a little freshening up - very clean, but needs a bit of a facelift (when we learned the hotel is some 80 years old our opinion relaxed somewhat, and our view from the 20th floor reminded us we would be spending most of our time outside anyway). We loved that you could opt out of housekeeping and get a voucher to use on room service or at the adjacent bar/restaurant. Even if you are a guest at the hotel there is still a cover charge up at Harry Denton's starlight room, we didn't go in since we were hoping to just have a quick drink and didn't think it was worth it. Scala's was wonderful, their Top Chef is great! The hotel is in a great spot! If you need your morning java fast and don't want room service there is a Starbucks downstairs. Union square is just a couple blocks away, so is Nob Hill and the Cable Car stops right in front. We had a great time at the Sir Francis Drake!

review.title: Never again!
review.reviewText: This hotel presents nicely from the outside. Inside, however, the bathroom was so small that you needed to be a gymnast to use the facilities. The worst part of this hotel is their policy on incidentals. They charge one hundred dollars a night to your credit card for incidentals and the room doesn't even have a mini-bar. I was there for 5 nights and was told that I would not be able to order room service and charge it to my room, even though the hotel had placed a $300 authorization on my card. On my second day, my credit card's theft department called me to ask if my card had been stolen. Even though my room was prepaid, the hotel had attempted several authorizations for amounts as high as $900. Much of my trip was spent with a card that was unusable due to these incedental charges. Save yourself the hassle and go somewhere else.

review.title: Big Disappointment with Sir Francis Drake!
review.reviewText:
I would never stay here again. The hotel staff were not very friendly. There were no room cards for nearly 2 days to get into your room. There was no apology to anyone from management.

The rooms are extremely old and the furniture is depressing and worn-out. My bathroom was very tiny and the shower stall left alot to be desired. The location of the hotel was alright - right outside are the cable cars. But overall, it was a very disappointing experience. The one good thing about the hotel is the SCALA BISTRO restaurant in the hotel. Very good food and the head chef is Jennifer Biesty from Season 4 of TOP CHEF.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: A gorgeous building. Beautiful lobby. Nice staff. Nice room, comfortable. Nice curtains that made the room dark. Slept in well as it was quiet as well. Great restaurant downstairs and they allow dogs!

review.title: Not terribly impressed
review.reviewText: As said above: the room was tiny, the bathroom door would not stay closed, the closet was not big enough to set the small suitcase up on the rack inside the closet, and the drinks in the lounge were a ripoff. The starlight lounge at the top had an okay view, but not as nice as others we've been in in SFO.

review.title: Nice ancient place. Not going back...
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby and other areas overall are just beautiful! The rooms were clean, the staff was extremely friendly and very helpful in giving directions, tips on where to eat, what to see...The only thing is the rooms were a little old and outdated. The toilet took forever to flush and I thought it was broken at some point. There really is no view unless you get a room overlooking the noisy street. If you dont mind an old boutiquey kind of room then its definitely worth the money and the stay as the hotel is just close to everything: restaurants, shopping, transportation. The only reason I would not go back is because I'm more of a Westin kind of person. (which was just across the street but...)

review.title: It's a good hotel; as long as we get our money back, I'm okay with the change of plans
review.reviewText: See above

review.title: Kimpton Hotels does it right!!!!
review.reviewText: Fantastic staff, great room, great location. Wished we could stay longer will return to stay at same place next time. Every Kimpton Hotel I have stayed in (8)has been perfect

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Good value and a great downtown location! If you want a 5 Star hotel at 3.5 star prIces you are not going to get it anywhere in SFO! The staff are attentive and if you need somehting all you need to do is ask. The free internet is a real bonus!

review.title: Great Charm and location
review.reviewText: Great experience at this hotel. Hotel is charming and has a beautiful lobby and bar. Hotel is in a great location walking distance to shops and restaurants. This hotel is not for the modern person as it has a old charm and rooms are a bit small, with that said was very clean and accomidating would definetly stay here again

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Sir Francis Drake for four nights and its location was ideal for us doing the tourist bit. The cable car stop was virtually outside the hotel.
The staff on the reception desk were friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Coffee making facilities in the room or within the hotel would have been welcome rather than having to use Starbucks on the corner. We had stayed earlier at another Kimpton hotel in Chicago, the Allegro, where coffee was available for guests in the reception area each morning as well as an evening wine reception.

review.title: would not recommend
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel lobby, excellent restaurant
Old hotel with maintenance issues - power kept going out in rooms & took very long for maintenance to correct
hotel staff very pleasant, but most were ineffectual in doing what was requested i.e. getting power turned back on in rooms - one day it took 4 requests & 13 hrs.
convenient location, but plenty of other hotels in same area

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
Good rate. Room was extremely small. they did not havie a coffee pot in the room or newspaper at the door in the AM. It was clean and housekeeping very nice. Scala Restaurant was excellent but the 3 women taking care of the lobby bar spent more time talking with each other than taking care of clientele.

I would recommend the hotel but with clarification in size of room and aminities.

review.title: It's all in the location
review.reviewText: The hotel is quite obviously old and pretty minimally decoorated/maintained, however it is clean and servicable and for the price you cannot do better in this location. So convenient to Union Square / cable car / etc - it is more upmarket than a lot around the area but outside the lobby (which is truly nice) the rest of the accommodations are ordinary. I would definately stay here again if Im looking for somewhere central.

review.title: Would definitely return to this hotel
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake was a wonderful hotel to stay. It was just my teenage son and I, so although our room was very small, we didn't spend much time in the room, as this hotel was so conveniently located (cable car stop right outside the hotel front door) we found ourselves hoping on and off all the pubic transportation a few steps away to explore this great city. We especially loved our concergies (Lane and Michelle) who went above and beyond their duties to help us visit every wonderful thing to see in San Francisco. We felt like old long-lost friends rather than guests to alot of the staff even though it was our first visit and we were only there 5 days. If you're looking for a great hotel at a wonderful price, go on expedia and book it.....it is well worth it!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Upon arriving at my room, I found it small but very nice and --- noisy. I could hear the people next door speaking, and there was a lot of noise from the streetcar outside since the room was on the fourth floor. I also was surprised not to find a hair dryer or coffee maker in the room. I asked the front desk and they brought me both. I was told that hair dryers are usually in the room, but they only bring coffee makers to those who ask (going green). The following morning, I asked to be moved due to the noise and was moved to the 15th floor. That solved the noise problem, and I got a partial water view, which was very nice. That room did have the hair dryer in it. I did not ask for the coffee maker this time because I did not like the coffee provided with it. I also got a call from the front desk mid-way through my stay asking me how my stay was going and whether I needed anything, i.e. bathrobe, etc., which I thought was a nice touch. This hotel also had a promotion going on where, for the sake of going green, for each day you opted not to have your room cleaned, you received a $10 credit to use at any of their restaurants. I thought that was a great idea and took advantage of it - no need to have your room cleaned every day - especially when you're travelling alone.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is great, it's right in the middle of union square there is a trolley line right out front. The parking is expensive but there is reasonible parking a few blook away. The hotel it classic and beautiful. The rooms were not exactaly what we expected they were nice and clean but very small. The bathroom is tiny small, the toilet was so small that it was almost comical. The hotel staff was very nice, no problems otherwise. Enjoyed but probably not again.

review.title: Housekeeping Staff does not turn in left behind articles
review.reviewText:
I left my favorite expensive belt hanging over the shower curtain and calle dthe very next day to ask about it. The housekeeping attendant and all the others who eneter the room at checkout denied seeing it.
It left a bad taste in my mouth.

review.title: grand old hotel
review.reviewText: great place but the room is too small.

review.title: Solid Hotel in the heart of the City!
review.reviewText: Its a nice hotel. Rooms are small but that should be expected in the heart of San Francisco.

review.title: NorCAl Vacation
review.reviewText: This hotel is situated next to the Union district of San Francisco. It provided us with easy access to many venues around the city. Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz Cruises and Chinatown are all within minutes of the Sir Francis Drake. For those of you traveling with 4 or more here is a little secret: It is cheaper to take a taxi than the cable cars if you don't buy an all-day pass. Of course if you like to experience the cable cars, please do. It is a friendly way to see different parts of San Francisco served by the cable cars. Shopping at Macy's, Nordstrom, and Niketown is just a couple blocks away. There are many restaurants nearby to choose from. Also like the fact that there is a Starbucks attached to the hotel. Be sure to check out the tin ceilings inside many establishments. They are quite interesting to admire.........overall I enjoyed my stay at the Sir Francis Drake. Staff was responsive to our needs, room was clean and neat and location was great. Remember, this is an older hotel so don't expect the latest and greatest in electronic gadgetry. You are here to relax and vacation, not to be on the Internet all day and/or watch cable tv. Get out and enjoy the town and take notice how the town transforms from daytime hustle and bustle to nighttime entertainment . Be sure to enjoy the great restaurants that abound in and around the city. For a taste of something different, travel to Valencia Street in the Mission District for an experience of a different type of fun.

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: When we entered the hotel we were greeted by the famous door man. He helped us wit our bags and we checked in. All the staff was very friendly. The room is a little small even though we reserved the queen tower room. I expected that since it is an older hotel. We ate at their famous food establishment downstairs and was very impressed with the service and food. Just a great time!

review.title: Good location. Small but comfortable rooms.
review.reviewText: Great location for business or personal travel; Rooms are smallish but comfortable. I would recommmend for a couple who just need a well located room or for business travel, but not for families. The hotel is convenitnely located near a light rail (BART) stop.

review.title: Nothing Special
review.reviewText: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. With a cable car stop right outside the main entrance, and Union Square a block away, you cannot beat the prime location of this hotel. The rooms are fairly small and not well maintained; Stained headboards, chipped paint, and a bathroom door that wouldn't close all the way were the features of my room. Despite the great location, I would pay a little more to pay in a higher quality hotel.

review.title: Goos place to stay
review.reviewText:
I liked SirFrancis Drake. I went there 23 years ago, so for me was a dip in the past.
The hotel has a good position.
They have to work on modernisation of the rooms.
Overall I was satisfied

review.title: Great SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, lovely hotel and wonderful minnestrone soup and bread at 11pm after night at the theater. Near all the shopping and little theaters. Check out ticket booth in Union Sq for shows just around the corner. no worries about taxies or ending up on a bad street.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: Stayed here right next to Union Square - great location, plus dancing to a DJ on the 21st floor for late night activities. Room was small, in particular bathroom in terms of spreading out any toiletries. Would do it again with out hesitation.

review.title: JUST AVERAGE AND THAT'S SAYING A LOT
review.reviewText: I was looking forward to staying at this historic hotel with my husband, but was disappointed. First, this hotel will assign you the most average of rooms if they see you booked through expedia and not directly with them. We had to go back and ask for a better room which they gave us when we said we were celebrating our anniversary. My husband and I went to the chic lobby for a drink and to enjoy the ambiance, but instead watched a scene from CSI--the SF police hauling these middle aged, dishoveled and apparently drunk women from the hotel elevator to the middle of the lobby in handcuffs. Disturbing.....The walls are thin cause it is an older hotel--we could hear the after-prom party down the hall all night long until we called the front desk. They seemed to be oblivious as to what was happening in the hotel.When we checked out, I could not do it from the room television set which is more convenient than going to the front desk. When I told the employee at the front desk, he seemed not to care (he could have at least faked it).....

review.title: SF Drake 2010
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel also 2 years ago. The position is great, the service is excellent. Rooms are a little small, but that's ok, considering the position and the price ( and being a newyorker, small is normal). It's always one of my first choices when I come to SF.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: The service of the staff was outstanding. The only issue was the size of the bathroom.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText:
They tried to "nickel and dime" us to death. I mean $5 for a tiny toothbrush and paste. $3 for a 50 cent bottle of water, parking at over $50 a night, paying for items that at other hotels are free, etc.
We would not use that hotel again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location; on the cable car stop and very close to Union Square. We did not eat in the hotel. When we noticed that there were no bathrobes in the room, the bellman promptly got us two of them.

The bed was VERY comfortable..the towels could have been thicker. Perhaps, they could spend their money on towels instead of the logo on the shower curtain!

We were in the hotel for two nights. I left a pair of slacks in the closet. When I called, housekeeping mailed them out the same day!

All the staff was very accomodating, and I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Worth the stay!
review.reviewText: Great location very helpful staff.

review.title: Will try another hotel on next visit
review.reviewText: The room however had no heat, very cold, maintenance brought a hand sized space heater that didnt work, serviced offered to chang our room after 1am but we were allready settled in. very uncomfortable

review.title: Not Impressed.
review.reviewText: Old but fairly well maintained. Too expensive for what you get. Parking fee was excessive and not flexible  should cost much less if car was left in parking lot entire time.

review.title: Wonderful Time in San Fran
review.reviewText: This was our second trip to the city . Last time we stayed near Fisherman's Wharf and had a great time and a great location . This time we went partly to shop and also to see a play . The Drake is excellent for bothof these . Both times we bought a Muni Pass and use it as our only source of transportation besides walking . It is probably the best deal in the city .

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: I would stay here again. The location is conveniently located in the heart of San Francisco. The staff is very friendly and seem to want to make sure you have a great stay.

review.title: room decor was really bad
review.reviewText:
It was just okay. We paid more for the view room. The windows were dirty. Hard to see the view. The windows were average in size. They wouldn't open,

None of us could undestand the room decor. We decided this room was used with left over stuff. We had a lovely time. We have been at better places there locally.

review.title: Not bad for the price
review.reviewText: I was going to celebrate my birthday weekend & paid extra for a King tower suite but upon arrival was given a queen. I called the front desk & they rectified the problem. However, when I booked the room the website said there were his & hers robes & there wasn't. There also wasn't a bath mat in either of the rooms that I was in, to put on the cold tile after your shower. They did however give me complimentary drink coupons to make up for the inconvenience. Aside from this, I would recommend this hotel. It was worth the price for location, service, & cleanliness alone!

review.title: Historic Gem
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, great ambiance, historical and fantastic night club.

review.title: Great location and ambiance
review.reviewText: Great location. Great lobby area, with fireplace upstairs. Rooms small, but it's an older building, so this is expected. If you get a drink in the lobby (there is a small bar there) know that the tip is included in the price! I tipped the bartender cash and charged the drink to my room...when I checked out I noticed a gratuity for the drink on my bill....very sneaky! But they took the gratuity off and all was forgiven. Charming place with Starbucks attached next door. Room service was not reliable, though. I called room service and had to leave a message (which was never returned). I got too hungry waiting and just went looking for some takeout. Nice workout room (small but clean with good equipment). Aside from the room service ignoring me, I'd still say it was a good place to stay. Great price for the location.

review.title: Sir Francisis Drake
review.reviewText: Great time would go back in a flash

review.title: Ok but unimpressive
review.reviewText:
Pros:
Great location. Located just a block from Union Square.
Friendly front desk staff and connoisseur.
Architecture of the hotel lobby is incredible.
Star light club located on the 21st floor.

Cons:
Room was small with a even smaller bathroom.
Room heater/AC was rather ineffective.
Expensive valet parking.

review.title: Loved the location
review.reviewText: I'm always a fan of Kimpton hotels and this is why we booked our stay at the Sir Francis Drake. We loved the look and feel of the Drake and the staff went out of their way to be helpful and informative whenever we had a question. As for location - you can't beat it. We were within walking distance of nearly everything, including Fisherman's Wharf, and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Best Location, Character
review.reviewText: Walking distance to many shops, restaurants, theaters, and public transportation. We were able to go everywhere conveniently. The bathroom was very small, but clean. The room did not have a frig or coffee maker, and had a small closet and a small dresser. The beds were comfortable, and other than the space issues, the hotel itself had a lot of character, and was at a great location. I would go again...

review.title: Not my favorite Kimpton Hotel
review.reviewText: I visit San Francisco once a year at New Years with my best friend. We've had really great experiences at other Kimpton Hotels in the area (particularly the Serrano and the Palomar). This time, the experience was mixed. The hotel staff was very friendly and the room itself was clean and well maintained. However, the hotel, although apparently revamped a few years ago, was not very attractive or particularly inviting. The other Kimpton Hotels are extremely charming. Additionally, on New Year's Eve, our floor of the hotel ended up being filled with very drunk revelers who never went to sleep. Next time, I suspect we'll return to one the smaller boutique hotels.

review.title: GOOD DEAL, BEST LOCATION
review.reviewText: the best location, one block to Union Square, good service, good price, the room are little small but they are ok. When you go ask for the rooms in the corners, is the same price but bigger rooms.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: All around good stay. The location is the best.

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: great experience

review.title: A piece of San Francisco history
review.reviewText: This was our third stay at the Sir Francis Drake during the Holiday Season. We enjoy this hotel because of its history and character as well as its close proximity to Union Square. However, with an older facility, you have to expect some sacrifices as far as room size, bathroom size and amenities, etc. Another positive aspect of the Sir Francis Drake is that room prices have always been fairly low compared to other Union Square hotels. Just be aware that parking fees are a significant additional cost above and beyond the room rate and taxes.

review.title: i would deffinately visit again.
review.reviewText:
the front desk and hotel staff were extremely helpful and very friendly.
it was a great experience.
the starlite lounge upstairs, well the service was not that great.
and prices are very high.
over all we had a great trip.

review.title: It'll be a very cold day before I go back
review.reviewText:
Short version: my room was really, REALLY cold and nobody at the Sir Francis Drake cared. I won't be going back.

Long version: the thermostat read between 60 and 64, but I'm certain it was colder, since I actually had trouble moving my fingers to type on my laptop after a while.

I set the thermostat to the maximum of 80 but that only turned on a fan, which made it feel even colder.

Of course, I complained multiple times, asking for help or a new room, and was always told "we'll send engineering up to take a look."

But engineering never came.

I'll concede that it was cold in San Francisco that day, and the windows in this (charmingly) older building are inherently drafty. Still, the temperature control -- a key component of a room's comfort -- was clearly broken, making for a terribly uncomfortably experience, made even moreso by management's unwillingness to do anything about it.

Following my visit, I communicated my concerns with Kimpton's corporate office, and received a prompt apology in reply, which copied the management of the Sir Francis Drake. But two weeks later, I've yet to hear anything from the hotel itself.

Of course, ignoring problems seems to be entirely in keeping with the hotel's approach to dealing with them.

Avoid.

review.title: awesome location
review.reviewText: I stayed last yr and was unimpressed with hotel and staff but stayed because of location. this time staff was extremely helpful and attentive.

review.title: It was nice
review.reviewText:
The rooms were a bit small (the bathroom especially) but they were nicely decorated and clean. I could have used a few more tv channels, we didn't have cable.. The room was in a good location right next to union square.. The hotel staff was very courtous and easily accesable..
I would go back..

review.title: Very frustrating
review.reviewText: We had booked our room on 10/31/09. We check in the hotel at 5:30 PM on 11/27/09. We were given the only available room on the 4th floor (smoking section); although the room was non-smoking. We come back after dinner around 8 PM to find out that the thermostat was not working and there was loud noises coming from the next door. The hotel staff transferred us to 15th floor (pet-friendly floor) around 9 PM. The dog was howling next door. We were then transferred to the 17th floor only to find out that the hotel staff gave our key to some other guest as they tried to enter our room around midnight. And we could hear a baby crying almost all night. So overall, our experience was very bad and frustrating. This was our first time and absolutely the last at Sir Francis Drake hotel. We feel that our money for the stay should be refunded.

review.title: Starlight tragedy
review.reviewText: Was on the top floor (21) just underneath the Starlight room and the deafening thumping music was a sleep depriving tragedy until 2:00 a.m. The hotel indicated other available rooms were worse as they were next to elevator shafts. Word to the wise: if you plan to actually sleep in this hotel room book a low floor and suffer the loss of the great view from the top.

review.title: Old, charming, elegant Hotel, but lacking service
review.reviewText:
I stay at the Sir Francis Drake any time I visit San Francisco. At first we were given a very noisy room(right on Powell Street) and requested to changeto a different room and was very satisfied with the new location. What is lacking at the hotel is service. There were some that "cared", but for the most part, the staff seemed unhappy and not willing to help. We had to track down the personel to order a drink and witnessed more than one experience of unhappy customers.

Overall though, I would give a good rating and come again due to cleaniness of the rooms, and convenient location to everything.

review.title: Clean but shabby
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly but the hotel and room were somewhat shabby. Windows had a layer of grime. Restaurant had great food and service for breakfast. Seemed like a very nice very old hotel that was down on its luck.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I realize that it is an old hotel (1928); however, with the exception of an elegant lobby that is as far as it went. The room, though clean, was small and in terrible condition. Very Spartan with a bare light bulb in a small closet. Cable TV had maybe 10 channels with no movie or sports channels. The elevators are small and extremely slow with a very small elevator lobby, which backed up considerable due to a very active dance club on the 21st floor. Be prepared to wait! Location is great though with a cable car stop in front, and Union Square two buildings down the street. Door men are very helpful but they need to put some money back into this place.

review.title: You can't miss the valet
review.reviewText: Incredible lobby bar and rooftop lounge. Beatiful architecture. Friendly staff.

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Great location. Nice room, although bathroom was small. Had a lot of fun in the Starlight Room.

review.title: The Palace
review.reviewText: As I arrived to the front door of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel and exited my taxi cab I was graciously greated by an extremely charming gentlemen in his elegant red armour that kindly escorted us to the Hotel Check Lobby. This kindness immediately set the tone for a very attentive and accomodating stay from all that worked in Hotel. From that moment forward our stay was exceptional. Not to mention the scrumptious food in the Restaurant"Scalas" and decadent dessert. For you Starbucks lovers, Starbucks is located right below hotel and every morning I awakened by the aroma of freshly brewed coffee. Sir Francis Drake is centrally located to fine dining, shops, specialty stores and let''s not forget Walgreens which is open 24 hours and has all those items some of us tend to forget when traveling. Thank you Expedia and thank you Sir Frances Drake Hotels for taking pride in assuring us excellent services. My favorite quote from Shakespeare says it best Thank you WITH my heart.

review.title: Fantastic...
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean and the location was great for getting around to the tourist locations like Alcatraz. The ambiance was amazing because the hotel maintained characteristics from another period.

review.title: Fabulous, especially for the price!
review.reviewText: Courteous staff who had our room ready early and answered all our questions. Really everything you need for a fine downtown stay in SF. Lots of extras (including a great restaurant and lovely bar), without the luxury prices!

review.title: Old World Feel
review.reviewText: Location and old world feel are what make this hotel. I would definitely return.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Rooms very small but, hotel is very nice.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the heart of Union Square. The lobby of the hotel was elegant and had an older feel to it. The room and bed was much smaller than I expected for what we paid. I think if the rooms and bathrooms were updated it would be a great place to stay.

review.title: Great Location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had picked this hotel for two main reasons (apart from the good deal on the cost of the room itself): location and prior experience with the Kimpton chain. I picked the Union Square location because when one travels light to SFO, it is extremely easy to take the BART into the city, and the Powell Street stop is just steps away from the hotel. That's a savings of over $40 each way on a taxi ride! And it only takes an extra 10 minutes to get to and from the airport by BART... As for the hotel itself, it is a grand, old hotel with rooms that have been nicely updated. I had a lovely corner room on a high floor with an incredible view on the bay. I had previously stayed at another hotel of that chain, the Palomar, and that room was simply wonderful. I was only disappointed in one thing in my room at the Sir Francis Drake: the size of the bathroom. That was perhaps the smallest bathroom I had ever been in, apart from those nasty little London hotels... There was nothing particularly wrong with the bathroom itself, apart from its size, really. But it made getting ready in the morning a much less pleasant experience than one would have wanted, as it was all about avoiding hitting a wall or the door! Apart from that one element, I had a very pleasant stay and would highly recommend this hotel. I would even stay there again, especially if I could get a larger bathroom!

review.title: A room that should be a closet!
review.reviewText: The room we were given was DREADFUL-VERY small, barely enough room for the Queen sized bed (booked) no promised TV or ironong board/iron. The room was under the nightclub abd all the rubbish was emptied outside the window at 1-2 in the morning. The airconditioning sounded like a 747! The staff on arrival (10pm) were MOST uninterested in changing the room and pretty disinterested altogether. After a dreadful night, the morning staff on reception were a complete contrast and moved us to a new room which was more what we THOUGHT we had paid for!

review.title: Old San Francisco Charm
review.reviewText: I remember when I was very young driving by the Sir Francis Drake and seeing the doormen who wear Beefeater hats and outfits. When making reservations for staying in SF I didn't hesitate to pick the Sir Francis Drake. The price is right, rooms are small but clean. The elevators are old but fast which is good because I am somewhat claustrophobic! The location is right on Union Square. Overall, good bet!

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We had a two week stay. Rooms are small and cramped. There wasnt any drawers to put our clothes in so we had to live out of suitcases for two weeks. We had a not so good experience when we got our room. It was taken care of immediately and after that all went well. Perfect location.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with this Hotel. I looked for good priced deals and did not expect much. When I arrived I was impressed with the beautiful lobby and great service. It was a great feeling to be in this Hotel, and added so much more pleasure to my sightseeing visit to SF. Part of my photos were of the beautiful Hotel Lobby. Definitely recommended.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: very convenient location, close to the new metro rail and central ave, restaurants shops etc

review.title: A decent, respectable hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is strong on character, well located, reasonably priced, maybe getting just a bit tired. A good choice if you want a hotel that is very central to the traditional centre of San Francisco.

review.title: Old and outdated
review.reviewText: Good location, but the hotel is old and need a major overhaul.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I liked everything, the nightclub was pretty empty though..

review.title: Very good Location
review.reviewText: Excellent Location, and the bar at the top is great !!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel although we did encounter an issue in our room with banging plumbing pipes (we think that's what was causing the noise). The hotel was full so they were unable to move us into another room however they did give us a voucher for $100 to be used for food within the hotel complex. We enjoyed a couple of amazing breakfasts in bed using the voucher which more than compensated for the noise (which wasn't constant, just every now and then). The bathroom was exceptionally compact but OK. We would recommend this hotel for a weekend stay - not sure if we would stay there for a longer term (just a little too compact).

review.title: Grotty Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was drab with bedlinen not at an acceptable standard

review.title: One of the outstanding hotels of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The location is extremely convenient for staying in the downtown area. We were quite impressed with the Starlight Room at the top of the hotel; the "small dish" menu was very good as well as the service, but the main attraction is the dancing and the view of the city. "La Scala" restaurant was a great find, the service was outstanding and the food great. The personnel at the checkin desk proved to be very helpful and courteous. We certainly will go back.

review.title: Love the Drake.
review.reviewText: If you like beautiful, old, maitained, historical hotels you will love the Drake. The doormen are my favorite. They totally take care of you. Location, Location, Location, it's the best, shopping, restaurants and the cable car at your fingertips. The top of the Drake is a fantastic night club/bar. It's all the best of San Francisco wrapped into one hotel. Due to the hotel being old the only draw back are the smaller bathrooms. Other than that we love it and always stay there when visiting San Francisco. Enjoy!

review.title: pretty great place
review.reviewText: great location very nice staff great clean room ..all around it was pretty great!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Not up to Kimpton standards. Amenities in bath poor (no lotion, Qtips, etc.). Robe would be nice. Bathroom very small; no room at all in to put toiletries - need shelves or something.

review.title: Good hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The room was ready well before normal check-in, which was a pleasant surprise. The staff was courteous. The room was large and bright, though the bathroom was very small. All in all a good hotel.

review.title: Better hotels in the area
review.reviewText: Go to a different, cheaper and better hotel if you want to stay in this area- there are a ton of them.

review.title: Excellent Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a superb hotel, great location, central to everything. Excellent value as well. We were a 4 person family group (2 adults 2 kids).... the room was well appointed, but very tight for a family. We spent most time outdoors anyway so that did not spoil anything. I'd stay here again, but not as a family.

review.title: Convienent Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: Only a block from Union Square - Cable Car stop right out front was very helpful! Beautiful, large room and very comfortable lobby. Staff was very helpful and went above and beyond the necessary duties! Reasonably priced for the area. Highly recommended, will stay there again!

review.title: Overall assessment
review.reviewText: The hotel is somewhat run down, although not extremely. It is clear that some renovations are in order (old carpet, furniture, TVs, etc. The personnel is vey nice and cooperative. The location is perfect and near all major attractions in San Francisco. Some old areas of the building are quite charming.

review.title: Nice hotel, central location
review.reviewText: The only problem was the refrigerator which was not working and the hotel could not fix it or replace it (they offered to change our room) during our five-night stay.

review.title: Small Rooms, Good Location and Value
review.reviewText: The Sir Frances Drake Hotel couldn't be in a better location for a tourist in San Francisco. BART is a few blocks away, shopping and restaurants are all around, and the cable car has a stop right outside (but good luck getting on - it's crowded). Service was very attentive, concierge was knowledgable and helpful, and the top floor bar really does take you back to the days of Dashiel Hammitt. Complaints - the room is pretty basic, bathroom is mircroscopic, and the TV was old and at a bad angle. But Beefeater Doorman was a kick!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, the entire staff was always quite helpful. The rooms are very clean, the lobby is breathtaking !! The rooms are a little small, but were usually only stayed in the room at nite. We would definately stay there again.

review.title: A big flop.
review.reviewText: Thought this was going to be a fabulous place to stay. Have stayed at other Kimpton Hotels before and been pleased. Our room was drafty, with poorly functioning windows. The bathroom window was open and not closable! The windows and walls seemed paper thin and we could hear EVERYTHING that was going on around us, even up on the 7th floor. The room we had requested on Expedia was NOT the room we got and we were put at the end of a hall right across from an extremely noisy ice machine (that guests used all hours of the day and night!!). The pillows were flat and uncomfortable. The bedsheet, despite what we told the housekeeper, was too short for the mattress -- twice! The fridge was broken and nothing was cold, including our stored food which we found out too late. They could have moved us, or repaired it in 3 days (we'd have been gone), but it wasn't worth it or convenient at the time. The hotel has no mid-level food establishment and parking was OUTRAGEOUS so we skipped it and put the rental car in another garage 1 mile away. I'll never stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Very nice hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: I have no reservations about recommending the Sir Francis Drake to anyone visiting San Francisco. Very good service. Excellent restaurant. Nice room. Very comfortable bed. The only negative I can think of was that restroom was a little on the small side.

review.title: Beautiful Setting - Old Style Charm
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel with two children and were happy. The room was very small, but we only used it for sleeping so it was perfect (pet friendly did mean I got a couple of flea bites). The location was fabulous, though be prepared for the noise of trams and people late into the night - take your earplugs. The Cable Car to Fisherman's Wharf was right outside as was a Walgreens Mart for all your basic water, snack requirements. There were LOTS of homeless people/panhandlers all around - so prepare to harden yourself. We would stay there again if in San Franciso

review.title: Fabulous!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I came up to see a friend's play and were running late. As we drove up the bellman (Eddie) was so sweet to take our car keys and assure us our bags would make it to our room. The lobby was gorgeous and as we checked in there was a family with a dog checking in so we knew we loved the place already. The front desk personnel were extremely gracious and even took our sunglasses to put in our room so we could rush off to the theatre. After the play we brought friends back to the lobby bar and the waitress and bartender were really fun! It was like we were hanging out with more friends. The elegance of the hotel was just outstanding and the room was beautiful. The very best part was the deluxe king bed. It and the bedding was so comfy I wanted to find out what brand it was so we can buy one. I still may call the hotel to inquire. Next time we need a room in the City we are definitely going to stay there. We've already recommended it to all of our friends - and some of them work in travel so they can recommend it to clients. Thank you!!

review.title: WOULD GO BACK AGAIN.......
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL WAS EVERYTHING I EXPECTED IT TO BE...

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: there were no curtains or shades over the bathroom window.... there is no 'secure' internet anyplace in the entire hotel...

review.title: NOT IMPRESSED, HOTEL VERY DATED & ROOM VERY SMALL AND BASIC!
review.reviewText: DON'T STAY THERE. VERY OVER PRICED!

review.title: Questionable Value
review.reviewText: The front desk messed up our credit card and de-activated our key cards, forcing us to the front desk late at night to correct their mistake. The rooms were small and we waited over 45 minutes for the valet to bring our car at checkout.

review.title: Small Room
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff was excellent, very accomadating. I had issue with the condition and maintenance of the hotel. Our room was in great need of repair. Other than being old and needing some TLC the building was beautiful and the staff exceptional. Great location by Union Square.

review.title: A good choice
review.reviewText: A quirky pleasant hotel, well placed for everything with very helpful staff. A little faded at the edges in the room but very comfortable beds and good atmosphere.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Would stay there again. Very convenient in the middle of downtown. A little noisy with the cable car running in front of the hotel. Overall, a nice hotel.

review.title: Great hotel, comfortable room
review.reviewText: Great experience with hotel. Room was a bit small but otherwise very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Pay for location - but the room was mediocre
review.reviewText: I over paid for a name brand hotel, but the room was nothing special. It was our anniversary and I thought I was getting us a fancy room, but I have stayed at much better hotel rooms for much less. It does have a fantastic location in Union Square and the club on the top floor is pretty awesome, but you can go there even without staying in the hotel.

review.title: Above Average Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean, staff pleasant. Most rooms are smallish. Bathroom design is strange (small), if you're a big person, request a larger bathroom if possible. Otherwise great, centrally located near Union Sq. shopping etc. Laundry service is always an issue - never stocked up with enough slips. Free internet rocks - if you have a wireless phone - the advantage is that you have free internet all over downtown via kimpton due to the large numbers of kimptons around that area.

review.title: Old World Charm and Warm, Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: The rooms are sweet and very clean and comfortable; far more interesting than the usual fare. The staff were very well versed on all of the local attractions, events and culture. The Drake is a lovely place to stay.

review.title: Would go back in a minute.
review.reviewText: When we go back to San Francisco I will check to see if we can stay there first then look for another hotel. I was very pleased with the hotel. Thank you Sir Francis Drake hotel. You helped in making my stay in San Francisco very enjoyable.

review.title: Had a blast in San Fran.
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful, the location excellent for getting on/off trolleys.2 Excellent breakfast places right across the street,"Lories Diner" and "Sears", also "Starbucks" is right there for coffee in the morning.I highly enjoyed my vacation, I would stay there again, and recommend my friends stay there also.

review.title: Might be better
review.reviewText: Good location, but small room and old furniture. Whole city is full of bums and there are always someone asking dollar near hotel entrance.

review.title: Nice but Noisy
review.reviewText: - Overall we were very satisifed (location, quality, value) - Ask for a room away from the street. Even though we were on the 15th floor, the street noise was excessive.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: The location is very good. Hotel has character and offers very good service. Expedia provided a very good deal, so even though the room was a bit small for four people we were quite happy and our vacation in SF proved to be very nice and memorable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Overall we liked this hotel and would stay again in ever back in San Fran... The rooms are very small but comfortable. Great lobby but be prepared to pay lots for drinks.

review.title: My memorial hotel
review.reviewText: This time, I stayed here because of my parents and my husband's parents visited us from my country. We reserved 3 rooms and we enjoyed our staying!! The room was large, comfortable and clean. It was only one night. I wanted to stay more! Next time, I choose this hotel again. It was one of the best hotel in my life. I will recommend it to everyone!! I had a good memory and I never forget my staying in this hotel!!

review.title: location was perfect. would definately stay again.
review.reviewText: Clean rooms. Friendly Staff. Fantastic location.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake Hotel....Highs and Lows
review.reviewText: Our recent trip to San Francisco included a stay at the Sir Francis Drake. We were able to get an excellent deal on Expedia.ca....and believe me, you get what you pay for. Although this hotel has an excellent location (one block off Union Square and close to all the best shopping SF has to offer), it is in serious need of updating. Whatever you do, do NOT upgrade your room to the higher floor with a queen size bed. These rooms are extremely small - smaller than ones I've seen in London or NYC. Also, the walls in the hotel are paper thin, so be prepared to hear everything going on next door, and I mean everything. The only redeeming quality of this place was the night manager's willingness to help us out immediately when we weren't satisfied with our tiny, run down room. He was incredibly polite and made every effort to ensure we were satisfied with the change. He even gave us coupons for a free breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel. In summary - if you really don't care about the room you're in, and you're ok with hearing all the traffic noise and your neighbors, the SFD Hotel is the place to stay.

review.title: Convenient, clean, comfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient to all services in San Francisco; the city center, the Museums, the Trolley, restaurants, China Town are all within walking distances. The doormen, front desk and housekeeping are very professional. The only problem was construction going on outside on another building that started early in the morning and the traffic below. But not excessive.

review.title: I WILL NOT be staying here on my next trip to San Francisco.
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, the service was very poor. There were not enough staff ready to help unload our bags from the taxi, but luckily the taxi driver was kind enough to take help us out. Upon arriving at 2:30pm, there were no rooms available to check into. I finally found someone to store our bags and returned at 3:30pm to be allocated to a room. I stressed to the reception desk that I needed our luggage straight away and if this was a problem I would take my own bags to my room. I was responded to with the answer "Not a problem sir, your bags will be delivered within the next 10 minutes." I waited 30 minutes and had heard nothing. I returned downstairs when my phone call was not answered and questioned the where abouts of my luggage (the receipt had not been even looked at by bell service). It took another 15 minutes to find my luggage, then ended up taking my luggage to my room with a look from the staff when I didn't produce a tip. The room was not as I would expect. The television provided was not as pictured in their advertisements downstairs, cords hanging out from wall sockets and a bathroom that could barely fit one person. In summary, very poor customer service in all aspects of this hotel from front desk, concierge and room maintainence services. Understaffed. Old facilities and amenities (don't let the grant entrance fool you!)

review.title: clean
review.reviewText: good stay

review.title: It was an experience im tight quarters
review.reviewText: This was the oldest hotel we have ever stayed in, and we were surprised by how small the room was. It was tiny! Everything was very clean, and recently remodeled. But, the bathroom could have used more counter space, there wasn't space around the sink, and the small glass shelf over the toilet was tilted. Anything placed on it slid off.

review.title: Small but clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: We had a corner room that smelled really clean. We used public transportation during our stay. Even walked to China Town. The front desk couldn'd do enough for us. We enjoyed our stay.

review.title: OK at half price
review.reviewText: The hotel was grand but the room was small. Great location though. If we had paid full price I would have been very disappointed but at half price, it was OK.

review.title: Great Hotel, Expensive Parking
review.reviewText: We got a great price on the room through Expedia and it was worth every penny. On Sunday afternoon they had a complementary bloody mary bar with snacks and the rooms are spacious for the city and some have great views. Parking is overly expensive, so find another overnight parking garage in the neighborhood to save money on parking. The hotel's parking was too pricey for us, but less than 1.5 blocks away we found a parking garage for 70% less than what the hotel was charging, so I recommend driving around the neighborhood to find a better parking price. Lastly, it's a great hotel for pets, so if you enjoy traveling with your dogs I recommend it (and all Kimpton Hotels).

review.title: Busy location. Great for shopping
review.reviewText: Rooms extremely small. No space to put anything in the washroom. No in room safe. Found bed very uncomfortable. Could have used two chairs to sit on. Woke up to garbage pickups outside. Heard the street noise. Certainly not a quiet room for sleeping. Lobby leaves a lot to be desired. No where to sit and read with decent lighting.

review.title: City by the Bay
review.reviewText: It is very likely that I will not stay at any other hotel when I visit San Francisco. It is an ideal location for visits of any purpose. Easy to get in, and out of the City. The staff was always helpful.

review.title: Expected more from a Kimpton Hotel
review.reviewText: I had heard a lot about the boutique-feel at Kimpton hotels, the modern amenities and high end quality, the Sir Francis Drake did not live up to the hype. It wasn't a bad place, it was just a regular old hotel room. We reserved a King, but there were none available when we checked in and they told us they were putting us in "the nicest room with 2 queen beds". Our room had two full beds, not a great view and was just average. The room was clean, there was a flat-screen TV and wireless Internet access. Overall not a bad stay, I just expected more.

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: Location was great for all our tours.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and in a good location, but our room was not very clean, which is an instant turn-off. However, we were just there for a baseball game and didn't spend much time in the hotel room. So it was okay for what we needed. The bed was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff.

review.title: Super place to stay.
review.reviewText: Older hotel well maintained. 1/2 block to Union Square. Cable car stop is located in front of hotel. Parking is expensive - about $50/day + tax. Loading and unloading vehicle is a challenge, but the staff is of great help. rooms are well maintained and our upper floor room was very quiet.

review.title: Expensive and no frills.
review.reviewText: While the Sir Francis Drake is clean, comfortable, and well-staffed, it was not a good value. We paid a discounted rate for our room, but then the hotel parking fee almost made up the difference. Had we paid the regular rate, we would have been very disappointed. The tiny bathroom and fewer amenities than nearly every other boutique hotel, left us feeling like we were only paying for the name and reputation of the hotel, not the experience.

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel located in Union Square. We stayed in a Towers Queen room and the room was spacious and spotless. The front desk staff and concierge was extremely courteous and helpful with providing area information and scheduling our tour reservations. Walk out the front door and you can hop right onto a cable car to see the city. I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Great spot!
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel just off Union Square... perfectly situated one block away to avoid most noise yet reap all the benefits without having to walk miles up those hills!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: For all the hype about this hotel, I was very dissatisfied with the experience. It is very overpriced and outdated. The customer service was not great either. I don't feel like I got what I paid for.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location...
review.reviewText: Liked the hotel, the scala resturant and the starlight room. It was all very very nice.

review.title: Great location, nicely redone
review.reviewText: Rooms very clean and comfortable; size adequate. Great location. Size of hotel is great; small enought to be quaint, but large enough to offer all of the amenities. Will stay there again on future visit to S.F.

review.title: good stay, good deal
review.reviewText: used the hot deals and got a good quiet, but small queen deluxe for a week of work in the city.

review.title: Fantastic Stay
review.reviewText: The drake is a wonderful place that I highly recommend to anyone wanting to visit San Francisco.

review.title: The staff makes this a great place to stay.
review.reviewText: The title says it all. Great staff. 5th time staying there. Enough said.

review.title: Make sure they dont charge you extra money
review.reviewText: I found an extra charge on my credit card that came directly from the hotel.

review.title: Very nice friendly hotel
review.reviewText: We very much enjoyed our stay at Sir Frances Drake, the staff are very friendly and it is in a great location at Union Square and you can get on the Cable Car right outside the hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small side but they feel very homely. Would definitely go back.

review.title: Hotel is understaffed
review.reviewText: Tried to check in early and was told to check back at 1PM which turned into 2PM which turned into 3PM. At check in, they said the rooms would not be ready until 5:30!!! They ended up sort of upgrading us and we go to the room at 3:30PM. It then took nearly 1 hour for the bell hop to bring up the bags. Ridiculous. It is a nice hotel at a good location and the price was right. Service is always very inconsistent here which I am suprised as it is a Kimpton hotel.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: +++ Excellent, central location on Union Square. +++ Starbucks downstairs. +++ Loris Dinner across the street. --- Parking fees. Find cheaper parking yourself on the square at any multilevel parking garages. -- Hotel is old, needs refresh. --- Bathrooms are very tiny in all hotel rooms according to the receptionist. Would stay there again for business and leasure.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Location is very good and internet is free of charge. Facilities are a little bit old.

review.title: Good hotel for a good price.
review.reviewText: An older hotel with small rooms but comfortable.

review.title: Beautiful Old, Boutique Hotel - Small Rooms - Great Union Square Location
review.reviewText: This old hotel is beautiful. The lobby/lobby bar in particular is spectacular. The standard rooms are rather small - to be expected at such an old property - but are clean and comfortable. This is definitely a Kimpton-style hotel - unique and boutique. Service wasn't as attentive as I would have hoped but it was certainly above average. Excellent location - right in Union Square.

review.title: Charming old hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were outstanding. Our room was a bit small, but tastefully decorated, sparkling clean and pleasant. We loved the location. The restaurant was marvelous. We'd return to this charming hotel.

review.title: Will not return.
review.reviewText: The room had peeling paint and looked to be in disrepair. We could hear noise from the street all night long. The wait for valet parking was long, so long that one of our friends had to wait 50 minutes for the car. Good location, but that's about it.

review.title: Fabulous.
review.reviewText: We loved it. We're staying there again for our anniversary in September.

review.title: Great hotel in prime location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a prime location- right in the middle of the Union Square area, close to many attractions. It is easy to get around and orient yourself from here, and the hotel itself was very nice. They have a concierge available to answer any questions, as well as a business center with computers (although you have to pay to use the computers- wish it was free). My only complaint would be that the lighting in my room was very dim, and I would have preferred it to be more bright. other than that, the service was great, and the front desk staff was always available and willing to answer any questions if the concierge was busy. I would definitely go back here next time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: charming hotel
review.reviewText: This is a historic hotel with a beautiful lobby. However the rooms are somewhat smaller than newer hotels and you hear some noise from the streets--though that is also part of the charm. Very charming place in an excellent location of town. Within walking distance to chinatown for meals.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great time at this hotel. The location couldn't be more perfect for sightseeing. Near to everything! Staff was very helpful and friendly. The lady at concierge was so nice and gave us free tickets to a show! Clean hotel. The only issue we had was that the heat wouldn't turn off in our room. Finally, after burning up for several hours we called down to the desk at about 2am and they moved us to the room next to ours. The next morning our room was 92 degrees! They compensated us by giving us free room service breakfast the next morning. Overall, great place and we plan on staying there every time we visit San Francisco! STAY HERE! You'll love it!

review.title: Hotel with lots of character
review.reviewText: This is my favorite hotel in San Francisco. I like staying in quaint old hotels and this is one of the best. Every morning I woke at sunrise and took off for a great run down one side of the street and back up the other with a stop at Sears for one of there famous breakfasts.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Confortable clean room. Helpful staff. Nice bar and lobby. Very convenient, right by Union Square. Only sour note: the fridge-bar never worked, though we stayed for week, more than once we reminded staff of the problem, and each time we were assured it would be fixed. As an afterthought, the lighting in the room was somewhat depressing.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The doormen were fun and very helpful when we needed directions or suggestions!

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: I did my research before booking the Sir Francis Drake and read the good & bad reviews. It worked out great -- we loved the location right off Union Square and across from Sears fine dining, overall the staff was very helpful and accommodating on our request for a late checkout. The room was small as was the bathroom but we knew that going in and we weren't there long enough for it to matter. Others complained about street noise here but we didn't have a problem on the 10th floor. The view from the Starlight room on the 21st floor at sunset is not to be missed!

review.title: Romantic weekend
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful time. I would highly recommend the Sir Francis Drake for your next visit to the city. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room was clean and I was surprised how quite it was for being in the city. Excellent location and a great value booking through Expedia. The only negative thing I could think to say, was the room was a little small but I think that should be expected in an older hotel (when people were smaller). Thank you Sir Francis Drake and thank you Expedia!!

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Great if you want to see all the sites and ride the cable cars alot. Room was small but comfortable. It's an old building so don't expect a modern look, but thats much like the rest of the city so it just added to our experience.

review.title: Great hotel, nice room, cold temperature
review.reviewText: I really like this hotel. The service was great and the restaurant was wonderful. I just had a difficult time warming up my room.

review.title: Greatest Place to Stay In S.F
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake is the greatest place to stay in San Francisco. It is located in the heart of down town just blocks away from great shopping and eating places plus the hotel staff makes you feel like royality.

review.title: Great room, great price, great views and wonderful staff
review.reviewText: I had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. My room was very spacious with beautiful views. The staff was super nice and helpful. I particularly love the doormen, they are all so nice, friendly and helpful. My room was cleaned spotless everyday. My only complaint is that my room was on the 20th floor underneath the Starlight Room, which takes up the entire 21st floor. At night it could be noisy at times because I could hear the music and commotion from the club. Other than that, I can't wait to go back to San Francisco. I'd stay at the Sir Francis Drake again!

review.title: Classic and great location
review.reviewText: Old but refurbished and charming. We had forgotten how tiny the bathrooms are and what a small area overall (felt almost European) but cute room, well maintained building, great drinks upstairs at the Starlight Room. We'll be glad to stay there again because it's so easy to get to Union Square and all of the nearby shopping.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: Like others, I felt the hotel rooms needed some updating. Unlike others, I felt the size of the room was adequate. Our only disappointment with the hotel staff was the fact that the hotel offered a boarding pass service where they would print your boarding passes for you. We gave them our flight info 24 hours in advance of our flight, the boarding passes were supposed to be in our rooms at least 3 hours before our flight and when we checked out (2.5 hours before our flight) the boarding passes had not even been printed. They took care of it before we checked out, but we flew Southwest, so early check-in was important to us. Other than that, everything was fine. I would stay there again. The Beefeaters were very helpful.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great spot to enjoy San francisco. They have a great bar in the lobby and are very helpful. They accidently erased our key cards on the 2nd day but that was fixed very quickly. I would go there again.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in great location. Door man in red uniform is the most welcoming person.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff is very responsive. Beautiful old hotel and perfect location in San Francisco.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: Perfectly positioned hotel with a really nice feeling through friendly staff and nice room.

review.title: Very distinguished looking hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very beautiful, though it did seem a little run down in places. Very comfortable room, very helpful staff and great beefeater uniforms!

review.title: very disappointing
review.reviewText: service personal very unfriendly

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The rooms were cold and the heating was not sufficient.

review.title: They were great!
review.reviewText: My husband and I travelled to SF to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. When we arrived and checked into our room, I was unhappy to find the windows did not open. When I called the front desk, they immediately switched our room to much larger one and the window opened! When my husband asked for suggestions about a restaurant to celebrate our 10th, they suggested Morton's which was incredible! When we arrived back to our room, they had made our bed with chocolates on the pillow and even a note with a bottle of wine! It was so appreciated... If you ever have questions as to where to go, ask the concierge, Karen. She was terrific! Thank you!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Sir Francis recently for one night. Check in was easy, and the room was great. I had a corner room with two windows. I knew that the room would be on the smallish size, but that did not take away from the charm or the enjoyment of the stay. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: A classic
review.reviewText: No in room coffee and parking was $45. Other than that, it was a great stay! The upgraded me to the 19th floor with an awesome view of Union Square.

review.title: OK for price
review.reviewText: Excellent location to Union Square. Room was very small and the overall feel of the hotel was very old. Bed was incredibly comfortable and was the best thing about the hotel.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was great. However, they didn't replenish the shampoo, lotion and soap twice. We used the wine glasses and never got anymore. Used the notepad and pen and never received anymore throughout our stay. We were their four nights over the Christmas Holiday and I could have called to complain but didn't. Just thought it was strange!!

review.title: Unsatisfactory
review.reviewText: Very convenient to shopping and restaurants but deluxe room was the size of a broom closet - some of the staff very nice , others not helpful . We would rather have spent more and had a room that two people could move around in and not bump into each other . We are both in the service industry , and were not impressed , when we inquired about the size of the room as we had booked a deluxe room and were told ,'this is an older Hotel - what do you expect '.Our next trip we will book another Hotel .

review.title: Great to be back!
review.reviewText: This is my second trip to the Sr Francis Drake. I won't go to any other San Francisco Hotel. The service is great, the staff friendly and the location wonderful. If you only have one trip to make, make it here. Great value for the money too.

review.title: Very Impressed would go back
