review.reviewText: After reading many reviews we weren't sure what to expect. In saying that we couldn't fault the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. Central to everything, staff more than helpful, rooms not your 'normal' cookey cutter hotel room. In a word lovely.

review.title: Very good value in San Fran
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Sir Francis Drake for one night and would definitely go back. I wish I stayed for more than one night so I had more time to enjoy the surrounding area and the hotel amenities, but the room was clean, comfortable and the staff was very welcoming and let me check in early.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: It is right in the heart of San Francisco, and everything is a walk away. I needed directions to visit my friends on Union Street, the staff helped me, printed me out a map. They were friendly, it was a great stay. That room was really cute!

review.title: Hidden fees
review.reviewText: Call hotel before going to see hidden fees and parking fees.

review.title: Iconic Doormen, Superb Location, Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake is a landmark hotel you've got to experience at least once in a lifetime. The location is absolutely superb, very central and close to most any place you want to visit. It's a very good value too.

review.title: Great Historic Hotel - great bar and night club!
review.reviewText: Overall we did love our stay in San Fran and our hotel room at the Drake. We had an issue with the toliet and though maintenance came up right away to fix the problem, he wasn't very clean with the plunger. There was water from the toliet was all over the bathroom floor and carpet. A bit disappointing.

review.title: Lovely Old San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location is unbeatable. Centrally located to absolutely everything. This is classic old San Francisco. Staff was nice, and the "Beefeaters" at the front door were especially friendly and helpful. Remembered us going in and out. Beds and room amenities very comfortable. For the price, especially on Expedia, you just can't beat it. You would pay several hundred dollars more per night at an equivalent hotel in a major European city.

review.title: Funky decor, perfect location
review.reviewText: The wall paper had thick green stripes, the whole decore in the rooms was funky but in good taste. The location was great! Less then a block from Union square and a couple blocks from the bart, muni or any other public transportation you might need. There's a good restaurant in the hotel and a dinner across the street in case you get hungry at 3am. I highly recommend this hotel, friendly staff too and clean rooms.

review.title: wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: nice staff, very friendly....will go back again ! Great location.

review.title: San Francisco Best
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my staff at the Drake

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel now seems old in comparison to others. It was in a great location, but it took forever to get in our room. Parking was very pricey - $50.

review.title: Conveneient location
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake is near union square and conveneiently located. Some rooms are small, but price is good for amenities and location

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We booked this room because we received a good deal and it was prime location down town. We learned from other reviews that the "Queen Petite" would be on the smaller size and they were not kidding. For 2 people who spent their days sightseeing though, the room worked out just fine. The room was always very clean and we were easily able to control the room temp with the thermostat. The bathroom was quite small, but honestly it got the job done. If space is something that is important to you though, definitely don't get the "Queen Petite." The concierge, Darcy, was wonderful and was able to answer every question we had. The front desk staff was always courteous and helpful as well. The lobby is absolutely gorgeous too!! This hotel may be "older" and not have the same kind of feel as something that built only say 5 years ago but it is in no way shabby or run down- it has characer! The hotel's location was perfect and we were able to simply walk to many destinations because it was right downtown.

review.title: Great location,great staff
review.reviewText: This "classic" hotel is wonderfully situated near Union Square and on the cable car line and, if room size is not an issue, it is a good place to stay. They are not kidding when they refer to the standard room as a "petite" queen.

review.title: So So Hotel
review.reviewText: The St. Francis Drake is in a great location with convenient access to transportation. There are many restaurants close to the hotel. The downside to the hotel is that overall it needs updating. Elevators need refurbishing, rugs look wornout and the rooms need painting. You can hardly open the door to the closet because the bed is too close. The room needs better lighting and there should be a light in the closet.

review.title: A Real SF Experience
review.reviewText: Great location, great people, and a fun environment. Better than the chain hotels, this provides a unique experience steps from Union Square. With one of the best Wednesday night spots at the top of the hotel, the mid week business traveler can't go wrong.

review.title: dank and noisy
review.reviewText: I chose the hotel since it's closest to where I needed to go. The room smelled like the carpet dried up in the shade. It's also in a busy area in SFO so it's really noisy. Windows are in deep need of squeegeeing and definitely not sound proof.

review.title: cute but not good enough
review.reviewText: i knew going in the room was small no problem check in was great friendly the first room looked clean room next to the elavator was next door not good air condtioning vent over the head board maybe in the usa queen size beds are smaller than in canada the sheets had holes in them so we moved rooms 2nd room the thermastate didn't work 3rd room was so noisy from construction next door not sure if the city has noise bylaws also the rooms don't have coffee makers and no free coffee in the lobby although the hotel was in a great location i would not stay again

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location with the cable car at the door and Union square with all the great shops just a few steps away. The hotel Staff are super friendly and helpfully in directions to any place.

review.title: I finally got to stay at The Drake!
review.reviewText: I always found their famous doormen charming and friendly when I passed them on the street. Luckily, I was able to stay at the hotel this visit and experience the full Drake hospitality. The foyer is very inviting and a good place to relax for one drink before you go out. Every employee I encountered was very pleasant and helpful. The location is great. I highly recommend them.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake was a fantastic hotel and not as cheesy as i was expecting given the name. Very well decorated,very clean with friendly service from all. The only thing we didn't like was that there was no room safe but instead safety deposit boxes in a room behind reception which was perfectly ok but a bit of a pain. Overall 9.75/10

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was OK, but room shabby and noisy (no double glazing).

review.title: Location is great
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location! Room was very small, but that was disclosed when I booked. The bathroom very small and floor not as clean as most. Beds are comfortable. There are trade offs for everything, and I would book this room again to stay in that area of town.

review.title: Seen better days
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel 20 years ago and had fond memories. It wasn't terrible this time, but it wasn't anything to write home about either. The grand lobby is now a noisy bar. Everthing seemed in need of a makeover. Hallways and elevators could have been vacuumed more often. On the plus side,room was clean, and service pleasant. But room was small and bathroom even smaller. The old grey mare.....

review.title: Francis Drake - San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic. Great location, friendly staff. Cable car right outside the front door.

review.title: Great service, cool hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was really neat. The rooms were well designed and everything was really classy. It was our little oasis from busy Powell street. The staff was very helpful and even upgraded our room because there was some computer problems that temporarily delayed our check in. It was our first time to stay in this fancy of a hotel but everyone was so congenial, and the mini-bar was even affordable. I would recommend this hotel to someone who wants to stay in a very tourist part of San Francisco with close proximity to the Bart.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Air conditioner was not working. Room was not properly equipped with ice bucket or glasses. Pillows were paper thin and provided no support. Room was not made up the next day until I made 3 requests. The room was made up at 9:30PM.

review.title: Great Location, Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: Highly Satisfied

review.title: Great location, VERY SMALL ROOMS
review.reviewText: Hotel lobby reminiscent of 20s grandeur, though subtle ageing of the interior of hotel is apparent, especially in the hallways and room. Room was so small that it was tough to move around. View is non-existent (unless you like looking at other highrises). Did not get a checkout slip under my door so I had to wait in a line for over 10 minutes in the lobby to check out. Seemed very popular hotel for Western European vacationers. Location near Union Square was great for local meetings and oddly dressed bellmen at the front of the hotel were very courteaous and helpful. Hotel would be ok for business travel, TERRIBLE for a vacation.

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: We absolutely loved the hotel. Right in Union Square. Took the cable cars & trains everywhere. Great time. Only criticism is that we didn't like the pillows, uncomfortable.

review.title: Historic Sir Francis Drake
review.reviewText: The Hotel was perfected situated near Union Square and Chinatown. Shopping was close too. Although the room was small, that's part of the package. However, if you want to put on make-up, it's quite inconvenient. I couldn't quite get close enough to the bathroom mirror to put my makeup on. Also, the bed was supposed to be 'Queen'. It was more like a full sized. The view from the 20th floor was great and there was an endless supply of hot water. Although, the water pressure suddenly disappeared for a moment on a few occasions. Overall it was a good experience. I love the old architecture

review.title: can't wait to visit again
review.reviewText: Awesome staff, everyone was lovely and helpful. The room was very clean, and the housekeeping was more than helpful with any room needs.

review.title: Great location, questionable service
review.reviewText: The cable car runs in front of this hotel which makes it very convenient to most locations in SF. The consierge was very helpful providing great information. There is no continental breakfast included although you can request a coffee maker, which they willinly provide, however it was impossible to get the coffee packets to go with it. Clean. Weekends are noisy as they book weddings.

review.title: Don't stay on 20th floor!
review.reviewText: Everything at the Sir Francis Drake was great....except for our first evening. I requested a to stay on a high numbered floor to enjoy the views of the hotel. BIG MISTAKE!!! Not only was our room the size of a coat closet and adjacent to the elevator, but was also extremely noisy from the dance club on the 21st floor. It sounded like people were actually IN our room having a conversation! We were promptly moved to the 6th floor the next day and enjoyed the rest of our stay.

review.title: Old World Charm - Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: We requested a 2 queen bed room through Expedia and it turned out the hotel does not have a room with 2 queen beds. They do have a room with 1 queen bed. We were traveling with our two children so we needed the additional space. The hotel did upgrade our room to a jr. suite with a pull out queen sofa and 2 double beds (the headboards were queen but the beds didn't match up). Our accomdations were very nice. The bathroom is also a bit small with no place to put toiletries. Also no fitness gym. You can go to another gym for $8.00 a day. The staff (from the front desk to the doormen) were very pleasant and accomodating to our needs.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to many attractions, trolley stops right outside door.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Some complained about the size of the small rooms. We found the room big enough for us (2 people w/ 5 days worth of luggage). All the staff at the hotel treated us great.

review.title: Great Hotel in Great Location - Customer Service lacking
review.reviewText: One can't get a better hotel at a better location in SF than Sir Francis. We were pleased with everything except the lousy and inattentive customer service at the front desk and concierge. In spite of the few encounters with the front desk staff, all other staff and facilities were very good. We will stay there again.

review.title: Showing it's age.
review.reviewText: This once beautiful hotel is really showing all of it's 90 years of age. Needs some serious renovation, but if you can look past that, and through the dingy windows, and the hallways that smell like your grandparents house, it's not a bad place to stay. The staff and location are great, but the structure needs help.

review.title: Best position in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Have just returned back from staying at The Drake. It is fantastic. I was a bit hesitant after some reviews that I read but they were totally unfounded. Yes some of the hotel is showing a little wear and tear but nothing that you do not find in most hotels anywhere. You can walk out your door and shop and eat and catch the trolley at your door step. You will never need a cab. We travelled all the way from Australia and would go back tomorrow.

review.title: We'll be back!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel! It has quaint rooms, very comfortable, the service was EXCELLENT and very friendly. Don't look for the size of a chain hotel, this hotel gives you SF ambiance and comfort for an exceptional value. The location and the experience couldn't be better. A king deluxe corner room on the 8th floor was perfect. Don't hesitate to make a reservation.

review.title: Well placed...
review.reviewText: Very convenient, on Powell Street cable car line.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: I was very satisfied with this hotel. Every employee was willing to go out of their way to help. Only slightly disappointed in the small size of the bathroom, but the elegancd of the hotel more than made up for it.

review.title: Small Rooms but Super-Satisfactory!
review.reviewText: The rooms at Sir Francis Drake ARE small, but they are very clean and functional. Besides, we were out all day sightseeing! When we came back to the hotel, we wanted a clean room and a good bed, and that's what we got. Also, the hotel staff was absolutely wonderful - very helpful and nice about it, too. There is a fantastic place for breakfast right across the street, and it was great fun and good exercise to walk down to the wharf area. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake - Kimpton Hotel - Convenient Location; Aging, Dark, Noisy
review.reviewText: In no other hotel have I had so many problems with the door "reading" my electronic key. Every day there was a problem of some sort with the room. For example, when the TV remote wouldn't work, the cleaning staff replaced the batteries, but did not leave any shampoo. Room lighting was minimal, plugs few and inconvenient. Windows not sound-proofed, so lots of street noise. Definitely not a "business" hotel.

review.title: A comfortable home away from home
review.reviewText: The only drawback to Sir Francis Drake was street noise (we were on the 7th floor facing Powell St.)--but that's to be expectected in a downtown urban setting. Excellent service, good cleanliness, and the in-house Italian restaurant serves a great breakfast (French toast made with orange bruschetta--yummy!).

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The best part of the hotel was it's location right on the Powell cable car route and easy walking distance to Union Square. We were able to go shopping, go back to the hotel to unload our packages, then head back out without wasting precious time. Our room and bathroom (Queen Petite) was small but adequate since we spent most of our time shopping and sightseeing. Definitely would go back.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake is a nice hotel, clean, great location. My husband and I were disappointed, though, that they could not find a King-bedded room for us, even though we'd made our reservation four months in advance and had specifically requested it. Because it is an old building, the rooms & bathrooms are smaller than normal, especially when there's an unused double bed taking up half the room. But overall the hotel is all right.

review.title: Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: Great Location. Near Shops and all ransportation.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. Everyone on the staff was extremely helpful and wonderful to be around. The rooms were a bit small but extremely nice and clean. I give this hotel very high marks and would recommend this to anyone heading to San Francisco. The cable car picks you up right outside the front door which is also a plus.

review.title: Nice, but...
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable eventhough the rooms were quite small. The location of the hotel was very convenient; walking distance to many attractions and restaurants. My only criticism was the lack of staff at the front desk and the concierge service was non-existant. I even left a message with the concierge service to arrange for a tour and they never called me back. The business center is outsourced so if you have any problems after hours you are out of luck, as I did when I tried to print my boarding pass on a printer that was out of toner.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: loved the starbucks right downstairs and the 24 hour walgreens, which carries Everything including fresh produce, across the street. cable car stop in front of hotel. very pretty lobby. rooms quite clean.

review.title: No ice on the 19th floor
review.reviewText: The only problem I had with this stay was when I needed to get some ice the ice-maker on the 19th floor did not work. This is fairly inconvenient in the middle of the night to have to go and look else where for something that should have been at my disposal.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Sir Francis Drake. The rooms were comfortable size, but not large. The service was excellent and the staff was very willing to help with anything. I stayed on the 20th floor and could here some noises on occasion from a neighboring room or possibly the night club that is on the 21st floor. The view was the only disappointing part of my stay. We were on the east side and had a limited view of everything because of taller buildings in the area. The location is great if you are planning on seeing different parts of the city and want access to public transportation and great shopping. I would certainly consider staying there again.

review.title: PETS FRIENDLY
review.reviewText: GREAT LOCATION

review.title: Charming older hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice central location in down town San Franciso. The Italian Restaurant of the hotel was delightful with a very nice atmosphere. Hotel room is fairly small with an even smaller bathroom, but very charming. Doorman Tom is fantastic!!!!

review.title: A Wonderful Find in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The lobby of this hotel was dimly lit and the space was cavernous. The staff was gracious and accomodating. The floors were clean but the hotel itself looked to be old. The restaurant provided fabulous food and it was surprising to find, in a smaller hotel, that the room service which was excellent. The room was clean and bright although furniture looked older. The bed was luxurious with plentiful pillows. It was very quiet at night. The bathroom was upgraded with marble,stone and new fixtures. My room was smaller as I booked at the last moment, so I can't speak to the size of other rooms.

review.title: Pleasant Experience
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a hotel in San Francisco that has value and is central to shopping and the business district, this is it. I work and live in the area and at times like to stay in the city rather than commute. When I do I stay here. The rooms are a decent size, nice decor and good facilities with nice restaurant on the ground floor and steps away from Union Square. While on wall socket with two lights didn't work on this particular trip (guilty of not reporting it as I was so tired) this hotel never lets me down.

review.title: Warm Welcome to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake is staffed by genuinely friendly people at the desk, on the phone and on room service. The room service FOOD is great, too. It was a pleasure to come "home" each evening after sight seeing!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly. Rooms were small, but comfortable.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying at this beautiful hotel. It was in one of the best locations as it was close to everything and had the historic cable car line running directly in front of it. The only problem we encountered was the noisy next door guests- we really did not need to hear the things we did!! But that was only because they were ignorant and doing it on purpose. We didnt hear a peep from the others. The doorman at this hotel was cool and very helpful in pointing us in the right direction whenever we went exploring. I accidently left my cell phone at the hotel and the staff was very helpful in fed exing it home to me.

review.title: Classic hotel in a classic location
review.reviewText: We were very happy with this hotel. The fact that it is located on Powell street just off of Union Square is a huge plus for those who like to explore the streets of San Fran via cable car. The rooms are smaller than newer hotels, but are more than sufficient for those who are there to see the city and not the inside of their room. The king size bed was very comfortable and came with a down comforter and good quality sheets. My wife and I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Charming experience
review.reviewText: The hotel reflects the delightful atmosphere of old San Francisco. The downtown location is perfect, walking distance to just about every attraction. The rooms could be considered small in this day and age, but they are decorated in an elegant and also practical way. Big isn't always better! Service was excellent.

review.title: What a great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The place was so cute and classy - yes the rooms were a little small but the flavor of the hotel made it possible to overlook it. Everyone was so helpful and nice. It is also woderful to see a "pet friendly" place even though we left our dogs at home! Can't wait to come back and stay again.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel room was small but it was fine we only slept in the room and it was very clean and the staff was VERY polite, the hotel was very nice overall. The best thing was the trolley drop off was in front of the hotel much appreciated! THank you

review.title: A Nice Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is fabulous, walking distance to nice restaurants, museums and stores. The hotel room and bathroom were very little and this made it a bit unconfortable. I chose it because I thought I had read it had big rooms and was disapointed to find the contrary. The hotel is old and the maintenance is not good, it really looks old. It is not really clean. The restaurant at the street level is good. It was a nice stay but the thing that bothered me the most was the size of the room and bathroom.

review.title: Great Lively Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was very helpful and service was great. Rooms wsere old but remodeled and clean. We stayed in a king tower room and it was worth it. The Petite Queen is exactly that...petite. The rooms with two queens are good size too. The Starlight Room was always happening and there were always a group of people in the lobby having drinks etc...lots of action but never noisy or disruptive. Perfect, ideal location too! Cable car stops right out front and is right in Union Square. Also have a brand new Starbucks right downstairs. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: went on vacation with my mother and my daughters. The hotel was in a really great location and really good public transpartation close by. Thr rooms were very comfortable. The bathroom was a liitle small but the four of us did fine. I would stay here again. Nobody had any complaints about the hotel we all really loved it

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location if you want to experience the SF tourist thing. The hotel is old but the decor has been updated. The elevators are slow and small and the hotel has an old feel to it but again it is a great location.

review.title: super location in SF, on the Powell St. cable car line
review.reviewText: This is a nice old grand dame of a hotel. Our only problem was that a convention had a hospitality suite down the hall, and they woke us up as they went to the elevator at 11:00 and 2:00AM. The rooms are nicely sized and well equipped. We would return to the Drake.

review.title: nice hotel right in the middle of things
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great, the rooms are clean, the service friendly. Here is the only complaint we have: They have installed a newer air conditioning and heating system in the window which causes the old sash windows to be permanently slightly ajar. This leads to reduced noise protection from the streets in this busy location. Expect to wake up early from the garbage trucks below.

review.title: A Weekend On the Coast
review.reviewText: Location, location, location! What a great spot to be in San Francisco. The hotel was beautiful and a great choice to stay at while visiting the city. I did have a difficult time tracking down the Concierge on Friday, and when I did, she was not helpful. That aside, my three night stay was excellent. The next time I travel to the city, I will again book a room at the Sir Francis Drake.

review.title: My stay at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel
review.reviewText: My stay was great. The location of the hotel was good. The staff was courtious. The room was somewhat small but fine for one person. The window did not open but that was not a problem for me. The TV selections could have been better but I was not in San Francisco to watch TV. I enjoyed my stay and would definately stay there again.

review.title: Beautiful old hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful old hotel right in the heart of the Union Square shopping center and close to everything. Hotel is somewhat noisy and drafty and does not have much space.

review.title: Nice clean hotel, but small rooms
review.reviewText: Nice clean place. Older hotel, and the rooms are pretty small, but affordable and I would stay there again.

review.title: Very Good Quality for the Price
review.reviewText: For the price I got, I was expecting it to be a lot worse. But when I got there, I was very pleasantly surprised. Kind of on the older side, but very well maintained. I stayed in another old hotel on Powell Street and it wasn't nearly as nice as this one. The bathroom was small but clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely recommended!!

review.title: Hotel has character but no substance
review.reviewText: An older hotel with fine architechural detail and enormous potential if so desired. Convieniently located to Market, Sutter and city landmarks within walking distance. Generally clean and comfortable however the rooms were as a fellow guest described "a bandbox". Barely adequate, tight bathroom space so much so that one nees to dry off from the shower outside of the confines. Most annoying was the "complimentary coffee" offered in the AM, only to find that it was only available until 6:30AM, after which it cost $3 a cup. Doorman dressed as Beefeater was a nice touch and helpful also. Overall, a bit dissappointed.

review.title: hotel review
review.reviewText: friendly staff, comfortable room, good location

review.title: Very good value for the price.
review.reviewText: I liked this Hotel . Good value for the price. Very convenient to all sights in San Francisco. Clean with good service. I would stay here again. thank you

review.title: San Francisco - great place
review.reviewText: This is a lovely 1920-30's hotel that's kept a lot of it's old character with a gorgeous reception/bar area, really friendly staff especially the rather interesting american beefeater to greet you at the door! Fabulous location for that essential shopping with it being yards away from Union Square. Great restaurants to be found throughout San Francisco with the Nob Hill area a real favourite for good Italian and French food. Would love to live there one day......

review.title: Pleasurable San Francisco visit
review.reviewText: Stayed in Sir F.D. the first weekend of April. Upon checking in, which we were able to do early, received a double upgrade. Very friendly service. Nice room. Only downside to hotel experience was housekeeping was very slow. Called housekeeping on two separate occasions. Required a follow-up phone call on both. Overall, great wkend!

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel takes you back to the grand days of old SanFrancisco..from the doorman in costume to the staircase to the Starlight room. It , as is all of SanFran, expensive. But a value comparitively.

review.title: Nice Union Square Pied a Terre!
review.reviewText: Apart from needing to be refurbished somewhat (which would undoubtedly drive rates through the roof!), I found the Sir Francis Drake to be an outstanding outfit and will look forward to staying there again.

review.title: Believe others, it is old
review.reviewText: Believe others, it is old, windows were dirty, doorknobs to bathroom fell off, oh there is more. The place stayed a balmy 73 degrees, no fresh air in the place. One of the elevators stopped for a bit of the time and not were we were going. Even after getting someone fix those problems they still existed.

review.title: Exellent
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: Excellent feel of the city
review.reviewText: Wonderful, old-style hotel that has been nicely refurbished. We had a double queen room that was nice, but on the small side although not uncomfortably so. This hotel is excellent if you are looking to get a feel of the city. A cable car runs right in front of the hotel. Union square is a great place to stay in the heart of the city. You are within walking distance of a lot of shopping, the finacial district, the wharf and the Embarcadero. Many good restaurants and within blocks. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Staff was great!
review.reviewText: Super location--easy to get anywhere. Room was small (typical for San Francisco) but very comfortable. Concierge was quite knowledgeable and extremely helpful in coordinating activities for my daughter and me. I would definitely go back!

review.title: Loved the Drake
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little compact, but if you can look past that - it is a wonderful place to stay! The rooms had historic charm with modern comforts! The hotel is in the heart of Union Square, located on the trolley line, bart & bus lines - it is easy to get anywhere in the city! We would definetely stay at the Sir Francis Drake during our next stay.

review.title: March 2008
review.reviewText: Great hotel especially for the price and location. The bathrooms are a little small with limited space to store your stuff but that was the only issue. All the employees were great and we will stay there again. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: great lobby and staff, mildew room smell
review.reviewText: The lobby is fantastic, the staff and doormen were great. The room smelled super strong of mildew and mold and there was old lingere (not mine) on the floor.

review.title: Would not go back
review.reviewText: This hotel needs a full, down to the studs, makeover. Layers of old paint just don't do it.

review.title: Great hotel in central location
review.reviewText: If you want to stay in downtown central San Francisco near to the top shops and with a good choice of bars and restaurants, you can't do better than this hotel for location. It's also right on the tram (cable car) route to the Wharf and North Beach (for easy walk to Little Italy and Chinatown areas). The hotel is on the north edge of Union Square, which is so much better, as it's a good few blocks away from the Tenderloin - to the south west of Union. The hotel is great - its an older style hotel, but it's comfortable/clean decor pretty good and not too expensive. I had a car, and the valet service on the door was great too.

review.title: The Good and The Bad
review.reviewText: Hotel ambiance, personnel, and decor all first rate. However, the rooms are very small (ok for one person...but not two), old (although nicely updated somewhat), and nosiy! I don't know if it is because we were on the 6 th floor, but even with the windows closed, we could hear EVERYTHING below...car alarms, people partying at night, cable cars clanging (charming for first 15 minutes...then annoying). Perhaps some sound proofing is needed

review.title: Hotel with character - great location
review.reviewText: If you like staying at historic hotels, this is a nice one. It's comfortable, centrally located and staff are great.

review.title: Nice, but a few glitches
review.reviewText: Our Deluxe King room turned out to have a double bed. After calling the front desk, the man we spoke with said there were no more king rooms, but he'd let us into the Starlight Room for free instead. We agreed to that, but then called back asking if there were queen rooms available & the woman we spoke with said there was a king room for us. Anyway, they brought our new key cards up to us & the new room was nice yet smaller than the first. Also, the toilet plugged up after the first use. We called for a plunger & it took about a 1/2 hour for a maintenance man to come up, but he took care of it & was very friendly. Anyway, the bed was comfortable, the shower was great & there's a DVD player in deluxe rooms which was nice.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Had a very nice stay. While the hotel does have some of the quirky features of an older hotel, it is renovated, clean and nice. The negative reviews seem unwarranted to me. I would quickly stay there again as long as the price stays within reason.

review.title: Almost luxurious
review.reviewText: We chose the Sir Francis Drake as an alternative to staying home during a neighbor's all-night party, so all we really needed was a quiet, comfortable place to sleep where we could also bring our dogs. The room was stylish, although certainly not luxurious. Even though we chose a Tower Queen room (an upgrade from Queen Petite and Queen Standard) our room was on the small side. There was plenty of room to move around, and even a desk-worktable, but one side of the bed was up against the wall (no end table). It took more than an hour, two phone calls, and a visit to the lobby to finally get a dog bed and bowls to use during our stay -- which we were offered when we checked in. None of the employees seemed to know where they were, or who to ask. Kimpton hotels pride themselves on being pet-friendly, I would have expected better. We were exhausted and just wanted to get to sleep, but we were unable to do so because we had to wait up for the bellman to bring these items.

review.title: Sir Francis didn't disappoint
review.reviewText: I found the Sir Francis to be a solid choice for my visit to San Francisco. Located close to Union Square with cafes, shopping, cable cars, china town, and restaurants all within footsteps it was a winning choice. The staff were very professional and always helpful. The hotel is older, and this shows in the small details: rugs in hallways, chips in paint, slight odours, but don't be discourage from staying here.

review.title: Old but really worth it.
review.reviewText: Stayed for 3 nights. Very friendly, the staff where helpful,lots going on. But speial mention has to go to the door men, with their very funky outfits you can't miss them. They were very knowlegeable and helpful.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a super location. The bathroom was small as some of the other reviews indicated, but overall the room was clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Sir Francis Drake over New Year's and loved it. It is an older hotel, but very charming. The hotel's location was perfect and there was so much to do within walking distance. The hotel staff was exceptional and provided great information on multiple occasions. The room was on the smaller side but was very nicely furnished and very clean. The bathroom was extremely small (two people would crowd it). As long as multiple people were not trying to get ready at the same time, it wasn't a problem. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: great value for the location
review.reviewText: this hotel is right on union square. it's easy to get anywhere from here. although our room was small, it was perfect for a few nights stay. the beds are really comfortable and the decor is nice too.

review.title: had a great night!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay, for one night. from the check in to the moment we drove away, we were treated with the utmost courtesy and respect. We called to request a newspaper in the Morning, and within 5-10 minutes, someone was at my door, with 2 papers, as well as our room service! I loved the bathrobes and slippers provided... very nice touch. We look forward to returning, hopefully for a weekend.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby definitely adds character to the hotel despite the very dim lighting. Lighting in our room also dim. We had a standard King room w/ not much space, although bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was pretty small. Noticed paint chipping in our bathroom & in the room. Hotel room unimpressive.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in the perfect location for shopping and cable cars/buses, staff were great, friendly and helpful.

review.title: I' chose diferent next time
review.reviewText: the lobby was too noisy the elevators where dirty our room wall paper was pealing off 2 of our towels where stain and we could not see outside from our window because the outside part of the glass was way too dirty in short the hotel need a lot of cleaning please check that out thanks

review.title: Very niece
review.reviewText: King Room, the bed was very comfortabale, the room was a little small for the king size bed. It would have been convient if a coffee maker was in room...E

review.title: If I had to recommend changes...
review.reviewText: Every single one of the staff that we encountered were incredibly nice and professional. The bed was very comfy. However, the windows could not be seen through they were so dirty, and the room was exceptionally small. I won't go there again in the middle of Christmas shopping season as the Union Square area was a zoo, and it was difficult to actually get to the hotel due to traffic and shoppers. However, overall, it was a pleasant sleep.

review.title: RIght in the heart of Union Square!
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake is a wonderful hotel...just a little tired. We stayed in an executive king...The room needed a little more furniture..certainly more counter space in the bathroom...and a bit more lighting in both the closet and bathroom areas would be wonderful! The Lobby Bar is a new addition...comfortable but a little disorganized as far as seating arrangements. But all in all, a happy place to stay during the holiday season, and certainly located right in the middle of all of the Christmas hustle and bustle !

review.title: Excellent location, recently renovated, good deal all round
review.reviewText: I used to live in San Fran and I still go there every month or so, but I hadn't stayed in the Sir Francis Drake before. I was very impressed overall -- the building is pretty old, but the rooms have been renovated and the interior fit out is excellent. The front desk guy was great -- my only quibbles were that the wi-fi wasn't working too well and my breakfast arrived a little late and I was in a hurry to get to a meeting, so I had to inhale it. Other than that, excellent value.

review.title: bit posh
review.reviewText: Has some very tacky doormen in the style of Sir Francis Drake and overall is a bit pretentious. Having said this it was very comfortable and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will return. Watch out for the lifts in the evening as they get very busy with people going to the Starlit lounge at the top. Get a tower room - the views are lovely over SF and the Bay.

review.title: Felt like home
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in December for business, and since the minute I checked in I felt at home. Everyone from the bell hop to the hotel engineer were incredibly friendly, helpful, and had wonderful attitudes! Though I had a couple of problems such as the phone not working because the jack had been ripped from the wall to blowing a fuse when using the hair dryer, every time I contacted the front desk to fix the problems they were prompt and curteous. They didn't trivialize any of the issues I had and that to me speaks volumes of what this hotel offers by way of customer service. This is now my hotel of choice for staying in San Francisco.

review.title: Everything Old Is New Again
review.reviewText: The Sir Frances Drake is a classic SF Hotel with great character, and ambiance. The rooms have recently been renovated and are beautiful,with elegant striped wallpaper and cherry wood furniture. The rooms are on the small side, as many hotel rooms are in big cities, but who's going to spend alot of time inside when you can explore SF? Everyone on the staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are also ecologically friendly,a bin for recycling, water saving shower head which is great. However, a word of warning. The light in the bathroom is motion activated. Which is fine, except when you're relaxing in the bathtub, and the lights go out. I did find out moving the shower curtain turns them on again. The location of the Sir Frances Drake is the best in the city! Half a block from Union Square and right on the cable car line and near shopping and restaurants. My husband and I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Need more work done on Hotel
review.reviewText: Our room had no air or heat. They brought up a broken fan for us to use.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: Nice room on 6th floor. Hotel has class. Service was very friendly on all counts. Would recommend highly for many reasons, including location.

review.title: Going to the dogs
review.reviewText: This hotel was most enjoyable with a great location. I only wonder about those dogs in the hotel. There's a time and place for everything and taking your dog to a downtown hotel doesn't seem like the right place.

review.title: Will not come back
review.reviewText: The rooms are too small and clautrophobic and the bathroom wasn't completely clean, very small and uncomfortable, the toilet didn't have a lid, etc....

review.title: Good hotel - very expensive room service
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel - recently renovated and most areas of the room felt new (some didn't) - extremely comfortable bed and fast, free wireless internet. Room service is outrageously expensive - better to go to Jodi's Diner right across the street for breakfast.

review.title: I am going back to that Hotel in a few months !!!
review.reviewText: Although this is an old building it has been well maintained and kept very clean ! The Hotel is quiet and comfortable and I must say has the best bed I have been in for a while (and my bad back would know !) The personnel are courteous and friendly ! No reservations in recommending this Hotel !

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Historic Hotel but, could use some updating. Slight musty smell in room. Unexpected cost for parking. Should have been made aware in advance.

review.title: Historic hotel but, could use some updating
review.reviewText: Did not expect to pay as much as we did for parking. We were not told in advance. Actually cost more if you add the cost of tips to have it brought to you when needed.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, Comfortable rooms, friendly, knowledgeable staff, Only bad point is $50.00 overnight parking

review.title: Nice, but small rooms
review.reviewText: The service and location is great, but the rooms are very small. We could not both fit in the bathroom at the same time and the TV was off to the side_ hard to watch from the bed.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I would not stay at this hotel again. The room and the bathroom were very small, and very run down. The conceirge staff was rude, unpleasant and not helpful at all!! I definitely wont be coming back to this hotel.

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in Union Square right in the middle a great shopping, food, and easy transportation to evey sightseeing thing you would want to do. Located on Powell Street, the cable car runs right in front and you can buy a 3 day metro pass right across the street. You can take the cable car to: Fisherman's Warf, Chinatown, and Market street where you can take the F-Line to Castro Distric, Embarcadero, Alcatraz Ferry, and all over.

review.title: On the famous union square
review.reviewText: Dated but trendy.

review.title: S.F.'s Worst
review.reviewText: phone was broken, bar was unstocked, room service was late and over priced. For the money, this is a total rip off of a place, and the overworked hotel staff are entirely unconcerned with whether or not you are content

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had an Executive Queen/Queen room, for 2 adults and 2 children. There was sufficient room for us and our luggage. Beds were VERY comfy. Doorman and staff were helpful and friendly. Hotel is old, but reasonably well maintained, and given the location, right at the cable car stop and just up from Union Square, the value was good, would certainly recommend it.

review.title: It will be my base in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Attentive service and excellent location.

review.title: Old San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was unaware that the room we booked would be so small with a tiny bathroom. It was adequate for one night but a longer stay would not be satisfactory. No bathrobes, "you could request them" I was told by the desk on checkout. No phone book to look up restuarants, etc.

review.title: it's ok
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake Hotel would have been ok, it is just that they would have charged you for everything. they did not even inform us they would charge for the card key that we have returned properly to them. we just found out from our bank that they charged for those.

review.title: 'Olde England' style but charming
review.reviewText: The hotel foyer may look like a set from one of Douglas Fairbanks' more swashbuckling movies and the approximation of a beefeater's uniform may adorn the doormen but don't be put off by what is a slick and professional operation. All the staff were smiley and efficient in my week long stay and helped with internet connections and a broken toilet roll holder(!) quickly and effectively. My twentieth floor room had a great double aspect view up Nob Hill and don't forget to check the starlight room. It might look tacky but it is worth the trip to the top just for the views across the city.

review.title: Perfectly placed but not the star it should be
review.reviewText: This hotel looked great in pictures and was as grand looking on arrival as we anticipated. The room was a little small but we had a good view of the city - which would have been better if we could have seen through the filthy windows. We were on the 7th floor, but surely modern technology can clean windows this high up? Our baggage took ages to arrive to the room and took 2 phone calls and a visit to the lobby before we had them delivered. The room had everything we needed - big comfy bed, TV, etc, but the bathroom was a little off putting. The plain glass window was cheaply painted over and left with rough looking brush strokes, and the floor corners were grubby. I would say that the bathroom needed a major renovation. The best thing in this hotel was the doorman who was extremely friendly and helpful arranging transport to the airport. If you want a location at Union Square, you can't get much better than this except for the Westin St. Francis. Therefore, for location it get thumbs up, but for service and dirty areas of the room, it gets thumbs down.

review.title: In the middle of everything
review.reviewText: Great hotel, funky room, if a bit small. Staff were very friendly. The location of the hotel is spot on, with a cable car stop right outside the door and shopping just a few doors away, everything you need well within reach.

review.title: 1920's-Charm
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake has that "days gone Bye" charm we went to the Sunday Brunch on the top floor and it was Great- Real 1920's-1940's charm fantastic!

review.title: Great location, great value
review.reviewText: Well refurbished -- everything works yet looks old. Rather stagey but totally consistent and true to its theme. Our room was small, though not otherwise lacking. Fantastic location: a block from Union Square; 1 1/2 from Chintatown; theatre, shopping, all the best hotels are right around you. Cable car stop at the hotel door! Overall superb value. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Would recommend to friends
review.reviewText: If you enjoy historic architecture, you'd enjoy this hotel. While it is turn-of-the-century in style, my room had been recently restored while maintaining its original charm. It has an excellent location near BART and Cable car lines. A good value. I also appreciated central air conditioning (as opposed to a window unit) after having spent some noisy nights in a Napa hotel.

review.title: One of San Fran's best values
review.reviewText: From the doorman to the cleaning staff, everyone was very friendly and helpful. It is an older hotel, but has been kept up and is in a prime location, convenient to Union Square, theaters and many restaurants.

review.title: Fine Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The Drake is a very good example of a 1920's high rise hotel. I would return again. A couple of ammenities that attract me to older hotels are: 1.Double hung windows that you can open for fresh air. 2. Big window in the bathroom. 3.Get a room 16th floor and up is enough for a good view and quiet from the street. 4. Location. Union Square shopping district is great. Cabs everywhere to get you to other parts of town.

review.title: Great Hotel Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is fabulous. And the location can't be beat.

review.title: Noisy rooms but centrally located
review.reviewText: While located centrally next to Union Square this hotel really needs to be refurbished. The rooms on the 16th floor are very noisy since the windows are neither holding off the cold wind nor the noise from the street. And the cable cars start at 6.30am!! So ensure you located high enough and away from the streets.

review.title: In the Heart of town
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the heart of the city... All of the staff was courteous and helpful... Our room was fine, but I have never perceived such a small bathroom... My wife was pleased to find Aveda products in it... Right outside the hotel door were the cable cars, a very nice addition for a first time visitor...

review.title: Upgrades not in our room
review.reviewText: I was disappointed that we were placed in a room that was not what I paid for, the room was a double, double and I really needed to have the Queen, Queen but one was not available, perhaps due to overbooking. The view was very nice of Union Square and the staff was nice as well. If you go be sure they have the room you want and don't bump you Down.

review.title: Nice character, great consierge and front desk service, like the renos
review.reviewText: Very nice character hotel in a great location. We were very impressed with our "first" room, great view of ocean and Union Square but after 2 nights had to request move due to a very annoying noise from the cooling system. Our luggage was moved to a new room (certainly not the same view or as nice a room) without being inconvenienced a great deal, but a decent room for one more night. Great friendly staff! Great experience!

review.title: Nice, but not that nice
review.reviewText: I stay at many hotels every year from the cheapest to the most expensive, all over the world. This hotel was nice, very clean, and the doormen, bellhops, etc., were very accommodating. It was also very nice to be right on the cable car line. However, the front desk staff were a bit snobbish for my taste, the rooms were very very small, and the hotel could use a little paint. I read that it had recently undergone a full renovation, but...they must have a heard of elephants living inside!

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a great location, this is the Hotel. Right in the heart fo Union Square. The rooms are a little small, so if you plan on taking an active trip to San Francisco this Hotel I would recommend. The A/C did not work very well and the Hotel window was dirty pretty much eliminating the view. I would give this hotel a B.

review.title: The one with the Beef Eater out front
review.reviewText: Everything was great, again!! Love the new bar in the lobby. It was welcoming and relaxing.

review.title: Not a bad hotel, great location and decent price
review.reviewText: It was close to the city centre,had a nightclub on the 21st floor and was generally quite close to everything. Even the tram cars stop right outside. Convenient, pleasant and not too costly.

review.title: Elegant and charming.
review.reviewText: The 20th floor room had a city view that impressed! The staff was delightful and very helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, the rooms are very small. When we had a problem with the room next to us blasting his tv security was on the spot. The restaurant was lacking in professionalism,

review.title: it was fun
review.reviewText: it was fun. and very close to a lot of fun downtown things. we injoyed being a part of the city, in that way. i would most definitly do stay again.

review.title: We were very impressed
review.reviewText: We cannot say enough good about this hotel. Location is prime, building is old world elegance, and the rooms were extremely comfortable. The staff and service was amazing. Everyone made sure we were comfortable and enjoying our visit. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable and made excellent recommendations for restaurants. Bonus: The cable car stops right at the door...how San Francisco is that? :)

review.title: Older hotel holding up well
review.reviewText: Sir Frances Drake is an older hotel that has been refurbished. Rooms are comfortable and furnished well. Cleaning staff prompt and consistent. Good central location. Cable cars stop outside front door.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is nicely located. We didn't get the room that we thought we had reserved. There was some confusion on our balance due at the front desk when we checked out. They did give us a credit for the in room snack bar for items we didn't even eat! The internet service was not working properly and I was overcharged...the hotel was supposed to take of the charge and did not.

review.title: Everything was average except the fridge.
review.reviewText: The fridge did not work well - it was not cool/cold enough. Actually, it was not cold at all! The service was good and the room was clean, though.

review.title: hot room!
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake is a great hotel with an awesome location. Parking fees are outrageous-$50. + per day...yikes!! The room we received had a broken A/C. It blew out HOT air. When we returned from dinner, our room was 82degrees! They tried to change our room to a queen with a roll-a-way, but turns out, it was actually a double bed with NO room for a roll-a-way-or anything else-very small.I went back to the desk and the only other option was to move us 3 blocks down to another hotel!11:30 at night-no thanks. We ended up having to stay in the hot room.Not very happy!!Also, did not know about the comp. coffee.

review.title: You decide!
review.reviewText: The hotel is a classic! Location is fabulous! Lobby is beautiful. Beds are comfy! Staff is great! Rooms are small. Showers have some mold. Wall paper was bubbling. There were mysterious stains on the comforter and desk chair. Finally, they should seriously rethink the porthole to another dimension mirrors that invade every single room!

review.title: Old school San Francisco
review.reviewText: Friendly people, beautiful lobby, convenient location.

review.title: Well located for shopping
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised that our room was very quiet. The only problem encountered was that our room was not cleaned the first day. A call to housekeeping put things straight right away, but I have never had to call before. The bathroom is very small with little room for your toiletries. However there was a huge lighted closet in our room.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: The room was everything that we could have needed & more. Very cute & charming inside the room. Bed was very comfortable. We could step right outside the lobby & catch the trolley. A couple blocks down to Union Square with lots of shopping. Everywhere we wanted to go was easily accessable from our hotel. We would definetly stay there again.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Everyone was very courteous and helpful and the hotel had a great feel about it and was very clean. Rooms are small but you hardly spend any time there anyway!

review.title: Definitely will go back
review.reviewText: Stayed here near the end of a round the world trip and found the hotel to be a very plesent experience. Room & bed was very comfortable and just what myself and my wife were looking for. Hotel location was fantastic (right in the middle of San Fran and easy trolley ride to fishermans Warf) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The Starlight Room lounge on the top floor was the icing on the cake. Ok, so there was no view out of our bedroom window, but we didn't come to San Fran to sit in our room and look out the window.

review.title: Good family hotel in great location
review.reviewText: San Francisco was our first stop on a 2 week trip to California. This was a pleasant way to start - with a comfortable hotel in a great location and with a very helpful staff.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Our hotel was very nice. Nice atmosphere for San francisco. Service very good, staff very helpful, and our rooms were nicely decorated, small bathrooms but everything we needed. I would stay there again, great location to everything, and a great breakfast place across the street. Overall very satified.

review.title: Wonderful stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby and bar was underconstuction and was going to be unveiled the next week. I is going to be so pretty. Our room was just perfect, like a boutique hotel. The starlite roof bar was a great place to watch the sunset. All employees were so eager to help. Just a short walk for so many places, China Town, Union Square, just to name a few. We will return by way of Expedia. Thank You

review.title: Dated Decor
review.reviewText: Rooms and interior was dated, and not in a classic way. Bathroom was tiny. Construction was happening in the lobby area which made things messy

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: Nice Price, Nice Hotel, very comfortable beds, room a little small but exactly what you would expect from an older Hotel like the Francis Drake. People real pleasant, very nice location.

review.title: What a View
review.reviewText: When we reserved a Towers Room, we of course looked forward to the lovely views of the city. Our room, on the sixteenth floor, actually did face toward Union Square as well. There was a ledge, however, that extended out about 6 feet from the window to the edge of the building. In addition to the usual satellite dishes parked on the ledge, we observed the usual accoutrements of a 16th floor ledge: beer cans, cigarette butts, and candy wrappers. What we didn't count on seeing, however, was the (more than slightly) used condom parked just underneath the larger of the two satellite dishes. Don't get me wrong, the upgrades to this classic SF hotel have been great. The bed was fluffy, the customer service was excellent, the lounge upstairs was fab, but we could never quite get past the condom. Recommend the hotel, probably going to go for less view on our next stay.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: When we arrived we were greeted by the doorman in a Beefeater costume who was very friendly. I found the service to be very good. The room and bathroom were small which was expected. We were on the 14th floor and could hear the street noise, which was not a big deal because we were so tired from all of the activities of the day that sleep was not a problem. The bed was extremely comfortable. Room was clean, location was perfect, overall I would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel, average service
review.reviewText: For the price and location, the Sir Francis Drake was probably the best value I've had at a hotel. It is steps from the Powell Street BART station, the cable cars and bus routes. It is also right at Union Square and surrounded by great shops and restaurants. The rooms are small, but keep in mind it is a major metropolitan city, and the rooms are usually small to accomodate all the people staying. While small, they were not uncomfortable in any way and were kept very clean. The only downfalls we experienced were small inconveniences from poor service. Hotels that master the art of "the little things" are always the best. This hotel is still working on mastering "the little things." For instance, we had three people in the rooms and were there for 5 nights. On only one occassion were there three sets of towels. We had to call every time and they would bring giant stacks of towels. Unnecessary. They would also take the drinking glasses and not replace them. And we also received a bit of condescention when we left our boarding pass information they promised to book as the flight opened to get the A passes. We called 20 minutes to remind and it had not been done and we ended up getting stuck in a different boarding group. While some of the service issues were frustrating, it all comes out in the wash with a charming hotel with great period details and a perfect location and reasonable price.

review.title: I would stayu at hotel again.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location if you like upscale shopping, designer didgs and goood eats. Bathrooms are on the small side, if you are of average size.

review.title: Stolen from our room
review.reviewText: If it hadn't been for two disturbing incidents, this hotel was not that bad. One, the elevators were shut down for over an hour one morning with a very nervous hotel guest stuck around inside. Second, my son's gameboy and all of his games were stolen from the room. He's eight years old, and nothing like this had ever happened to him before, needless to say he was miserable.

review.title: I know where to stay next time
review.reviewText: I was highly impressed with this hotel. I booked four nights and wished I could stay longer. For one, the location is great; there are plenty of restaurants and stores in the area, it's right across the street from the cable car stop, and it's right down the street from Union Square. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, offering travel tips and answering any questions you have. The room itself had plenty of space; although the bathroom was a bit on the small size, it was very nice. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable. It was hard for me to get out of it! The central air kept the room at a comfortable temp. The free wireless internet was very convenient. I will definitely stay here again next time I visit the city. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: Will DEFINATELY stay there again - I would ONLY choose that hotel!
review.reviewText: Leban, the outside greeter/helper was fantastic - very informative, professional, and courteous! Our room was cleaned daily - fresh bedding, towels - the works! Whenever we needed something (forks, ice), we weren't told where to get it, it was brought to our room very promptly, and with great enthusiasm. Even gave us a great list with coupons for room service. Awesome stay - would only stay at Sir Francis Drake whenever we stay in San Francisco! AAAAA++++++!!!

review.title: My favorite hotel
review.reviewText: Only criticisms: No hair dryer. Maid service didn't arrive until around 4:00 p.m., when I was back from the day's events and taking a nap. I sent the maid away.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake
review.reviewText: Rooms could be bigger for the price you pay!

review.title: Small rooms, expensive parking
review.reviewText: The room was very small and the bathroom, even smaller and I was told I was given a larger room than I had originally booked. WOW. I can't imagine. The overnight parking fees were very high...approx. $50 per night after taxes....and I was there three nights. Too high.

review.title: location
review.reviewText: great location, with excellent service. A must place to stay while in the city.

review.title: Not as advertised
review.reviewText: This hotel is in need of updating and general maintenance. Although the web site says it's been remodeled, I don't see it. Checked in and desk clerk tried to give us Queen although we had reserved King. Got that fixed. Room was terrible, room 330. They use low wattage floresiant bulbs in all the lamps and overhead lights. You can't see to read. Choose a different hotel.......you'll be happier

review.title: Quaint with great location
review.reviewText: Rooms are very nice in decor. Bathroom has very little and I mean very little vanity space but what do you expect from a hotel built in 1948. Everyone at Drake very nice and helpful. Location couldn't be better, cable car stop at the corner! Complimentary coffee and tea are served...read the guest card. Unfortunately I went next door every am for coffee and not until I was checking out read the guest card and learned of free coffee in the AM. Highly recommend a stay at the Drake.

review.title: customer service
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was exceptional in their customer service.

review.title: Loved the place
review.reviewText: This was the first time we had ever been to San Francisco and the trip was made very memorable by the outstanding service we received from the staff at the Sir Francis Drake. A friend had recommended it to us and he had stayed there 9 years ago. The starlight lounge was awesome and we will be sure to rebook at this fantastic establishment on our next trip to the bay area.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Our family of five found the hotel and its staff to be extraordinary. Although there was confusion about our non-smoking reservation, the desk staff solved the problem in a short time. Our only complaint was the per night valet parking charge. It may be the norm for the Union Square Hotels in San Francisco, but we found it execessive.

review.title: Nice Hotel; nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel has an excellent condition. The rooms have style; even the bathrobes have style. The staff is helpful and very kind. It is a great place to stay in san Francisco. I recommend it a lot. I am from Mexico and I had a chance to visit most of the "places-to-go" from the hotel at just walking distance.

review.title: Special Place
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake is a special hotel. Very personable and helpful staff. Limo service was first class - made our trip! Rooms/baths small, but adequate. Beds extremely comfortable - never slept so soundly away from home. Suggest upper floors to avoid street noise.

review.title: Better than most
review.reviewText: Nice view, but the outside window was dirty, I couldn't enjoy my view.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Nice old Hotel in great shape.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is right on Powell street. I t is a great location, near everything and Chinatown is 2 short blocks away. The rooms are small but the TV and fridge hepled out. Go to Walgreens and buy your water and snacks. The food in Chinatown is great. Take the double decker bus for two days and see san franscico on your time. the buses #F line is great for traveling for $1.50. Bring a fleece jacket and comfortable walking shoes.Make sure you eat at Boudine's.

review.title: Classy and friendly
review.reviewText: Perfect location for shopping, transit systems, touring. Beautifully renovated. Very professional and friendly staff. Room was small but very nice and cozy.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Loved it. Very typical San Francisco style. Beautiful hotel. It is an older hotel with smaller rooms, but they were clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed the Cafe Expresso resetaurant next door and we visited the Starlight Room on the top of the hotel for drinks and dancing. Great View. This hotel is in a great location, easy to get to everything.

review.title: Excellent Location, Good Value
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Concierge was less than helpful when asking for restaurant recommendations. Rooms were nice, spacious and clean. Hotel bar was closed for a remodel but it will be nice when it opens. Very nice hotel for the price but next time we would try to go a grade higher.

review.title: Best Bed Ever!!!
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake in San Fransicso had the most awesome bed and comforter ever!!! I have slept in 5 star hotels that did not have a bed as nice as the one at Sir Francis Drake!! Location if you like shopping was the best. Close to all major department stores and designer shops. I felt totally safe walking around to the shops at night. Enjoyed my stay immensely.

review.title: Charming place to stay
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay at the Sir Francis Drake. The location is great...1/2 block from Union Square, a few feet away from a cable car stop, close to many shops and restaurants. Although the room was kinda small it was very clean and well kept. The staff were very polite and helpful. Having free wireless available was extremely handy. Had to contact their Help Desk to get it working but that was taken care very quickly.

review.title: A good buy in an expensive city
review.reviewText: I just spent 4 nites and 5 days at this hotel and found it quite accommodating. I had a "petite" queen non-smoking room. It was a corner room with windows on 2 sides, giving me a view of the Bay, Union Square and the city. The hotel had a street car stop at its front door and was in walking distance of China Town. I personally feel cold very easily, and when I could not get the AC to turn to heat, the staff engineer came to fix it in 10 minutes. The hotel also offered me a "space heater" in case I needed more heat. My office sent a package to me by FEDX. The hotel staff was very dilligent in seeing that it got delivered to my room and notifying me of its arrival when I was attending a conference at another hotel. I commend the hotel for its "customer relations" and recommend it as a comfortable place to stay in San Francisco.
It's centrally located. Best part.

review.title: Room smaller than expected
review.reviewText: Although the room was very comfortable it was much smaller than we had expected. In fact is was so small that there was no coffee maker. However, it was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable and the location was fantastic.

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: The staff at Sir Francis Drake was outstanding! Service was as good or better than any hotel we've visited. Location was great with close proximity to Union Square and public transportation. Parking was not good and very expensive - recommend using the public system or a cab. The Starlight Club on the 21st floor offers a very good view of San Francisco.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great bed and not too much street noise. Within walking distance of eating and shopping.

review.title: Great location; central to everything
review.reviewText: The very best as far as affordability combined with location. Central to Union Square shopping, Financial District,BART, and cable-car route runs in front of hotel. Upstairs, The starlight Room is great entertainment and good food ( even if just for Happy Hour) Older property, but well-kept!

review.title: Great location - will be back!
review.reviewText: Great location, close to everything! Loved the doormen's attire.

review.title: Loved the charm of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was cozy. Overlooked union sqaure and Powell street. Great location in the city. Would come and stay again.

review.title: Better Can Be Found
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake has a lot going for it: great location, tons of history, friendly staff. And, when all is said and done, we enjoyed a comfortable stay. But our first impression of the room was not good. It was small, dingy despite a recent renovation, and had stains on the wallpaper -- and this was after we had been 'upgraded' from a typical Expedia reservation. The staff was very accommodating, allowing us to preview several other rooms before we eventually switched to one with more light and a slightly more open layout. But as we walked the surrounding neighborhood, we couldn't help but notice the abundance of beautiful hotels. Sure, many of them aren't cheap -- but neither was the Sir Francis Drake. When you plan your next vacation to San Francisco, think carefully about whether an extra few bucks a night is going to break you.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: this hotel is in the middle of everything, within walking distance of the theater, chinatown, union square, and many other sites ,if you need a ride, cable car stops right in front of the hotel!!!

review.title: Best Location - Shooping, Resturants, Cable Cars, etc, etc.
review.reviewText: The charm of this old hotel has been mainatained and all the staff were great. The location was excellent - clos to shopping, chinatown, cable cars, resturants, great location to just get out and walk - very safe. Cafes, convience store, Starbucks all really close. We can't wait to go back.

review.title: Great place,great restaurant
review.reviewText: Rooms were small but we had everything we needed. The Starlight room was so beautiful. The location was the best we could walk to almost anywhere or hop on the cablecar

review.title: Value for Money
review.reviewText: Small rooms but you cannot beat the location or the price. Very clean. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: Just stayed at hotel and was overall satisfied with the room and service. We were mostly gone running around the city but when we were there it was clean and comfortable. We stayed in a queen room which was rather small, not much extra space for comfort, but it was clean. Had a bad iron and called several times before it was replaced. The great thing about this hotel is it's location. It is right on Union Squire and is close to many things, Chinatown, Embarcadero, Metreon, SFMOMA, and convenient for transit system. The cable car lines run right in front of hotel. Don't forget Sears Fine Foods right across the street. Hotel is good but the location is great.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake - SF
review.reviewText: If you like an older type of hotel with some character, Sir Francis Drake is a good one for you. On the other hand, if you like a modern type of hotel, don't go there.

review.title: Great Hotel for a Great Price
review.reviewText: Looking for a quality hotel that is fair and reasonably priced and located in the heart of San Francisco, the Sir Francis Drake is the place. After the recent extended weekend trip my wife and I took, we would recommend this hotel. The hotel was recently remodeled and looks great. The hotel is an excellent location as there is a cable car stop right outside the front door, which is absolutely necessary for getting around the city. Overall, we enjoyed our stay from 5/4/07 - 5/7/07.

review.title: Decent stay, great location.
review.reviewText: The room size was decent. Bathroom was okay. The location was great, right up the street from great shops. Service was prompt and efficient. Only worth it if you want to be close to it all. Overall, it was an okay stay.

review.title: Excellent location and great service
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly located by Union Square and is in great shape. Good service and friendly atmosphere.

review.title: A Fine Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: It was our first trip to San Francisco. We chose the Sir Francis Drake Hotel because it's near Union Square. That was a very good decision. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel. We were right in the middle of things. Plenty of good restaurants and stores nearby. Since it's an older hotel, the rooms are a little smaller. However they're well-appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The lobby is very ornate and typical of the 1920s- a good historical feel. The service was prompt and friendly. We would stay there again. A good spot for a San Francisco vacation.

review.title: OK, but you may want to look at other options
