review.reviewText: I stayed on the 19th floor. Live music was performed on the hotel's top floor and the music was load enough to be heard in my room. The music ran until after mid-night. The room was small and in need of renovation. Ice machine on my floor didn't work. Had problem with TV in the room. It took engineering / maintanence almost an hour to respond. All-in-all, it was a less than satisfactory experience.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel had recently been renovated and the rooms were small but quaint. The bathrooms were very small, but we expected that. Right in Union Square, the location can't be beat. We were 2 blocks from the theatre and the cable car runs right in front of hotel. I'd recommend this hotel especially for the price.

review.title: Small room
review.reviewText: I'm pretty sure there are different rooms in the hotel but when we reserved the trip and the room, there was a couple pictures of the room but we couldn't tell how big is it.So when we get there we were surprised.Very small room.Other then that the hotel is good.

review.title: Lost Shoes
review.reviewText: After a wonderful visit to San Francisco we returned home to discover we were missing a pair of shoes that were purchased during our visit. It was disappointing that the shoes were not located until I had called lost & found 3X with no return call. It took two more conversations with the manager before there was any effort put into the search. My phone bills and the shipping will probably make up for the "sale" price of the shoes but at least we will have them back.

review.title: Great Location, Clean, and a good value
review.reviewText: Pros: --The Drake is in a great location, near shopping, Chinatown, GoCars (which has AMAZING self-guided tours of the city), a BART metro stop (that goes to and from the SF airport), and is directly in front of a trolley (which is a blast). --The room was clean, and my fiancee loved the bathroom products. --We got a great deal, compared to what the guidebooks said the price would be. We went in late April. Neutral (Age-Dependent): --The club upstairs is for the young-at-heart, but if you're under 40, look for nightlife somewhere else. Cons: --The staff were mostly friendly, but the guy at the concierge was clearly unhappy to be there, and the guy behind the desk at night's idea of directions was "take a cab." --There are three computers in the lobby, but the hotel charges an exhorbitant fee to use the internet, and that's for just fifteen-minute increments.

review.title: Great Value and Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, close to Union Square and Chinatown. The staff was extremely helpful. The rooms tend to be small because it is an old historic hotel, but it is well maintained and very clean. The first night, we had a room near the elevator which was very noisy. The staff was very accommodating, and moved us to another room for the duration of the trip. I would definitely stay their again.

review.title: Not that impressed
review.reviewText: Although the Sir Francis Drake is a nice hotel, we found the room and bathroom to be extremely small. Our room on the 3rd floor overlooked the trolley track and it was a very noisy room. Scalas restaurant was lovely and the pizza and bruscetta wonderful but the barmaid there was not very friendly. We also found it very hard to get to the hotel each time we had to return with the location it was in. Also, I think that when a reservation is made it should be made clear that to have a car there is going to cost you dearly. Not a terrible place to stay but with so many other great hotels, I don't think we will go back.

review.title: Very Disappointed!
review.reviewText: Very poor service. Staff not very helpful.

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: I had a favorable impression of the SFD and decided to stay there on business in order to save some money. Big mistake. The problems: i) they put me in a cramped room (barely enough room to put up the ironing board); they failed to tell me that I had a message waiting for me upon my arrival at the front desk; iii) there were no towels in my room; iv) they mistakenly assessed a parking fee to my room (I didn't have a car); v) their fitness room is closed for rennovation, but they were kind enough to refer me to a nearby gym where I could pay a fee to work out; vi) last but not least, they completely failed to make my wake up call -- no call at all! To make up for the inconveniences, they removed the gym charge!

review.title: Way too average for the price
review.reviewText: average service, very noisy rooms...

review.title: Will Come Back Again!
review.reviewText: Overall, our experience at the Sir Francis Drake was excellent. The hotel location is perfect for exploring the city, and is surrounded by tons of great restaraunts. Many revewers have complained of the small rooms, but I found ours to be very cozy and extremely charming. The bathroom was spotless and again, I found it to be plenty big. The hotel is eco friendly which we view as a plus. The only drawback was the consierge's inability to answer simple questions such as "Does the hotel have an ATM?" and "Where do suggest having breakfast?" We'll be staying here again on future trips!

review.title: Great Value for the Money
review.reviewText: Well-located off Union Square, the Sir Francis Drake Hotel greets guests with a friendly doorman in Beefeater costume. The hotel decor is old-fashioned, but not shabby, and is in process of updating. Front desk & bellman are professional & efficient. Rooms are clean and comfortable, with the usual amenities, and about average size for San Francisco hotel rooms. Prices are lower than most comparable hotels in the area that are trendier, making this hotel a great value for the money.

review.title: Hey, it's San Francisco!
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Sir Francis Drake before, back before they became a Kimpton Hotel. The rooms have now been refurbished, although they are still on the small side. The hotel promised Wi-Fi throughout, but I was never able to get my laptop to stay connected--too weak a signal (I did connect with my Palm Pilot a few times). But, hey, San Francisco is still one of my favorite cities, and the location, 1 block from Union Square and on the cable car line, is still fantastic.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice and close to everything in San Francisco

review.title: Very beautiful
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake has a quaint charm and character not found in large hotels. The rooms while small are beautifully decorated. Beds are very comfortable. Staff friendly and extremely helpful.

review.title: Best deal in the city
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a fantastic location and very reasonably priced. The rooms were small, but who goes to San Fran to stay in their hotel room? The beds were very comfortable, and the rooms had recently been redecorated. There are not a lot of extra amenities at the hotel room like fitness rooms or pools if that is a requirement for you.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square. We were within walking distance of most areas that we wanted to see.

review.title: I will go back!
review.reviewText: The first room they gave me was small and dirty,after my complain I received a very nice one on the 10th floor. The location was perfect.If you fancy a great breakfast go to "Sear" just across the street and don't forget to try the cheese cake at "The cheese cake factory" located at Macy's;it's great!!!

review.title: Not impressed - Great Location - Old Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed in the Sir Francis Drake after getting a recommendation from a work collegue and seeing a decent low price with an Expedia special rate. Checked in at 10pm after an evening flight to San Francisco. The lobby was okay. Hallways to the rooms should have warned us... Room 730 itself was smaller size, paint peeling on base boards, the bathroom was only big enough for one. Woke up the next AM and a three night stay turned into one - we went elsewhere. While the location is about 50yrds from Union Square there are many choices withing two or three block of the property. In hindsight, we should have paid the $40 extra to stay elsewhere more upscale.

review.title: Old style San Fran
review.reviewText: Room was very small, bathroom was tiny and walls were a bit thin. No view from interior rooms.

review.title: Nice Ambience
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake is a beautiful hotel. The lobby and room furnishings brought out the vintage charm of this grand hotel. My only complaints were that I wish the bed was more comfortable (not to mention the "flat pillows!" ) and the bathroom being a bit small. With that aside, a pleasant stay-- location was perfect!

review.title: i like this hotel
review.reviewText: i recomendet this hotel, because its one of the best in san francisco

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The location was great. Cable car right in front of the hotel. The room and bathroom was on the small side, but very cozy and clean. The bed was very comfortable. I will stay there again in the future.

review.title: Excelent location!
review.reviewText: The excelent location allow me to travel to all SF, enjoying the sightseens and go to the principals attractions.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Cable cars outside front door. 3 day pass for $18.00 is best deal! Good for buses also. Buy at Walgreens across the street. Sears Fine Foods across the street is great for breakfast. Schiros (sp?) located inside hotel has great dinners!

review.title: dissapointed
review.reviewText: they didn't change the towels next morning though they were wet. also i requested two double beds but they assigned me single first and made me move to other room next day whixh was so anoying.

review.title: small room
review.reviewText: very cramped in petite queen. ok for one person but not for a couple.

review.title: Fair price, very well located in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Confortable rooms. The serivice is OK for the price. Very well ubicated in downtown business area. Closed to local attractions and entertainment.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake Hotel, Personality +
review.reviewText: We (I and my two teenage children) were very pleased with the location (Union Square.) The rooms though small were extremely comfortable. I would suggest a maximum of 2 people in one room as this is an old hotel with a small yet completely modernized bathroom. The staff was friendly and competent. When I called the front desk for extra towels they were delivered to my room with-in 5 minutes. On the last day of our trip, when I asked the bellmen to call us a cab to the airport, he suggested that we take the hotel car. My kids and I were expecting a van but were escorted to a stretch limo, my children were thrilled. Personally I love hotels that have some history and personality, the Sir Francis Drake has a lot of both!

review.title: Awesome stay and location
review.reviewText: Great location, close to everything (especially shopping) and great place to stay if you're there as a tourist.

review.title: I would love ot stay there again
review.reviewText: I like the hotel locate ..The room its ok! the service at frontdrek not give good service ..they so busy and sometime rude.But For the room and locate are good.Its good for what you pay.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake Hotel in march 3 nights
review.reviewText: Great location; nice rooms. As a european we are used to small rooms. It has everything in it you need, so? Very clean as well.

review.title: Needs improvement
review.reviewText: I've stayed at other Kimpton hotels and the Drake was not up to par. The 1928 hotel seems to be stuck between it's past glory and future potental. More cover-ups than renovations in my opinion. Most distressing was the staff seemed generally diinterested in helping us, especially at the desk. One morning when we asked if they had the NY Times the answer was simply "no." It should have been "let us see if we can find one." At the famed Starlight Room we waited 35 minutes for a glass of wine when the bar was almost empty. The decore in the newly "renovated" rooms is nice and the bed was typical Kimpton confortable but the bathroom was way too small for a modern hotel. It will take more than new wallpaper to stay competetive.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The location was perfect. You can catch the cable car right outside the hotel. You can walk to all the stores and china town. The BART station is about a 5-10 minute walk. Great hotel and location. The bathroom was alittle small but no big deal.

review.title: Really enjoyed our short star
review.reviewText: We had a good stay and apprecisted the tips and helpful advice of the staff.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The locaction was the best. Great shopping,restuarants and centered close to other areas. Chinatown,little Italy and more.

review.title: Great Nightclub On Top
review.reviewText: great location in Union Sq. the view at the top at the Starlight Lounge is pretty impressive, fairly decent jazz band. you get a free VIP pass on check-in, but don't lose it-- they won't give you another one. a little annoying. VERY small bathrooms, but sparkling clean.

review.title: Ready to Head Back
review.reviewText: This a great hotel to stay at. Everything is right there. Walk out the hotel doors and right onto a cable car warf.

review.title: good one
review.reviewText: clean hotel, friendly staff

review.title: A great stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is convenient to the cable cars and many restaurants in the downtown area. You can get a rental car around the corner from the hotel.

review.title: The Drake - Boutique Chic
review.reviewText: I thought the Drake was a beautiful hotel... inside and out. The details from the hotel, built in 1928 are still there... but with a touch of modernism. The rooms were small but quaint, adorably decorated and VERY comfortable. The staff was very pleasant, from the Beefeater who greets you at the doorway to the maids who are very sweet and adorable. We even had our room switched due to some loud neighbors and they accomodated us, even going so far as to move our bags and set it all up in the new room. Overall our experience at the hotel was fantastic. We celebrated our 5 year wedding anniversary and I think The Drake was a perfect hotel to do so.

review.title: Nice Renovation, very pet-friendly!
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised by the quality and appearance of the room renovation. The drake is in a most convenient location and now, with the renovation, offers an unbeatable value proposition for pricey San Francisco hotels. I have two Standard Poodles that I traveled with, and they were treated like VIP's by the staff. The only drawback, which is not limited to the Drake, is the expensive daily parking rate.

review.title: In the City
review.reviewText: If you enjoy being in the city and close proximity to restaurants, this is the place to be. Sure it's kind of noisy because of the trolley bells but the room and people are comforting. P.S. Don't try Cafe Espresso.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel couldn't be in a better part of San Francisco. It's surrounded by the best stores and restaurants, and you can either walk around or take the Cable Car (goes by right in front of the hotel) to visit other places. The only drawback is that one of the rooms (there were 4 of us, 2 in each room) was really small and kinda old. Make sure you get one of those sweet corner rooms above the 15th floor and you will be delighted.

review.title: nice hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is alittle dated but was very clean and comfortable. Met all our needs for a comfortable stay.

review.title: location, location...
review.reviewText: I enjoyed our stay at the Sir Francis Drake. The only issue was the room was cold and we could not get the heater to heat to the requested temp. We asked one of the staff to help us, he said he would and then did not follow up. I am certain though, had we taken the issue farther it would have been resolved. Over all it was a great hotel right in the middle of union square.

review.title: Service awsome but...
review.reviewText: I know I got a cheap room but I expected to be able to look out the window. It was caked with drit so much so you could see the rain pattern from the globuletes of dirt spatters crossed the pane. My only other complaint were the obvious black shoe marks left on the closet door. Other than that the room was nicely furnished and comfortable. I didn't spend too much time there anyway but it would have been nice to look out a clean window.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel but do not rent "Run of House" for three adults if you expect to be comfortable.

review.title: Drake Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: Cute little hotel in the middle of downtown. Starlight room has a big plus to have in the hotel. Overall, I'd stay here again.

review.title: Sir Francis Drake Hotel
review.reviewText: Whats to be said? Sir Francis Drake Hotel one of San Franciscos best from the time it opened in 1928.

review.title: Great deal for a great location
review.reviewText: The only complain i have is the size of my room. A bed wasn't kingsize for sure but because i was traveling alone, i didnt care. Room was small but clean. As for the rest, i can't compain. Great location, great service. Wireless internet. Concierge worked perfectly. I have requested a few things and it was done immidiately. Lovely. I would definitely recommend it.

review.title: tiny room
review.reviewText: i know its the city , but this was the smallest room ive ever stayed in.my wife ordered slippers and nail polish remover from room service and it never showed up. also our room was not very clean. the lobby is beautiful, some great old architecture.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Room was far too small for a Deluxe room and located on the eighth floor not near the top of the 21-floor hotel as suggested by your advertisement. Service was excellent.

review.title: Great value. Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was extremly comfortable and in the middle of Union Square. The room was somewhat small but had very comfortable beds with pillow tops. The decorations and overall feeling of the hotel made it a true vacation. I plan on staying there for my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Most Comfortable Beds
review.reviewText: I had one of the best nights sleep. Usually I can't sleep the first night in a strange bed. But these were so comfortable, like sleeping inside a cloud. Loved it. Everyone was extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating to any of our requests. I've stayed at this hotel several times, but never able to write a review. Excellent price for a great quality hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: After spending quite a bit of time researching for a place to stay, I decided to go with this hotel due to the location and decent rates. A friend of mine was to meet me in San Fran a few days after my arrival so I reserved a single room for myself and a double for later. I was pleasantly surprised that the front desk person allowed me to stay in the double room for the entire time. It eliminated the hassle of having to check out of the single and into the double. Housekeeping went out of their way to inquire if I needed anything every morning as they were in the halls. I appreciated them going out of their way to make my stay comfortable. As a person who's been in the hospitality industry, the customer service at the hotel was more than commendable. The location's perfect for those who want to be in Union Square, as it's only a block away from the departments stores and restaurants. The cable car runs along Powell St. so there's no problem getting on and travelling to Fisherman's Wharf. I give this hotel 2 thumbs up!

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText: Excellent location on Powell street, only a half a block from Union Square. Easy walk to BART station. Beautiful hotel with large rooms. The front counter staff was "fair" as far as customer service but the bellmen and doormen were all very nice.

review.title: Extremely accommodating staff
review.reviewText: Nice quite hotel, staff very helpful. When booking request room away from Powell Street. Great location with central access to city sights and shopping.

review.title: Great location, great charm
review.reviewText: Hotel was right in the middle of San Francisco, Great Charm, some parts of hotel were certainly aged, but the room was great and very clean. Hotel employees were exceptional.

review.title: Remarkable Service @ this boutique-style hotel
review.reviewText: The level of service given by the hotel staff was exceptional. From the time we arrived @ the front door and throughout our 2 night, stay, we received excellent service from the friendly & attentive staff. The room was lovely. The decor was superb, and the ammentites were very good. Bed linens and towels were great. The only problems we experienced during our stay were in maintaining internet access( it kept going in & out), and the mini frig. wasn't functioning...nothing was cold. The housekeeping services were excellent, as was the concierge and bell staff. We also experienced outstanding service @ the hotel restaraunt( the food was terrrific too). We had a lovely time.

review.title: Would be my choice hotel in SF from now on.
review.reviewText: Right smack in the heart of the hustle and bustle of SF - Union Square. no more than 2 minutes walk to restaurants, shopping - neiman marcus, saks, macy's dior, Victoria Secret, bloomingdales - all a few steps away. cable car stop. restaurants every block. nightclubs to keep you awake the whole nite, if you so wish to indulge. Love the quaint deco of the room. Very helpful doorman.

review.title: san francisco trip
review.reviewText: hotel was very convenient right by union square and a trolly stop right outside the hotel.we spent very little time in the hotel too busy seeing the beautiful city but when we were in the hotel everyone went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable.

review.title: Our Favorite place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: My husband and I have stayed at the Francis Drake for four visits -- all have been wonderful. The staff is extremely courteous, helpful and responsive. The rooms are small but if you don't mind tiny bathrooms, they are quite comfortable. Recent upgrades to the rooms include flat screen tv w/ dvd player, goose down coverlet, etc. The cafe' downstairs is convenient and serves a decent hot ala carte breakfast w/ wonderful coffee -- don't even need to leave the hotel! The location can't be beat! Just a short few blocks down the hill to union square shopping, or over to China Town and North Beach. The cable car stops outside the front door. This hotel can't be beat! We look forward to returning for our next visit.

review.title: Sir Francis DREK
review.reviewText: I stayed here many years ago and found it charming. Now it is under rennovation and it is noisy. The rooms walls are also very thing which made the screaming children nect door noisome! The traffic around Union Square is so bad now it isn't worth even going near it in a car. We complained a lot about our room, which was an upgrade, go figure, and no one ever offered to move us. It sucked!

review.title: nice, comfortable stay
review.reviewText: A lovely boutique hotel with recently renovated rooms and comfortable down bedding. Beautiful architecture in the lobby (though this might be under renovation in early 07) and the door men were a hoot. Fabulous access to the Powell Street cable car (get a daily or multi-day passport to save $) and request a quiet room to avoid hearing those "ding-dings" until 1am when the cable cars shut down. No need for a car at this location. If you do bring one, be prepared to pay dearly to valet it. The Sir Francis Drake caters to an adult crowd of any age, but I wouldn't recommend the hotel for young partiers or families with very small children. The only real drawback was the nightclub on the 21st floor and the swarms of people trying to get in. Take the lower level elevator and show your room key to bypass security and crowds, and you might want to reserve a lower floor (no sound problems on the 15th floor for us.) Overall, we were very satisfied and would stay there again. Note: If you aren't coming to the city for "the San Francisco" experience (think: history, architecture, crowds, noise, small rooms), or if you need state-of-the art conveniences and business services, then stay in a newer chain hotel. But, as boutique hotels go, the Sir Francis Drake was definitely better quality. (I prefer it for location and comfort over the Maxwell, for instance.) Check out the other Kimpton Hotels in the area too, as some have wild lobby decor worth a walk by.

review.title: Good location, just ok hotel
review.reviewText: The location right in union square is just fabulous and very convenient. However, the hotel is just ok. The room was just tiny and the service subpar. But it was a pretty good price for the location. I would stay there again just for the location.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: While the hotel is in an excellent location being near the BART and having a trolley stop at its entrance, the building itself is a bit worse for the ware. Apart of the historic hotels collection, it is some what charming but if you are looking for luxury and comfort, I would suggest a more modern hotel. Conditions are so cramped in the bathrooms that the hair dryer is kept in a cloth bag hanging on the door and one's knees are essentially touching the sink while using the toilet. There was absolutely no counter or drawer space any where and the TV was situated to the side of the bed instead of in front of it due to lack of room space. However, the trade off is convenience in location so... it's a toss-up.

review.title: Ok but overpriced
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis was close to all new year's celebrations and many people loved the night club on top of the hotel

review.title: wonderful service
review.reviewText: I can not say enough about the service. We ordered room service everyday...it was wonderful. The assistance from the staff made our stay so wonderful, we are going back.

review.title: great location, older hotel
review.reviewText: The room we stayed in was small, as expected. We were on the 18th floor, so there was a bit of noise from the nightclub upstairs on the 21st floor. Also, we could hear a baby crying in the next room. My husband and I don't mind noise, so it wasn't an issue. The room was very clean and colorful. We loved the zebra and cheetah printed robes. The bathroom had the most comfortable toilet we've ever used--ergonomic. The only thing was, when you sit down, your thigh would touch the tp! Okay, this doesn't sound too good, but we had a nice stay. The room was great & the staff was very friendly. Try the famous pancakes across the street at Sears Fine Foods or walk to the Tenderloin district for breakfast at Dottie's.

review.title: Comfortable Beds & Great Location
review.reviewText: Redecorated, very comfortable beds. Right at Union Square - perfect for Christmas shopping.

review.title: Best rest ever!
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake had the most comfortable beds ever in a hotel. The service was excellent as well. They were doing some maintenance on the hotel on certain floors, so we did hear some machinery, but that was during the day only and it was at a minimum. The hotel was conveniently located on the cable car line and was right there in the middle of the shopping district.

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: The best feature of the hotel is the location near Union Square and cable cars at the front door. The lobby is quite grand but the rooms are less spectacular, yet clean and comfortable. Staff is nice and friendly.

review.title: Classic Hotel
review.reviewText: Classic Hotel. Building is old but add to the charm of the hotel. Well maintained. Service Staff is excellent. Very helpful and always pleasant. Centrally located, walking distance to excellent shopping, public transportation (BART) and wonderful restaurants.

review.title: Small, Old, Location-Only Hotel
review.reviewText: The only reason to stay at the Sir Francis Drake is location. That is what you are paying for. The rooms were incredibly small. Since it is a historic structure they cannot bring the rooms up to modern standards. The lobby is the best part.

review.title: Good hotel and location (but small rooms)
review.reviewText: The hotel service (reception and housekeeping) is quite good. So are its toiletries. My 5 night stay at the hotel was comfortable. The cafe right below the hotel is reasonably priced and good. However, the bistro is quite expensive. My only complaint is that the rooms are quite small and the windows are covered with dust outside -- they need to be cleaned to improve the view. The hotel location is great. It is in Nob Hill, it just a block away from Union Square, and is about a 10 minute away from the Powell St. BART station.

review.title: Very Old, but quite attractive
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old but the staffs are quite good even though they are dying for some tips. Major attraction of this hotel is its location. It is located in the central downtown near union square so you can find quite fancy restaurants near by this hotel.

review.title: solid hotel-short on decor/room amenities
review.reviewText: outdated decor in rooms with rather schizoid color and deco combinations.lobby very nice. service very very good. bed comfortable. felt very safe in hotel. the top floor night club was pricy but nice, a cover charge for guests seemed inappropriate, food was good. TV had only 15 channels-minimal selection. reading lights were marginal. bathroom showed wear but very good shower.

review.title: What a comfortable bed...
review.reviewText: Everything was ok, but all I did was show up sleep and leave. I was extremely tired, and found the room to be very comfortable... especially the bed. Also, complimentary yoga mat was a plus.

review.title: It was okay
review.reviewText: I loved La'Ban the Beefeater at the front door. He was the Best part!! Our room didn't look like it had been cleaned as there was a thick layer of dust everywhere!! The room was very small with no view.

review.title: Funky but fun.
review.reviewText: The public rooms are rather grand in a charming, old-world way. The beef-eater schtick is a bit over the top. . . Red costumed men outside opening car doors and giving directions, wearing flowered hats. It's supposed to be British. . . Inside and upstairs, the rooms are small with appalling decor. Imagine: horizontal striped curtains: purple, green and gold! But we closed our eyes and were relatively comfortable. It's funky, but fine really. . . The location is excellent.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Best thing about hotel was location right in Union Square. Valets were also great. Rest was not impressive. Since hotel boasts about "pet program" on website, we brought our puppy. This unknowingly got us a room on the "pet" floor which was not only dingy & unrenovated (again, website boasted renovations) but dirty. Bar/restaurant closed. Couldn't break bills at front desk. Maybe if you don't bring a pet you get better rooms/service? Too bad we paid the same price as everyone else...

review.title: Beautiful and historic
review.reviewText: Now that's a classic hotel. From the marble in the lobby to the doorman in full attire, this was a great place to stay. Room was smaller than is the norm now, but the classic charm more than made up for it. Great location and easily accessible. Easy check in. I would stay there again without question.

review.title: Good for the price and location.
review.reviewText: The restaurant is wonderful, one desk clerk was rude, the halls are worn and some doors don't close well and the windows were dirty. On the other hand the door men and one desk clerk were great and the beds were very nice.

review.title: A great experience!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location - right by Union Square. Our room was lovely - good size, clean, good views, comfy bed, good bathroom - ask for a corner room. Staff great and helpful. All in all a brilliant time and we will most definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: nice clean and comfortable hotel in a good location. don't get a room facing union square, though, because there is a lot of street noise.

review.title: Excellent value, but definitely not a deluxe queen room
review.reviewText: Excellent location, hotel with charm and very good service especially room service. Delicious and good selection. The room type is however definitely "inflated" -- what was called a "deluxe queen" was a very small room with queen bed and side table/usual closet, but the bathroom was not to be believed, one could manage to stand in front of the sink if you are a petite woman (which I am) but there was not an inch to even turn around, bathroom was recently renovated but cheaply done. Otherwise, good value.

review.title: Historic, boutique hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located in San Francisco's Union Square. All the major shops and boutiques are within walking distance and taxis and the cable car are nearby to take you around the city. The renovated room we stayed in was comfortable and whimsically decorated. Think gold, dark woods, and liberal use of violets, browns, and greens. It was on the smaller side but not uncomfortably so. The entertainment center could use some updating but you probably won't watch much TV anyway. The DVD player is a nice touch. Overall, the hotel is a great place and I would recommend others to stay if you: - want to be in Union Square - prefer boutique hotels - don't mind downtown noises - plan to be out and about most of the day

review.title: Pleasant enough
review.reviewText: Great location just a few blocks from Union Square, on the trolley line. This is a very old hotel but has been kept up reasonably well. I had a very small but comfortable room. Staff members were not particularly friendly but that seems to be typical of staff at hotels in this area.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Primier location, excellent value

review.title: Getting a Bit Down At the Heels
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake has seen better days -- the lobby and public areas are still magnificant, but the rooms for this business traveler were a bit run down and badly in need of updating. The one hiccup was that I ordered room service and was told 15 minutes, which in reality was 45 minutes and a badly overcooked (under the heat lamps?) meal. I actually sent it back and they did return in 15 minutes with a perfectly cooked meal.

review.title: Good location, small rooms
review.reviewText: We had a newly renovated room and it looked very nice. Given the busy area of the neighborhood, our room was very quiet though we were on the tenth floor. The bed was very soft and comfortable. The biggest problem was the bathroom. It was so small two people couldn't stand in it without someone being partly out the door. Due to the size, there was no shelf in the bathroom. The room itself was small but as I don't require that much room, it was not a problem. The biggest plus with the hotel is the location.The cable car is right outside and several attactions are within walking distance.

review.title: Great Location, Superior Service
review.reviewText: The Drake was fun. It is an old hotel, with all the charms that entails...the room was smaller, the bed was SUPER comfy, and the bathroom was tiny...LOVED the Aveda toiletries though !! If you are used to spacious accomodations, then DON'T stay here...if you are looking for authentic San Franciso charms then...this is the hotel for you.....We loved it and would go again.

review.title: down at the heels and skimpy
review.reviewText: Our room lacked: a bedside phone, enough towels, a luggage stand, paper cups for the bathroom. Some of the above arrived, when requested, but others never did. The room was only satisfactory. For that price, it should have been better. Not recommended.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: This hotel is a very good value .It is a great location ,a half a block off Union Square. The cable cars run right by the front door, and it is walking distance to many fine eateries. Highly reccommend it .

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Though the lobby is lovely with its art-deco motif and the location was great, the rooms are postage stamp size and the bathroom was very outdated. Not much value for the money.

review.title: Just what we'd hoped for!
review.reviewText: For a 5-night, spur of the moment vacation, we were delighted to see that this hotel was available and so reasonable. The location in Union Square is ideal---we walked and "cable carred" to all the major neighborhoods and sites. The Cafe Espresso, accessible from the hotel lobby, was perfect for quick (and as large as you want) breakfasts. Free NY Times in the hotel every morning. We've previously stayed in 3 different hotels in the area, but this was by far the best.

review.title: Historic Value vs. Comforts
review.reviewText: This is an interesting historic hotel with a nice lobby and top services; however our "petite quenn" room was cramped for two people and dated. The bath was reasonably clean and up-to-date (although cramped and the the door a bit hard to close) and the bed was reasonably comfortable. The location is great for grabbing a trolly and walking to other attractions. As far as comfort, I would have preferred a newer budget hotel on the highway, while the location and ambiance did add some value.

review.title: Too Too Tiny!
review.reviewText: The room was cute, but so small you could barely turn around. The bathroom was so small you couldn't even leave your toothbrush in there. We had a problem in the middle of the night with noise coming through the wall from the room next door & the front desk didn't answer the phone for 45 minutes and then took another hour to solve the problem. The location is great, but we wouldn't stay there again.

review.title: small but cozy
review.reviewText: my husband and i stayed here for a week on our honeymoon. it had a very cute design and boutique feel, and we loved it. The bed was very comfortable with down comforters and many pillows. the room was quite small, and i would recommend it for people that are spending a lot of time in the hotel. But we were there only at nights and loved how cozy it was. After one week it felt like home. One thing i recommend is not parking your car with the hotel. There are at least two other garages with in 1 minute walking distance from the hotel that were half the price!

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: great location, rental car not needed, very friendly staff

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Room was well maintained and clean. Great bed. Service was excellent, not overbearing. Rooms are small, typical of older urban hotels. Can't beat the location. We'll be back.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel location is second to none - just a block from buzzing Union Square and a couple of blocks from the trolley terminal. Immediate area is alive with good diners & restaurants so no car is needed. Also the buses, subway and trams are all within easy walking distance of the hotel. Hotel has recently been re-furbished so we had no complaint with the room decor but the bathroom was exceedingly small. Not a real problem for us Europeans but might be a big problem for a large size American lady or gent. The room we had was quite noisy around 6 o'clock in the morning because (although on the 10th floor)it was above the sidewalk area where the trash bins are collected every morning by trucks which make an awful racket when being emptied. Would recommend for breakfast Loris (there are 2 within 200 yards) or Sears (directly opposite the hotel front door) particularly for dinner. Their food was magnificent at a very reasonable rate. Overall a good 5 night stay. Would recommend the hotel to friends but warn them of the small bathroom. We would certainly go back.

review.title: San Francisco classic
review.reviewText: Great location in a SF legendary property. Great Kimpton standards such as good duvets; bath products etc.

review.title: Great location but service bites...
review.reviewText: We went to San Fran for a wedding and decided to stay at the Sir Francis Drake hotel. The service at the hotel is less than satisfacory. There were maybe 2 people working at the front desk but at times there was only one person, so it seemed we always had to wait. There was a confusion with our luggage the first day we arrived and it wasn't found until 45min. later which made my husband-as the best man in the wedding- miss the entire rehersal. We did get apologies from the person at the front desk and a free breakfast (which in our mind wasn't enough for the missed rehersal) but the manager never called as promised. Other than that the location is great, right by Union Square and the hotel rooms (especially the bathrooms) are small but the newly renovated rooms are decorated very tasteful.

review.title: Not enthused at all!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location (1 block from Union Square) and Harry Denton's Starlight Room is on the top level. Other than that, the hotel was not worth the price I paid for (and I even got a great rate). I would rate this hotel as a 3.5 star hotel, more like 2 stars based solely on room size, room cleanliness, and other aspects of the room. Not a good time for me.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: The Sir Francis Drake has an excellent location, especially for out-of-towners that don't know the area. It would be easy to get stuck in a not very "friendly" neighbor a few blocks away. Easy access to any and every SF spot. The staff are very helpful and we ran into no problems whatsoever. Would definately do again.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Hotel is looking shabby. Room was small; bathroom very small -- no shelves for make-up; closet even smaller. Room had a funny smell to it. Small selection of TV channels. Location, though, is great.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location and the staff and service were top notch. The rooms were small but otherwise a great place to stay

review.title: Wouldn't Recommend It
review.reviewText: Bad service, couldn't get through to the reception on multiple occasions. Asked for something to be sent to the room, waited over an hour even though they said "it will be right there". Filthy bathroom, run-down room.

review.title: Nice, old-fashioned hotel, but noisy room
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and charming, but has seen her better days. My room was awful noisy and there were also boisterous events by the lobby. Thus I wouldn't call the hotel too peaceful. The location is excellent, close to Union Sq. Valet parking works well though is pretty expensive ($40 per day). I would recommend if you don't expect very quite hotel, but appreciate central location and get a good deal.

review.title: Worth one stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel is worth a visit and stay to experience the 1920's feel of the place. The lobby is stunning and our room had recently been refurbished and was comfortable, especially the bed, which is the most important thing anyway! The bathroom was small and we guess this is because it is an old and possible listed building? Everything worked, although the maid forgot to do our room one day and we had to remind them, which was sorted promptly. Worth one stay, but would not necessarily return. Disappointed with the Starlight Room as they asked us for ID, even though we had the room keys. Good breakfast in restaurant, but remember to book for dinner as is very popular.

review.title: some hotel tips
review.reviewText: the hotel was in a great location-the doormen and most of the front dest staff were terific david-mgr-was fabulous and so accomodating all the conceirge women were wonderful the hotel needs to update the towels-most with holes or frayed they also need to buy a better quality toilet paper

review.title: good amentiies and location but overpriced
review.reviewText: it's a standard 3.5 star hotel in an excellent location. I liked the staff and the room was decent, but I've stayed at better for less money.

review.title: Not worth it!
review.reviewText: Old SF charm, but it is worn out! Very noisy, old widows not insulated well. Room was clean but again, tired. Bathroom was the worst. Cracked sink and bathroom tiles, paint chipping. Noisy window climate control unit. I have stayed in lots of 3 star hotels that are way nicer than this which is rated at 3.5 stars. You can do a lot better for the money in my opinion.

review.title: Nice room but small bath
review.reviewText: This was a very nice room but the bathroom was very small and there was very limited space to place toiletries or really anything. The only other negative was that the cafe next door was supposed to be open until 10 (Sunday night) but was closed when we went there at 9:15. Also, if you come in through the main door (on Powell) and want to carry your own bags, there is no elevator up to the check-in desk which was hard after a full day of traveling and then walking from BART with all of our bags.

review.title: San Francisco's Sir Francis Drake
review.reviewText: The SFD is a classic old SF hotel that has kind of lost its way. On the street level and in its rooftop bar, it still has its SF magic. But, once you enter the hotel and the guest room floors, you notice that its grandeur is only superficial. The lobby is rather dreary, energized only by the youthful staff; yet even they aren't able to imbue the place with more than a smile. The residence floors are rather shabby and the rooms pretty small. My room wasn't picked up as late as 7:00 p.m. the day after my arrival; indeed, it wasn't until I called to inquire that they promptly dispatched someone to make my bed. Having lived in SF for a number of years, I have always enjoyed SFD's proximity to Union Square and Nob Hill, its colorful beefeater doormen, and its two first class ground level restaurants, Scala and Cafe Espresso. I've also drank and danced away the night in Harry Denton's rooftop ballroom. Yet, I'd never really ventured into the hotel, as hotel. Now that I have, I wouldn't recommend it.

review.title: Clean, but small
review.reviewText: The bathroom is even smaller than a customer would expect. I bruised my hip against the vanity when I walked into the bathroom.

review.title: old SF charm
review.reviewText: Loved It! Scala's is always delicious

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: ...good hotel for business traveler...easy walking distance from financial district, BART, etc. Pleasant, helpful staff. Though the hotel is clean and comfortable, it needs to be rennovated in the near future.

review.title: Expected more
review.reviewText: The bathroom door to our room would not close since the toilet was in the way, so to shower or use the light while the other person was sleeping disturbed that person. They decided to turn off water service at 11:00am the day we checked out instead of waiting until check-out time at 12, so this was really inconvenient. They charge for internet in the lobby even though the website implies internet access is free (only if you use your own laptop its free). They did provide free airline boarding pass printing, but I could not log out of my account and hotel staff wasn't to familiar with it so they had to reboot the computer to log out of my mileage account. This wasted about 15 minutes of my time. Very beautiful hotel, but expected a lot more than received. They even charged my credit card for the honor bar twice, even thought when I checked out they said I had not charges and we did not use the honor bar. They did credit the charges back, but its a good thing I checked my credit card statement.

review.title: Great spot to stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel was friendly and helpful when trying to find our way around San Francisco. The rooms are newly remodled and very tastefully done. Location is great. One block from Union Square and on the Powell street cabel car line with a stop right in front of the building. Lots of good dining from casual to dressy within a few blocks. Only drawback is that as an old hotel the rooms are small.

review.title: Room with a view.
review.reviewText: My initial room assignment had a poor layout (ie. TV beside the bed) and seemed small. This was on the 11th floor room 1117. I had checked in before 3pm on a Sunday. I asked for a better, higher room with a nice view at the same price level. They gave me room 1711. It was a very nice, corner room with two great views of the city. One view looked down on Union Square.

review.title: I room we had was to small
review.reviewText: We had a king size room. It was not large enough. I hate to see a regular size room.

review.title: Small and Old
review.reviewText: This hotel is very old. The service is OK. We were checked in early (2PM) which was nice. The room had sealed shut window which we could see nothing out of anyways. Our friends had a CORNER room which was great- I would only recommend that type of room, if you can even get it. It had open windows and was bigger. The bathroom was so small, my husband and I were tripping over eachother. There is no counter space either, so I had to do my make up on the desk. You could hear the trolly bells outside, nice atmosphere. The only great thing about this hotel is its location. I would try another hotel before I stayed here again. It was very close to all the shopping. I did receive wireless internet access in the room for no charge, that was great. The lounge upstairs was full of older people (over 40), not recommended for under 40. Our friends lost their credit card their and it was a huge hassle to get it back. Staff was OK. The BED has very COMFORTABLE, I have never slept in a more comfortable bed in a hotel. And the down comforter and down pillows were a huge plus!

review.title: okay stay in the bay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but rooms are a little older and small.

review.title: Cannot beat the location - everything else is average
review.reviewText: The location is this hotel's trump card - you get out of the door and you are on Union Square with its endless shopping opportunities and just steps away from touristic china town of the Grant Street. The room size is average by SF standards (read: it will likely feel smallish). The room interior is past its prime but not yet horrible. There is no free coffee/tea in the morning, no wine tasting in the evening. The lobby and the costumed door man look grand but this is where the luxuries end. I would stay there again and recommend it to anyone else who, like me, prefers to just drop their luggage in a safe and reasonably clean place and go explore the city.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This is a charming restored hotel right off Union Square. Very good detail work with the restoration. Nice designer furnishings, well maintained. It is an excellent value. Rooms are not large but adequate. Great beds.

review.title: No, Old time romance
review.reviewText: Old time romance If you are in search of the feel and thrill of San Francisco romance find another hotel. We were not impressed. The windows are sealed shut, locking out all the freshness and sounds of the City. The missing pieces, no breeze, no cable car bells, no feeling of the City that we came to experience. Sir Francis Drake charged excessive money for a small very enclosed room. we will chose another hotel on Union Square to stay at next time.

review.title: Good Location, small rooms
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but rooms are small

review.title: Expected more
review.reviewText: It was a very luxory hotel it needs some up date at the lobby. Everybody very friendly . Bed kind of hard couldn't get used to in 6 nights. Excellent location. Yes I will go back !!!!

review.title: San Fran Best
review.reviewText: Excellent

review.title: Good Location, Good Staff
review.reviewText: Very satisfied; close to Union Square, large hotel with history, very kind (and excellent) staff, and colorful room. Like all Kimpton hotels I've stayed at, at times it appears that Pee Wee Herman is their chief designer for fabrics and wallpaper. However, the decor is new and done up in such a sweet style it does make you think about how clever they are.

review.title: Not in a hurry to go back
review.reviewText: The room was extremely small, if we tried to walk by the bed at the same time one of us was always knocked in the wall. The bathrooms are in serious need of a remodel, they're actually quite gross. The nicest part of the hotel is the lobby and the fact that it's conveniently located. The daily rate for parking, ridiculous!

review.title: Enjoyable
review.reviewText: Enjoyable, is a perfect word to discribe the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. From the door man to the maid, everyone was helpful and pleasant. Our room was not ready 2 hours after check in but we were accommodated with a similar room with a killer view of the entire city.

review.title: Great Service-Great Location
review.reviewText: Sir Francis Drake is superb for location and service. The rooms are small due to the age of the hotel but how much time do you really spend there. The only thing that was not up to par in my opinion was the condition of the bathroom. It was as if you were in a different hotel when you entered the bathroom. It was not up to par for cleanliness in comparison to the lobby, common hallways and room condition.

review.title: Circus, Circus
review.reviewText: We only needed a place to sleep as our schedule was quite hectic. It's a good thing. We couldn't stay in the room without being uncomfortable. The numerous patterns on the wall, drapery, and bedding was disconcerting. The service was prompt an efficent and the expedia air/hotel deal was a great value. From the entrance, to the lobby, to the room it felt like we were staying under The Big Top in 16th century England. A coffee maker in the room would be helpful but the Espresso shop on the corner eased this inconvenice.

review.title: Awesome stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel is great... The room was extremely clean, the decor was awesome, and the service was excellent...

review.title: Great location near Union Square
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for shopping and dining in Union Square. The hotel lobby was beautiful. I loved the decor in our room. Check-in time was at 3:00 and they didn't have our room ready at that time so we had to wait a half hour. But overall it was a great place to stay. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: Lovely medium sized Hotel - helpful staff, quiet drink - beautiful room.

review.title: Okay for old renovated hotel
review.reviewText: Very well located Great staff Classic building but with the compromises renovation brings in terms of design and facilities layout and old lifts etc

review.title: Fantastic location off Union Sq, with great 25th Fl Bar and Night Club.
review.reviewText: Centered for shopping and great SF resturants!

review.title: Pretty Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The location was great! The room was a good side, except they keep the air conditioner unit right next to the bed so it blows on your face during the night. It took 2 hours after the check in time to get our room ready, which was a bit annoying, but other than that it was a great visit!

review.title: Nice but becareful
review.reviewText: This hotel and their staff were friendly enought but be prepared to tip for any kind of decent service. The hotel seem to have a problem with ice. They didn't have machines anymore so all ice had to be delivered which always took a while. Also watch out for the 45 dollar-a-day valet parking "ouch!" Stay at a lot instead above Sutter on Powell which I believe is public and cheaper but does not have in and out privileges.

review.title: A Union Square Hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and service was prompt and friendly. Great location. Rooms are quite small but functional.

review.title: Good leisure hotel when going to a big city
review.reviewText: Good service, reasonable pricing, very good location

review.title: The Drake was awesome. Historic building within walking distance of lots of stuff & helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Way cool.

review.title: Will be better when renovated--good restaurant
review.reviewText: First, the bad: The room we had for our first night was very small, and the room's only window was streaked with dirt and grime so we could not really look outside. We had asked for the quietest possible room but were awakened at 5:00 a.m. with extremely loud clanking and rumblings that continued for at least another hour and a half--our room was right on top of garbage pickup and construction. The room's television was old and got marginal reception. The next day we asked to be moved to another room and were moved to a larger quieter room with clean windows (and absolutely no view). The computer by mistake billed us twice, but the front desk was very good about clearing it up. The restaurant, Scala's, was very good, service friendly, made us feel welcome. The people at the front desk told us they are renovating the whole place and it should be much improved over the next year. I'd wait until that's been done before trying this one again.

review.title: Good location in Union Square
review.reviewText: Old hotel with alot of charm, especially the Sir Francis Drake guy that greets you on the sidewalk and the very cool lobby. The rooms are not quite as nice but mine was quiet and had a good view of Union Square.

review.title: Bathrooms seem as old as the hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was reasonably priced and I generally like Kimpton hotels. The overall conditions of the hotel are fine, but the bathrooms need a redo! They are ancient and in poor repair (I was told by the front desk clerk that they will begin renovating in August '06). Also, for those who get up very early (I am from the east coast), coffee is not available unti room service starts up service (6:30 am), so this is a definite drawback. On the other hand, the honor bar is nicely stocked and reasonably priced and the restaurant at the hotel is very good (try the calamari)!

review.title: Sir Francis needs repair work
review.reviewText: Room was ok. Bathroom was not the cleanest and fixtures on the tub fell off. Can't beat the location for shopping and SF activities.

review.title: cable tv
review.reviewText: Although we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, expanded channels on the tv, or even satilite tv would have been nice.

review.title: Nothing Special
review.reviewText: Room and bathroom were the size of my closet (small) and I think the I got what I paid for. One of the two beds was completely broken down and uncomfortable.

review.title: We would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel was San Fransisco! It was charming, location was perfect, cable cars passed in front all day long. When we didn't feel like walking we just hopped on the cable car that stopped in front of the hotel. Also had a nice cocktail lounge on the top floor overlooking the city.

review.title: Age is showing; renovation badly needed. Great service.
review.reviewText: Great ambience, but you can't sleep or bathe in that! Bathroom needed an overhaul-cracked tile, leaky pipe under the sink. Got a room on back as suggested for quiet with windows so high up NO view, just a glimpse of an air shaft. I like grace and charm, but will choose a newer hotel on my next trip. Location is good-on cable car line. Beware expensive parking if you have a car.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean, but had a somewhat moldy smell. I think this was due to the age of the rooms and lack of ventilation fan in the bathroom. The location was fantastic and the staff was helpful and friendly. It was easy to take the BART train from the airport to Powell St. station and walk 2 blocks to the hotel. I was amazed at how many people were shopping and walking about at night(before midnight)on weekdays. It felt very safe and fun to be out.

review.title: Perfect spot along the cable car route!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and were amazed by the beauty of the lobby as well as our room. We enjoy staying in hotels that are not part of a big chain of places that all look the same no matter where you are. The Sir Francis Drake is a gorgeous boutique hotel, lots of charm, and warmth. The staff are all very helpful and with a smile! Loved the location - close to everything you want to see by walking, cable car, bus or cab. The Starlight Room on the top floor is the BEST View of SF!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: All the amenities in the hotel room were very distressed (leaky sink, cracked ceiling, poor lighting, lumpy mattress). Service was spotty as they had record of a late checkout request placed earlier this morning and were considering charging an additional fee.

review.title: No way will I go back
review.reviewText: The location is about the only plus for this hotel. The bed was uncomfortable, the closet was not deep enough for the clothes to hang straight, the bathroom was in need of a remodel and the switch plate on the outlet was not secure. When you unplug an appliance you needed to hold the switchplate to keep it from coming off. In addition there are only a few TV stations and the reception was poor. Only CNN no FOX (very poor)

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, clean and comfortable. Elevators worked great - very fast. Had heard there was noisy people in the halls from nightclub on top floor but we did not hear anything - room was very quiet. Loved the doormen - great outfit and extremely helpful. Service was great.

review.title: It looks it's age!
review.reviewText: The rooms were small and very dated. Bathrooms needed a lot of updating. Very noisy - lots of street and hallway sounds.

review.title: The hotel has gone down hill.
review.reviewText: My husband and I have stayed here on several occasions in the past and have enjoyed our stay. The hotel is old but it was always well cleaned and maintained. This time it was horrible. The windows were so filthy you could not see out. The hallways and room were never vacuumed. The bathroom was never cleaned. We called down for help with our bags and waited half an hour and now one showed up. Throughout our stay the front desk was generally unhelpful. We were very disappointed and will not stay here again.

review.title: Great location but not worth the money
review.reviewText: I have stayed in many hotels in SF and this one has the "name" and the location, but it was not worth the money. The rooms are very small, no view and in need of an upgrade. You get the same quality for less money in many of the other "B" grade hotels in the same area.

review.title: So so decor, great restaurant
review.reviewText: Our room was just ok... The decor was not my taste, very busy with striped walls and paisley bedspread. However, the Scala restaurant and Starlight room were romantic and a lot of fun. Beware of big extra charges, parking was a big hit!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel needs upgrading, bathroom tub not clean. Other places in town nicer for this price

review.title: Can't Wait to Go Back!!!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is terrific! Close to shopping, restaurants and a short distance to Fisherman's Wharf. There's a great cafe on the corner of Powell and Sutter next to the hotel. The Starlight Room is located on the top floor of the hotel and one of the hot night spots in the city. The dance floor has a fabulous view of the city at night!

review.title: Nice Hotel... but Noisy
review.reviewText: Great hotel, right on union square; but if you stay here, make sure you ask for a room that faces south away from the street... the rooms are not quite or insulated from the street noise. All the staff were great! And if you stay here, you have to visit the StarLight club on the top floor, very classy!

review.title: I now always look for Kimpton hotels when I travel!!!
review.reviewText: Kimpton seems to be a growing chain - that feels like home - of hotels. I've have not been let down - in any city - by Kimpton.

review.title: Great Location...In Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at this hotel for a fun weekend away. Right on Powell Street, this hotel is right on the cable car line---always fun for any trip. The staff was friendly, willing to make our trip better.

review.title: Absolute Worst Hotel
review.reviewText: I travel for business weekly and stay in all types of hotels. This was the absolute worst accomodation I have stayed in, during the last 10 years!!! Would never recommend to anyone.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location of the Sir Francis Drake is perfect-a block from Union Square-but the room was tiny. Not necessarily a great value, but a beautiful hotel with nice ammenities (aveda shampoo and free internet).

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel was not at all what we expected. The room was very, very small and the hotel was older. We changed hotels the second night.

review.title: will try other places first
review.reviewText: lounge was somewhat exclusive, had to be out by 8 if you are wearing casual dress. rooms were small

review.title: Not impresses
review.reviewText: The room was very small and uncomfortable. The bathroom was horrible. The bathtub had mold and looked very old. The paint was peeling off on the ceiling and around the windows.The rooms need remodeling.

review.title: Too old and run down!
review.reviewText: The rooms were dirty and the comforters/bedspread looked like they had never been cleaned. It smelled horribly of mildew. The bathroom was old and the tub scary. We had a party of four and we only got two sets of towels. I had to ask 4 times for towels to be brought up. It was impossible to catch any transportation out in front of the hotel-it was just too busy! People need to know thatif they plan on using public transportaion.

review.title: Bathroom sink and wall problem
review.reviewText: The best thing of the hotel is the high speed wifi Internet access in room and the free printing service in the lobby. If the hotel can put in more than two computers in the lobby, customers don't have to wait in line. In the room, the carpet was dirty. Water still came out after you turn off the water on the sink. There are cracks on the bathroom wall.

review.title: San Francisco Charm
review.reviewText: Hotel is old and it shows in some areas. The rooms are small and the bathrooms could use some work. I feel that for the price it could of been in a little better condition.For old world charm and being located in the heart of the city near all of the attractions you can't go wrong.

review.title: "Wonderful Experience"
review.reviewText: My husband and I just completed a five day stay at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. The quality of hotel service was outstanding. When we checked in we asked to be placed in the back of the hotel which turned out to be an ideal location. We had read previous reviews by others that some rooms were noisy and not well kept.  We did not find this to be true at all. The staff was very helpful and professional at all times. Do enjoy the "Starlight" room located on the top of the hotel. We had a great time taking free salsa dance lessons one evening. The music and dance lessons vary from night to night. We would go back to the Sir Frances Drake in the future.

review.title: Very Charming. Lots of character!!!!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel.  It was very quirky, but very fun.  The food was amazing.  I would go back in an instant!!!

review.title: Nice Lobby...but that's about it.
review.reviewText: It is easy to be drawn in by the beautiful lobby of the SFD but once you dig a little deeper you get the sense that the same care and attention to detail is not used throughout the hotel.  The "Fitness Center" is a joke, an average home gym would blow this little room out of the water.  The presence of the Starlight Room on the 21st Floor is more of a distraction than attraction, as the elevators are packed with drunken yahoos.  The rooms are small, to a falut, and while the Union Square location can be a bonus, there are plenty of other hotels to chose from.  We had to call the front desk twice once at 2AM and again at 4AM to have the guests across the hall to pipe down.  It's a shame, but I just would never stay there again, unless I could sleep in the lobby.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Rooms are tiny and a little seedy...Room service is bad.

review.title: You can find a much better place for the money.
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Sir Francis Drake six nights. For three nights there was no heat in the room and temperature outside were in the forties. The room was in poor condition, mattress was very worn as was the blanket and sheets. Bathroom had cracked tiles
and floor was dirty.

review.title: Very Impressed!
review.reviewText: Wonderful place to stay!, Old but great shape, all employees very helpful. Location great. Remember this is an old, built in 1928, hotel, so it's not like what we've normally stayed in,for instance, bathrooms are small, some of the rooms are also, but the atmosphere is very gracious.

review.title: Fine at fair price.  Not 4 star.
review.reviewText: Overall Ok.  Good location.  Biggest complaint was that free internet service was lousy in my room.  When I asked desk for help, the wanted me to call their provider.

review.title: Small rooms
review.reviewText: I realize that I stayed as a single person, but I am used to larger hotel rooms even as a single.  The personnel were exceptional so that made up for the closed in feeling.

review.title: Overrated
review.reviewText: Seemed understaffed.  People at front desk seemed indifferent to customers.  I had a difficult time getting seemingly simple items fixed, e.g. phone cord missing, light bulbs burned out.  Also, no spaces were saved in the restaurant for guests so meals had to be taken outside of hotel.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is charming and old world, but it could definately use some upkeep.  I have been spoiled by luxurious linens offered by other boutique hotels I have stayed in and had wished that this hotel had gone that extra mile.  With that said, the location couldn't have been any better.  Walking distance to the heart of the city and right at the end of the cable car line.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Lobby was nice, but rooms need updating.  Shower drain was backed-up.

review.title: Great dining experiences
review.reviewText: The hotel waitstaff was fantastic.  The location was perfect.  The hotel was elegant and stately.  The only drawback was that the petite queen room was quite small.

review.title: Love Sir Francis Drake
review.reviewText: The service was great at the hotel, from the valet parking to the quick and easy checkout. Sir Francis Drake just across the street from Union Square and only about 2 blocks away from the eight0story shopping center on Market and Powell. There is nowhere else I'd rather stay than Sir Francis Drake!

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Room a little funky with old style decor and black and white tiled bathroom.  We had a corner room on the 17th floor.  Great view!

review.title: Sir Francis Drake Hotel
review.reviewText: The service at the hotel is very good, but the rooms are extremely small. The location however is perfect. For a single person on business, the rooms are fine, but for two are more persons the room is very crowded.
